Article Title: Determinants of delays at European airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airport delays; Airport congestion; Hub-and-spoke; Congestion externalities; Airport demand management
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION; INTERNALIZATION; CARRIERS; NETWORK
Abstract: Using flight data for the period 2000-2004 we find that four significant variables in explaining delays at European airports are market concentration, slot coordination, hub airports and hub airlines. We find evidence for the hypothesis that airlines internalize the effects of self-imposed congestion, but the results for the hub variables are somewhat puzzling. While delays are higher at hub airports, hub airlines experience lower delays than non-hub airlines. This may be at least partly explained by the special characteristics of the hub-and-spoke system in Europe, which is less extensive and more constrained, relative to the US. If introduced in Europe, efficient airport congestion tolls should be carrier-specific to account for the differences in internalization of delays. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Study of Emergency Aid of Coal Mine Serious Accidents
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: coal mine; serious accidents; emergency; aid
Abstract: Emergency aid is important for preventing accidents evolution after accidents and reducing personal casualty and property loss. Thus, it is analyzed that emergency aid when accidents occur and after accidents occur and watchful problem during emergency aid. The research results show that if during emergency aid reasonable, effective and scientific measure can be used personal casualty and property loss can be reduced farthest and production in coal mine can be renewed fast. The analysis for emergency aid of coal mine serious accidents can provide some references for accidents aid.

Article Title: Mine Slope Stability
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Slope project; Stability; Analysis and application
Abstract: Recent years, with the great development of infrastructure in our country, the slope project brings significant effects in the constructions of our national economy, it refers to the every aspects of our national economy, meanwhile the stability research and the maintenance of the slope seems more and more important. Many projects such as mines, water conservancy, highways and railways relate to a large number of slope problems, the stability of the slope not only influences the secure operation and using of the project itself, but also influences the construction cost. Therefore, the significances of the stability analysis of the slope are very important, it can provide scientific theoretical basis for the successful construction of the projects.

Article Title: Shift designs for freight handling personnel at air cargo terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Air cargo terminal; Personnel shift scheduling; Demand leveling; Hierarchical workforces; Mixed integer linear programming
Keywords Plus: HIERARCHICAL WORKFORCE; MODELS
Abstract: This paper presents an integrated mixed integer linear programming (MILP) model for determining manpower requirements and related personnel shift designs for the buildup and break-down of the unit load devices (ULDs) at the air cargo terminal to minimize manpower costs. To utilize the manpower resources efficiently, we implement a new mechanism for demand leveling. In addition, we consider the qualification hierarchy between build-up and break-down workers. A case study based on the real-life data shows that the model is useful for manpower planning at air cargo terminals and the integrated approach is far superior to a traditional two-stage approach. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Levine, B; Nozick, L; Jones, D
Author Full Names: Levine, Brian; Nozick, Linda; Jones, Dean
Article Title: Estimating an origin-destination table for US imports of waterborne containerized freight
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Origin-destination table; Containerized freight; Optimization; Gravity model
Keywords Plus: COMMODITY TRANSPORTATION; MODELS
Abstract: Containerized freight imports into the US are growing at an average of 10% per year. This traffic is concentrated at a small number of US seaports. It is therefore important to have an accurate understanding of the flow of containers from their origin country through these seaports to their final destination. This paper develops an optimization model to estimate route flows and a corresponding multi-modal origin-destination table for containers by synthesizing data on international trade and railcar movements with a gravity model for the demand of container traffic. This analysis provides insights into the balance of rail and truck inland transportation from each port. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Solak, S; Clarke, JPB; Johnson, EL
Author Full Names: Solak, Senay; Clarke, John-Paul B.; Johnson, Ellis L.
Article Title: Airport terminal capacity planning
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Passenger terminal design; Airport planning; Capacity expansion; Multistage stochastic programming
Keywords Plus: EXPANSION
Abstract: The airport terminal capacity planning problem deals with determining the optimal design and expansion capacities for different areas of the terminal in the presence of uncertainty with regards to future demand levels and expansion costs. Analytical modeling of passenger flow in airport terminals under transient demand patterns is especially difficult due to the complex structure of a terminal. Because of this difficulty, the airport terminal capacity planning problem has not been studied in a holistic fashion, such that studies in this area either do not account for expandability or focus only on one particular area of the terminal. In this study, we consider the airport terminal capacity planning problem as a whole. In this regard, we first derive time functions to approximate maximum delays in passageways and processing stations of an airport terminal. We then use these delay functions to develop a multistage stochastic programming model based on a multicommodity flow network representation of the whole airport terminal. The solution of the model, for which we develop an efficient solution algorithm, provides optimal capacity requirements for each area in an airport terminal during the initial building phase, as well as the optimal expansion policy under stochastic future demand. The results of the study are applicable to all similar queuing networks, including other types of passenger terminals. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The hierarchical hub median problem with single assignment
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Hub location; p-Hub median; Hierarchical; Time restrictions
Keywords Plus: LOCATION-PROBLEMS; FORMULATIONS; MODEL; PROGRAM
Abstract: We study the problem of designing a three level hub network where the top level consists of a complete network connecting the so-called central hubs and the second and third levels are unions of star networks connecting the remaining hubs to central hubs and the demand centers to hubs and central hubs, respectively. The problem is to decide on the locations of a predetermined number of hubs and central hubs and the connections in order to minimize the total routing cost in the resulting network. This problem includes the classical p-hub median problem as a special case. We also consider a version of this problem where service quality considerations are incorporated through delivery time restrictions. We propose mixed integer programming models for these two problems and report the outcomes of a computational study using the CAB data and the Turkey data. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Hyperstar: A multi-path Astar algorithm for risk averse vehicle navigation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Robust route guidance; Vehicle navigation; Uncertain networks
Keywords Plus: ASSIGNMENT
Abstract: The Astar algorithm, which forms the backbone of vehicle navigation systems, is capable of producing only one path. Given uncertainty about link travel times, there is interest in algorithms that can deliver all the paths that may be optimal, termed collectively a hyperpath, to improve travel time reliability. The actual path taken within the hyperpath will typically be determined by on-trip events, like incidences of congestion leading to delay. In this paper, the Spiess and Florian algorithm for generating hyperpaths in transit networks is adapted to road networks by assuming that drivers follow a risk averse strategy whenever a choice of path arises. To improve the efficiency of the resulting algorithm for vehicle navigation applications, the Astar approach to link selection is incorporated, leading to the Hyperstar algorithm. Proof of the optimality of the algorithm is provided, followed by numerical examples. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Elderly Population Forecast Based on Neural Network
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: population aging; neural network; population forecast
Abstract: The population system is a very complicated system. Many of the decisions in a country are related to population situation and its trend. Population growth is a non-linear function of many factors. Neural network which has ability of curve fitting for complicated non-linear system can forecast population well. Based on neural network, the trend of population aging in china is forecasted. Population aging has brought great impact on economy and society. Fully recognizing challenges and grasping opportunities brought by population aging can help tackle its impact on economy and society.

Article Title: Development of a Spatial Decision Support Framework for IMPETUS project in West Africa
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: LAND-USE; SYSTEMS; MODEL; TECHNOLOGY; MANAGEMENT; FUTURE; BASIN; TOOLS; WATER
Abstract: Spatial Decision Support Systems (SDSS) need to be interdisciplinary and highly related to the target group. Developing systems for different persons in government, university and rural areas in developing regions seems to be impossible, if requirements in scientific reliability with the use of complex models are taken into account. The SMILE FRAMEWORK tries to meet these demands balancing the different, in parts contradictory, requirements. Therefore this java (R) based software tries to ensure a good adaptability, simple maintenance, wide capacity of integration of different models and tools, highly efficient development of the SDSS and over all the possibility for developers and scientific users to concentrate on the content of their work instead of getting perfect knowledge in programming languages. Within the IMPETUS project there are 30 Systems developed with and within the SMILE FRAMEWORK. The range of disciplines included in this integrated decision support framework (ISDSS) varies from climate models such as the weather-generator, integrated hydrological models to socioeconomic systems. Target groups for the systems are governmental, scientific and non governmental organizations within Benin and Morocco.

Article Title: Monitoring of environment by energy efficient usage of Wireless Sensor Networks
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: environment monitoring; wireless sensor networks; neural-networks; energy efficiency; time series
Keywords Plus: ARCHITECTURE
Abstract: The paper presents an energy efficient solution based on wireless sensor networks for monitoring of the environment by traffic control. The algorithm is based on Fuzzy ART model of neural networks. Our system provides high dimensionality reduction when sending only the classified data and transferring only the new data in given time series. In this way, the system can be very energy efficient for monitoring of not frequent events. The system is based on MicaZ sensor motes and adapted Fuzzy ART model. Efficiency is very high when there are no changes in the sensed data from the motes. Experimental results and analyze when the system was applied in the real-time environments are presented. Model of the system that can be used in ecology for environment monitoring also is presented in this paper.

Article Title: Research on Economic and Intensive Use of Land Resource In the Old Industrialized Zone-A Case Study of Huangpu District in Guangzhou City
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: economic and intensive land use; land resource; Huangpu District
Abstract: Huangpu District, located in the eastern part of Guangzhou city, Guangdong province, China, has historically been the most prosperous foreign trade port in South China, and also an important heavy industry base in Guangzhou. However, associating with the rapid urbanization, there are many problems emerging gradually, such as extensive use of land resource, unreasonable urban land use structure. Economic development has been restricted by the supply falls shout of demand of land resource by degrees. The objective of this research is trying to find out an appropriate approach according with Huangpu reality to promote the economic and intensive use of land resource, which can make Huangpu keep a sustainable, healthy and rapidly development. Furthermore, we also expect the other old zones in coastal areas of China can draw lessons from Huangpu. This paper analyses the status of construction firstly. Then it tries to construct an evaluation index system of intensive land utilization, considering the requirement of ecological environment and cultivated land protection. Analysis results show that Huangpu District of urban land use is still in a low level. Finally, measures and suggestions are proposed to promote economic and intensive use of land in Huangpu.

Article Title: On Participatory Governance: the Risk Society Perspective
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: participatory governance; civic participation; risk society
Abstract: Based on risk social perspective, participatory governance can effectively deal with the risk of governance failure. Participatory governance is the cooperation between government and citizens. Its basic values are: it helps avoid government failures, helps achieve participatory democracy, and helps avoid or maximize social risk, and improve public management performance and achieve good governance. The pathes to participatory governance are: the emergence of new transformational leadership, the establishment of the representation role of civil servants, fostering ethics of civic participation, and achieving the institutionalization of civic participation.

Authors: Jiang, JL; Zeng, RY; Zhu, KW
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jiang, J. L.; Zeng, R. Y.; Zhu, K. W.
Article Title: Talent Training of Engineering Management with Strategy of Strong Province on Construction in Zhejiang Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Talent training; Engineering Management; Construction; Zhejiang province
Abstract: Zhejiang is a large province on construction. The production value and profit of construction industry have ranked first for several consecutive years in China. In the future, growth mode of construction industry should be changed, and construction industry of Zhejiang province should be upgraded, so as to transform from a large province on construction to a strong province on construction, and continue to lead Chinese market. Talent is a key to achieve a strong province on construction. However, training of construction talent does not correspond to development demand of the industry. Talent training of engineering management is deficient especially in Zhejiang province. This paper describes the status and development trends of construction industry in Zhejiang province. It analyzes the deficiency of industry development, and discusses long-term development strategy of the industry. It describes development situation of college specialty of Engineering Management in Zhejiang province. It reviews development course, and discusses existing problems, development trends and so on. Current discrepancy between talent training of engineering management and industry demand has been analyzed. Demand and requirement on talent training of engineering management have been discussed in terms of future development of industry. It proposes to train future engineering management talent in accordance with need and trend of industry development. Therefore, following suggestions have been issued for local college: (1) college major of engineering management should be expanded and developed, and training quality and capacity should be enhanced; (2)we should lead industry forefront, and train new talent who would suit and direct future development of industry; (3)we should think much of capability training, and train practical talent of engineering management; (4)we should pay attention to innovation of training forms.

Article Title: Calculating and Analyzing the Property Tax Burden to Individual Housing-Take Harbin for the Example
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Property tax; Laver curve; Individual housing; Tax burden reckoning
Abstract: Amerrican Economist Arthur Laver described the relation among the tax burden, the tax base, the tax rate and the economy by utilizing the modern econometric technique, and established a model that reflects the function relation between the tax rate and the tax revenue. It has became a inevitable direction of tax system reform that levying the property tax in our country. It will take the important influence to the real estate market. It is the most difficult part in the design process of property tax that levying the property tax to individual housing, also will cause quite big society affect. However, the family tax burden is especially sensitive that it brings. This article reckoned the corresponding tax rate change of the Harbin medium income family under the different tax burden proportion by using the dynamic analysis method. Finally, this article proposed concrete implementation steps of levying the property tax to individual housing from the family tax burden change angle.

Authors: Li, YH; Wang, XB; Adams, TM
Author Full Names: Li, Yihua; Wang, Xiubin; Adams, Teresa M.
Article Title: Ride service outsourcing for profit maximization
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation service outsourcing; Fleet assignment; Driver scheduling; Column generation
Abstract: Transportation service subcontracting is becoming an effective means of business for many leading carriers to maintain their market dominance and profitability. This research is based on an outsourcing practice in one of the few largest limousine fleet companies in the US. whose (mostly advance) demand for services often exceeds its capacity. We develop a model for ride service outsourcing. A column generation method is proposed. The outsourcing decision is made simultaneously with pre-scheduling of in-house ride services as well as staffing. Test with services data indicates that the developed method dramatically improves the carrier's outsourcing decision. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Keywords: the circulation of the right to use rural house site; urban-rural interaction; system conception
Abstract: Regarding the promotion of the urban-rural interaction as a target, this paper analyzes the emphasis point of the circulation system of the right to use rural house site. This paper finds that the design of the circulation system of the right to use rural house site ought to commit itself to establish a benign interaction between urban and rural, construct a circulation market for rural house site based on the principle of compensation for the use, formulate the circulation procedures and a circulation profit distribution mechanism which is helpful to quicken the development of the rural areas so as to promote the right of using rural house site to transfer normally, healthily and orderly.

Article Title: Heuristics for the integration of crane productivity in the berth allocation problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container terminal operations; Berth allocation problem; Quay crane assignment; Crane productivity; Squeaky wheel optimization; Tabu Search
Keywords Plus: CONTAINER TERMINALS; PORT; SEARCH; MODELS
Abstract: In this paper, the combined problem of berth allocation and crane assignment in container terminals is investigated. The proposed problem formulation includes important real world aspects such as the decrease of marginal productivity of quay cranes assigned to a vessel and the increase in handling time if vessels are not berthed at their desired position at the quay. To solve the problem a construction heuristic, local refinement procedures, and two meta-heuristics are presented. These methods perform well on a set of real world like instances. The results emphasize the important role of quay crane productivity in berth planning. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: vehicle emissions; air pollutants; emission inventories; road transport
Abstract: This paper presents the main characteristics of COPERT 4 software, a European tool to calculate emissions from road transport. The paper presents the main methodological elements of the application, the sources of primary information, the software architecture, and demonstrates an example of application for the Greek national road transport vehicle stock. COPERT 4 is being downloaded by similar to 100 users per month and is being used in a large number of applications, including air emission inventorying, input to air-quality studies, and academic research.

Article Title: Research on Tax System of Real Estate
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real Estate; tax
Abstract: Tax of real estate includes all steps of real estate as the important means of State's adjusting macro-economy. Levy object includes individual taxable ground and community of ground and building. There are two categories tax related: the one is tax aiming at real estate directly, including Land Appreciation Tax, the use on land in Cities and Towns, Property tax, Tax on the Use of Arable Land, the other is tax related to building, including Corporation Income Tax, Individual Income tax, City Maintenance and Construction Tax, Business tax and Stamp Duty.Tax system not only guarantee the resource of state financial revenue on Real Estate, but also keep fare of market competent. It enables the government Macro-control lever for real estate so as to be developing smoothly. The paper researches tax system of real estate and relation between real estate and market so that it conform to the need of real estate market.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Housing Consumption and Economic Growth in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing consumption; Economic growth; Co-integration; ECM; Granger causality test
Keywords Plus: COINTEGRATION VECTORS; ERROR-CORRECTION
Abstract: Consumption is a very important part in social reproduction, and its driving effect on social economic growth always plays the leading role. Housing is the basic living material which is essential for people's life; housing consumption is the important material condition for the labor force reproduction. This study, based on China's statistical data from 1985 to 2007, by employing co-integration theory, Granger causality test and error correction model (ECM), respectively investigates the relationship between consumption, housing consumption and economic growth. The empirical result denotes that there exists bilateral Granger causality relationship between consumption and economic growth. For a long period, there exists long term stable equilibrium relationship between GDP, consumption, and housing consumption; consumption and housing consumption both promote the growth of GDP. Housing consumption's contribution to the growth of GDP is obviously higher than consumption. For a short period, consumption spurs the growth of GDP more than housing consumption.

Article Title: A Research on Proceeds, Reductionism and Financing Mode of Rail Transit Projects ebased on the Value Integration Theory - Dalian Rapid Rail Transit Line 3 as an Example
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: urban rail rapid transit; value integration; the proceeds return approach; Dalian Express Rail Traffic No.3 Line
Abstract: Rail transit is an effective solution to urban traffic congestions. As an effective solution to the urban road congestion, urban rapid rail transit (URRT) has been widely utilized in various countries. However, URRT constructions and operations are subject to funds shortage, therefore the introduction of innovative financing and development modes is necessary to solve the problem. According to the value integration theory, if the rail transit project is integrated with the surrounding real estates, the resulting proceeds of real estates will considerably relieve the financial pressure of the URRT. Dalian Express Rail Traffic No.3 Line project is taken as an example in my essay. Based on the Hedonic Approach, the study of project's effects on the integrated value-added rate and on the value of surrounding real estates has been done. Meantime,through the value integration theory, a concept and related methods of comprehensive development of the URRT is put forward to further analyze its effectiveness and scope quantitatively, which is aimed at taking advantage of land comprehensive proceeds return to establish a new financing and developing mode.

Article Title: Application of Social Network Analysis in the Study of Government Project Supervision
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Social Network Analysis; Government Projects; Supervision
Abstract: In recent years, Social Network Analysis (SNA) has been quickly developed as a widely accepted sociology research method. Social network analysis (SNA) is a sociological research methods with widely applicability. This paper presents the basic ideas and main concepts of SNA, summarizes the characteristics of government project supervision, and then introduces SNA into the study of government project supervision, the application method and steps. A new tool for quantitative analysis and research paradigm in the study of government project supervision have also been provided. The main contents include: establish relational matrix and sociogram between the actors; conceptualize the supervision into a series of supervision network with different principal functions; find the critical node in supervision network by the calculation of density, centrality and other network indicators; conduct cluster subgroup analysis, reveal the possible cluster subgroup and structural holes, so as to provide quantitative basis for the improvement of supervision performance.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Knowledge Management Framework to Promote Infrastructure Project Sustainability
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Sustainability; Infrastructure; Knowledge Management; Project Management
Keywords Plus: PERFORMANCE; INDICATORS
Abstract: Infrastructure development can cause major impacts on our environment, society and local economy. As the global realm of sustainability develops and evolves, it is increasingly accepted that sustainability issues should be put on top of the agenda when contemplating infrastructure development. While many construction organizations will not argue against pursuing sustainability, in practice problems often lie with what should be done, who should do them and how mutual benefits can be obtained. This is compounded by the fact that very often there are no common understandings between the stakeholders, and the gap between advancement of research and real life applications in actual projects is still significant. New approaches should be investigated to both develop and expand the body of sustainability knowledge on infrastructure development and investigate better ways of communicating with and managing it to overcome the various barriers within the sector. Knowledge management (KM) has shown its worth and promise in existing applications in the construction industry. Various attempts are being made to develop tools and mechanisms for the effective management of construction knowledge yet few are capable of handling specific characteristics associated with sustainability concerns and infrastructure works. An ongoing research project, undertaken by Queensland University of Technology in Australia, is introduced in this paper. It enlists two rounds of industry surveys to study the unique characters of infrastructure development as well as how sustainability knowledge is best shared and managed. A holistic KM approach is proposed to facilitate sustainability knowledge creation, capture, sharing and application, and the whole process is encapsulated in a general KM framework for decision making of infrastructure stakeholders. It is expected that this research will build up the links between KM activities, industry environment and organizational performance.

Basing on testing of the data under the Random forest method, the very important factors about wage are. expected wage, satisfactory degree, location, job kind and skill The working year, education and industry have some effects to the wage level The working environment, stability and gender have little effect to the wage level

Article Title: FTPL across Government Tiers in Fiscal Federalism
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: fiscal federalism; government tiers; the fiscal theory of the price level; inflation
Keywords Plus: MONETARY
Abstract: After the tax-sharing reform, is FTPL valid in Chinese-style fiscal federalism? We address this question theoretically. We use a general equilibrium model to construct a framework of FTPL in Chinese-style fiscal federalism, where local governments balance their budgets through transfer payments from the central government, and the central government has the right to issue government bond to finance deficit This paper shows that the decrease of local or central government fiscal surplus would raise the equilibrium price level However, both the centralization of fiscal revenue and complementary fiscal policy among local governments will lessen the effect of local government deficit on inflation.

Article Title: Research on Space-time Evaluation of Real estate Development Project Life Cycle
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: life cycle; space-time evaluation; sustainable development
Abstract: Life cycle analysis (LCA) is a kind of evaluation techniques and methods. It was used to analyze the environment influence of the construction entire life cycle, including raw materials acquisition, production, use until the disposal of the products. The LCA method can analyze impacts of the energy consumption and environment emissions on the whole society from each link of constructing the entire building. Its analysis result will enable the project participants to have a clear understanding on energy consumption and the environment emissions. Life cycle assessment method can analyze impacts of the energy consumption and the environment emissions of the entire building on the whole society. The results of the analysis can make each participant clear understand impacts of construction projects on the whole society. Based on the life cycle theory, LCA space-time evaluating indicator is put forward. It can analyze the building energy consumption and environmental emissions. However, its implementation effect is concerned with the corresponding platform.

Article Title: A shockwave profile model for traffic flow on congested urban arterials
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Shockwave profile model (SPM); Traffic flow theory; Traffic signals; Intersection queue; Oversaturation; Spillover
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; HIGHWAY; WAVES
Abstract: In this paper a new traffic flow model for congested arterial networks, named shockwave profile model (SPM), is presented. Taking advantage of the fact that traffic states within a congested link can be simplified as free-flow, saturated, and jammed conditions, SPM simulates traffic dynamics by analytically deriving the trajectories of four major shockwaves: queuing, discharge, departure. and compression waves. Unlike conventional macroscopic models, in which space is often discretized into small cells for numerical solutions, SPM treats each homogeneous road segment with constant capacity as a section; and the queuing dynamics within each section are described by tracing the shockwave fronts. SPM is particularly suitable for simulating traffic flow on congested signalized arterials especially with queue spillover problems, where the steady-state periodic pattern of queue build-up and dissipation process may break down. Depending on when and where spillover occurs along a signalized arterial, a large number of queuing patterns may be possible. Therefore it becomes difficult to apply the conventional approach directly to track shockwave fronts. To overcome this difficulty, a novel approach is proposed as part of the SPM, in which queue spillover is treated as either extending a red phase or creating new smaller cycles, so that the analytical solutions for tracing the shockwave fronts can be easily applied. Since only the essential features of arterial traffic flow, i.e., queue build-up and dissipation, are considered, SPM significantly reduces the computational load and improves the numerical efficiency. We further validated SPM using real-world traffic signal data collected from a major arterial in the Twin Cities. The results clearly demonstrate the effectiveness and accuracy of the model. We expect that in the future this model can be applied in a number of real-time applications such as arterial performance prediction and signal optimization. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Finding the most reliable path with and without link travel time correlation: A Lagrangian substitution based approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Shortest path algorithm; Path travel time reliability; Reliable route; Lagrangian relaxation method
Keywords Plus: SHORTEST; MODEL
Abstract: Path travel time reliability is an essential measure of the quality of service for transportation systems and an important attribute in travelers' route and departure time scheduling. This paper investigates a fundamental problem of finding the most reliable path under different spatial correlation assumptions, where the path travel time variability is represented by its standard deviation. To handle the non-linear and non-additive cost functions introduced by the quadratic forms of the standard deviation term, a Lagrangian substitution approach is adopted to estimate the lower bound of the most reliable path solution through solving a sequence of standard shortest path problems. A subgradient algorithm is used to iteratively improve the solution quality by reducing the optimality gap. To characterize the link travel time correlation structure associated with the end-to-end trip time reliability measure, this research develops a sampling-based method to dynamically construct a proxy objective function in terms of travel time observations from multiple days. The proposed algorithms are evaluated under a large-scale Bay Area, California network with real-world measurements. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Spare parts demand: Linking forecasting to equipment maintenance
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Spare parts; Maintenance; Forecasting; Inventory management; Delay time
Keywords Plus: DELAY-TIME ANALYSIS; INTERMITTENT DEMAND; JOINT OPTIMIZATION; BLOCK-REPLACEMENT; INVENTORY CONTROL; POLICIES; MODELS; SYSTEM; MANAGEMENT; LEVEL
Abstract: Demand for spare parts is typically intermittent and forecasting the relevant requirements constitutes a very challenging exercise. Why is the demand for spare parts intermittent and how can we use models developed in maintenance research to forecast such demand? We attempt to answer these questions: we present a novel idea to forecast demand that relies upon the very sources of the demand generation process and we compare it with a well-known time-series method. We conclude that maintenance driven models are associated with a better performance under certain conditions. We also outline an inter-disciplinary agenda for further research in this area. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Evolutionary variational inequalities and applications to complex dynamic multi-level models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain networks; Infinite-dimensional duality; Lagrange multipliers; Quasi-relative interior; Variational inequalities; Equilibrium problems
Keywords Plus: INFINITE-DIMENSIONAL DUALITY; PRICE EQUILIBRIUM PROBLEM; EXISTENCE; FORMULATION; SYSTEMS; STABILITY; SPACES
Abstract: In this paper we consider a supply chain network model with three tiers of decision-makers (manufacturers, retailers, and consumers) in the case when prices and shipments are evolving on time. Moreover, we assume that excesses of production and excesses of demand of the commodity are present. For such a framework we furnish, using the infinite dimensional duality theory, the equilibrium conditions for the representatives of each tier of the supernetwork, the time-dependent variational formulation governing the complete supply chain supernetwork, and we provide some existence theorems and a numerical example. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sajadieh, MS; Thorstenson, A; Jokar, MRA
Author Full Names: Sajadieh, Mohsen S.; Thorstenson, Anders; Jokar, Mohammad R. Akbari
Article Title: An integrated vendor-buyer model with stock-dependent demand
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Batch production; Double marginalization; Inventory; Integrated vendor-buyer model; Stock-dependent demand
Keywords Plus: CONTROLLABLE LEAD-TIME; LOT-SIZE MODEL; PRODUCTION-INVENTORY PROBLEM; SUPPLY-CHAIN; POLICY; COORDINATION; EXTENSIONS; REDUCTION; PURCHASER; SYSTEM
Abstract: We develop an integrated vendor-buyer model for a two-stage supply chain. The vendor manufactures the product and delivers it in a number of equal-sized batches to the buyer. The items delivered are presented to the end customers in a display area. Demand is assumed to be positively dependent on the amount of items displayed. The objective is to maximize total supply chain profit. The numerical analysis shows that buyer-vendor coordination is more profitable in situations when demand is more stock dependent. It also shows that the effect of double marginalization provides a link between the non-coordinated and the coordinated case. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Solutions to the request reassignment problem in collaborative carrier networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Collaborative planning; Electronic exchange platform; Auction mechanism; Travelling salesman problem with; precedence constraints
Keywords Plus: COMBINATORIAL AUCTIONS; TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; DELIVERY PROBLEM; PROCUREMENT; PICKUP
Abstract: The paper considers an arrangement for exchanging transportation requests to facilitate collaboration among independent carriers. The goal is to maximize the total profit without decreasing the individual profit of the carriers. Two solution approaches are developed for this problem involving decentralized control and auction based exchange mechanisms. The results are compared with those obtained without collaboration and by a centralized control. They indicate that horizontal collaboration pays off even in highly competitive environments. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Airline emission charges: Effects on airfares, service quality, and aircraft design
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Emission charges; Airlines; Global warming
Keywords Plus: NOISE REGULATION; SOCIAL-WELFARE; EQUILIBRIUM; COMPETITION; NETWORKS
Abstract: This paper explores the effect of airline emissions charges on airfares. airline service quality, aircraft design features, and network structure, using a detailed and realistic theoretical model of competing duopoly airlines. These impacts are derived by analyzing the effects of an increase in the effective price of fuel, which is the path by which emissions charges will alter airline choices The results show that emission charges will raise fares, reduce flight frequency, increase load factors, and raise aircraft fuel efficiency, while having no effect on aircraft size Given that these adjustments occur in response to the treatment of an emissions externality that is currently unaddressed, they represent efficient changes that move society closer to a social optimum (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Article Title: Pareto-improving congestion pricing and revenue refunding with multiple user classes
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic equilibrium; Congestion pricing; Pareto-improving; Revenue refunding
Keywords Plus: MULTICLASS; TOLLS
Abstract: This study investigates Pareto-improving congestion pricing and revenue refunding schemes in general transportation networks, which make every road user better off as compared with the situation without congestion pricing We consider user heterogeneity in value of time (VOT) by adopting a multiclass user model with fixed origin-destination (OD) demands. We first prove that an OD and class-based Pareto-improving refunding scheme exists if and only if the total system monetary travel disutility is reduced In view of the practical difficulty in identifying individual user's VOT, we further investigate class-anonymous refunding schemes that give the same amount of refund to all user classes traveling between the same OD pair regardless of their VOTs We establish a sufficient condition for the existence of such OD-specific but class-anonymous Pareto-improving refunding schemes, which needs information only on the average toll paid and average travel time for trips between each OD pair (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Authors: Cao, JX; Lee, DH; Chen, JH; Shi, QX
Author Full Names: Cao, Jin Xin; Lee, Der-Horng; Chen, Jiang Hang; Shi, Qixin
Article Title: The integrated yard truck and yard crane scheduling problem: Blenders' decomposition-based methods
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container terminal operations; Benders' decomposition; Scheduling; Combinatorial optimization; Mixed-integer programming
Keywords Plus: LOADING OUTBOUND CONTAINERS; OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; ROUTING ALGORITHM; TERMINALS; SYSTEMS
Abstract: This paper proposes a novel integrated model for yard truck and yard crane scheduling problems for loading operations in container terminal. The problem is formulated as a mixed-integer programming model. Due to the computational intractability, two efficient solution methods, based on Benders' decomposition, are developed for problem solution; namely, the general Benders' cut-based method and the combinatorial Benders' cut-based method. Computational experiments are conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed solution methods. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Structure of competitive transit networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Transit system design; Bus rapid transit; Transit networks; Transit operations; Transit performance; Urban accessibility
Keywords Plus: BUS; DESIGN
Abstract: This paper describes the network shapes and operating characteristics that allow a transit system to deliver an accessibility level competitive with that of the automobile. To provide exhaustive results for service regions of different sizes and demographics, the paper idealizes these regions as squares with uniform demand, and their possible networks as a broad and realistic family that combines the grid and the hub-and-spoke concepts. The paper also shows how to use these results to generate master plans of transit systems for real cities. The analysis reveals which network structure and technology (Bus, Bus Rapid Transit, or Metro) delivers the desired performance with the least cost. It is found that the more expensive the system's infrastructure, the more it should tilt toward the hub-and-spoke concept. Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) competes effectively with the automobile unless a city is big and its demand low. This happens despite the uniform demand assumption, which penalizes collective transport. It is also found that if a city has enough suitable streets on which to run Bus and BRT systems, these outperform Metro even if the city is large and the demand high. Agency costs are always small compared with user costs; and both decline with the demand density. In all cases, increasing the spatial concentration of stops beyond a critical level increases both, the user and agency costs. Too much spatial coverage is counterproductive. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: He, XZ; Guo, XL; Liu, HX
Author Full Names: He, Xiaozheng; Guo, Xiaolei; Liu, Henry X.
Article Title: A link-based day-to-day traffic assignment model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Day-to-day traffic assignment model; Link-based; Wardrop user equilibrium
Keywords Plus: STOCHASTIC EQUILIBRIUM; DYNAMICAL-SYSTEMS; STABILITY; ROUTE; NETWORK; COMPUTATION; EXISTENCE
Abstract: Existing day-to-day traffic assignment models are all built upon path flow variables. This paper demonstrates two essential shortcomings of these path-based models. One is that their application requires a given initial path flow pattern, which is typically unidentifiable, i.e. mathematically nonunique and practically unobservable. In particular, we show that, for the path-based models, different initial path flow patterns constituting the same link flow pattern generally gives different day-to-day link flow evolutions. The other shortcoming of the path-based models is the path-overlapping problem. That is, the path-based models ignore the interdependence among paths and thus can give very unreasonable results for networks with paths overlapping with each other. These two path-based problems exist for most (if not all) deterministic day-to-day dynamics whose fixed points are the classic Wardrop user equilibrium. To avoid the two path-based problems, we propose a day-to-day traffic assignment model that directly deals with link flow variables. Our link-based model captures travelers' cost-minimization behavior in their path finding as well as their inertia. The fixed point of our link-based dynamical system is the classic Wardrop user equilibrium. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Congested hubs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion; Hub-and-spoke networks; Overprovision of frequency; Congestion internalization; Congestion tolls
Keywords Plus: AIRPORT CONGESTION; AIRLINE ALLIANCES; MARKET POWER; INTERNALIZATION; COMPETITION; CARRIERS; CAPACITY; DELAYS
Abstract: Hub congestion is a major concern and a relevant policy issue because it causes important problems at airports such as flight delays, cancellations and missed connections that end up affecting both air travelers and airlines. We address the interplay between flight frequency and aircraft size in a congestion-pricing model, finding that airlines schedule too many flights using overly small aircraft, which constitutes a major contributor to congestion. Then we work out the needed congestion tolls, which account for the congestion imposed on other carriers and the congestion imposed on all passengers. Finally, we analyze the effects on congestion of network size, airport capacity, alliances and competition in layover time. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Experimental Investigation of Reducing Chlorite Content in Iron Concentrates
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Chlorite; Selective flocculation desliming; Anion reverse flotation
Abstract: Chlorite is an iron-bearing aluminosilicate mineral with structural iron ions on the surface. It is similar to iron oxide minerals in flotation properties, so that it is difficult to separate from iron minerals by flotation. In this work, a comparative test of two processes such as single reverse flotation and selective flocculation desliming-reverse flotation was carried out on fine-grained iron ore with 14.8% chlorite and 23.1% quartz. The results showed that the grade of iron concentrates increased by 2.15% and the content of chlorite in the concentrates decreased greatly. It is obvious that the process of selective flocculation desliming-reverse flotation has advantages in improving the concentrate grade and reducing the chlorite content.

Article Title: Groin-offshore Breakwaters Engineering Impacts Beach Landform of MaoJiaGang
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management

Keywords Plus: SAND
Abstract: The paper studied changes of beach landform impacted by Maojiagang Groin offshore breakwaters engineering study the beach surface in sea wall,discovery that district from original erode change is to silt up, the new beach surface of opposite direction has formed and original beach surface inclines. Beach surface silts up, reach development after balance, beach surface silt in wave role take off, so as pass quality form sport, make be away from the beach surface in bank sea wall silt adjust again, it is been high that the beach surface of wave shadow district silts continuously. Form the beach where is near main sea wall and is away from bank sea wall surface silt up silt up form recently, beach surface forms the topography of saddle shape because of silting up.

Article Title: Application of Flash Magnetizing Roasting Technique in Beneficiation of Siderite and Limonite
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Siderite; Llimonite; Magnetizing roasting
Abstract: Siderite and limonite are well known refractory ores featuring low theoretical grade and complicated association with gangue minerals which usually differ little from siderite and limonite in specific gravity, specific susceptibility, surface hydrophobicity and specific conductivity. Therefore, satisfactory beneficiation results for them can be hardly obtained by physical means. Even if iron concentrates almost having a theoretical grade are obtained at the cost of loss of iron recovery, they can not be used in sintering process in large quantity due to the structure of the ores. In view of the problem, a technique of flash magnetizing roasting is developed to transform siderite and limonite into artificial magnetite so as to enlarge the difference between siderite/limonite and gangue minerals and realize effective separation of the ores. Through comparing the results of separation after Magnetizing roasting of siderite and limonite with those by physical means, it is found that the grade of iron concentrates is increased by 6-15%, the recovery of iron by 15-20%. The technique of flash magnetizing roasting, characterized by fast mass and heat transfer and short reaction time, has advantages such as low roasting cost and high feasibility.

Article Title: Locating road-vehicle refueling stations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Refueling station; Alternative-fuel vehicles; Facility location; Set cover; Mixed integer programming
Keywords Plus: SHORTEST-PATH; FUEL; MODEL; INFRASTRUCTURE; FACILITIES; CONVERSION; NETWORK
Abstract: This study follows the concept of set cover for proposing a refueling-station-location model using a mixed integer programming method, based on vehicle-routing logics. Its solution uses only the easy-obtain data of the origin-destination distance matrix. A case study that focuses on the siting of refueling stations for achieving multiple origin-destination intercity travel via electric vehicles on Taiwan demonstrates the applicability of the model. Sensitivity analysis shows that greater vehicle range will result in a lower number of refueling stations that need to be sited. Range is crucial in reducing the facility-location costs, and therefore is an important issue in the development of alternative-fuel-vehicle technology. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lin, CC; Lin, DY; Young, MM
Author Full Names: Lin, Cheng-Chang; Lin, Dung-Ying; Young, Melanie M.
Article Title: Price planning for time-definite less-than-truckload freight services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Pricing; Logistics; Hub-and-spoke network; Lagrangian Relaxation; Implicit enumeration
Keywords Plus: REVENUE MANAGEMENT; YIELD MANAGEMENT; ELASTICITIES; OVERBOOKING; DEMAND
Abstract: Price planning simultaneous determines the service demand (with associated prices) and an operational plan to maximize a carrier's profit. We modeled this integral-constrained concave program in the link formulation and proposed an implicit enumeration embedded with Lagrangian Relaxation upper bounds to determine the optimal prices. Computations on Taiwan's time-definite less-than-truckload freight market showed that the carrier needs to simultaneously re-evaluate its network capacity while determining prices. The common practice of distance-based pricing that sets price by a base rate over direct shipment distance underestimates operating cost, specifically operating losses for short distance shipments. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Suzuki, Y; Crum, MR; Pautsch, GR
Author Full Names: Suzuki, Yoshinori; Crum, Michael R.; Pautsch, Gregory R.
Article Title: Predicting truck driver turnover
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Motor carrier; Truck driver turnover rate; Survival model; Decision support model
Keywords Plus: RETENTION
Abstract: We propose a decision tool for truckload carriers that can help control driver turnover rates. Our approach is to use an existing econometric method, along with the drivers' work data, to predict the quit probability of each driver on a weekly basis, so that carriers can identify a subset of drivers who are about to quit in a timely manner. Empirical results from two case studies indicate that our approach does a nice job of predicting driver exits, and that it may become a useful management decision tool. Our method was recently adopted by two US truckload carriers. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Replenishment and lead time decisions in manufacturer-retailer chains
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Inventory; Integrated model; Lead time; Distribution free demand
Keywords Plus: BACK-ORDER DISCOUNTS; LOT-SIZE MODEL; INVENTORY MODELS; INTEGRATED INVENTORY; STOCHASTIC DEMAND; VENDOR; POLICY; COST; PURCHASER
Abstract: This study investigates the decisions of replenishment and lead-time reduction for a single-manufacturer multiple-retailer integrated inventory system in which the probability distribution of demand for each retailer is unknown but its mean and variance are given. A decision model is presented and a minimax. distribution free procedure is applied to determine the lead time, the common shipment cycle time, the target levels of replenishments and the number of shipments per production cycle so that the expected total system cost can be minimized. A decision support system has been implemented on a personal computer to illustrate the application of the model. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bhat, CR; Sen, S; Eluru, N
Author Full Names: Bhat, Chandra R.; Sen, Sudeshna; Eluru, Naveen
Article Title: The impact of demographics, built environment attributes, vehicle characteristics, and gasoline prices on household vehicle holdings and use
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: MDCEV model; Gasoline prices; Built environment; Household vehicle holdings and use; Vehicle make/model choice
Keywords Plus: CAR OWNERSHIP; DISAGGREGATE MODEL; CHOICE; PREFERENCES; FORMULATION; TRAVEL
Abstract: In this paper, we formulate and estimate a nested model structure that includes a multiple discrete-continuous extreme value (MDCEV) component to analyze the choice of vehicle type/vintage and usage in the upper level and a multinomial logit (MNL) component to analyze the choice of vehicle make/model in the lower nest. Data for the analysis are drawn from the 2000 San Francisco Bay Area Travel Survey. The model results indicate the important effects of household demographics, household location characteristics, built environment attributes, household head characteristics, and vehicle attributes on household vehicle holdings and use. The model developed in the paper is applied to predict the impact of land-use and fuel cost changes on vehicle holdings and usage of the households. Such predictions can inform the design of proactive land-use, economic, and transportation policies to influence household vehicle holdings and usage in a way that reduces the negative impacts of automobile dependency such as traffic congestion, fuel consumption and air pollution. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: The disposition state of investment & financing of environmental protection in China is closely related to the regional economic structure and the extent of economic development. In the relatively developed regions with higher economic efficiency, the investment & financing of environmental protection is comparatively more efficient. This paper attempts to use empirical data to compare the investment & financing of environmental protection of different areas, thus making an in-depth analysis of the immanent cause of the difference of investment & financing of environmental protection among different regions.

Article Title: Research On Evaluation For Green Development of Tourism Real Estate
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Tourism real estate; Green development; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; Tangshan hot springs resort
Abstract: Tourism and real estate are high value-added and strongly associated in tertiary industry. With the development of China's economy, they has become an important growth point of national economy. Real estate tourism is born due to the synchronization of the tourism and real estate. Presently, there is no tourism real estate in foreign research, timeshare is a more frequently used word. With the rapid development of the tourism industry, investment for tourism real estate has gradually become the new hot spot. How to achieve green development of tourism real estate and sustainable development of resources is an important issue for the development of tourism real estate. The concept and type of tourism real estate was first discussed in the paper, and then a green tourism real estate development evaluation index system was built, the green development of Tangshan hot springs resort project was evaluated with fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method at last and some measures were stated for the late development.

Authors: Holmes, G; Fletcher, D; Reutemann, P; Frank, E
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Holmes, Geoffrey; Fletcher, Dale; Reutemann, Peter; Frank, Eibe
Article Title: Analysing chromatographic data using data mining to monitor petroleum content in water
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Gas Chromatography Mass Spectrometry; GC-MS; BTEX; Data Mining; Model Trees; Regression; Data Preprocessing; Correlation Optimized Warping; Petroleum Monitoring
Abstract: Chromatography is an important analytical technique that has widespread use in environmental applications. A typical application is the monitoring of water samples to determine if they contain petroleum. These tests are mandated in many countries to enable environmental agencies to determine if tanks used to store petrol are leaking into local water systems. Chromatographic techniques, typically using gas or liquid chromatography coupled with mass spectrometry, allow an analyst to detect a vast array of compounds-potentially in the order of thousands. Accurate analysis relies heavily on the skills of a limited pool of experienced analysts utilising semi-automatic techniques to analyse these datasets-making the outcomes subjective. The focus of current laboratory data analysis systems has been on refinements of existing approaches. The work described here represents a paradigm shift achieved through applying data mining techniques to tackle the problem. These techniques are compelling because the efficacy of preprocessing methods, which are essential in this application area, can be objectively evaluated. This paper presents preliminary results using a data mining framework to predict the concentrations of petroleum compounds in water samples. Experiments demonstrate that the framework can be used to produce models of sufficient accuracy-measured in terms of root mean squared error and correlation coefficients-to offer the potential for significantly reducing the time spent by analysts on this task.

Article Title: Risk Identification of E-Government Outsourcing
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: e-government; flowchart; outsourcing; risk identification
Abstract: This paper analyzed the risk identification method for e-government service outsourcing. E-government has become an explicit component of public sector reform and e-government outsourcing becomes a crucial choice for government to support its sustainable development. Outsourcing decision and contractual arrangements of e-government is a risky endeavor which may lead great loss. Based on review of literature, this paper identified major risk categories of e-government outsourcing. Then, various risk factors within each stage were discussed according to the outsourcing process. Finally, a general framework for the study of risk factors in e-government outsourcing was proposed.

Article Title: The Owners' Tactics of Leading the Implementation of the Partnering Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: owners; the Partnering Model; leading role
Abstract: In recent years, although the construction engineering investment has reached at a very high scale one year in Chinese mainland, there are still some problems, such as the level of the construction project management need to be enhanced, the effect of the construction investment need to be improved urgently, etc. This paper highlights the importance of partnering in construction and the leading role which the owners should play in the process of implementing the partnering model. The paper presents the tactics on how the owners lead the implementation of partnering, which include the following: the owners learn deeply and grasp concisely the essence of partnering, prepare well for the proposing and practicing of partnering, put forward the demand of implementing partnering at the procurement phase, lead the concluding of partnering agreement, hire facilitator, and keep the process of partnering under control.

Article Title: Chinese Culture and Modern Enterprise Learning-The Promoting Function of Traditional Culture Textbooks
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Chinese Culture; Modern Enterprise; Learning Organization; Textbooks
Abstract: The enterprises organization management mode is one of the core issues of the management theory. The theory of learning organization has thought under the background of new economic the enterprise continuous development should rely on enhancing its overall abilities and improving its overall quality. Chinese traditional culture has contained rich management thinking, especially strong motivation for the modern enterprise learning. The theory of learning organization and Chinese traditional culture are compared in this paper. It is obvious that they have strong consistency in ideology. At the same time, the shackles of Chinese traditional culture to the modern enterprise learning are analyzed. But this paper pays emphasis on the impetus of Chinese culture to modern enterprise learning, so powerful vitality of Chinese traditional culture has been shown. It is an optional road for our enterprise management that to abandon the management ideas of traditional culture and form our modern enterprise management with Chinese culture connotation.

Abstract: China has begun issuing local government bonds since March 2009, whose release can effectively mobilize the enthusiasm of local governments and implement the proactive fiscal policy However, local government bonds as a financial instrument is also a risk, and have their unique risk characteristics in China's economic background and institutional context This article analyzed the characteristics risk of Chinese local government bonds from different aspects, and classified the different risks of the different levels of classification, and put forward the corresponding risk prevention measures for the major characteristics risk.

Article Title: Fuzzy Modelling for Enhancement of Integrated Network Management Effectiveness
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Awareness modelling; Fuzzy logic; Fuzzy Modelling; Integrated Network Management
Abstract: It is well established that the basic idea of managing networks, through monitoring and control of their comprising elements and nodes are not effective for modern complex enterprise networks. For these networks, an integrated management approach that also takes the nature of the enterprise and the services it provides into account must be utilized. This is a complex task. While many automated approaches are in use, to a large extent the effectiveness of the integrated management depends on understanding the functions of its components and their relations with one another. In most cases, it is impossible to identify precise crisp models describing the roles, functions, and interactions of such components in a useful manner. One of the main reasons for that, is that characterization of these concepts by human beings and managers has a fuzzy nature. Linguistic variables are extensively used in communication of such understandings. In this paper, these ideas are further discussed and ways to utilize fuzzy modelling to improve integrated management effectiveness are explored.

Article Title: Research on the Sustainable Development of Chinese Real Estate Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green building; The real estate; Sustainable development; Measures
Abstract: Recently, the real estate industry has become one of the pillar industries in China. In 2005, even if under the government's macro-control, the rate of their increase was 20 percent of the contribution made by the real estate industry accounts for above 8 percent of GDP(July, 2007). However, there is a large difference between the real estate industry and the other manufacturing development: the land resources and the consumption demand directly limit the development of the real estate industry. The strategy of sustainable development is the basic development strategy of China, and is the guiding principle for development of every industry. At present, with the high-speed development of real estate industry, the problem that is incongruous with sustainable development comes up. These problems are analyzed in the paper, and the measures on the real estate industry sustainable development are put up.

Article Title: Research on Innovation of Classroom Instructional Mode and Practice Teaching Mode of Real Estate Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate development; Classroom; Practice; Innovation
Abstract: Real estate is a special kind of commodity. The realty business is a particular industry. Real estate management and operation is a professional aspect of engineering management to culture talents in real estate. Real Estate Development is one of very important professional basic courses of engineering management specialty, which include central contents of real estate development. The study in this paper establishes multi-level teaching system of real estate development and opening practice teaching mode to cultivate innovative talents better which have been taken as a target. Meantime, it puts forward suggestions, including reinforcing the construction of teaching material, putting emphasis on registered engineer's basic requirements of practicing qualification, reforming assessment methods, strengthening the teachers' cultivation, and inspiring students' subjective initiative of study in the joyful learning and competence-based teaching ideas. This paper fully embodies the educational ideas of individualized teaching and cultivating personality.

Authors: Yang, GF; Wang, ZP; Li, XQ
Author Full Names: Yang, Guang-fen; Wang, Zhi-ping; Li, Xiao-qiang
Article Title: The optimization of the closed-loop supply chain network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Closed-loop supply chain; Network; Return ratio; Transformation rate; Variational inequality
Keywords Plus: PRODUCT RECOVERY; EQUILIBRIUM; MANAGEMENT; IMPACT; MODEL
Abstract: This paper develops a model of a general closed-loop supply chain network, which includes raw material suppliers, manufacturers, retailers, consumers and recovery centers. The objective of this paper is to formulate and optimize the equilibrium state of the network by using the theory of variational inequalities. Several examples and figures are used to describe the effects of parameters (the return ratio, the transformation rate of raw materials, and the transformation rate of recyclable products) on the equilibrium shipments and net revenues.
