Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Some Research on a Coordinated and Harmonious Development between a Transit-Oriented Land Development Format and Rail Transit Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Transit-OrientedDevelopment; Transportation on Rails; Real Estate Development
Abstract: In the background of rapid urban expansion in China in terms of its speed and scale, rapid urban mass transit systems on rails are under planning. This kind of transit system serves as a major counter-measure against urban traffic congestions so as to improve the quality of life in the urban environment and to maintain and push forward a sustained development in society and the urban economy. Meanwhile, the arrival of a mass transit system on rails will have a knock-on effect on the real estate development all along the lines of the rail roads. This leads to housing development in a rather high density, together with suburbanization. This thesis probes into specific measures in Transit-Oriented Development. This paper puts forward feasible and operational counter-measures for a well-coordinated development between rail transport and real estate after it explores the inter-relations between the two types of development.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Intensity measure of land-use: Based on the view of Growth Drag
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land Intensity measuring; Land planning; Growth Drag
Abstract: Since the implement of comprehensive land use planning (1986-2000) in China, it is the most important target of land policy to use land intensively to meet the land demand of industrialization and urbanization. The questions we care about are how to measure the land-use intensification degree in China? Does the degree of land-use intensification enhance or reduce? The thesis introduces the Growth Drag model to answer those questions. After combing the literature, the thesis discovered that, the former researchers started with the case of Cobb-Douglas production function, in which the elasticity of substitution among production factors is 1. But the hypothesis is not true in the real economy world. So we choose the modified two-level CES production function as the basic model. Meanwhile, the thesis gives hypothesis of land resource limitation, which is the scarce of land resources is more alleviation. Based on the modified two-level CES production function, we deduce the equations of Growth Drag. In the empirical study, firstly, the thesis used the OLS to estimate the parameters, found that the serious autocorrelation between variables violates the basic hypothesis, and then used the Generalized Difference Method to overcome the autocorrelation. The result indicated that the Growth Drag of land resource was 0.46% and 0.37% respectively. From the view of Growth Drag analysis, the thesis drew a conclusion that the degree of land-use intensification degree in 1985-1995 had a larger upgrade than the one in 1996-2005.

Authors: Ye, W; Chong, XA; Xin, L
Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y

Article Title: Research on Commercial Bank's Performance Appraisal Based on K-Means
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: commercial bank; performance; silhouette coefficient; k-means; cluster analysis
Abstract: Based on the management data of our country's twelve commercial banks, this paper first used the two indexes of minimum square sum of error (SSE) and silhouette coefficient to determine the optimum cluster number, and then it did cluster analysis of each bank's performance by using K-means. The paper at last gave a solution on the determination of the optimum hierarchy number in commercial banks' performance appraisal, which has high referential value.

Article Title: How to Detecting Fraudulent Financial Statement through SVM
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Abstract: It is very important for investor, creditor and supervisor to effectively detecting fraudulent financial report of listed companies This paper build a model to detect fraudulent financial report,which is based on Support Vector machine (SVM) with Gauss Function as core function and choose the best parameters through 7-fold cross-validation combined with network searching algorithm The result identify that the SVM model has a better accuracy

Authors: Zhang, YL; Li, HM; Ma, X; Wang, WH
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang Yuling; Li Huimin; Ma Xin; Wang Wenghuan
Article Title: Study on Assessment System of Green Construction of Infrastructures Based on Coordinated Development Degree
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Innovation capability; Infrastructures Green Construction; Assessment System; Coordinated Development Degree
Abstract: In order to satisfy users with the operation requirements of infrastructures and reduce the energy consumption and environmental pollution during the building implementation process, the DSS assessment system of green construction of infrastructures is established. By introducing coordinated development degree, the common characteristics and concerted mechanism in the process of infrastructure construction are studied and obtained. Then the 6 kinds of infrastructure projects which include road and bridge engineering, water supply engineering, drainage engineering, waste treatment, night soil treatment and household energy are used as the first grade indexes evaluation objects of coordinated development degree, the classification indexes of concrete refinement are used as the second grade indexes, and the evaluation indexes of concrete implementation are used as the third grade indexes. By computing the order parameter -coordinated development degree of the indexes at all levels, the influencing factors which go against the sustainable development in the process of infrastructure construction are found out, which can offer the decision basis for building control. Conclusions are drawn through the research:(1)The construction procedure has great significance in the architectural sustainable development;(2) The assessment system should give attention to generality and flexibility;(3) The qualitative and quantitative indexes can coexist in the evaluation indexes of concrete implementation.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on correlation between Construction Technology Standardization and Industrial Competitiveness
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction Technology Standardization; Industurial Competitiveness; Correlation
Abstract: Technology standardization is coding the information of product and technology to reduce the cost of transmitting information and improve the level of standardization, which can accelerate the transformation, promotion and application. Though had tried something in standardization, our construction industry still has many problems such as lacking of consciousness, lagging of system, inefficient process and insufficient tracking and participation in international standardization. This paper deals with the correlation between technology standardization and industrial competitiveness. On this basis, this paper puts forward four measures such as mechanism of construction standards formation, mechanism of coordination with construction technology innovation, mechanism to track and participate in defining international standards, and excitation mechanism which is set up by government to encourage construction technology standardization.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Implicit Marketing Mode Based on Promotion of Purchase Intentions
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Implicit Demand; Residential Product; Purchase Intentions; Marketing Mode
Abstract: With the consummation of the residential market, consumers have become mature and rational. At present, the consumers not only consider the visible elements, like the quality, the price, the location and so on, they value other factors more and more, such as the knowledge and the emotion factors. Therefore, the developer needs to develop implicit demand of the residential product constantly. However, the recognition and development of implicit demand only achieves the stage of the creativity production to product realization, the successful product development doesn't always bring on successful marketing. It is the key of transforming profit successfully which is how can we deliver the value of the residential product based on implicit demand exploitation by using suited marketing mix, and how can we inspire the consumer's purchase intentions. This paper chooses the consumer's purchase intentions based on implicit demand exploitation as the dependent variable. By reviewing researches on antecedents of purchase intention, the paper finds out three pivotal antecedents variables: perceived value, perceived quality and perceived risk, and chooses product knowledge, perceived price, consumption scene, brand perception, advertising perception and reference group as the independent variables. This paper endeavors to build marketing mode based on the residential product of implicit demand exploitation and propose the corresponding marketing strategy by discussing the factors and ways that influence the consumer's purchase intentions.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Brokerage Industry and Buyer's Choice in an Emerging Housing Market: A Case Study of Guangzhou
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Broker; Brokerage industry; Buyer search; Search duration; Exclusive contract; Housing market
Keywords Plus: REAL-ESTATE BROKER; SEARCH
Abstract: This paper examines characteristics of brokerage industry and buyers' choices in their search process in China's urban housing market, where inactive housing stock transactions and infant brokerage industry are distinct characteristics. Using Guangzhou as a case, determinants of buyer's decision to use broker service or not, and how many brokers a broker-assisted buyer will employ are examined. The efficiency outcomes are also evaluated. It is demonstrated that despite the industry's immature nature, brokers do shorten search duration by reducing search cost. The broker-choice model shows that besides search cost, buyers' confidence in brokers' service quality will greatly influence their choice. Some buyer groups are more likely to employ many brokers during search, such as those who have lower opportunity cost of time and sensitive to housing price, but such arrangement does not helpful for improving market efficiency measured by duration.

Authors: Zhu, XQ; Van Ommeren, J; Rietveld, P
Author Full Names: Zhu, Xueqin; Van Ommeren, Jos; Rietveld, Piet
Article Title: Indirect benefits of infrastructure improvement in the case of an imperfect labor market
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Regional modeling; Surplus equivalence problem; Efficiency wage theory; Transport infrastructure; Welfare effects
Keywords Plus: UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS; EQUILIBRIUM; AGGLOMERATION; MODELS; WAGES
Abstract: We perform a welfare analysis of transport infrastructure improvements in the presence of an imperfect labor market, allowing for endogenous wages and involuntary unemployment. Efficiency wage setting is incorporated in a spatial two-region general equilibrium model, written as a welfare program. In our model, firms set wages above the market clearing level to create an inducement for employees not to shirk. The economy-wide effect (i.e. social welfare or total welfare) consists of the direct effect in transport market and the indirect effect in other markets. We conduct welfare analyses different from the conventional cost-benefit analysis, in which we distinguish between the direct welfare effect based on consumer surplus in the transport market and the indirect welfare effect through changes in regional unemployment, which is captured in the economy-wide effect. In our model, infrastructure improvement may increase unemployment in one region, but overall unemployment levels fall. The indirect welfare effects through decreases in overall unemployment are about 10-20% of the direct welfare effects for most plausible labor market parameters. The indirect welfare effects are larger, the poorer the initial transport infrastructure and the larger the labor market imperfections. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Han, LS; Ukkusuri, S; Doan, K
Author Full Names: Han, Lanshan; Ukkusuri, Satish; Doan, Kien
Article Title: Complementarity formulations for the cell transmission model based dynamic user equilibrium with departure time choice, elastic demand and user heterogeneity
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User equilibrium; Cell transmission model; Complementarity; Departure time; Heterogeneous users; Demand elasticity
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; VARYING FLOWS; CONGESTION
Abstract: In this paper we formulate the dynamic user equilibrium problem with an embedded cell transmission model on a network with a single OD pair, multiple parallel paths, multiple user classes with elastic demand. The formulation is based on ideas from complementarity theory. The travel time is estimated based on two methods which have different transportation applications: (1) maximum travel time and (2) average travel time. These travel time functions result in linear and non-linear complementarity formulations respectively. Solution existence and the properties of the formulations are rigorously analyzed. Extensive computational experiments are conducted to demonstrate the benefits of the proposed formulations on various test networks. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Space allocating strategies for improving import yard performance at marine terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container terminal; Import operations; Storage strategy; Rehandles
Abstract: This paper focuses on the organization of the import storage yard at container port terminals. Three new stacking strategies are introduced which take into account the containers' arrival and departure rates and the storage yard characteristics. A mathematical model based on probabilistic distribution functions is developed to estimate the number of rehandles required to manage an import container yard. The model is applied to the three proposed stacking strategies. Results show that the optimal strategy depends on stacking height and the relationship between vessel headway and container dwell time. Authors: Zhao, Y; Triantis, K; Murray-Tuite, P; Edara, P
Author Full Names: Zhao, Y.; Triantis, K.; Murray-Tuite, P.; Edara, P.
Article Title: Performance measurement of a transportation network with a downtown space reservation system: A network-DEA approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation network; Performance measurement; Travel demand management; Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA); Network DEA
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; SLACKS-BASED MEASURE; EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS; PRODUCTIVITY; OUTPUTS
Abstract: We propose an evaluation approach for a novel travel demand management strategy known as the downtown space reservation system (DSRS). This approach takes into account three perspectives, i.e., transportation service providers, the user's, and the community's and is based on network-Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) where the perspectives are inter-related through intermediate inputs/outputs. Two types of network-DEA models (radial and slacks-based models) are considered. An example is provided using data propagated from a microscopic traffic simulation model of the DSRS. The results show that individual node performance can drive network DEA performance and that this information can inform future designs of the DSRS. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Zhu, QH; Geng, Y; Sarkis, J; Lai, KH
Author Full Names: Zhu, Qinghua; Geng, Yong; Sarkis, Joseph; Lai, Kee-hung
Article Title: Evaluating green supply chain management among Chinese manufacturers from the ecological modernization perspective
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Green supply chain management; Ecological modernization; China
Keywords Plus: ENVIRONMENTAL GOVERNANCE; DEVELOPING-COUNTRIES; CIRCULAR ECONOMY; INNOVATION; PRESSURES; POLICY; LEVEL
Abstract: Green supply chain management (GSCM) has become an emergent ecological modernization tool amongst Chinese manufacturers to balance environmental performance with productivity and business performance gains. Ecological modernization at the society level is influenced by restructuring policies and regulations. Some of these policies and regulations in China are focusing on enhancing energy savings and pollution reduction (ESPR). Based on a survey of 376 responses, we investigate whether different Chinese manufacturer clusters varying in their extent of implementing GSCM exist from this ecological modernization perspective. We also examine if Chinese manufacturers' awareness of domestic and international environmental ESPR-oriented compliance is related to GSCM implementation and whether a mediating effect of regulatory pressure plays a significant role. The results highlight the varying pace of Chinese manufacturers to ecologically modernize with GSCM practices and the significance of regulatory pressure to diffuse the practices adoption by Chinese manufacturing industry. Implications of this research go beyond the manufacturers investigated in this study where similar occurrence of these relationships may exist in other regions. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. Article Title: The corridor problem: Preliminary results on the no-toll equilibrium
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Morning commute; Congestion; Corridor; Equilibrium
Keywords Plus: LAND-USE; URBAN MODEL; CONGESTION; TRANSPORTATION
Abstract: Consider a traffic corridor that connects a continuum of residential locations to a point central business district, and that is subject to flow congestion. The population density function along the corridor is exogenous, and except for location vehicles are identical. All vehicles travel along the corridor from home to work in the morning rush hour, and have the same work start-time but may arrive early. The two components of costs are travel time costs and schedule delay (time early) costs. Determining equilibrium and optimum traffic flow patterns for this continuous model, and possible extensions, is termed The Corridor Problem. Equilibria must satisfy the trip-timing condition, that at each location no vehicle can experience a lower trip price by departing at a different time. This paper investigates the no-toll equilibrium of the basic Corridor Problem. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Huang, SY; Hsu, WJ; He, YX
Author Full Names: Huang, Shell Ying; Hsu, Wen Jing; He, Yuxiong
Article Title: Assessing capacity and improving utilization of anchorages
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Decision support system; Anchorage capacity; Disc packing algorithms
Keywords Plus: RECTANGULAR CONTAINER; CIRCLES
Abstract: Anchorages are important resources for certain hub ports, and they are increasingly in demand during peak periods. We evaluate the capacity of multiple anchorages by reproducing realistic mix of arriving vessels, dwelling time and the current practices in choosing anchoring spots within an anchorage. The model is validated by using historical data. We also propose methods for improving space utilization of anchorages. Our experiments with four real anchorages show that the space utilization is improved by 6-10% with MHDF and WALLPACK_MHDF algorithms. This finding opens up possibilities of designating vessel anchoring spots for improved utilizations in the future. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhang, C; Chen, XJ; Sumalee, A
Author Full Names: Zhang, Chao; Chen, Xiaojun; Sumalee, Agachai
Article Title: Robust Wardrop's user equilibrium assignment under stochastic demand and supply: Expected residual minimization approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Wardrop's user equilibrium; Robust traffic assignment; Demand and supply uncertainty; Nonadditive cost; Expected residual minimization
Keywords Plus: LINEAR COMPLEMENTARITY-PROBLEMS; TRAFFIC EQUILIBRIUM; TRAVEL-TIMES; NETWORK; UNCERTAINTY; MODEL; RELIABILITY; DESIGN; COSTS
Abstract: Various models of traffic assignment under stochastic environment have been proposed recently, mainly by assuming different travelers' behavior against uncertainties. This paper focuses on the expected residual minimization (ERM) model to provide a robust traffic assignment with an emphasis on the planner's perspective. The model is further extended to obtain a stochastic prediction of the traffic volumes by the technique of path choice approach. We show theoretically the existence and the robustness of the ERM solution. In addition, we employ an improved solution algorithm for solving the ERM model. Numerical experiments are carried out to illustrate the characteristics of the proposed model, by comparing with other existing models. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: van den Berg, V; Verhoef, ET
Author Full Names: van den Berg, Vincent; Verhoef, Erik T.
Article Title: Congestion tolling in the bottleneck model with heterogeneous values of time
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion pricing; Bottleneck model; Heterogeneity; Value of time; Second-best pricing
Keywords Plus: ROADS
Abstract: When analysing the effects of transport policies it is important to adequately control for heterogeneity: previous studies note that ignoring heterogeneity biases the estimated welfare effects of tolling. This paper examines the effects of tolling, in a bottleneck model, with a continuously distributed value of time. With homogeneous users, first-best public tolling has no effect on prices. With heterogeneity it does: low values of time lose, and high values of time gain. The average congestion externality decreases with the heterogeneity in the value of time. Consequently, the welfare gain of first-best tolling also decreases. The more heterogeneous the value of time is, the lower the relative efficiency of a public pay-lane. This finding contrasts with the previous literature. Earlier studies, using static flow congestion, conclude that the relative efficiency increases with this type of heterogeneity. With more heterogeneity in the value of time, the relative efficiency of a private pay-lane is also lower, while that of a public time-invariant toll is higher. Our results suggest that the welfare gains of different tolling schemes are affected differently by heterogeneity. Further, the impact of heterogeneity on the effects of a policy also depends on the type of congestion considered. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The decline of the traditional travel agent model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airline ticket market; Travel agencies; Low-cost carriers; e-Commerce; Purchase channel; Multinomial logit model
Keywords Plus: LOW-COST AIRLINES; FULL-SERVICE CARRIERS; BUSINESS TRAVELERS; AIR-TRAVEL; E-COMMERCE; TOURISM; MARKETS; PERSPECTIVES; PASSENGERS; AIRPORTS
Abstract: This article analyzes the struggle between traditional travel agencies and airlines to gain control of the Spanish airline services market. Also analyzed is the strong emergence of a third player, online travel portals that act as online travel agencies. We use a multinomial logit model to study the influence of 27 socio-economic factors and trip attributes on passenger purchase channel choice. The results show that the profile of a passenger who has a greater likelihood of making his/her bookings online is that of a young person, a student or educated to a high level, a habitual traveler, booking a simple journey and using an LCC. The factors linked to an increased likelihood of making purchases by phone include: being male, middle-aged, on a business or short trip, and the passengers usually use a travel agency. Finally, passengers who are over 65 years of age, with a lower academic level, who use a travel agency and are going to make a more complicated journey, are more likely to purchase their tickets in-store. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Tordeux, A; Lassarre, S; Roussignol, M
Author Full Names: Tordeux, Antoine; Lassarre, Sylvain; Roussignol, Michel
Article Title: An adaptive time gap car-following model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic; Car-following; Maximum likelihood estimation; Simulation; Kinematic waves emergence
Keywords Plus: DYNAMICS
Abstract: We intend to define a continuous car-following model exclusively based on the time gap. A model of the interaction between a vehicle and its predecessor is produced by adjusting the time gap to a targeted safety time that is a function of speed. The model is defined by a differential system, to which a consistent numerical scheme is associated The parameters of the model are statistically estimated by maximum likelihood In order to reproduce a heterogeneous traffic flow, vehicles are differentiated by type, and to recreate asymmetric longitudinal behavior, acceleration phases are distinguished from deceleration phases. Introducing a reaction time, inducing a delay in the perception and processing of information about vehicles in interaction, can alter the stability of the flux through appearance of kinematic waves By simulation, the types and domains of parameters which are asymptotically unstable are identified. The results reveal that, in the model, the statistically estimated parameters form is strongly factor of instability (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd All rights reserved

Authors: Li, Z; Hensher, DA; Rose, JM
Author Full Names: Li, Zheng; Hensher, David A.; Rose, John M.
Article Title: Willingness to pay for travel time reliability in passenger transport: A review and some new empirical evidence
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Travel time reliability; Passenger transport; Value of travel time savings; Value of reliability; Schedule delay
Keywords Plus: VALUATION; UNRELIABILITY; VARIABILITY; UNCERTAINTY; DRIVERS; MODEL
Abstract: This paper reviews and critiques the modelling frameworks and empirical measurement paradigms used to obtain willingness to pay (WTP) for improved travel time reliability, suggesting new directions for ongoing research. We also estimate models to derive values of reliability, scheduling costs and reliability ratios in the context of Australian toll roads and use the new evidence to highlight the important influence of the way that trip time variability is included in stated preference studies in deriving WTP estimates of reliability in absolute terms, and relative to the value of travel time savings. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Marazzo, M; Scherre, R; Fernandes, E
Author Full Names: Marazzo, Marcial; Scherre, Rafael; Fernandes, Elton
Article Title: Air transport demand and economic growth in Brazil: A time series analysis
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Air transport demand; Time series; Co-integration; Error correction model
Keywords Plus: ELECTRICITY CONSUMPTION; COINTEGRATION
Abstract: We investigate the relationship between air transport demand (passenger-kilometer: PAX) and economic growth (GDP) between 1966 and 2006 in Brazil. Special attention is paid to stationary features and the existence of a long-run equilibrium between variables to work in a vector autoregressive environment. Our findings suggest that GDP and PAX are co-integrated. Impulse-response analysis indicates a strong positive reaction of PAX due to a positive change in GDP. However, GDP reacts to a change in PAX in a slower and moderated way. We interpret these findings as an empirical evidence of air transport multiplier effects in the economy. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Paleari, S; Redondi, R; Malighetti, P
Author Full Names: Paleari, Stefano; Redondi, Renato; Malighetti, Paolo
Article Title: A comparative study of airport connectivity in China, Europe and US: Which network provides the best service to passengers?
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport connectivity; Network features; Travel time
Keywords Plus: CENTRALITY
Abstract: This paper investigates the connectivity of the airport networks in China, Europe and US. our aim is to analyze which network is most beneficial to final passengers in terms of travel time and which of the network features lead to such a result. A time-dependent minimum path approach is employed to calculate the minimum travel time between each pair of airports in the three networks, inclusive of flight times and waiting times in intermediate airports. We evaluate each fastest indirect connection in terms of waiting times and routing factors to consider the effect of the hubs' coordination and locations. The Chinese network provides the quickest travels for passengers, but this performance is explained by a small number of airports per inhabitant. The US network is the most coordinated when considering indirect connections. The EU network provides the most homogeneous level of service when comparing airports of different sizes. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Strategic design and operational management optimization of a multi stage physical distribution system
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Facility location (FL); Supply chain management (SCM); Location allocation problem (LAP); Cluster analysis (CA); Mixed integer programming; Heuristic algorithm
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT; FACILITY LOCATION; INVENTORY; ALLOCATION; FRAMEWORK; NETWORK
Abstract: Design and management of logistic networks is one of the most critical issues in supply chain management. However, the literature does not contain any effective models, methods, and applications that simultaneously support management decisions in the strategic design of the distribution system, in the operational planning and organization of vehicles, and in container trips organization adopting different modes of transportation. The aim of this paper is to illustrate an original framework for the design and optimization of a multi echelon and multi level production/distribution system that combines mixed-integer linear programming modeling with cluster analysis, heuristic algorithms, and optimal transportation rules. A significant case study is illustrated revealing the effectiveness of the approach and tools proposed. Crown Copyright (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Barros, Carlos Pestana; Weber, William L.
Article Title: Productivity growth and biased technological change in UK airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: UK airports; Productivity growth; Biased technological change; Policy implications
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; MAJOR AIRPORTS; PERFORMANCE; EFFICIENCY; BENCHMARKING; DEA; METHODOLOGY
Abstract: In this paper we estimate the total factor productivity of UK airports using a Malmquist index. Productivity change is factored into an index of efficiency change and an index of technological change. Technological change is further decomposed into indexes that measure the bias in the production of outputs, the bias in the employment of inputs, and the magnitude of the shift in the production frontier, Airports are ranked according to their productivity change for the period 2000-2005. Economic implications are derived. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A vehicle routing cost evaluation algorithm for the strategic analysis of radial distribution networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Retail distribution; Vehicle routing; Load building and routing
Keywords Plus: BIN PACKING PROBLEM; LOWER BOUNDS; HEURISTICS
Abstract: This article presents a new algorithm, based on bin packing algorithms, that determines vehicle routing costs on networks with certain geographic characteristics. Requiring very little data and computation time, the algorithm is used to test the impact of adding flexibility to a retailer's Canadian distribution operations. It is shown that it is possible to save 5-10% of vehicle routing costs by modifying shipping schedules. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Keywords: regional disparity; consumption effect; the elasticity of consumption
Abstract: Research of the effects of local government spending on regional household consumption has great guiding significance for the local government to adjust the spending to stimulate household consumption and develop regional economy because China's regional economic disparity has shown a growing trend The result of this paper shows that the relationship between China's local government spending and household consumption reflects distinct regional differences, so each region should arrange for local government spending in accordance with the level of economic development to boost household consumption in the region

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chen Xu; Li HuiMin; Yan RuiQi; Zhong XingRun
Article Title: The Application of Value Engineering in Transformation of Old Industrial Building
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: old industrial building(group); function transformation; Value engineering; insulation materials
Abstract: The beginning of the 21st century world is from the industrial age into the information age, from the industrial society to post-industrial society, from city to city of the century. [1]With the global economy and global integration process of industrial restructuring, China's economic structure is undergoing dramatic changes. Post-industrial society is rapidly rising, while the industrial society is increasingly a recession, there ware some phenomenons that have been described by some scholars that is Deindustrialization or back three binary In post-industrial society, there is a phenomenon called deindustrialization occurring, which requires the old industrial buildings (groups) to have function transformation. This transformation is complex system engineering and the design for renovation project is extremely hard, in addition, its process should be feasible and cost should be reasonable. This paper takes the East campus building of Xi'an University of Architecture and Technology as an example, using the core thinking of value engineering to do functional analysis, especially on insulation materials. As a result, offers same advices on the old industrial buildings (groups) reusing.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Influence Of Urban Wetland on Housing Prices: Evidence from Hangzhou Xixi Wetland
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: urban wetland; housing price; Xixi Wetland; hedonic analysis; Hangzhou
Abstract: This study estimates the effects of wetland proximity on property values empirically by employing hedonic price model. The results show that wetlands proximity significantly influences residential property values. Further, proximity to different types of wetlands is valued differently. Decreasing the distance to the nearest wetland increases house values. The marginal implicit price of reducing the distance to the nearest wetland by 1,000 meter, evaluated at the mean house value yields a 1950 Yuan increase in house value. While there is a preference to be closer to wetlands, the type of wetland does seem to matter. The type of open water wetland has significantly positive effect over other types of wetland. The marginal implicit price for open water over other types, evaluated at the mean house value, indicates an increase in house value of 320 Yuan. The results also shows that structural and neighborhood characteristics are of great importance in explaining the variations of housing prices, especially the distance to CBD, which indicates that traditional commercial center still has strong impact in the city of Hangzhou. Comparatively, the influence of wetland is marginal.

Article Title: The Analysis of Strategic Cost Management Problems and Countermeasures of China's Real Estate Enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate enterprises; Strategic cost management; Problems; Countermeasures
Abstract: Since 1980s, benefited from the rapid economic growth and the surge in housing demand, China's real estate enterprises have gained huge profits. Strategic cost management, a scientific cost management method, is to make a strategic choice with the strategic cost information and organize a cost management in different strategic choices. There are a series of problems in the process of strategic cost management implementation in China's real estate enterprises, mainly embodying one-sided understanding of the connotation of the strategic cost management, inadequate analysis of cost factors and value chain, deficiency of information validity, backward in human resources management, etc. This paper puts forward a series of applied measures to improve the real estate enterprise' strategic cost management from updating concept, improving the quality, setting up the department of strategic cost management, constructing Enterprise Information Platform and implementing Strategic Human Resource Management.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Selected Elements of Housing Affordability Impacting Otherwise Potentially Sustainable Communities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Holding cost; housing affordability; planning; assessment period; opportunity cost
Keywords Plus: LAND
Abstract: It is widely held that strong relationships exist between housing, economic status, and well being. Therefore, recent events emerging from the United States, culminating in widespread housing stock surpluses in that country and others, threaten to destabilise many aspects related to individuals and community. However, despite global impact, the position of housing demand and supply is not consistent. The Australian position provides a strong contrast whereby continued strong housing demand generally remains a critical issue affecting the socio-economic landscape. Underpinned by strong levels of immigration, and further buoyed by sustained historically low interest rates, increasing income levels, and increased government assistance for first home buyers, this strong housing demand ensures elements related to housing affordability continue to gain prominence. A significant, but less visible factor impacting housing affordability particularly new housing development relates to holding costs. These costs are in many ways hidden and cannot always be easily identified. Although it is only one contributor, the nature and extent of its impact requires elucidation. In its simplest form, it commences with a calculation of the interest or opportunity cost of land holding. However, there is significantly more complexity for major new developments - particularly greenfield development. Analysis suggests that even small shifts in primary factors impacting holding costs can appreciably affect housing affordability. Those factors of greatest significance not only include interest rates and the rate of inflation, but even less apparent factors such as the regulatory assessment period. These are not just theoretical concepts but real, measurable price drivers. Ultimately, the real impact is felt by the one market segment whom can typically least afford it new home, first home buyers. They can be easily pushed out of affordability. This paper suggests the stability and sustainability of growing, new communities require this problem to be acknowledged and accurately identified if the well being of such communities is to be achieved.

Article Title: Congestion pricing in the absence of demand functions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Congestion pricing; Transportation network; Marginal-cost; Variational inequality problems; Unknown mappings
Keywords Plus: NETWORK; IMPLEMENTATION; EQUILIBRIUM; TOLLS
Abstract: This paper enhances a trial-and-error implementation scheme of marginal-cost pricing on a transportation network, in the absence of explicit expression of the demand function. Link tolls and link flows are updated for the next trial with the revealed link flows forgiven current trial toll pattern. The method is quite simple, requiring only some function evaluations. Also, the step size is not required to be square summable, thereby leading to the improvement of the efficiency of the algorithm. The global convergence of the method is proved and some numerical results are reported to illustrate its performance. Crown Copyright (C) 2008 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The toll plaza optimization problem: Design, operations, and strategies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Toll plaza; Transportation; Optimization; Dynamic configuration; M/G/1 queueing process; Non-linear integer programming
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION; COLLECTION; BOTTLENECK; SYSTEM; QUEUE; MODEL
Abstract: This paper presents comprehensive decision-making procedures for designing a new toll plaza with the right initial capacity, then finding the optimal dynamic lane configuration for operations. evaluating the effects of increasing future traffic volume on waiting time by sensitivity analysis, and establishing along-term quantitative strategy by transferring low-throughput lane users to high-throughput lanes. We develop a non-linear integer programming model integrated with the M/G/1 queueing process. A case study based on actual data demonstrates how effective the model and the strategy are in reducing operating and user-waiting costs and, thus, improving overall system performance at toll plazas. Authors: Kurt, A; Betül, A; Karaca, F; Alagha, O
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Kurt, Atakan; Betul, Ayse; Karaca, Ferhat; Alagha, Omar
Article Title: 5 Artificial neural networks based modelling of carbon monoxide: Effects of spatial parameters
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Air pollution; CO; Neural networks; Air quality prediction; forecasting
Abstract: Web systems for air quality information and pollution modeling provide access to daily measured and predicted valuable information for the internet users. There are just a few examples around the world in this area. A recently developed web system at http://airpol.fatih.edu.tr is one such application. It provides information about air quality prediction for Istanbul, Turkey in a user friendly interface. New studies have been performed to increase the prediction efficiencies of the system and presented in this work. This paper presents a Study on the prediction of carbon monoxide (CO) levels using Artificial Neural Networks (ANN). ANN models have been applied to the prediction of 3 day CO levels into future. The observed and predicted values were compared to determine the performance of the ANN models. The experimental results shows that spatial parameters (Universal Transverse Mercator coordinates) generally produce better forecasting (30% error) than ordinary, non-spatial parameters, although there are some cases where spatial parameters yield lower prediction accuracy. The experiments reveal that models with spatial input variables deserve further study and better models could be developed with higher accuracy.

Article Title: Quantitative Analysis on the Relations Between Price of Real Estate and Urbanization Level in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; cointegration; demand; urbanization level
Abstract: Price of real estate rises quickly in recent years. The problem of price of real estate has become the focus of attention. There are many impact factors to the real estate price. The relationship between supply and demand in real estate market is the essence factor. The urbanization level is one important factor of the demand of real estate. In this paper, co-integration analysis and Granger causality analysis are used to analyze the relations between price of real estate and urbanization level in China in the period of 1987-2007. Empirical results show that the improvement of China's real estate price is Granger cause of the level of urbanization in China. There is a long-term stable equilibrium between China's real estate price and the level of urbanization in China. The regression model shows that real estate price will increase by 30.298 units if the level of urbanization increases one unit. Finally, some suggestions are provided.

Article Title: Empirical Researches on Industrial Structural Diversities and Economic Growth in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: industrial structure; structural diversity; economic growth
Abstract: The relationships of industrial structural diversities and per capita GDP, transformational velocities of industrial structural diversities and GDP growth rates in China are empirically researched based on the important characteristics-diversities in industrial structures by the application of information entropy approaches and the data from 1978 to 2007 in the China. It is found that the per capita GDP linger in a low level when the diversities of industrial structures are high, and the decreases of the diversities in industrial structures promote the per capita GDP growth, and the transformational velocities of industrial structural diversities and GDP growth rates are lined. Lastly, the policies and proposes about industrial structural adjustments are presented in China.

Article Title: Developing and constructional control model of industrial park
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate

Author Keywords: Urbanization; Harmonious; Development; Industrial park; Control model
Keywords Plus: SPC
Abstract: The development and construction of industrial parks have moved from the initial exploration phase into a more comprehensive and standardized stage and has become an important form of urban expansion of china. The park economy in particular is an important feature and motive force of urban development, which has some advantages in the speed, quality, and driving force of urban development. This paper describes the mechanism of industrial park construction and harmonious development, and sets up the park development impacting factor system through the analysis of urban scale, space layout, spatial distribution, industry selection. It also uses AHP theory, combining with SPC and EPC technology, to explore the harmonious development of the industrial park construction control model, in order to provide a rational basis for decision-making of the industrial park development and construction.

Abstract: This paper investigates the threshold effects of provincial and sub-provincial FD on provincial economic growth in China The empirical results strongly suggest the existence of threshold effects between FD and provincial economic growth in China In total both provincial and sub-provincial expenditure FD have positive effects on provincial economic growth, but revenue decentralization has negative effects There is synchronic structure of institutional linkage between fiscal decentralization and other institution such as privatization institution and other dimensional fiscal decentralization institution in China

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Logical Framework Analysis for Procedural Provisions of the Construction Contract
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction projects; Construction contracts; Process clause; Logical framework
Abstract: Contract analysis is the start of project management of contractor. By implementing the aims and the provisions of the contract into the specific issues and cases, guiding the specific work to enable the contract to meet the needs of day-to-day project management, it is an important work which makes the project's implement in accordance with the contract. If the contractor does not analyze the terms of procedural or analysis may not be proper, the contractor would be in a major risk of the contract, such as limiting rights, expanding obligations, breaching contract, losing claim opportunity and falling into the contract trap. Based on the characteristics of procedural provisions, this paper puts forward a logical framework analysis approach. It is explained from the perspective of the contract implementation. By defining key words, editing logical relationship table and drawing procedural diagram, Logical framework analysis(LFA) analyzes construction contract procedural provisions and suggest amendments on the issues identified, then design a new procedural diagram of the original construction contract to improve the procedural provision, Logical framework analysis(LFA) is the contractor's effective method and tools for contract analysis.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Discussions on New Mode of Entrepreneurial Management
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: Entrepreneurial Management; three respects; a high-level of coordination and integration
Abstract: This paper mainly discusses three important respects intimately related to the Entrepreneurial Management, namely, the invisible respect market demands, the visible respect government supportive polices as well as the third respect, arguably the most indispensable respect, protection by relevant laws and regulations. The paper also stresses that the three respects are closely intertwined in practical management environments. Thus, the three respects should be highly coordinated and systematically integrated. The Entrepreneurial Management is generally seen as a practice of the Modern Management involving many factors, which requires a high-level of coordination and integration of the market demands, government supportive policies and protection by relevant laws and regulations in order to make overall plans while taking all relevant factors into consideration and effectively deal with various issues occurring in the course of enterprises development. Thus, it seems safe to suggest that a new mode of Entrepreneurial Management ideally involves the coordination and integration of the factors of market demands, government supports and law protections. A conclusion drawn by the author is that, in today's increasingly competitive market, the Entrepreneurial Management is a process of exploring new and successful business survival mode and a practice of encouraging enterprise to actively seek government assistances and supports and seeking appropriate protection offered by relevant laws and regulations while observing the principle of the market demands in order to ensure a advantageous position when competing with competitive rivals.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Project Information Integrated Management Based on IPMIS
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban rail transit; Projects; information integration; IPMIS
Abstract: TEDA (Tianjin Economic-Technological Development Area) urban rail transit project, invested by the TEDA Government, is the modern urban tramway transportation system. In this article, the authors summarize the achievements and experience of project information management for TEDA urban rail transit project, and analyze the necessity of information integration management. The framework model of Integrated Project Management Information System (IPMIS) is established and the empirical study of its application in urban rail transit projects is carried out. This article theoretically analyzes the information integration management system of TEDA urban LRT project, sets up IPMIS framework model, and carries out empirical study of its application. It is suggested in this research that web-based IPMIS can best solve the problems of information collection, processing and storage in project management. The research team also believes that IPMIS based on integration management will have a brighter future with step forward research conducted by scholars and peers.

Authors: Tan, C; Tan, DL; Shen, LY
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Tan, C.; Tan, D. L.; Shen, L. Y.
Article Title: Analyzing the current situation of rural building reconstruction in post disaster in Sichuan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: post-disaster reconstruction; rural building; site selection; architectural forms; funds management
Abstract: An earthquake measured at 8.0 on the Richter scale occurred in Wenchuan district on 12th May, 2008. It is the most destructive, the most widespread and the most catastrophic seismic disaster since the founding of P.R.C. There are 1,443,800 household rural buildings to be strengthened, 1,911,700 household rural buildings and 5,735,100 rooms to be reconstructed only within the Sichuan Province. It is urgent and crucial to reconstruct the rural building, as normal life is hoped to be restored as soon as possible with limited funds. This paper analyzed, roundly and thoroughly, the current situation of post-disaster rural building reconstruction, especially on site selection, architectural forms and corresponding financing and management. Meanwhile, comprehensive analysis on restoration circumstance and progress was conducted, and suggestions were provided afterward. Through comprehensive analysis, this paper, hopefully, helps to build up a foundation for decision making on the issue of rural building reconstruction in the future.

Authors: Teng, TL; Li, QM; Yang, H; Guo, TY
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Teng, T. L.; Li, Q. M.; Yang, H.; Guo, T. Y.
Article Title: The dynamic coupling model and its application of the housing market and the housing security
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing market; Housing security; Coupling degree; Jiangsu
Abstract: The startup of the 900 billion investment plan for housing security indicated that the Chinese government would further intensity the construction of the housing security. Up to date, there have been considerable concerns with the issues that whether the investment project of housing security by the government will be a shock to the current soft housing market as the efficiency of the housing market would be affected by the excessive housing security level. However, much of the existing research just tended to analyze the interaction between the housing market and the housing security qualitatively. This paper differed from the existing literatures by estimating a dynamic coupling model from the quantitative aspect. Coupling degree was utilized to express the coordinated relationship between the housing market and the housing security. The model revealed that the elliptic trajectory of the coupling relationship goes through 4 stages, e.g.: low-grade symbiosis, coordinated development, limit development and regeneration development. Taking the condition of Jiangsu province as an example, this paper tried to analyze the evolution process of the coupling degree. The results showed the universal law and matching degree of the coupling relationship between the housing market and the housing security. In particular, these findings provided the quantitative data basis to the balance between the reasonable policies of the government on housing security and the matching housing market.

Authors: Tzima, FA; Niska, H; Kolehmainen, M; Karatzas, KD; Mitkas, PA
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Tzima, Fani A.; Niska, Harri; Kolehmainen, Mikko; Karatzas, Kostas D.; Mitkas, Pericles A.
Article Title: An Experimental Evaluation of ZCS-DM for the Prediction of Urban Air Quality
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: THESSALONIKI
Abstract: Understanding and forecasting urban Air Quality (AQ) is not only a multifaceted and computationally challenging problem for machine learning algorithms, but also a difficult task for human-decision makers: the strict regulatory framework, in combination with the public demand for better information services poses the need for robust, efficient and, more importantly, understandable forecasting models. Unlike neural network or regression-based techniques traditionally used in the domain of AQ, our current approach adopts ZCS-DM - Zeroth-level Classifier System for Data Mining - for the production of a set of AQ prediction rules in the urban domain. On this basis, the aim of our experimental investigation is twofold and includes (i) the handling of incomplete data matrices and (ii) the evaluation of ZCS-DM effectiveness against methods widely used in the target domain, namely multi-layer perceptron (MLP), support vector machines (SVM), linear discriminant analysis (LDA) and classification trees (C4.5). Overall, the obtained results reveal the potential of ZCS-DM as a data mining tool to be used for AQ forecasting, and point to its insensitivity for missing values (cf. MLP, SVM, LDA) and the understandability of produced models as its greater advantages.

Authors: Wang, G; She, J; Lin, ZR
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang, G.; She, J.; Lin, Z. R.
Article Title: Study on Influencing Factors of Supervisor Turnover
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Supervision industry; Supervisor turnover; Job satisfaction; organization commitment; Confirmatory factor analysis; Path analysis
Keywords Plus: EMPLOYEE TURNOVER; MODEL
Abstract: Supervision industry is a special industry in China. However, the disorder of supervision industry becomes more and more serious at present. It is mainly reflected in the distrust in supervisor by the government and owners, as supervision industry cannot supply the standardized services for the market. In order to improve the service quality in supervision industry, and then assure of the quality of project to benefit the whole society, this paper studies the present situation of supervisor turnover, and builds a casual model of supervisor voluntary turnover. The sample with 207 supervisors is used to test the model. Our result provides evidences that the impact of job satisfaction and organization commitment on supervisor turnover is notable. At the same time, this paper finds that supervision job is so comfortable that it will increase the rate of personal turnover. The influence of satisfaction with incentive mechanism on organization commitment isn't significant as expected.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF

Article Title: China's Marketization Degree and Ecological Benefits Study from a Perspective of Government Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: government innovation; marketization degree; ecological benefits; Granger causality test
Abstract: Grasping the starting point of government innovation, this paper studied China's marketization index, evaluated China's ecological benefits, and had the Granger causality test between marketization index and ecological benefits, finding that ecological benefits is the Granger reason to marketization degree Using the VAR model, draw the conclusion that in a short term the marketization degree produces a restricting effect on ecological benefits, and the ecological benefits has a promoting effect on marketization degree, and also find that transformation of government functions, as well as innovative management model have played a positive role in both accelerating the marktetization degree and improving the ecological benefits.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Comparing the Housing Guarantee Systems among PRC, UK and US
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public housing; Mixed-income community; Sustainable development
Abstract: Since September of 2008, the global financial crisis was getting worse and worse. In November 2008, Chinese government published the 4000 Billions Investment Plan, on which the guarantee housing construction investment was listed. This paper introduces the revolution of Chinese Urban Housing Guarantee System, paying more attention to the relative policies and the market behaviors, concluding the problems China met in the guarantee housing development during the past 10 years. Reviewing the histories of Housing Guarantee Systems in the UK and US, this paper summarizes the main problems the two countries met in the evolutions of public housing systems, and their resolving methods. The two countries' experiences reveal that large numbers of public housing construction in one place will lead to the poverty concentration and serious social problems. This paper introduces how the UK and the US solve the public housing problems, which give us great enlightenments. Finally, whereas the public housing problems we met during the past 10 years, we suggest China should bring forward Mixed Income Communities to guide sustainable development of the housing market. Before new period of large scale public housing construction, we should modify the relative policies to prevent irrational plans from having bad impacts to the urban cities in the long run.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Professional Company Agent and Full Process Management:Analysis of Construction-Agent System in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Government investment; Project construction-agent system; Management of full process
Abstract: High investment and low efficiency in public projects is a challenge in the world. System innovation of public project output has been re-concerned in many countries. From four-in-one at the beginning of reform to construction-agent system advocated by government now, management of government investment project is constantly developing. But some new problems came out simultaneously in application of construction-agent system(CAS), for example, inconsistent target, distrust, and even suspending in the process. This paper presents that the root cause of these problems is that frequent intervention from owner out of the Construction-Agent system and limitation to Construction-Agent party in working scope, which put the Construction-Agent party into the dilemma where Construction-Agent exists only in name. To ensure steady implementation of Construction-Agent and promote its improvement, the root cause should be resolved in Construction-Agent system, namely, the essence and the working scope of Construction-Agent should be defined, and the effective form of Construction-Agent should be determined at the same time. This paper has analyzed development course and typical types of implementation mode of Construction-Agent at the present time,and then, through case analysis of one section in South-to-North water diversion project and a settlement houses project in Jiangsu Province, this paper concludes that professional engineering consulting company should be the best agent party in the future, which should participate in the full process management from project planning to completion.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Production Mechanism of Engineering Trust in Partnering Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering Trust; Partnering Project; Production Mechanism
Abstract: Cooperation and coordination among various organizations is the foundation of smooth implementation of project and the passport of project success.The imperfection of the contractual relationship and asymmetry of information among the participators give rise to the trust crisis in current engineering projects. Engineering trust, as a boost of the project success, shows swift trust or trust with no guarantee, and different project participators call for different engineering trusts. From the perspective of the life cycle of partnering project, the paper points out that the transitional track of engineering trust is as follows: the trust based on deterrence will develop into the one based on performance and then be updated to the one based on consensus. Besides, in view of different development stages of partnering project, suggestions are put forward accordingly to promote the generation of engineering trust. This research will be beneficial for the partners of the engineering projects to fully understand engineering trust, strengthen close cooperation, and form a conjunct orientation of interests, thereby reducing the transaction costs and simplifying the process of decision-making to advance the project success.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Theoretical Study of Urban Regeneration on the Thinking of the System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban Decline; Urban Regeneration; Systems Thinking; Sustainable Development
Abstract: Urban declination, as a common problem in old cities, is common not only in China but also around the world. Urban regeneration thought, originating from developed countries in Western Europe, came into existence as the situation required. It has developed from the urban development thought of urban reconstruction, urban revitalization, and urban renewal. The beginning this paper gives the definition of urban regeneration and urban regeneration system by introducing the evolution of urban regeneration thought and the connotations of urban declination. Next, this paper proceeds to analyzes the constituent elements of the Urban Regeneration System comprehensively, especially the main subsystems. Finally, on the ground of dynamic process of the urban regeneration and the elements of each system, the paper conceives a structure of the urban regeneration system to reveal intrinsic links among the subsystems. In short, the paper is trying to seek a theory on the development of inner cities so as to direct the practice.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, Y. S.; Chen, T. T.
Article Title: Analysis of the Real Estate Markets Efficiency Based on Data Envelopment Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: DEA; markets efficiency; analysis
Abstract: In recent years the input and output of real estate industry is uncoordinated, the rate of input growth of real estate in our country is stable, but there is really big fluctuation in the output. Because of the related policy, the real estate demands of our country's residents rapidly increased and the real estate supply had a large increase, but the price of real estate also had large scale climbing. Facing the situation of the rapidly growth of the input, output and price of real estate, it means a lot to increase our country's city real estate industry production efficiency so as to satisfy the sustained growth of our country's real estate demands. This paper uses the DEA method to estimate the real estate market relative efficiency of the eastern region, the middle region and the western region of China. We provide three kinds of efficiency to estimate them, the technical efficiency, pure technical efficiency and scale efficiency. The less efficient city could get its example cities which are more efficient than them, and they could get the way to adjust their scale to reach the scale efficiency.
