Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Residential road planning scheme evaluation based on the operating efficiency
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Road planning; Residential area; operating efficiency; Date Envelopment Analysis (DEA); Entropy Method
Keywords Plus: DECISION-MAKING
Abstract: In residential area, whether the network distribution, total area, per capita road area of roads conforms to the traffic demand is of importance for real estate developers in road planning. The residential road network is a relatively closed traffic system, its functions and various traffic characteristics are very different from the urban road networks', so the evaluation Indicator system and mathematical methods used in urban road network evaluation are not very suitable for residential road network evaluation. In view of the above problems, and by analyzing and comparing the current evaluation methods commonly used, this paper combines Date Envelopment Analysis (DEA) with Entropy Method to evaluate the operating efficiency of residential road network. After demonstrating the feasibility of using Entropy-DEA method for evaluating the residential road network, this paper analyzes the characteristics and economic factors of residential road system, and then, establishes the evaluation Indicators system of Entropy-DEA model. This paper carries out empirical research to describe the application of evaluating the operating efficiency of residential road network by Entropy-DEA in detail, based on statistical data of four selected residential areas in Nanjing.

Abstract: Government's decision for bailout or not in crisis will determine not only the direction of economic development of the current time, but also its future The bailout behaviors by Federal Reserve System in 1987 and 1998-2001 periods caused the great economic loss of the US and the world in 2007 Government serves as the supervisor and manager for the market While in crisis, the governments are expected to do something for the bailout, but more often the government's intervention in this regard is not in conformity with the reality What government should do is to regulate the market, not to bailout. When government breaks the rule of market to make the market profitable, It will be the time that government digs a trap The investors should take careful decision for their investment.

Authors: Zhao, WC; Hao, J; Wang, WS
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhao Wenchuang; Hao Jun; Wang Wenshun
Article Title: Research on Overall Value Management System of Large-scale Construction Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scale construction project; Project management; Whole life cycle; Overall value management system
Abstract: As an important management method, application of value management in large-scale construction project management has not been discussed deeply yet. This paper has absorbed the essence of the value management concepts, whole life cycle management methods and team management ideas, and has selected some indicators and evaluation points from every phase of project process. Aiming at the shortage exist in the present project value management processes, according to project's whole life cycle concepts, team management and process management idea, combined with value engineering theory, value-oriented scientific decision-making and control mechanism, comprehensive budget management mechanism and resource allocation mechanism can be set up. So, an overall value management system of large-scale construction project will be built from the essence of the three mechanisms. This system can help the large-scale construction project realize value and social value, utility maximization and highest satisfaction for construction stakeholders, and reach the highest level of project management requirement finally.

Article Title: Research on E-Commerce Secure Payment Protocols
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: electronic payment; security; SSL; SET
Abstract: The security of payment is important to electronic commerce. With the development of Electronic Payment, the system that based on SSL and SET protocols at present could not meet existing demands. It has new research on how to build secure and efficient E-Payment. The paper analyzes SSL and SET protocols, and constructs a secure control model to improve E-Payment protocol.

Authors: Osorio, C; Flötteröd, G; Bierlaire, M
Author Full Names: Osorio, Carolina; Floetteroed, Gunnar; Bierlaire, Michel
Article Title: Dynamic network loading: A stochastic differentiable model that derives link state distributions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Stochastic network loading; Probabilistic traffic flow modeling; Queueing network theory
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; TRAFFIC FLOW; KINEMATIC WAVES; CONGESTION
Abstract: We present a dynamic network loading model that yields queue length distributions, accounts for spillbacks, and maintains a differentiable mapping from the dynamic demand on the dynamic queue lengths. The model also captures the spatial correlation of all queues adjacent to a node, and derives their joint distribution. The approach builds upon an existing stationary queueing network model that is based on finite capacity queueing theory. The original model is specified in terms of a set of differentiable equations, which in the new model are carried over to a set of equally smooth difference equations. The physical correctness of the new model is experimentally confirmed in several congestion regimes. A comparison with results predicted by the kinematic wave model (KWM) shows that the new model correctly represents the dynamic build-up, spillback and dissipation of queues. It goes beyond the KWM in that it captures queue lengths and spillbacks probabilistically, which allows for a richer analysis than the deterministic predictions of the KWM. The new model also generates a plausible fundamental diagram, which demonstrates that it captures well the stationary flow/density relationships in both congested and uncongested conditions. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Huang, Y; Huang, GQ; Newman, ST
Author Full Names: Huang, Yun; Huang, George Q.; Newman, Stephen T.
Article Title: Coordinating pricing and inventory decisions in a multi-level supply chain: A game-theoretic approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Multi-level supply chain; Dynamic non-cooperative game; Nash equilibrium; Product family design; Pricing; Inventory
Keywords Plus: REPLENISHMENT POLICIES; PRODUCT VARIETY; VENDOR; CONFIGURATION; CHANNEL; BUYERS; MODEL
Abstract: This paper concerns coordination of enterprise decisions such as suppliers and components selection, pricing and inventory in a multi-level supply chain composed of multiple suppliers, a single manufacturer and multiple retailers. The problem is modeled as a three-level dynamic non-cooperative game. Analytical and computational methods are developed to determine the Nash equilibrium of the game. Finally, a numerical study in computer industry is conducted to understand the influence of the market scale parameter and the components selection strategy on the optimal decisions and profits of the supply chain as well as its constituent members. Several research findings have been obtained. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Applying price and time differentiation to modeling cabin choice in high-speed rail
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Cabin choice; High-speed rail; Stated-preference; MNL model; Time segment
Keywords Plus: MIXED LOGIT; AIR TRANSPORT; TRAVEL; SERVICE; DEMAND; COEFFICIENTS; SAVINGS; INCOME
Abstract: This paper applies price differentiation of time segment, service class, and advance purchase to modeling cabin choice behavior. The proposed model was constructed with combining revealed-preference and stated-preference and validated by the case of reserved and unreserved-seat cabins in Taiwan high-speed rail. Furthermore, this study also investigates the effect of seat uncertainty in order to estimate its monetary value. The empirical results reveal that time discount and seat available definitely act as important roles on cabin choice behavior as well as fare level. Scenario analysis suggests cabin allocation should vary with time segment and trip characteristics. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhao, QH; Chen, SA; Leung, SCH; Lai, KK
Author Full Names: Zhao, Qiu Hong; Chen, Shuang; Leung, Stephen C. H.; Lai, K. K.
Article Title: Integration of inventory and transportation decisions in a logistics system
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Vendor managed inventory; Integrated logistics system; Inventory and transportation management; Markov Decision Process; Case study
Keywords Plus: VENDOR-MANAGED INVENTORY; SUPPLY CHAIN; POLICY; INFORMATION; ALGORITHMS; DEMAND
Abstract: This paper addresses some of the challenges faced by a company which is responsible for delivering coal to its four subsidiaries situated along a river, through river hired or self-owned vessels. We propose to adopt a vendor managed inventory concept that involves establishment of a central warehouse at the port, and apply the Markov Decision Process (MDP) to formulate both ordering and delivery problems, considering different transportation modes, costs, and inventory issues. An efficient algorithm is developed for solving the MDP models. Our computational tests show that the proposed strategy can significantly reduce the overall system costs while maintaining smooth Just-in-Time supplies of coal to the subsidiaries. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Bliemer, Michiel C. J.; Rose, John M.
Article Title: Construction of experimental designs for mixed logit models allowing for correlation across choice observations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Stated choice; Experimental design; D-efficiency; Panel mixed logit
Keywords Plus: PAIRED-COMPARISON DESIGNS; SIMULATION
Abstract: In each stated choice (SC) survey, there is an underlying experimental design from which the hypothetical choice situations are determined. These designs are constructed by the analyst, with several different ways of constructing these designs having been proposed in the past. Recently, there has been a move from so-called orthogonal designs to more efficient designs. Efficient designs optimize the design such that the data will lead to more reliable parameter estimates for the model under consideration. The main focus has been on the multinomial logit model, however this model is unable to take the dependency between choice situations into account, while in a stated choice survey usually multiple choice situations are presented to a single respondent. In this paper, we extend the literature by focusing on the panel mixed logit (ML) model with random parameters, which can take the above mentioned dependency into account. In deriving the analytical asymptotic variance-covariance matrix for the panel ML model, used to determine the efficiency of a design, we show that it is far more complex than the cross-sectional ML model (assuming independent choice observations). Case studies illustrate that it matters for which model the design is optimized, and that it seems that a panel ML model SC experiment needs less respondents than a cross-sectional ML experiment for the same level of reliability of the parameter estimates. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Cantillo, V; Amaya, J; Ortúzar, JD
Author Full Names: Cantillo, Victor; Amaya, Johanna; Ortuzar, J. de D.
Article Title: Thresholds and indifference in stated choice surveys
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Discrete choice models; Thresholds; SC survey; Modelling indifference
Keywords Plus: WILLINGNESS-TO-PAY; INCORPORATING THRESHOLDS; MODEL; PREFERENCE; DESIGN
Abstract: One typical aim of choice experiment designs is utility balance, that is, the alternatives defined within each choice set should have similar choice probabilities; otherwise, choice is too easy and little information about preferences may be obtained. Therefore, in a good design respondents may often find themselves close to indifference and thus perception thresholds may be an issue. We propose a discrete choice model to examine the behaviour of individuals with indifference thresholds, i.e. that would make them perceive two or more alternatives as almost identical in stated choice (SC) experiments. Such thresholds may be stochastic, differ among the population and even be a function of socio-economic characteristics and choice conditions. Two estimate this model we need SC data including an indifference option, so that respondents are not forced to choose when finding that the two alternatives are equally attractive. Our formulation allows estimating the parameters of a threshold probability distribution using information about choices. As an illustration, the model is applied both to synthetic and real data; results clearly show that when indifference thresholds exist, using models without them can lead to errors in estimation and prediction. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Determinants of passenger transfer waiting time at multi-modal connecting stations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Multi-modal; Feeder service; Headway; Headway capacity; Transfer waiting time
Keywords Plus: OPTIMIZATION; RELIABILITY
Abstract: This paper formulates a model to represent the transfer waiting time for a connecting service at multi-modal stations, where waiting time considers the characteristics of both the connecting service and its feeder services. Numerical simulation results show that transfer waiting time is mainly affected by the capacities and headways of the connecting and feeder services. Simulations also show that compared with the effects of connecting service variables, the corresponding variables of the feeder service usually have greater influences on transfer waiting time. In general, simulation results suggest that multi-modal operations, transfer waiting time cannot be improved without operational coordination with the feeder service. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Airport congestion management under uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Slots; Congestion pricing; Uncertainty; Airport networks; Welfare
Keywords Plus: INTERNALIZATION; CARRIERS; CAPACITY; TOLLS
Abstract: This paper is about single airports and airport networks. Linear and non-linear model specifications are applied to analyze the relative welfare effects of slots and congestion pricing under uncertainty. Uncertainty refers to passenger benefits and congestion costs. I show that, from a welfare perspective, congestion pricing is the right choice for single airports in a linear context, but that slots might be preferred, if non-linearities (quadratic marginal external congestion costs) exist. I also show that uncertainty about congestion costs increases the relative welfare benefits of congestion pricing while airport networks increase the relative welfare benefits of slots. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The welfare effects of the allocation of airlines to different terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport terminal; Airlines; Ticket price; Social welfare
Keywords Plus: ALLIANCES; DUOPOLY; PRICE
Abstract: Many airports around the world have recently built, rebuilt or are in the process of constructing new terminals. Incumbent airlines and new entrants must be allocated to the new and old facilities. When spaces at airport terminals are directly allocated, the allocation should be done by taking into account the implications for airlines' competition and social welfare, given the airlines' network configuration. We use a theoretical model in which two airlines compete in prices with differentiated products for a given network structure. The model shows that, in general, if airlines are allocated to different terminals, the level of competition is reduced, the ticket prices are higher and the consumer surplus and social welfare are lower. Only in some routes, and under certain conditions on the market size, ticket prices may be lower. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Erera, A; Hewitt, M; Karacik, B; Savelsbergh, M
Author Full Names: Erera, Alan; Hewitt, Michael; Karacik, Burak; Savelsbergh, Martin
Article Title: Locating drivers in a trucking terminal network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Less-than-truckload transportation; Driver domiciling; Driver scheduling
Keywords Plus: DYNAMIC-PROGRAMMING ALGORITHM; FLEET MANAGEMENT; DESIGN
Abstract: We consider the problem of determining the home locations, or domiciles, of truck drivers for a less-than-truckload carrier. Domiciling decisions are complex, in part due to regulations and union rules restricting driver schedules, but have a significant impact on the operating costs of less-than-truckload carriers. We present an iterative scheme, using driver dispatch technology in each iteration, to allocate drivers to terminals and to determine drivers' bids so as to satisfy union requirements. Computational experiments demonstrate the value of the iterative scheme and quantify the impact of union rules on the number of drivers required (and the resulting operating costs). (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lam, SW; Low, JMW; Tang, LC
Author Full Names: Lam, Shao Wei; Low, Joyce M. W.; Tang, Loon Ching
Article Title: Operational efficiencies across Asia Pacific airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport efficiency performance; Data envelopment analysis; Factor productivity and price; Outsourcing; Country-specific effect
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; PRODUCTIVE EFFICIENCY; COMMERCIAL AIRPORTS; DEA; BENCHMARKING; PERFORMANCE; INEFFICIENCIES; COST
Abstract: This paper analyses various dimensions of operational efficiencies in major Asia Pacific airports through Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) models that simultaneously account for external macroeconomics and price factors. Results from this study show that technical, scale and mix efficiencies are high among the major Asia Pacific airports. In addition, significant disparities in cost efficiencies were detected amongst these airports. These disparities can be attributed to the presence of country-specific effect and differences in allocative efficiencies. A virtual airport is then introduced as a superior performer to rank the efficiency performances of airports. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Pricing and competition in a transportation market with empty equipment repositioning
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Empty container; Repositioning; Pricing; Transportation market
Keywords Plus: FREIGHT TRANSPORTATION; MODELS; ALLOCATION
Abstract: This paper studies a transportation market with two firms providing transportation service between two locations. There are potential demands for transportation service in both directions. Firms make decisions on prices. The realized demands reflect the price decisions of both firms. Equipment is required to transport demand from one location to the other. To sustain the business, firms have to reposition empty equipment from a surplus location to a shortage location and incur repositioning cost if the realized demands are unbalanced. We build a mathematical model to study the pricing strategy and analyze the outcome of competition. The optimal pricing strategy of a firm is either to achieve the balance of realized demands or treat these two directions as two separate markets. We also study the outcome of competition. In case of a duopoly market, we corroborate how the profit of a firm is affected by potential imbalance, unit loaded equipment movement cost, unit empty equipment repositioning cost, price sensitivity and the competition intensity. It is interesting to find that profit may increase with potential imbalance and with unit empty equipment repositioning cost. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: MACE - Multiagent Control for Energy Infrastructures
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Multiagent Systems; Distributed Energy Resources; Energy Infrastructures; Supply-Demand-Matching; DACS Methodology
Abstract: Considering future energy supply infrastructures, distributed energy resources like micro-combined heat and power or photovoltaic plants are expected to increasingly pervade the public power grid. For supply companies, such decentralised power generation capacities provide the beneficial potential to cover demand peak loads of electrical power on level of the public grid by means of a systematic operation of the distributed components. The following work presents MACE, an agent-based control system for distributed energy resources in low voltage power grids. To level the global load progression of a given cluster, agents coordinate power generation and consumption of the underlying households by means of supply-demand-matching. In conclusion, an evaluation based on different simulation scenarios shows that the described technique is suitable for covering peak loads on level of the public grid.

Article Title: Gaming Analysis of Value Added Tax for the Coal Enterprise
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: the coal enterprise; value added tax; gaming; tax avoidance
Abstract: Our country has implemented production value-added tax since reformed the tax system in 1994 With the rapid development of economy, the drawback has manifested in the production value-added tax, which can't realize the use of value-added tax work. Our country carries on the trial VAT reform in the northeast at first, and will implement the whole country by taking this opportunity. Our country has implemented widely reforming of value added tax since January 1, 2009, that is value added tax with consumption type Transition of the value added tax to adverse effect of the coal enterprises was analyzed, gaining model between the tax organ and the coal enterprise was constructed, adverse effects of transformation of value added tax for the coal enterprises were analyzed, gaming model between the tax authorities and the coal enterprise structured and punishment vigor for low tax cost, unreasonable tax avoidance, etc were reduced, finally methods of behavior of avoidance of value added tax for the coal enterprises were obtained effectively.

Article Title: Appraisal Methodology of Life Cycle Cost For Energy-Saving Reconstruction Of Existing Building
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Energy-saving reconstruction; Life cycle cost; Cost appraisal
Abstract: Energy-saving reconstruction is carrying out in wider area. The appraisal modle of life cycle cost for energy-saving reconstruction extends the appraisal methods. Using the theory of life cycle cost to analyse the feasibility of the program can short the difference between analysis result and the real result.In order to improve the advantage of the method of appraising the energy-saving reconstruction program, appraisal methodology of life cycle cost for energy-saving reconstruction of existing building is analyzed drawing lessons from the whole life cycle cost theory. And Cost and Efficiency (CE) method is used to constitute the model of appraisal methodology of life cycle cost for energy-saving reconstruction of existing building. Promoting energy-saving reconstruction is carried out in wider area.

Article Title: Research on Near Miss Monitoring System on the Subway Construction Site
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Precursors; Subway Construction Site; Near Miss Monitoring System
Abstract: In the subway construction, because of various adverse factors such as complex geological circumstances, accidents take place more often than not, and result in casualties and huge property losses. As a result, it is necessary to take some measures to eliminate the accidents. Near Miss, which is defined as a kind of dangerous behaviors of workers and improper conditions of environment, is considered as the precursor of the accidents and applied in other fields. In this paper, a method is proposed to observe and track the Near Miss on the construction site, to analyze the safety condition of the site, and to take some measures to eliminate or reduce the possibility of accidents before the occurrence of them. Firstly, according to the existing accidents and research, the real-time analysis of the characters of the Near Miss of accidents is made and then a database related to Near Miss is established. Secondly, some advanced apparatus are applied to detect the growth of the Near Miss. At the end, the results detected are compared with the rules which are defined by some experts and an early warning is given if the deviation exceeds a certain level. By means of this, it is likely to reduce the possibility of the accidents.

Authors: Huang, L; Wong, SC; Zhang, MP; Shu, CW; Lam, WHK
Author Full Names: Huang, Ling; Wong, S. C.; Zhang, Mengping; Shu, Chi-Wang; Lam, William H. K.
Article Title: Revisiting Hughes' dynamic continuum model for pedestrian flow and the development of an efficient solution algorithm
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Pedestrian flow; Continuum modeling; Reactive dynamic user equilibrium; WENO scheme; Eikonal equation
Keywords Plus: USER EQUILIBRIUM PROBLEM; ASSIGNMENT MODEL; COMPETITIVE FACILITIES; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; MARKET AREAS; IMPLEMENTATION; SCHEMES; WAVES
Abstract: In this paper, we revisit Hughes' dynamic continuum model for pedestrian flow in a two-dimensional walking facility that is represented as a continuum within which pedestrians can freely move in any direction [Hughes, R.L., 2002. A continuum theory for the flow of pedestrians. Transportation Research Part B. 36 (6), 507-535]. We first reformulate Hughes' model, and then show that the pedestrian route choice strategy in Hughes' model satisfies the reactive dynamic user equilibrium principle in which a pedestrian chooses a route to minimize the instantaneous travel cost to the destination. In this model, the pedestrian demand is time varying. The pedestrian density, flux, and walking speed are governed by the conservation equation. A generalized cost function is considered. The reformulated problem is solved by the efficient weighted essentially non-oscillatory scheme for the conservation equation and the fast sweeping method for the Eikonal equation. A numerical example is used to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed solution procedure. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Huang, N; Xu, W; Shen, J
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Huang Nan; Xu Wei; Shen Jie
Article Title: A Comparison between China's Standard Form of Construction Contract and FIDIC Conditions of Contract for Construction on Risk allocations
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: risk allocations; FIDIC Contract Form; China's Standard Contract
Abstract: Construction projects, due to their unique nature, are full of risks, each of which may exert impacts, to some extent, upon the quality, time and cost. In terms of managing risk, the purpose of signing construction contract is to allocate the risks between employer and contractor in such a way as to enable risks to be managed efficiently and effectively in the process of construction. Due to the laws, which are applicable to contracts, the principles of risk allocation are different between standard form contracts at home and abroad. The risks usually are classified into natural, political, economic, behavioral, legal risks, which exist under construction. The latest edition of China's Standard Form of Construction Contract (published in 2007) and FIDIC Conditions of Contract for Construction (The New Red Book) are compared in this paper, from a risk-allocation angle. Though both the FIDIC Form and China's Standard Contract advocate the doctrine of sharing risk, the specific division principle is different to some extent. The difference, which is because of development of construction industry in china and developed countries, brings out these differences in terms of specific sharing-risk. Under FIDIC Form, the contract condition is more stringent to contractors than to employers for the sake of putting contractors bearing more risks. While under China's Standard Contract, contractors bear lower risks. Yet clear contract language and proper risk allocation principles can help reduce such impacts and achieve management efficiency, which is the consensus in the domestic and international academic circles. The comparison between two standard forms of construction contracts can help Chinese contractors, who are eager to engaging in the international project contracting market, be familiar with the contract condition and bodies of law which are used in the international projects at large. This study is also helpful for foreign contractors understanding the environment and conditions of contract in China, as well as promoting the further research about the application of FIDIC Forms of Contract in China.

Authors: Ji, YB; Guan, X; Xu, B
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP

Article Title: Study on the Social Benefit Evaluation of the Industrial Commercial Residential Buildings Based on the Sustainable Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Industrial residential buildings; Sustainable development; Social benefits evaluation; Policy recommendation
Abstract: It is considered that sustainable development is an essential requirement for building industrialization. Under the concept of sustainable development, from the view of social benefits, this paper evaluates the sustainable development of the industrial commercial residential building and its construction from: socio-economic impact, social environment impact, social inter-adaptive analysis and social risk analysis. It explores the establishment of a set of social benefits evaluation index system to measure the social benefits of commercial residential industrialization. This paper takes the industrialization's impact on peasant workers as an example. Through practical research and questionnaire, the status of peasant-workers was comprehended and the social mutual adaptation between the peasant-workers was identified in order to control and avoid social risks effectively. The analyzing will use SPSS statistical software was used to analyzed questionnaire. The preliminary analysis of the questionnaires suggests that: The majority of the peasant workers' education level is below junior high school. Work time is longer than 8 hours. Daily income is less than 100 Yuan. Labor intensity is greater. Under certain conditions, they are inclined to accept the pre-fabricated construction production.

Article Title: Growth of Chinese Big Businesses in Context of MNCs' Participation-Cases in Automobile Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: automobile industry; competitiveness; MNC
Abstract: In the whole 1990s and first half of this decade, the world witnessed the wave of globalization and rise of big business as a result of rapid development and application of information technology, liberalization of world trade and capital markets, explosive M&A, dramatic growth of business capabilities of leading global firms. Along with this trend, China experienced the dramatic growth of the whole economy with rapid development of markets in almost all the sectors and local industrial capabilities, which attracted most of the key global firms to participate in sharing the market as well as enjoying the low cost manufacturing base In most of the sectors or markets, we see the strong participation of leading global firms, via partnerships with Chinese indigenous companies. At the same time, the Chinese government has been devoted to foster its own big companies through industrial policies and policies in economic reform and opening-up The study analyses the elements which influence the competitiveness of our automobile industry using Diamond Model and makes the judgment of automobile industry's tendency At last, the paper draws conclusion of the specific ways in raising the competitiveness of Chinese automobile industry, such as promoting the technology of energy-saving and environmental-protection car improving the demand developing the relevant industry, making use of the effect of overflow, etc.

Article Title: The Evaluation of Beijing Real Estate industry Sustainable Development Based on DEA Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate industry; sustainable development; DEA model; scale effectiveness; technology effectiveness
Abstract: Real estate industry is the basic and guiding industry, also an important part of the national economy, so its sustainable development receives much concern. This paper constructs DEA model based on the input-output matrix and the index of sustainable development to evaluate the sustainability of Beijing real estate industry about the recent 12 years. It makes detail calculation about the scale effectiveness, technology effectiveness and sustainable development track of input-output in the development progress. The results show that: over the past ten years, the DEA effective values, the scale effectiveness and the technology effectiveness of Beijing real estate were all in a high level, while the resource consumption of input-output was large, the environment price was high, the dependence on technology was deficient, the efficiency of input-output was low, and the developing curve can't keep consistent with but was inferior to the track of sustainable development. Finally it points out some advices about Beijing real estate industry combined with practical.

Authors: Li, LX; Wu, P; Tang, WM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li Li-xin; Wu Ping; Tang Wei-ming
Article Title: Information Management of Area Project Based on Project Controlling Pattern
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project Controlling; Area Project; Information Management
Abstract: With the development of urbanization, many area projects such as Technology Development District, Central Business District emerged unceasingly. One of the important reasons is that area projects can play a role of centralization and can stimulate local economic. For example, ten function area projects were established in Ningbo City during the 2006-2010 periods, such as Eastern Business District, Southern Business District and Ningbo Free Trade Port Area, etc. Meanwhile, these projects are characterized by high investment, multi-participants and short delivery time, the owners will meet the enormous challenges to their project management, especially to the project in which the supervision system is used. Area projects have the systematic character, which put project controlling forward as the owner project management model. The measure of area project controlling includes information collecting and handling. The basis of area project controlling is the unification of project information classification system. The production of area project controlling consists up controlling reporting system and file management system. The core of area project controlling is constituting visual circumstance of project management.

Authors: Liu, HL; Zhu, L; Zheng, L
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Liu Hai-Long; Zhu Lei; Zheng Lei
Article Title: Studies on Organizational Management and Control of Project Management Enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Operation of an Enterprise; Organizational Management and Control Model; Organizational Control System; Organizational Structure
Abstract: Regarding the large scale project management enterprise, there exits such characters as huge asset sizes, complex service structures and so on. It is an extremely important problem for the enterprise headquarters to realize effective control of its regional subsidiary companies or services departments. Based on the analysis of PM enterprise's whole operation model and the selection standards of the headquarters organization control pattern, the paper established the enterprise headquarters' control system to its various subordinate units and designed the project management enterprises' organizational structure. As the result the strategic goal of project management company headquarters can be achieved when a suitable control system and organizational structure goes with it. The paper suggests that the company headquarters must pinpoint their role and position, improve the control system of each subsidiary, clear the respective responsibilities of management and control, and design the suitable organizational structure to support the management and control systems.

Article Title: Income Distribution of Urban Citizens and Government Behavior
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: urban citizen; income distribution; governmental behavior
Abstract: The Chinese government has proposed a strategic goal to expand interior demanding due to the recent global financial crisis However, the basis of expanding the interior demanding is the improvement of citizen's income and the system of distribution The enlarging Income gap between urban and rural groups is the major cause of declining domestic demands since adopting the reform policy From the retrospective of income enlarging, we can see immediately that almost all kinds of problems related with distribution have relationships with unregulated governmental behaviors, which implies that regulating the government behavior is the key In this paper we examine Gini coefficient and Kuzniz's coefficient to analyze the urban citizen's income situation, and propose a strategy from the aspects of the system of social security, taxation reform, public supporting, etc

Article Title: Development Cost of A Harmonious Society
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: harmonious society; cost of development; sustainable development capacity; entropy; quatity-dimension
Abstract: A harmonious society is one to strive for a minimum entropy value and a maximum negative entropy value. The construction equation of a harmonious society is the one of the social sustainable development capacity A harmonious society must first of all is one with continual development, which is the quatity-dimension of building a harmonious society Second, the building of a harmonious society should also be paid attention to the quality-dimension, which is also a degree of social coordination Third, the state of a harmonious society should be long sustained. The building of a harmonious society and that of social sustainable development capacity are not only positively relevant, but even identical in their standard measurements

Authors: Pourakbar, M; Sleptchenko, A; Dekker, R
Author Full Names: Pourakbar, Morteza; Sleptchenko, Andrei; Dekker, Rommert
Article Title: The floating stock policy in fast moving consumer goods supply chains
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain; Floating stock; Intermodal transport; Virtual warehousing; Inventories
Keywords Plus: INVENTORY SYSTEM
Abstract: The floating stock distribution concept exploits intermodal transport to deploy inventories in a supply chain in advance of retailer demand. In this way response times are reduced and storage costs can be reduced as well by having products in the pipeline. In this paper we present two mathematical models to analyse this policy with backlogging allowed. The first one tries to optimize the advanced shipping time of containers to intermodal terminal, and the second optimizes the total number of containers in pipeline and terminal. A comparison is made with the simulation outcomes of applying previously developed strategies, which shows that this concept has advantages in inventories over other strategies. Article Title: The Reality and Possibility of Non-Administration of Residents' Committee: Taking the Case of Residents' Committee Reform in X Sub-district of Shanghai as an Example
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: residents' committee; non-administration; involution; community governance
Abstract: Two level government, three level management, four level network of urban social management system in Shanghai highlight the administration of residents' committee. With the purpose of returning autonomy, X sub-district launched residents' committee reform encompassing direct election and secretary groups establishment. However, after the reform, the organizational structure with the integration of residents committee and secretary groups in the process of election separated from employment, together with separation of decision and operating system under the sub-district governance, reflecting rehash of the reform, thus leading to involution That's mainly due to relatively contrary objective orientation that community construction undertaken obscured pertinence of reform, and the neighborhood hollowing-out' effect and the lack of social capital weakened the effectiveness of reform If the government want to achieve substantial outcomes in residents' committee reform, it need to sort community public affaires rationally, then integrate different community governance bodies, such as government, social intermediary organization, residents' committee and owner's committee, into functional complementation, power shared and mechanically connected multiple-Interactive governance network

Article Title: Research On The Life-cycle Value System of Construction Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction project; life-cycle; value system
Abstract: With increasing scale of projects in modern society, production process becomes more and more complex as a result of large investment, long-term and unforeseen factors. There is growing concern about the value of construction projects. Project is valuable, and the value is balance of quality, resources and risks. In project management, the establishment of the life-cycle value management system which centers the project user is an effective ways to coordinate the benefits of related parties and finally achieve win-win situation. Based on related principles of engineering value, this paper research on the life-cycle value system of construction project, set forth the denotation of all life-cycle construction project value, comprehensively analyze the value evolvement principle and the increment of the value chain. In addition, the paper mainly discusses the value demands from different project parties, and conceives the value management system of construction project. The objective of the paper is to provide the theoretical base for the application of the life-cycle value system.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: Plant Phenotyping with Low Cost Digital Cameras and Image Analytics
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: RESTORATION; GENOMICS; FUSION
Abstract: In this paper we discuss a prototype, easy-to-deploy, and low cost (similar to $250) phenotype collection system for growth chambers. Off the shelf digital cameras, wireless transmitters, and PCs are used to store and process the images. A Matlab pipeline is used to fuse multiple images, identify the location of each Arabidopsis plant, segment its leaves, and measure leaf topology and area. Our early findings (unpublished) using this system for correlating genotype to phenotype are very promising. We hope that with future improvements and broad adoption, it will have the same disruptive effects as the first build your own microarrayers, which allowed for the explosion of genotyping information. Low cost genotyping and phenotyping will hopefully address some of the environmental, agricultural, and industrial sustainability challenges we are facing today.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: An Analysis of Idle Land in Real Estate Development in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Idle land; Real estate development; Land supply; Land market
Abstract: During the course of the latest round of continual and rapid increase in housing price in China's large and medium cities starting from 2003, real estate developers hoarding lands is generally considered to be one of the most important reasons for it. That is, lots of real estate firms postponed land development and caused a great deal of land to be idle. This paper first discussed the evolution of China's land regulations in real estate development and stipulations on the idle land in some typical countries as research background. Based on it, this paper investigated the characteristics of China's idle land of real estate development in a decade from 1998 to 2007. The results show that the scale of idle land in real estate industry has been already over 1 billion, and 70% of it is accumulated in the last five years. However, the increase rate of annual land area increment purchased and undeveloped is generally decreasing, especially the increase rate is negative in 2005 and 2006. The phenomenon is contradicted with the prevalent statement in the market that the real estate developers are increasingly hoarding the lands in this period.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang ZhiHong; Li Dawei; Wang Fen
Article Title: Effective Measures to Improve the Buildings Energy Efficiency in China Promoting Wide Use of Energy Efficient Windows, Doors and Sun-shading Devices
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: buildings energy efficiency; measures; China
Abstract: The total floor area of urban buildings for residential and commercial purposes has amounted to 18.15 billion square meters as of 2008 in China(National Bureau of Statistic of China,2008). Energy efficiency of windows, doors and sun-shading devices is based on their impact on heat gain and loss in cold weather and heat gain in warm weather which can be quantified by well-established indicators such as U-Factor and Solar Heat Gain Coefficient (SHGC). China has the third largest territory in the world with climate straddling from cold temperate zone in north and tropical zone in south. Products that are energy efficient in Heilongjiang Province will not necessarily be energy efficient in Hainan Province. It is of paramount importance to improve the energy efficiency of buildings, mainly by reducing energy loss from exterior structures including windows and doors, and improving the energy performance of the utility within buildings. According the market analysis, We design a project plan to achieve it.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Comparison Study on Operation Performance of Construction Criterions for Public Works between China and UK
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public works; Sustainable development; Construction criterion; Operation Performance management
Abstract: With the reform of economic system of China, researches on government investment projects have been a new hot topic in construction management field. The construction criterions for government investment projects released by the central government and local governments made it have concrete foundation for carry on these projects. From the prospective of construction practice, these criterions play a certain role in regulating government investment projects but as a whole, the performance is still relatively low. In the UK, the construction of public works belongs to the fields of government procurement. There were shortcomings in the course of carrying on public works, such as over-budget, over completion time, low performance, in previous times. But though the activities of Achieving Excellence in Construction, these problems are settled perfectly. On the basis of analyzing operation modes of public works, the paper carries on research from two aspects. On one hand, it researches the standards which have an important role in laws for public works. On the other hand, it researches unique characteristics by the sequence of construction process in project procurement, operation modes, management modes, supervision systems, auditing and performance management aspects. With researches above, conclusion is drawn to illustrate the experience and lessons in carry on public works from two aspects: from the prospective of operation philosophies of criterions and from the sight of project procurement.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF
Article Title: The Overexpansion of China's Local Extra-Budget Funds: Formulation Mechanism and Solutions: Based on Centralization and Decentralization during 1984-2006
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: budget; extra-budget funds (EBFs); centralized percentage
Abstract: Extra-budget funds (EBFs) arc not invented by China or endemic to China However, rarely have EBFs at such a scale and such rapid growth rate as China in the world, and the country thus become the most fiscally dispersed one in the world China's EBFs have undergone several times of adjustments, the main trend being that the central government EBFs become increasingly insignificant in the overall EBF structure, whereas local EBFs soar rapidly This study looks Into the underlying mechanism of the overexpansion of local EBFs and related solutions, which has great implication for better regulation on EBFs and for the standardized operation of the overall fiscal system Along the review of centralization-decentralization, this paper analyzes the correlation between centralized percentage and the overexpansion of local EBFs during 1984-2006, and examines the formation process of over-expanding local EBFs It concludes that, both centralization and decentralization may induce overexpansion of local EBFs In solving this overexpansion, policy makers should not consider the timely shift between centralization and decentralization, but focus on the optimization of the power-interest structure between central and local governments, and the formulation of more rational, coordinated and stable rules

Article Title: Housing Price, Land Price and Housing Rental Price of the Relationship Based on ECM
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: housing prices; land prices; housing rental prices; the error correction model; Granger causality
Abstract: Housing price, land price and housing rental price of the relationship Based on ECM processes a preliminary analyze. The results show that housing prices and land prices exist cointegration rank. In the lag period from I to 5, land prices put impact on housing prices significantly; lag more than 5, they do not exist the Granger causality between the land price and the housing price. They do not exist the cointegration relationship between housing prices and housing rental prices, they are also no Granger causality.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF
Article Title: The Study of NPO's Sincerity Based on the Theory of Self-Organization
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: Non-profit organization; sincerity; Self-Organization
Abstract: The sincerity is the most important value for the existence and development of an organization On the condition of improving the sincerity of our country, the sincerity of the non-profit organization (NPO) has caused the concern of many people, but the study about this problem is very little So we try to deeply analysis how the sincerity of the non-profit organization evolving through the theory of the self-organization in this text We think that the most important task is to setup the opening and fair environment at present. On the basis of this analysis, we put forward our suggestions about how to improve the sincerity of the non-profit organization in our country

Authors: Zheng, LC; Zhang, L; Cai, ZC
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zheng, L. C.; Zhang, L.; Cai, Z. C.
Article Title: Evaluate the Social and Economic Benefits About China Policy Investment From the Perspective of Construction Industry Using Input-Output Analysis Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: ConstructionIndustry; Input-output; Social and Economic Benefits Transportation
Abstract: In order to cope with economic growth fall and ease employment pressure, Chinese government declared ten measures to revitalize the economy in 2008, and plan to add 4 trillion Yuan investment to the economy system. According to this plan, a large portion of it will be invested in the field of construction industry. Therefore, as long as we find out the tech-economic property of construction industry, we can valuate the social and economic benefits brought by this investment program. Using the input-output model, this article finds out three features of construction industry: Above all, construction industry can greatly boost economic development compared with other industries and exerts a powerful influence on national economy. Secondly, construction industry can provide large number jobs for society. Finally, the level of resource consumption is lower. At last, this article uses some methods to forecast features of construction industry in future, and valuate the investment benefits in aspects of economic development, job providing and resource consumption. Some feasible advice has been proposed in the last part.

Article Title: Modeling Oil Futures Market Dynamic Using Complex Adaptive System Simulation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: oil price; futures market; complex adaptive system; multi-Agent; Petri net
Abstract: The factors that affect crude oil price are various and interrelated, composing a complex oil price system. With the development of the oil futures market, the oil price is driven by virtual demand. The problem becomes even more severe due to the virtual demand created by speculators. On the basis of complex adaptive system theory, we build a model of crude oil futures market by using a high level Petri Net, which can describe the agent's characteristics and its behavior details. While this model should be served as the foundation for further simulation programming in future work, based on this, we attempt to quantitatively study how virtual demand driving oil price volatility.

Authors: Zhu, S; Bian, L; Xu, XJ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhu Shan; Bian Lei; Xu Xiaojuan
Article Title: The Research on Residential Differentiation Caused by Indemnificatory Housing and Its Countermeasures
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Indemnificatory housing; Residential differentiation; Mix-incoming housing
Abstract: Under the current situation of international financial crisis and Chinese real estate market depression, the central government of China decided to make huge investment mainly on people's livelihood projects such as indemnificatory housing, education, sanitation and culture. Therefore, the indemnificatory housing will certainly become the focus of national housing policy. But the location of indemnificatory housing is always a controversial issue among governments at all levels, scholars, real estate developers and citizens. In this paper, the author gives the definition of residential differentiation, presents its positive and negative externalities. To solve the problems caused by residential differentiation, the author proposes the idea of mix-incoming housing in the construction of indemnificatory housing. By analysing the advantages of mix-income housing and listing the favorable conditions already formed in adopting this pattern, the author puts forward some tactics for the implementation of mix-income housing in China.

Authors: Hamdouch, Y; Ho, HW; Sumalee, A; Wang, GD
Author Full Names: Hamdouch, Younes; Ho, H. W.; Sumalee, Agachai; Wang, Guodong
Article Title: Schedule-based transit assignment model with vehicle capacity and seat availability
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Transit assignment; Transit seat allocation; Schedule-based; User equilibrium; Capacity; Travel strategy
Keywords Plus: EQUILIBRIUM ASSIGNMENT; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; PEAK-PERIOD; NETWORKS; CONSTRAINTS; STRATEGIES; SYSTEMS
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new schedule-based equilibrium transit assignment model that differentiates the discomfort level experienced by sitting and standing passengers. The notion of seat allocation has not been considered explicitly and analytically in previous schedule-based frameworks. The model assumes that passengers use strategies when traveling from their origin to their destination. When loading a vehicle, standing on-board passengers continuing to the next station have priority to get available seats and waiting passengers are loaded on a First-Come-First-Serve (FCFS) principle. The stimulus of a standing passenger to sit increases with his/her remaining journey length and time already spent on-board. When a vehicle is full, passengers unable to board must wait for the next vehicle to arrive. The equilibrium conditions can be stated as a variational inequality involving a vector-valued function of expected strategy costs. To find a solution, we adopt the method of successive averages (MSA) that generates strategies during each iteration by solving a dynamic program. Numerical results are also reported to show the effects of our model on the travel strategies and departure time choices of passengers. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Operational and environmental performance measures in a multi-product closed-loop supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Closed-loop chains; Greenhouse gas emissions; Green supply chain; Mathematical modelling
Keywords Plus: EXTERNAL COSTS; MODEL; PRODUCT; DESIGN; MANAGEMENT
Abstract: This paper investigates a number of operational and environmental performance measures, in particular those related to transportation operations, within a closed-loop supply chain. A mathematical model in the form of a linear programming formulation is used to model the problem, which captures the trade-offs between various costs, including those of emissions and of transporting commodities within the chain. Computational results are presented for a number of scenarios. using a realistic network instance. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Equilibrium properties of taxi markets with search frictions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Market equilibrium; Taxis; Meeting functions; Search frictions; Pareto efficiency
Keywords Plus: PRIVATE TOLL ROADS; TRAVEL-TIME; SERVICES; MODEL; COMPETITION; UNEMPLOYMENT; DEREGULATION; EFFICIENCY; NETWORKS; INDUSTRY
Abstract: The equilibrium properties of an aggregate taxi market are investigated using a general bilateral searching and meeting function which characterizes the search frictions between vacant taxis and unserved customers. Three specific issues are analyzed for meeting functions that exhibit increasing, constant and decreasing returns to scale. Firstly, service quality in terms of customer wait/search time and average profit per taxi are examined jointly in relation to taxi fleet size, and a Pareto-improving win-win situation is identified, where an increase in taxi fleet size leads to improvements in both service quality and market profitability. Such a Pareto-improving situation is found to emerge if and only if the meeting functions show increasing returns to scale. Secondly, the properties of the socially optimal solution are examined. It is found that the taxi fleet size should be chosen such that the total cost of operating vacant taxis equals the total cost of customer waiting time multiplied by an asymmetric factor of the meeting function, and that taxi services should be subsidized at social optimum only when the meeting functions show increasing returns to scale. Thirdly, the Pareto-efficient services are examined for trade-offs between social welfare and profits in the light of partially conflicting objectives of the public sector and the private taxi firms using a bi-objective maximization approach. The taxi utilization rate and the customer wait/search time or service quality are proved to be constant along the Pareto frontier and equal to those at social optimum if the meeting functions show constant returns to scale. Extensions are made to the cases with increasing and decreasing returns to scale. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The multinomial logit model revisited: A semi-parametric approach in discrete choice analysis
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Discrete choice model; Gumbel distribution; Multinomial logit model; Semi-parametric model; Variance stabilization
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL-TIME SAVINGS; SPLINES
Abstract: The multinomial logit model in discrete choice analysis is widely used in transport research. It has long been known that the Gumbel distribution forms the basis of the multinomial logit model. Although the Gumbel distribution is a good approximation in some applications such as route choice problems, it is chosen mainly for mathematical convenience. This can be restrictive in many other scenarios in practice. In this paper we show that the assumption of the Gumbel distribution can be substantially relaxed to include a large class of distributions that is stable with respect to the minimum operation. The distributions in the class allow heteroscedastic variances. We then seek a transformation that stabilizes the heteroscedastic variances. We show that this leads to a semi-parametric choice model which links the linear combination of travel-related attributes to the choice probabilities via an unknown sensitivity function. This sensitivity function reflects the degree of travelers' sensitivity to the changes in the combined travel cost. The estimation of the semi-parametric choice model is also investigated and empirical studies are used to illustrate the developed method. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Long, JC; Gao, ZY; Szeto, WY
Author Full Names: Long, Jiancheng; Gao, Ziyou; Szeto, W. Y.
Article Title: Discretised link travel time models based on cumulative flows: Formulations and properties
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Link travel time; Cumulative flow; Piecewise linearization; FIFO; Causality
Keywords Plus: VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; DYNAMIC TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; USER OPTIMAL ASSIGNMENT; KINEMATIC WAVES; NETWORK; ROUTE
Abstract: In the research area of dynamic traffic assignment, link travel times can be derived from link cumulative inflow and outflow curves which are generated by dynamic network loading. In this paper, the profiles of cumulative flows are piecewise linearized. Both the step function (SF) and linear interpolation (LI) are used to approximate cumulative flows over time. New formulations of the SF-type and LI-type link travel time models are developed. We prove that these two types of link travel time models ensure first-in-first-out (FIFO) and continuity of travel times with respect to flows, and have other desirable properties. Since the LI-type link travel time model does not satisfy the causality property, a modified LI-type (MLI-type) link travel time model is proposed in this paper. We prove that the MLI-type link travel time model ensures causality, strong FIFO and travel time continuity, and that the MLI-type link travel time function is strictly monotone under the condition that the travel time of each vehicle on a link is greater than the free flow travel time on that link. Numerical examples are set up to illustrate the properties and accuracy of the three models. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Han, DR; Yang, H; Wang, XL
Author Full Names: Han, Deren; Yang, Hai; Wang, Xiaolei
Article Title: Efficiency of the plate-number-based traffic rationing in general networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Road space rationing; Efficiency; User equilibrium; Vehicle plate number
Keywords Plus: NONATOMIC CONGESTION GAMES; ELASTIC DEMANDS; COST MAPS; ANARCHY; PRICE; EQUILIBRIUM
Abstract: Road space rationing based on vehicle plate numbers restricts vehicle access to a network based upon the license number on pre-established days. It has been used in some large cities especially when there are some major events. This paper analyzes the efficiency of road space rationing schemes by establishing the bounds of the reduction in the system cost associated with the restricted flow pattern at user equilibrium in comparison with the system cost at the original user equilibrium. The bounds are established under the general traffic equilibrium model formulated as variational inequalities and illustrated with a simple example. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The impact of control strategies on the management of returnable transport items
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Closed-loop supply chain; Materials management; Packaging; Returnable; Reverse logistics; Tracking
Keywords Plus: OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT; RFID TECHNOLOGY; SIMULATION
Abstract: This research examines the impact of different control strategies on the management of returnable transport items (RTIs) in closed-loop supply chains. A simulation model is developed based on an empirical case and is used to explore different scenarios. The results suggest that the choice of control strategy has a significant impact on investments and operating costs, and that RTI shrinkage can be controlled either through the use of tracking systems, or choice of control strategy. Moreover, a simulation-based method for estimating the fleet size required to operate the system for the different strategies is presented. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A multiple discrete-continuous nested extreme value (MDCNEV) model: Formulation and application to non-worker activity time-use and timing behavior on weekdays
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Multiple discrete-continuous choices; Random utility maximization; Kuhn-Tucker demand model systems; Flexible substitution patterns; Activity time-use; Activity timing
Keywords Plus: ACTIVITY PARTICIPATION; CONSUMER DEMAND; JOINT CHOICE; TRAVEL; HOME
Abstract: This paper develops a multiple discrete-continuous nested extreme value (MDCNEV) model that relaxes the independently distributed (or uncorrelated) error terms assumption of the multiple discrete-continuous extreme value (MDCEV) model proposed by Bhat [Bhat, CR., 2005. A multiple discrete-continuous extreme value model: formulation and application to discretionary time-use decisions. Transportation Research Part B 39 (8), 679-707; Bhat, CR., 2008. The multiple discrete-continuous extreme value (MDCEV) model: role of utility function parameters, identification considerations, and model extensions. Transportation Research Part B 42 (3), 274-303]. The MDCNEV model captures inter-alternative correlations among alternatives in mutually exclusive subsets (or nests) of the choice set, while maintaining the closed-form of probability expressions for any (and all) consumption pattern(s). The MDCNEV model is applied to analyze non-worker out-of-home discretionary activity time-use and activity timing decisions on weekdays using data from the 2000 San Francisco Bay Area data. This empirical application contributes to the literature on activity time-use and activity timing analysis by considering daily activity time-use behavior and activity timing preferences in a unified utility maximization-based framework. The model estimation results provide several insights into the determinants of non-workers' activity time-use and timing decisions. The MDCNEV model performs better than the MDCEV model in terms of goodness of fit. However, the nesting parameters are very close to 1, indicating low levels of correlation. Nonetheless, even with such low correlation levels, empirical policy simulations indicate non-negligible differences in policy predictions and substitution patterns exhibited by the two models. Experiments conducted using simulated data also corroborate this result. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
