Authors: Mínguez, R; Sánchez-Cambronero, S; Castillo, E; Jiménez, P
Author Full Names: Minguez, R.; Sanchez-Cambronero, S.; Castillo, E.; Jimenez, P.
Article Title: Optimal traffic plate scanning location for OD trip matrix and route estimation in road networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Plate scanning; OD trip matrix estimation; Route identification; Traffic count location problem
Keywords Plus: ORIGIN-DESTINATION MATRICES; RGS VEHICLE PROBES; D DEPARTURE RATES; STATISTICAL-ANALYSIS; BAYESIAN NETWORKS; SENSOR-LOCATION; RELIABILITY; COUNTS
Abstract: During the last decade, there has been a substantial interest in how to determine the optimal number and locations of traffic counters for origin-destination (OD) trip matrices estimation. On the contrary, the optimal allocation of plate scanning devices has received very limited attention, even though several authors have demonstrated that plate scanning (route identification) techniques are much more informative than those based on traditional link count information. This paper provides techniques for obtaining the optimal number and location of plate scanning devices for a given prior OD distribution pattern under different situations, i.e. maximum route identifiability or budget constraints. Two rules analogous to the counting location problem are developed, and several integer linear programming models fulfilling these rules are proposed. The proposed methods are finally illustrated by their application into Nguyen-Dupuis and Cuenca networks. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: de Grange, L; Fernández, E; de Cea, J
Author Full Names: de Grange, Louis; Fernandez, Enrique; de Cea, Joaquin
Article Title: A consolidated model of trip distribution
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Trip distribution; Multi-objective optimization; Gravity model; Entropy; Maximum likelihood; Spatial aggregation
Keywords Plus: INTERVENING OPPORTUNITIES
Abstract: This work analyzes and compares various trip distribution models with spatial aggregation within a common theoretical framework for formulating and solving multi-objective optimization problems. A new model is designed that incorporates the main characteristics of existing ones. These models are then calibrated with a single database at different spatial aggregation levels using maximum likelihood. The results show that with aggregated data the various models differ little, but with disaggregated data the differences are considerable. It is also demonstrated that changing the level of data aggregation can significantly alter the models' parameter values. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Besides this paper compares the respective features of sports venues' construction and general construction projects and lists with great emphases major concerns in sports venues' construction with corresponding solutions.

Article Title: A methodology to derive the critical demand density for designing and operating feeder transit services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Feeder transit; Flexible transit; Demand responsive; Continuous approximation; Critical demand
Keywords Plus: RESPONSIVE TRANSIT; MODELS
Abstract: Feeder lines are one of the most often used types of flexible transit services connecting a service area to a major transit network through a transfer point. They often switch operations between a demand responsive and a fixed-route policy. In designing and running such systems, the identification of the condition justifying the operating switch is often hard to properly evaluate. In this paper, we propose an analytical model and solution of the problem to assist decision makers and operators in their choice. By employing continuous approximations, we derive handy but powerful closed-form expressions to estimate the critical demand densities, representing the switching point between the competing operating policies. Based on the results of one-vehicle and two-vehicle operations for various scenarios, in comparison to values generated from simulation, we verify the validity of our analytical modeling approach. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Integral Design of Information Management System for Building Deformation Monitoring During Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Deformation Monitoring; Project Safety; Digitalization of Management; System
Abstract: The information system for construction deformation monitoring is a system which based on the module of buildings' data collection and data management. Due to the influence of many factors, all kinds of buildings deform during its construction and operation. If the deformation is not within the permitted limit, the normal use of buildings will be affected. Therefore, it is essential to monitor deformations for various buildings, and to carry out the system of data collecting, data processing, and data analyzing. This thesis analyzed the present situation of building deformation monitoring information management system, and brought forward a well-designed scheme of building deformation monitoring information management system. This research aims at designing a specific building deformation monitoring information management system. This information management system can not only analyze and monitor various engineering building security, provide necessary information for safety diagnosis, identify and solve problems, but also can help us to understand the mechanism of deformation and conduct feedback for design and build more effective theory and method on deformation prediction.

Article Title: Options Comprehensive Evaluation Model of Real Estate Development Projects in Multi-stages
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate; real options; brand value; evaluation model
Abstract: The option pricing theory has been widely used to research the valuation problems of the real estate projects. Options theory is proposed by Black and Scholes in 1973, developed and perfected by Merton, etc. Then it entered gradually from financial fields into real investment fields. Up to 1985, considering Los Angeles and global widely exist undeveloped vacant land, Titman[5] constructed a simple two-phase discrete model, without considering the investors preference, given the evaluation formula of the vacant land price and points. For phased development of real estate projects in the latter part of development projects have the characteristics of waiting for the value of options, the paper establishes the options comprehensive evaluation model of the real estate development projects in phases considering the impact of brand value forming in the pre-development projects on the latter project evaluation. According to the comprehensive evaluation results of the model, more reasonable investment decisions can be made on the latter part of the project development.

Article Title: Research on Barriers and Solutions in the Development of Non-profit Mass Sports Organizations in China from the Perspective of Motivation Theories

Abstract: First, the paper analyzes the situation of non-profit mass sports organizations in the past fifty years under administrative orders and it indicates the mass sports activities are conducted due to governmental acts or things like that in China. Secondly, it deeply illustrates the urgency of reforming non-profit mass sports organizations in China and systematically reveals the internal and external barriers in the reform based on analyzing the situation of non-profit mass sports organizations. Finally, it finds out several practical routes to the development of non-profit mass sports organizations in China according to the situation and the internal and external obstacles combined with motivation theories.

Authors: Deng, TJ; Xie, GB; Zou, PXW
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Deng Tiejun; Xie Guibin; Zou, Patrick X. W.
Article Title: Current State-of-play in Identifying and Assessing Safety Risks at Design Stage of Building Projects in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction management; Design; Safety; Safety risks; China
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTION SAFETY
Abstract: Statistics showed that the casualty rate of workers in the building construction industry was twice as high as other industries. Past research has shown that most safety risks may be identified, assessed and minimized or eliminated during design stage of building projects. Several countries such as UK and Australia have developed and implemented relevant effective Guidelines on designing for safety; however, the perceptions, acceptance and practice in Chinese Building Design and Construction Industry still remain unknown. 109 designed survey questionnaires were sent to professional designers in order to study the practice of designing for safety concept in China and 50 valid questionnaires were received, the survey results were presented and comparison with US practice is made wherever suitable. 40% respondents stated that they would accept the designing for safety concept and believe it could minimize or eliminate safety risks in construction sites, but they also mentioned some impacts such as increased liability, the precluding from the culture and nature of construction industry, interferes from the client's investments, etc. In the meantime, the unreasonableness of corporate culture and management of some design institutes also hindered the implementation of the concept. It is deemed that a full range of measures should be adopted to remedy the situation which included affording more new design tools and on-job trainings, issuing relevant guidelines and regulations etc.

Article Title: Construction of Matrix for Choosing Professional Knowledge Strategies and the Application to the Construction Industries
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Knowledge management; Knowledge strategy; Matrix for Choosing Professional Knowledge Strategies (MCPKS)
Abstract: With the development of knowledge economics since 1980s, knowledge resources have become the core of enterprise competition. How to carry on the reformation in knowledge into the construction and its relative industries to adapt to the change is an important issue. Based on the knowledge management principle this paper puts forward a Matrix for Choosing Professional Knowledge Strategies (MCPKS). With the three typical professions in the chain of building industry - architectural design, civil engineering and engineer consultation, the author points out the knowledge strategies that should be applied to the three professions first, then predicts the trend in choosing the knowledge strategies with the accumulation of the professional knowledge, and proposes a direction for these professional knowledge management to follow.

Authors: Gao, G; Wang, TY; Xu, ZL; Taudes, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Gao, G.; Wang, T. Y.; Xu, Z. L.; Taudes, Alfred
Article Title: Evaluation on civil trade area ecology carrying capability
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Civil trade area; Evaluation system; Carrying capability
Abstract: Civil trade area ecology system can self-maintain and self-adjust by its own. Without the disturbance of outside environment, it can keep the self-balance status. Civil trade area ecology carrying capability (CTAECC) can reflect the self-adjust capability of trade area system. Different level trade area ecology system has the self-adjustment function. The focus of trade area ecology function is the principal part of the trade area, which has the function to fit for the change of outside environment. While this function has some limitation, there is a maximum capability. If beyond this boundary, the balance will be destroyed, and the upper trade area will degrade to lower trade area. We will follow the scientific, systematic, dynamic, combined the qualitative indicators and quantitative indicators, reliable and feasible principle. We establish the indicator system to evaluate the civil trade area ecology carrying capability, including the indicator subsystem of trade area elastic degree; subsystem of trade area physical carrying capability; subsystem of environment improvement degree; subsystem of trade area pressure degree. And then we will use the principal component analysis method to get the final results.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Knowledge Management in Construction Enterprises: The Problem and the Resolution Approach
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Knowledge management; Knowledge sharing; Knowledge innovation; Tacit knowledge; Explicit knowledge; Virtual enterprise
Abstract: With the economic globalization and the development of the knowledge economy, the basis of the modern economy has become from the natural resource to intellectual asset, and more and more construction enterprises have realized the great importance of knowledge management. Knowledge management is still in an initial stage in Chinese construction enterprises-the system of knowledge sharing and the knowledge innovation mechanism have not formed completely. Firstly, this paper states the basic elements of knowledge management, and analyzes the importance of the knowledge management for construction enterprise. Secondly, it studies two types of problem-the focalization in knowledge sharing and the lack of knowledge innovation mechanism in the construction enterprises. On this basis, to resolve the former problem, this paper points out that the construction enterprises should establish the knowledge sharing system and the dynamic alliance based on virtual enterprise. To resolve the later problem, this paper points out that the construction enterprises should constitute the knowledge produce-transfer-pervasion mechanism and relative implementation measures. This study has great meanings for construction enterprises to promote their knowledge innovation and enhance their competitiveness.

Article Title: Research on the Quality Problem of Accounting Professional Judgment in Chinese Real Estate Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Professional judgment; Accounting professional judgment; The quality of accounting professional judgment
Abstract: Through analyzing current situation of the quality of accounting information in Chinese real estate industry, this paper points out that non-definite of the existing accounting standards and the quality of the accounting professional judgment in Chinese real estate industry are the main influence factors, and puts forward some measures,such as completing the real estate industry accounting norms. It strengthens external supervision, improves the corporate governance structure, and enhances professional quality of accounting and so on. This will ensure that companies provide reliable accounting information and service for investors' decision. The conclusion of this paper is better for improving the quality of accounting professional judgment in Chinese real estate industry. The real estate industry has entered an important period of accounting professional judgment, theoretical research department, practical research department and accounting regulators have realized the important role of accounting professional judgment. Accounting staff make good use of the accounting professional judgment, which can provide business stakeholders with relevant, reliable accounting information and make contributions to social development.

Article Title: Construction Management'S Role In Construction Claims Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction claims; Dispute resolution; Construction contract
Abstract: This paper discusses the role of construction management (CM) profession in claims management. It reviews the attitudes, psychology and practices relevant to CM knowledge. This paper first reviews the stages of a construction project in which various types of claims may arise. It then examines the pertinent procedures of managing a claim from the perspective of legal practice. It further identifies critical issues concerning preparation and resolution of construction claims for which most practitioners without proper legal training or counseling tend to overlook or find bewildered. An array of CM practices is discussed in response to the potential pitfalls or confusions surrounding the task of construction claims management; and lastly summary remarks are given. It is the purpose of this paper to highlight CM profession's knowledge in this area as this profession's core competence in contemporary construction.

Author Full Names: Hu Changming; Zhang Pei; Zeng Fankui
Article Title: Research on the Qualification Examination to the Security Houses in Xi'an
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: The security yhouses; Economical and Comfortable house; Subsidiary rental house; Public rental house; The Qualification Examination
Abstract: Housing is an important livelihood issue. Solving the low-income families' housing problems is an important content in building a harmonious society. In the imperfect situation of our country's personal credit system, how to ensure the fair distribution of the security houses in a large scale becomes the focus of all levels of government. This article refers to the current situation of the Qualification Examination of the security houses in Xi'an. By applying to SPSS statistical analysis to analyze the correlation between various factors in the Qualification Examination, the unreasonable parts will be pointed out and a series of recommendations will be put forward to improve the House Social Institution, such as: to determine the income criteria of protected objects; to increase the protection area standards of security housing and the standards of rental subsidies to low-income families; to increase the qualification examination dishonesty penalties and so on. The purpose of this article is to establish and improve the House Social Institution which will concern the reality more in Xi'an, promoting social stability and unity in order to build a harmonious society.

Author Keywords: Housing price; rental price.; volatility; ADL-GARCH; Hong Kong
Keywords Plus: UNITED-KINGDOM; DYNAMICS; INFORMATION
Abstract: This paper analyzes the time-varying volatility of housing price with the case of Hong Kong (from January 1993 to December 2008) using the ADL-GARCH model. The stability of housing market is a crucial factor to the overall economy and the welfare of society as well as the mortgage market. During the last decades, however, the tremendous rise in housing price has made the housing market become increasingly volatile. On the other hand, rental price is widely employed to calculate the fundamental value of housing price, which is becoming increasingly fluctuant as well. Hence estimation of the volatility turns to be much more important and difficult when we study housing price mechanism. In this paper, we introduce rental as an independent variable to explain the movement of housing price and estimate volatility during the sample period. This study presents (i) a more efficient and precise measure to comprehend of price movements, (ii) estimate the conditional volatilities and (iii) reduce heteroskedasticity problem of housing market. Furthermore, we identify three fluctuated periods which are corresponding to some external shocks of political and economic events.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Quality Comparison of Traditional DBB and BOT Construction Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project delivery method; BOT; DBB; Construction quality; Supervision; Organization procedure
Abstract: Governments of many countries have encouraged the BOT mechanism for infrastructure in recent years. Many studies investigate the upstream issues of BOT projects such as concessionaire selection criteria, financial requirements, and risk factors. But it is not clear in execution whether BOT projects develop better construction quality than traditional design-bid-build (DBB) ones. This research explored the influence and difference on construction quality by the two project delivery methods. It used case study to analyze and compare ten subway construction projects in Taiwan(China), in which five executed in DBB and five in BOT methods. Thirty interviews were conducted with the project participants, and interview questions were designed to inquire the construction quality results and quality processes of the degree of supervision and organization procedure by the two methods. The study results show that construction quality has no apparent difference by the two methods. But the quality processes such as the degree of quality supervision and organization procedure are different. In traditional DBB method, the project is more cautiously and rigorously supervised by the government officials feeling with greater responsibility. In the BOT project, procurement is more flexible in which the concessionaire can use its connections, innovation, and efficiency. Although the contactor experience and ability are the most influential factor for construction quality, the adequate degrees of supervision should be planned and organization procedure simplified when executing BOT projects since they also have influence on construction quality.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li, J. C.; Tserng, H. P.; Lin, W. S.; Weng, K. W.; Loisel, Denise C.
Article Title: Research on the Development of aProject Performance Measurement System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Performance measurement; Earn Value Management; Project Control
Abstract: Traditional project control depends mostly on the experience of project managers, thus creating difficulty in developing an objective and systematic project control model. This research integrates the concept of CAPP, developed by the Construction Industry Institute, and EVM to develop project performance indexes, showing the difference between benchmarked cases and actual cases. The main purpose of this research is to provide project managers with project performance indexes to control the cost and schedule during the whole construction life cycle to avoid losses or delays. This research developed a web-based project performance evaluation system to store benchmarked cases and to monitor executing cases with the expectation to enhance the project performance. This study uses previous benchmarking and alerted project data as standard database, employs performance indicators to control real-time projects, aiming to provide project managers with an Internet-based project performance measurement system to continuously and instantaneously control project schedule and cost.

Article Title: Research on the Changes of Village-level Governance in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: governance; rural governance; village-level governance
Abstract: This paper focuses on the changes of village-level governance in China and related theories It divides the changes of the village-level governance in China into five stages the embryonic form of village-level governance (village system), the democratic revolution period of village-level governance (including the different initiatives for the KMT and CPC), the rural people's commune era of village-level governance, village-level governance during the household contract responsibility system period and the tax and fee reform period, village-level governance during the tax and fee reform period and the new rural construction period Additionally, it analyzes the causes, characteristics, influences, pros and cons Finally, it concludes eight contexts of the changes of the village-level governance in China

Article Title: Study on Practical Teaching Reform of Engineering Management Major
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering management major; Practical teaching; Teaching reform
Abstract: The talents training of the engineering management major aims to train the inter-disciplinary and application-oriented talents who not only know relevant engineering technologies but also know the economy management. The vigorous development of practical teaching of engineering management is the inevitable request of the major characteristics of the discipline, however there practically is a tendency that the practical teaching separates from the society and the market. The actual problems existing in the current practical teaching of engineering management major such as great difficulty an high cost of practice, the difficulty in the deep and all-round practice caused by the existing practical teaching arrangement and the difficult combination of theories and practical teaching are analyzed in this paper and the countermeasures and suggestions are brought forward from the aspects such as strengthening the construction of practice base, adopting 4+1 mode for practical teaching and setting double tutorial system.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: An Integrated Perspective of the Spatial Pattern and Influence Domain of Cities: the Case of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban Land Use; Spatial Pattern; Influence Domain of Cities; Multiscale Spatial Autocorrelation; China
Abstract: Studies on the relationship between cities in a region are carried out from two perspectives: verifying the agglomeration or interaction of cities of different sizes, and identifying central cities and their influence domains. But they both have limitations. The former is only used for descriptive analysis without considering the relationship among cities, while the latter is restricted by the preciseness of identification. Using the spatial autocorrelation analysis, this paper combines the two methods to investigate the regional and local influence of cities of different sizes from the influenced rather than influencing perspective, which also indicates the agglomeration and dispersion of different sized cities. The empirical study on China's 637 cities with urban land sizes proves the integrated approach feasible and effective. Considering the effect of scales on interaction among cities and the hierarchy of urban service functions, we analyze the issue on regional and local scales with the inverse distance and inverse distance squared as the spatial weight matrix. Regardless the own size of investigated cities, as long as most cities are surrounded by large cities, in other words association types of city sizes are mainly HH or LH, it indicates that large cities with powerful regional or local influence are dominant in the region. Otherwise, the radiation effect of central cities is limited and agglomeration of small cities is the typical characteristic of regional urban system. Cities with the most significant regional influence agglomerate in the Yangtze River Delta, the Pearl River Delta and the Beijing-Tianjin metropolitan area. Among the five metropolitan areas in Eastern China, super-cities are dominant in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei and the Pearl River Delta without the following development of small and medium cities; the Yangtze River Delta and Central-Southern Liaoning are characterized by the collaborative development of different sized cities led by super-cities; cities in Shandong Peninsula cooperate with each other well without a distinguished leading city. The regional influence of central cities in central and western China is limited. There are relatively large numbers of cities in central China, whose local influence domains can completely cover the whole region. At the same time, the regional influence of some (joint) central cities may increase by leaps and bounds. However, the urban size hierarchy is dominated by small cities as lacking large cities in the vast west China. Because of the limited regional and local influence of central cities, many outlying small cities have no chance to share the radiation effect of central cities. Since the influence of a specific central city on non-central cities can't be separated from that of other cities, this integrated approach of inspecting the influence domain of central cities through their influences accepted by others is not perfectly accurate. However, the method provides a new perspective for the study on city's influence domain, which is to combine the regional influence of central cities with the spatial distribution of cities of different sizes through the interaction among them.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Developing an Investment Decision Model Associated With Mega-Infrastructure Using Real Option Theory
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Mega- infrastructure; Indeterminacy value; real option; Investment decision
Abstract: Mega-infrastructure with a big investment and long construction cycle often has a significant impact on the development of local and regional economy. The indeterminacy value of mega-infrastructure is usually depicted by qualitative analysis decision in early research, which is difficult to provide efficient reference for decision-makers and often lead to wrong decision-making and resource waste. In order to overcome above shortcomings, Real Option theory was employed in this paper to develop an investment decision pricing model quantitatively, and a typical case is thus chosen to illustrate how to use the model to make investment decision. This investment decision model is believed to benefit the decision-making by providing quantitative information and a new decision-making thinking to decision-makers. The significance of this research is to quantify large infrastructure's indeterminacy value, comprehensive reflect large infrastructure's value, provide efficient reference to investment decision-makers, promote the rational allocation of limited resources and contribute to the sustainable development of society.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Affordable Housing and Social Security Housing in the People's Republic of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: affordable housing; social security; affordability
Abstract: Currently, the construction of social security housing is boosted in China in missions to stimulate the economy against depression and conquer the deficiency in social or public housing supply, which has been ignored since the housing reform in the late 1990s. Based on comprehensive literature review, the paper firstly reviews definitions of social security housing from local governments in China and sums up various terms related, finding that though the main types of housing including low-rent housing and economical housing are still the same as before, the political guideline beneath has converted from reform to security, showing progress. Then specific comparison was made between social security housing and its corresponding type, namely the affordable housing, in the US and the UK. It shows that the affordable housing in developed counties is abundant in subsidy and property forms, and social security housing is obscure in its target without a comprehensive allocation mechanism. Furthermore, the paper explores the reasons behind such problem in China. Lacking of housing act to protect residents' housing right will result in the dependence on the state and local authorities' unstable directions which would badly affected the benefits of households in the future. In addition, the underdeveloped official system of statistics and investigation is a restriction to a fine planning which is also harmful to administrations' prestige.

Article Title: Network Measures in Civil Air Transport: A Case Study of Lufthansa
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007

Keywords Plus: HUB-AND-SPOKE; SCALE-FREE; DEREGULATION; CENTRALITY; IMPACT
Abstract: Air transport networks have exhibited a trend towards complex dynamics in recent years. Using Lufthansa's networks as an example, this paper aims to illustrate the relevance of various network indicators - such as connectivity and concentration - for the empirical analysis of airline network configurations. The results highlight the actual strategic choices made by Lufthansa for its own network, as well in combination with its partners in Star Alliance.

Article Title: Research on the Implementation of Green Supply Chain Management in the Construction Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green supply chain management; Construction industry; Sustainable development; Construction energy consumption
Abstract: The energy consumption of construction, industry and transport has become three major energy-consuming in our society. Especially the construction energy consumption which was associated with the total construction quantity rising and upgrading of living comfort has shown a sharp rise. Construction energy consumption (including building energy consumption , living energy consumption, heat air-condition energy consumption and so on) occupies about 30% of the total social energy consumption. When the energy is in emergency, the energy-efficient building is put on the agenda again. On one side, the state has increased the promotion of green building and enforced the energy efficiency standards; on the other side, supply chains of related industries which are closely related to controlling construction energy consumption will carry out energy-saving campaign, which is called green supply chain management. The green supply chain management from systematic views and integrative ideas is an effective method which can solve the conflict between the construction industry and the environment. Surely, the management process of introducing the green supply chain management to Chinese construction industry will necessarily result in developing sustainable and coordinating with economics and energy.

Article Title: Study on Housing Security System for Land-lost Farmars in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: land-lost farmers; housing security; urbanization; land acquisition
Abstract: Based on the current pace of urbanization in China, there arc about 4 million of farmers lost their land each yea!, land-lost farmers have become a large special social group, and this social group is growing rapidly, so It will benefit China's economic development and social stability to solve the housing problem of land-lost farmers The current policy of land acquisition and residence relocation is seriously unfair to land-lost farmers, and It is not conducive to sustainable urbanization and urban development To solve housing problems of land-lost farmers and maintain their property rights, governments need to establish a series of housing security system for land-lost farmers, including housing loan funds, affordable housing and low-rent housing especially for land-lost farmers. Such housing security systems could help land-lost farmers to achieve the transformation from peasants to urban residents

Article Title: Empirical Analysis of the Impact of Organization Slack on Corporate Philanthropy Donations

Author Keywords: corporate philanthropy donations; organizational slack; China listed firms
Abstract: Is corporate giving dependent on the availability of its having? This study examines the impact of organization slack on corporate philanthropy donations following Wenchuan Earthquake Absorbed slack and unabsorbed slack are used to measure organization slack from different perspectives Empirical results indicate that unabsorbed slack has a significant positive impact on a firm's donations The findings also suggest that firms are more likely to use unabsorbed slack on charity activities

Article Title: Impacts of Geographic Clusters and Network Status on Innovation Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: geographic clustering; network status; innovation performance
Keywords Plus: FIRMS
Abstract: As competition becomes increasingly intensified nowadays, many a corporations have become wary of their resource limitation and choose cooperating with others. By collaborative efforts they can acquire outside knowledge and resources by which firms generates better innovation performance. As the article illuminates, external factors and inter-organizational network relationships are significant conduits via which companies are able to expeditiously acquire resources and knowledge requisite for innovation. This article utilizes a social network approach and a clustering approach to explore the relationship between geographic clustering and network status and their impact on innovation performance. The results of this study may have many managerial and practical implications.

Article Title: Study on the Supervision Characteristics and Enterprises Development of the Construction Engineering in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction engineering; Supervision industry; Project characteristics; Development research
Abstract: The construction engineering industry and enterprises have a relatively short development history, and are in the preliminary stage of a booming industry. With the further merge of domestic and overseas engineering consultancy market, the domestic construction engineering supervision and consultancy enterprises will face the challenge from more and stronger opponents. Compared with overseas companies, although with certain strength as individuals, the domestic construction engineering supervision and consultancy enterprises are still a supporting role in the international market, and need to improve their competition ability. First, this dissertation analyzes the current situation, characteristics and existing problems and reasons of the construction engineering supervision industry. Second, SWOT is utilized to analyze the strength, weakness, opportunity and threats of the construction engineering industry. Then, an analysis is given to the current situation and development trend of construction engineering enterprises, pointing out the prospect and the necessity for the construction engineering enterprises to develop into the consultancy or project management companies with comprehensive abilities. The development and achievements of China's construction supervision are analyzed as references and inspirations for the construction engineering enterprises development

Authors: Wang, XY; Yang, F; Han, CF
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang Xuyu; Yang Fan; Han Chuanfeng
Article Title: Game Theory Analysis of the Real Estate Price Under the Raise of the Loan Rate
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: loan rate; land primary market; real estate primary market; game
Abstract: In recent years, the real estate industry has been developing rapidly in China. And it occupies a pivotal position in national economy. However, to a great extent, the fast rising of the real estate price hinders the healthy development of the market. Thus the government took a series of measurements, the direct and main one of which was raising the loan rate to curb the unreasonable rise of the real estate price, but the effect was unobvious. In this context, basing on the game theory, this paper builds different models to analyze the problems according to the objectives and behaviors of the main participants, including central government, local government, real estate developers and consumers,then reveals the reason why raising the loan rate had little effect on the real estate price. The research result indicates that changing the supply-demand relation is the key point to control the real estate price, then we offers some suggestions such as strengthening the regulation of land market, optimizing the housing supply structure, improving the monitoring system etc. to promote the development of the real estate market.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Housing Price, Bank Lending and Monetary Policy in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing price; Bank lending; Monetary policy
Abstract: International economic crises show that housing price fluctuations have great impacts on financial stability and economic fluctuations in mature market economies. In order to find out whether there exists a two-way relationship between housing price and bank lending in such a transition economy as China, this paper estimates a vector error correction model using quarterly data from 1998 to 2008 in China. The conclusions are as follows. (I) In long-run there exit a cointegration relationship between housing price, GDP, interest rate and bank lending. (2) In short-term, housing price increases cause bank loans to expand which stimulates housing price to rise subsequently. There exist two-way Granger causality relationships between housing price and bank lending. (3) Innovations to housing prices have significant and persistent positive effects on bank lending which is similar to housing prices' responses to innovations to bank loans. This means housing price and credit are interdependent in China and housing market has played an important role in the transmission mechanism of monetary policy particularly through credit channel.

Authors: Yan, J; Sun, XY; Liu, JJ
Author Full Names: Yan, Jia; Sun, Xinyu; Liu, John J.
Article Title: Assessing container operator efficiency with heterogeneous and time-varying production frontiers
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Stochastic frontier analysis; Production efficiency; Bayesian approach
Keywords Plus: PANEL-DATA; MODELS; PORTS; PRIVATIZATION; INEFFICIENCY
Abstract: We build an empirical model under the stochastic frontier framework to assess production efficiencies of container operators from the world's major container ports in the years between 1997 and 2004, The empirical model measures efficiencies, efficiency changes, and time-persistence of efficiencies after controlling for the individual heterogeneity in technology and technical change. The model is estimated using a Bayesian approach via the Markov Chain Monte-Carlo simulation. We find that the mean efficiency level of the container operators is in the range of 70-90% of their full efficiencies, and the mean efficiency changed with time slightly. However, the percentage of highly efficient operators has increased since 1997. Common model misspecifications without controlling for the individual heterogeneity and technical change can alter the results dramatically. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Asymmetry of the Monetary Policy on the View of Prospect Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: prospect theory; asymmetry of the monetary policy; risk appetite
Keywords Plus: ECONOMIC-FLUCTUATIONS
Abstract: This article explain the asymmetry of monetary policy with a extend type of prospect theory. The study indicate: difference of income (or wealth) will spur people to adjust their datum mark, while marginal gains (value) and its weights will place the gross value function on different location and conduct the people to take on different risk appetite and adopt different measurement. This will weaken the Shortterm effect of expansionary monetary policy, while magnify the effect of tight monetary policy.

Article Title: Deepen E-Government Construction to Promote Service- Oriented Government Building

Author Keywords: e-government; service- oriented government
Abstract: E-Government is an an essential entry point of building service- oriented government and information society. The paper starts from the inherence of E-Government and service- oriented government, analyzes E-Government's promoting effect towards service- oriented government, and then points the main problems under current E-Government circumstances, tentatively proposes some suggestions of deepening the E-Government construction to promote the building of service- oriented Government and finally use the Beijing Drug Safety Information Service Platform to testify the truth.

Author Full Names: Zhou, J. S.; Xing, H. J.
Article Title: The Construction Analysis of the Land and Resources E-Government in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land and Resources Management; Informationization; E-Government
Abstract: The Land and Resources E-Government means bringing the modern electronic technology idea into the management of Land and Resources, reaching to the modern and scientific management on all aspects of this department. In this paper, it illustrated the importance of Land and Resources E-Government construction, and analyzed the problems on the awareness, personnel training, system standards and integration, and system information security during the Land and Resources E-Government construction. Then, it provided several corresponding ways targeted those problems. The LREG construction is an important part and the first process of the Land and Resources Informationization Programme. With the implementation of China's GLP, there will be more and more areas to add into the LREG construction team. And the LREG construction is a very complex system engineering, there are still some issues during the construction on the data center building, horizontal (from other government departments) network-building, EG trust-building system, legal system and system security, etc, which may be difficult to solve. Therefore, the LREG construction need to more constantly research and exploration.

Authors: Agatz, NAH; Erera, AL; Savelsbergh, MWP; Wang, X
Author Full Names: Agatz, Niels A. H.; Erera, Alan L.; Savelsbergh, Martin W. P.; Wang, Xing
Article Title: Dynamic ride-sharing: A simulation study in metro Atlanta
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Ride-sharing; Dynamic optimization; Carpool; Passenger transporation; On-demand
Abstract: Smartphone technology enables dynamic ride-sharing systems that bring together people with similar itineraries and time schedules to share rides on short-notice. This paper considers the problem of matching drivers and riders in this dynamic setting. We develop optimization-based approaches that aim at minimizing the total system-wide vehicle miles incurred by system users, and their individual travel costs. To assess the merits of our methods we present a-simulation study based on 2008 travel-demand-data from metropolitan Atlanta. The simulation results indicate that the use of sophisticated optimization methods instead of simple greedy matching rules substantially improve the performance of ride-sharing systems. Furthermore, even with relatively low participation rates, it appears that sustainable populations of dynamic ride-sharing participants may be possible even in relatively sprawling urban areas with many employment centers. Authors: Chen, XM; Zhou, XS; List, GF
Author Full Names: Chen, Xiaoming; Zhou, Xuesong; List, George F.
Article Title: Using time-varying tolls to optimize truck arrivals at ports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Port management; First best toll pricing; Time-dependent queuing model; Stochastic service time distribution
Keywords Plus: POINTWISE STATIONARY APPROXIMATION; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; MODELS; EXISTENCE; QUEUES
Abstract: An analytical point-wise stationary approximation model is proposed to analyze time-dependent truck queuing processes with stochastic service time distributions at gates and yards of a port terminal. A convex nonlinear programming model is developed which minimizes the total truck turn time and discomfort due to shifted arrival times. A two-phase optimization approach is used to first compute a system-optimal truck arrival pattern. and then find a desirable pattern of time-varying tolls that leads to the optimal arrival pattern. Numerical experiments are conducted to test the computational efficiency and accuracy of the proposed optimization models. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Scheduling freight trains traveling on complex networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Trains; Scheduling; Optimization; Heuristics
Keywords Plus: MODEL; ALGORITHMS; STRATEGY
Abstract: In the US, freight railways are one of the major means to transport goods from ports to inland destinations. According to the Association of American Railroad's study, rail companies move more than 40% of the nation's total freight. Given the fact that the freight railway industry is already running without much excess capacity, better planning and scheduling tools are needed to effectively manage the scarce resources, in order to cope with the rapidly increasing demand for railway transportation. This research develops optimization-based approaches for scheduling of freight trains. Two mathematical formulations of the scheduling problem are first introduced. One assumes the path of each train, which is the track segments each train uses, is given and the other one relaxes this assumption. Several heuristics based on mixtures of the two formulations are proposed. The proposed algorithms are able to outperform two existing heuristics, namely a simple look-ahead greedy heuristic and a global neighborhood search algorithm, in terms of railway total train delay. For large networks, two algorithms based on the idea of decomposition are developed and are shown to significantly outperform two existing algorithms. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Wong, C. K.; Heydecker, B. G.
Article Title: Optimal allocation of turns to lanes at an isolated signal-controlled junction
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic signal control; Signal timing optimisation; Junction geometric design; Lane-based optimisation; Mixed-Integer-Programming
Keywords Plus: OPTIMIZATION; CAPACITY
Abstract: Conventional design methods require the lane marking patterns, which are painted on ground showing road users the permissible turning directions on different approach lanes, as exogenous inputs to define the traffic stream grouping for analysis. This predefined grouping of traffic movements may restrict the design of signal timings in the optimisation procedures. More recently, a lane-based design method has been developed to relax the lane markings as binary-type control variables in a mathematical programming approach. The lane marking patterns and the signal timings can then be optimised simultaneously in a unified framework. This paper presents an extension work to further relax the numbers of approach lane in traffic arms as new integer variables which can then be optimised to give optimal lane arrangement in various arms of a junction to manage the given traffic demands more efficiently. All well-defined signal timings variables in the phase-based approach as well as the lane marking and lane flow variables in the lane-based approach together with their governing constraints are all preserved in the new formulation for the reserve capacity optimisation of isolated signal-controlled junctions. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Jiang, YQ; Wong, SC; Ho, HW; Zhang, P; Liu, RX; Sumalee, A
Author Full Names: Jiang, Yanqun; Wong, S. C.; Ho, H. W.; Zhang, Peng; Liu, Ruxun; Sumalee, Agachai
Article Title: A dynamic traffic assignment model for a continuum transportation system
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Continuum model; Dynamic traffic assignment; Predictive user-equilibrium; Path-choice strategy; Hamilton-Jacobi equation; Finite element method
Keywords Plus: USER-OPTIMAL ASSIGNMENT; VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; HAMILTON-JACOBI EQUATIONS; LINEAR MONOCENTRIC CITY; FREIGHT DISTRIBUTION; VISCOSITY SOLUTIONS; TRIP ASSIGNMENT; CIRCULAR CITY; ROUTE-CHOICE; EQUILIBRIUM
Abstract: A predictive continuum dynamic user-optimal (PDUO-C) model is formulated in this study to investigate the dynamic characteristics of traffic flow and the corresponding route-choice behavior of travelers within a region with a dense urban road network. The modeled region is arbitrary in shape with a single central business district (CBD) and travelers continuously distributed over the region. Within this region, the road network is represented as a continuum and travelers patronize a two-dimensional continuum transportation system to travel to the CBD. The PDUO-C model is solved by a promising solution algorithm that includes elements of the finite volume method (FVM), the finite element method (FEM), and the explicit total variation diminishing Runge-Kutta (TVD-RK) time-stepping method. A numerical example is given to demonstrate the utility of the proposed model and the effectiveness of the solution algorithm in solving this PDUO-C problem. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A mixed-integer linear program for optimizing sensor locations along freeway corridors
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Sensor location problem; Mixed-integer linear program; Branch-and-Bound techniques; Loop detectors
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; ALGORITHM
Abstract: How to optimally allocate limited freeway sensor resources is of great interest to transportation engineers. In this paper, we focus on the optimal allocation of point sensors, such as loop detectors, to minimize performance measurement errors. Although it has been shown that the minimization problem can be intuitively formulated as a nonlinear program, the formulation is so complex that only heuristic approaches can be used to solve the problem. In this paper, we transform the nonlinear program into an equivalent mixed-integer linear model. The linearized model is shown to have a graphical interpretation and can be solved using resource constrained shortest path algorithms. A customized Branch-and-Bound technique is then proposed to solve the resource constrained shortest path problem. Numerical experiments along an urban freeway corridor demonstrate that this sensor location model is successful in allocating loop detectors to improve the accuracy of travel time estimation. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yang, W; Karaesmen, IZ; Keskinocak, P
Author Full Names: Yang, Wei; Karaesmen, Itir Z.; Keskinocak, Pinar
Article Title: Managing uncertainty in on-demand air travel
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: On-demand transport scheduling; Heuristics; Aviation; Rescheduling; Robustness
Keywords Plus: OWNERSHIP PROGRAMS; AIRCRAFT; OPERATIONS; SCHEDULES; AIRLINES
Abstract: Fractional management companies (FMCs) that provide on-demand air travel services experience frequent changes in aircraft availability and flight requests. We propose scheduling heuristics which are both cost-effective and persistent (i.e., close to the original schedule) to address the uncertainty. The heuristics include pro-actively enforcing idleness of aircraft in creating the original schedule, strategically repositioning aircraft to serve yet-unknown demand and dense scheduling. Computational experiments are conducted in a simulator that mimics FMCs' daily operations. Simulation results quantify the value of each heuristic, which can be easily incorporated into existing computational methods used in FMCs for static scheduling problems. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Park, BJ; Zhang, YL; Lord, D
Author Full Names: Park, Byung-Jung; Zhang, Yunlong; Lord, Dominique
Article Title: Bayesian mixture modeling approach to account for heterogeneity in speed data
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Speed distribution; Heterogeneity; Skewness; Multimodality; Finite mixture; Bayesian estimation
Abstract: Speed is one of the most important parameters describing the condition of the traffic flow. Many analytical models related to traffic flow either produce speed as a performance measure, or use speed to determine other measures such as travel time, delay, and the level of service. Mathematical models or distributions used to describe speed characteristics are very useful, especially when they are utilized in the context of simulation and theoretical derivations. Traditionally, normal, log-normal and composite distributions have been the usual mathematical distributions to characterize speed data. These traditional distributions, however, often fail to produce an adequate goodness-of-fit when the empirical distribution of speed data exhibits bimodality (or multimodality), skewness, or excess kurtosis (peakness). This often occurs when the speed data are generated from several different sub-populations, for example, mixed traffic flow conditions or mixed vehicle compositions. The traditional modeling approach also lacks the ability to explain the underlying factors that lead to different speed distribution curves. The objective of this paper is to explore the applicability of the finite mixture of normal (Gaussian) distributions to capture the heterogeneity in vehicle speed data, and thereby explaining the aforementioned special characteristics. For the parameter estimation, Bayesian estimation method via Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling is adopted. The field data collected on IH-35 in Texas is used to evaluate the proposed models. The results of this study show that the finite mixture of normal distributions can very effectively describe the heterogeneous speed data, and provide richer information usually not available from the traditional models. The finite mixture modeling produces an excellent fit to the multimodal speed distribution curve. Moreover, the causes of different speed distributions can be identified through investigating the components. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An approximate algorithm for the two-dimensional air cargo revenue management problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Air cargo; Revenue management; Dynamic programming; Heuristics
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE SEAT ALLOCATION; YIELD MANAGEMENT; OVERBOOKING; MODEL
Abstract: For the air cargo revenue management problem, this study developed a solution algorithm based on approximating the expected revenue function in the dynamic programming (DP) model while taking into account the stochastic volume and weight of shipments. In order to alleviate the computational load, the approximation was achieved by computing only a limited number of points in the DP state space. In the simulation experiment, the developed algorithm was compared with a recent heuristic algorithm based on de-coupling the relationship between weight and volume. It was found that the approach of this study can generate higher revenue than the de-coupling control for most of the cases. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Operational workforce planning for check-in counters at airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport operations management; Mixed integer programming; Staff scheduling; Tour scheduling
Keywords Plus: TOUR SCHEDULING PROBLEMS; PART-TIME; PERSONNEL; SHIFT; ASSIGNMENT; MODELS; SYSTEM; BREAK; COST
Abstract: This paper addresses operation models for workforce planning for check-in systems at airports. We characterize different tasks of the hierarchical workforce planning problem with time-dependent demand. A binary linear programming formulation is developed for the fortnightly tour scheduling problem with flexible employee contracts. This binary programming model is solved for optimality by CPLEX for real-world demand scenarios with different workforce sizes. The numerical study analyzes the impact of the degree of flexibility and economies of scale. The model formulation is extended to generate convenient tours with regard to employee preferences. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Corman, F; D'Ariano, A; Pacciarelli, D; Pranzo, M
Author Full Names: Corman, Francesco; D'Ariano, Andrea; Pacciarelli, Dario; Pranzo, Marco
Article Title: A tabu search algorithm for rerouting trains during rail operations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Real-time railway traffic management; Scheduling; Routing; Alternative graph; Tabu search
Keywords Plus: SCHEDULING TRAINS; MANAGEMENT; BLOCKING
Abstract: This paper addresses the problem of train conflict detection and resolution, which is dealt every day by traffic controllers to adapt the timetable to delays and other unpredictable events occurring in real-time. We describe a number of algorithmic improvements implemented in the real-time traffic management system ROMA (Railway traffic Optimization by Means of Alternative graphs), achieved by incorporating effective rescheduling algorithms and local rerouting strategies in a tabu search scheme. We alternate a fast heuristic and a truncated branch and bound algorithm for computing train schedules within a short computation time, and investigate the effectiveness of using different neighborhood structures for train rerouting. The computational experiments are based on practical size instances from a dispatching area of the Dutch railway network and include complex disturbances with Multiple late trains and blocked tracks. Several small instances are solved to optimality in order to compare the heuristic solutions with the optimum. For small instances, the new tabu search algorithms find optimal solutions. For large instances, the solutions generated by the new algorithms after 20 s of computation are up to more than 15% better than those achieved within 180 s by the previous version of ROMA. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An integrated production-inventory system in a multi-stage multi-firm supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Production-inventory; Lot streaming; Complete backorders; The complete/perfect squares method
Keywords Plus: ECONOMIC-LOT-SIZE; COMPLETE SQUARES METHOD; TECHNICAL NOTE; ORDER QUANTITIES; EPQ MODELS; DERIVATIVES; VENDOR; EOQ; ANALYZE; DESIGN
Abstract: We first generalize a number of integrated models with/without lot streaming and with/without complete backorders under the integer-multiplier coordination mechanism, and then individually derive the optimal solution to the three- and four-stage model, using algebraic methods of complete squares and perfect squares. We subsequently deduce optimal expressions for some well-known models. For our model, we check that the optimal solution, which is algebraically derived, is a global one. We present three numerical examples for illustrative purposes. We finally suggest some future research work involving extension or modification of the generalized model. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Grandfather rights in the market for airport slots
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airports; Grandfather rights; Use-it-or-lose-it rule; Airport slots
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION; CARRIERS; PROPERTY; POWER
Abstract: Grandfather rights are currently used in the European Union to allocate airport slots. This article shows that airports prefer such a use-it-or-lose-it rule to unconditional property rights. Assuming that there are informational asymmetries between airports and air carriers because air carriers have better information on passenger demand, the use-it-or-lose-it rule increases slot use when demand for air transport is low. Airport profits increase and those of the air carriers. together with social welfare, decrease The profit-maximizing slot-use ratio is less than one. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Ecological Compensation in the Water Source Areas -Research on South-to-North Water Diversion Project(Middle Route)
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: ecosystem services; the water source areas of the South-to-North Water Diversion Middle Route project; growth curve; ecological compensation
Abstract: Ecosystem services function is natural environmental condition and utility that the human beings depend on to survive formed and maitained by ecosystem and ecological process. This paper calculates the ecosystem services value by using the measure method of ecosystem services function value, and gets the result of ecological compensation amount of the water source areas of the South to North Water Diversion middle routes project is 33.57 billion yuan by calculating the willingness-to-pay according to Logistic growth curve of the benefited areas. On this basis, the paper finds out the compensation rate and compensation amount to the benefited areas.

Authors: Sumalee, A; Tan, ZJ; Lam, WHK
Author Full Names: Sumalee, Agachai; Tan, Zhijia; Lam, William H. K.
Article Title: Dynamic stochastic transit assignment with explicit seat allocation model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dynamic transit assignment; Transit seat allocation; Stochastic simulation model; Schedule-based transit assignment
Keywords Plus: STRICT CAPACITY CONSTRAINTS; ROUTE CHOICE; EQUILIBRIUM; NETWORKS
Abstract: This paper proposes a stochastic dynamic transit assignment model with an explicit seat allocation process. The model is applicable to a general transit network. A seat allocation model is proposed to estimate the probability of a passenger waiting at a station or on-board to get a seat. The explicit seating model allows a better differentiation of in-vehicle discomfort experienced by sitting and standing passengers. The paper proposes simulation procedures for calculating the sitting probability of each type of passengers. A heuristic solution algorithm for finding an equilibrium solution of the proposed model is developed and tested. The numerical tests show significant influences of the seat allocation model on equilibrium departure time and route choices of passengers. The proposed model is also applied to evaluate the effects of an advanced public transport information system (APTIS) on travellers' decision-making. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Oliveira, Alessandro V. M.; Huse, Cristian
Article Title: Localized competitive advantage and price reactions to entry: Full-service vs. low-cost airlines in recently liberalized emerging markets
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 11th World Congress of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Industrial organization; Entry; Low-cost carrier; Price reactions
Keywords Plus: PERFORMANCE; AIRPORT; POWER; MODEL
Abstract: This paper empirically investigates price reactions to the entry of the low-cost carrier Gol Airlines in the Brazilian domestic market in 2001. Given the substantial reduction in unconditional yields of the incumbent airlines on routes actually entered by Gol, we perform an econometric analysis of the determinants of pricing power along with the analysis of the pattern of price reactions by incumbent legacy carriers. Using data from a panel of routes disaggregated at the airline level, we obtain that (i) both airport and route presence are relevant at explaining pricing behavior; (ii) price responses vary significantly according to flight distance and the amount of seats supplied by the entrant, in the sense that the shorter the route, and the more the seats offered by the newcomer, the stronger the price reactions from the incumbents, with significant point estimates in the range 22-26% in yield reduction for routes as short its 350 km (approx. 195 miles). More generally, the results shed light on the impacts of airline deregulation in emerging markets and the issue of localized competitive advantage due to product differentiation in the industry. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chang, A; Liu, C; Tsai, Y
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chang Andrew; Liu Chien; Tsai Ya
Article Title: Developing Performance Framework and Measures for Construction Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Performance measures; performance evaluation; quality; construction projects
Abstract: Evaluating performance needs a framework and measures. For construction projects, performance is formed by many participants and they have different interpretations. Performance frameworks are proposed by researchers but they are most conceptual ones. On the other hand, quantitative measures are adopted to indicate results such as cost/schedule deviation but they are mainly lagging indicators. A practical framework and leading indicators are lacking. This paper develops a performance framework and measures for construction projects. The framework is derived from the input-process-output transformation process, as well as cost, time, and quality. Leading and lagging measures are identified from theoretical research, ISO management requirements, and a typical construction contract's articles. The developed measures are tested for validity against six projects at different construction stages. The results show that these measures can distinguish performances of different projects. Based on the evaluation outcomes, further analysis and actions could be made for improving unsatisfying parts of the construction performance. A project has different emphases during construction period. The developed measures can be selected, weighted, and combined to represent management needs at different times.
