Article Title: Real Estate on the Contribution of Local Economic Development Research
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; Local economic; Sustainable development
Abstract: Real Estate associated high power led, has become one of the backbone of the national economy. In the current global economic crisis, our central government promoted the expansion of domestic demand and steady economic growth. However, to overcome with the economic crisis and increase domestic demand, readjust the structure, the best way is to invest in real estate. The best way to expand domestic demand and improve people's life standard is also to invest real estate. Therefore, the real estate industry plays a positive role in promoting economic growth, and local income and employment. In order to better measure the real estate development's impact on the local economic growth, some statistical data is applied in this thesis. To quantitatively reflect the relationship between real estate industry in Jilin Province and other industries and reveal the interaction between real estate industry and other industries, as well as the contribution real estate in Jilin Province's to the local economy. This thesis aims to provide the basis quantitative gist for development of the Jilin local economy, and to provide suggestions for the sustainable development of the real estate industry in Jilin Province.

Authors: Chen, L; Ding, LY; Wu, KZ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chen, L.; Ding, L. Y.; Wu, K. Z.
Article Title: An Empirical Study on the Reconstruction of Village-in-City-Taking Guangzhou as an example
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Village in city; Reconstruction; stakeholder group
Abstract: In this paper, a method that combines qualitative research with quantitative research, and theoretic study with empirical study is applied to a special research on some typical villages in city of Guangzhou. Besides in-depth field researches on key villages, interviews with district governments, street offices, village committees, villagers and other relevant functional departments that are related to the villages which were conducted, and questionnaire investigations was made among villagers. On the basis of the work above, a series of thoughts on the solution of the problems found are presented, and proposals for the policy of promoting the reconstruction of village in city are put forward. In such a background, we conducted, taking Guangzhou as an example, a special investigation on the problems of village in city. The research project, which lasts close one year, made an empirical study on literature research. On the basis of the work above, a series of thoughts on the solution of the problems found are presented, and proposals for the policy of promoting the reconstruction of village in city are put forward.

Article Title: Study on the Construction of DIC Judgment System in Real Estate
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate industry; Domestic Industry Competitiveness (DIC); Judgment System
Abstract: With the advancing of opening to the outside world in China, the bound of enterprises in real estate between nations is blurring and thus the competition between nations extends to that between regions in a country. So, research on domestic industry competitiveness (DIC) is becoming a highlight. As for the real estate, one of the four supporting industries, the research on it in DIC is very important. In this chapter, we are trying to build a system to judge the DIC in real estate based on the common accepted definition and the existing judgment system on DIC. As for the foreign real estate, their involving make domestic competition more severe in real estate enterprises because their earlier stating and thus the advantages in many fields such as capital, brands etc. So for the development of China's real estate enterprises, the study of domestic competitiveness and the establishment of a certain evaluation index system to judge and benefit is very necessary.

Author Full Names: Cruz Baez, D. Israel; Gonzalez Rodriguez, Jose M.
Article Title: SIMULATION OF TOURISTIC SECTOR IN A DESTINATION INTO A DECLINE PHASE
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Growth curves; Simulation; Tourism; Canary Islands
Keywords Plus: STOCHASTIC LOGISTIC MODEL; STABILITY ANALYSIS; GROWTH; DIFFUSION; CURVES
Abstract: By using the a modified Point Matching Method to determine parameter identification in logistic equations we model the evolution of the Tourist Offer in one zone of Tenerife Island, in Canary Island, Spain which in the last years has been growth affected by de known decline phase in the terminology of Butler. We use a new version of Bass equation to simulate the real evolution of this variable which can too be considered as level solution of a stochastic equation.

Book Editors: Naimzada, AK; Stefani, S; Torriero, A
Article Title: Empirical Analysis of the Architecture of the Interbank Market and Credit Market Using Network Theory
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Keywords Plus: TOPOLOGY
Abstract: The credit relationships in an economic system are essentially three: the interbank market, the lending market between banks and firms, the commercial credit among firms. Here the focus is on the first two kinds of credit, using network tools. The graph theory, which is at the basis of network analysis, is used as the natural mathematical environment to investigate the architecture (topology) of these markets. The interbank market is represented as a network where the nodes are banks and the links are the reciprocal exposures. The lending relationships between banks and firms is represented by a bipartite graph where the nodes are of two kinds: banks and firms. From the bipartite graph, the network of cofinancing banks is extracted. We observe the leading role of large Italian banks which form a strong core in the network both in the interbank and in the lending market. The small banks act as lenders and the large as borrowers in the interbank market. Both of them finance firms on the lending market, the large ones financing the most of the large firms, while the small ones the small local firms.

Article Title: The Research of Construction Supply Chain Management Based on the Lean Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Lean construction; Construction supply chain; Core enterprise; Win-win situation
Abstract: Lean thinking and supply chain management (SCM) are two regular practices in manufacturing industry, but they both can be implemented in construction industry. This paper aims to apply LC revolution which maximizes value delivered to the customer while minimizing waste to the management of construction supply chain (CSC), in order to form a lean and efficient construction supply chain management (CSCM). With the combination of the lean thinking and SCM in the construction industry, this paper explores that the LC plays a promote role in CSCM. The zero waste thinking of LC has a guiding role to the CSCM. LC thinking and the CSCM conform to a common sociotechnical design with the same goals, activities, and workforce capabilities, therefore the construction enterprise will be built based on the lean SCM as its core competitiveness ability. The effective integration of lean thinking and SCM will promote the CSC economy, high efficiency and quality. In addition, the structure of the supply chain organization can be promoted to be leaner, the organizational synergy can be enhanced, and ultimately promote the development of construction enterprises. Finally, this paper presents some main points when implementing the SCM under the LC term that is focus on strategic management, supplier selection and the information management in CSC. From the perspective of relationship and stakeholder perspective, CSCM with the guidance of lean thinking is necessary and feasible, and the LC is an inevitable trend in the development of CSCM.

Author Keywords: SCI; colleges and universities; evaluation system
Abstract: At present, many colleges and universities establish the links of SCI journal articles with staff academic reward, evaluation of professional title and application for doctor tutor This will inevitably bring increased stress to researchers, they may not devote themselves wholly into the subject that they are working with and some basic research will become more and more superficial and shallow because they want to achieve the results as quickly as possible in order to gain short-term profit Some researchers even fabricate the data and plagiarize papers from other people. In order to improve the function which SCI should have as one of the important indicators of evaluation system of scientific research papers, we should set down some counter-measures to formulate the Immoral behavior in academic circle and finally promote long-term development of our universities.

Abstract: According to the principle that the level of economic development should be in accordance with the geographical location. China can be divided into three major economic zones the eastern part, the central part and the western part Since the reform and opening-up, China's regional economy has witnessed a state of uneven development What's mole, the tax burden in different regions has also been deepened, with the lack of coordination between regional tax burden and economic development The building of Panel Data Model for quantitative analysis shows that the tax elasticity of China's economic growth is I 2954 The tax elasticity of the eastern, the central and western parts are 1 3727, 1 2488 and 1 1554 respectively The economic growth of the eastern region contributed to the national finance most

Author Full Names: Iyer, Vijayan Gurumurthy; Mastorakis, Nikos E.
Article Title: Eco-Friendly Chrome-Less Gin Roller Development For Cotton Roller Gins
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: cotton; gin; ginning; lint; roller; rubber; standards
Abstract: Most of the cotton ginning operations is performed by using double roller (DR) ginning machines which serve an important role in the ginning industries. The rollers used in these industries are made of Chrome Composite Leather-Clads (CCLC) covering fixed to a shaft. The CCLC coverings contain about 18 077 to 30 783 mg/kg (ppm) of chromium particles which is a carcinogenic substance. When the seed-cotton is processed in DR ginning machine, the lint cotton is contaminated with chromium dust of about 110 to 1990 ppm as total chromium, against the safe limits of 0.1 ppm. During the cotton ginning process, due to persistent rubbing of leather over stationery knife, the chromium particles are carried into lint cotton in such a way that the spun yarns contain about 100 to 200 ppm, which according to eco-standards for spun yarns should not be more than 0.1 ppm. The CCLC rollers used in cotton roller ginning machines get powdered during the ginning process as chromium specific dust. Gin and mill workers are directly exposed to this carcinogenic substance and are vulnerable to health hazards. Chromium leak threat to health effects to those who wear cotton[46]. To offset this problem, eco-friendly rubberized cotton fabric (RCF) washers / rollers both for laboratory and commercial studies have been fabricated and experimented [36]. These eco-friendly chrome-less rollers were evaluated for their performances, with a particular reference to techno-commercial and environmental aspects. In this the roller covering is made of multiple layers of fabrics bonded together using white rubber compounding which has a surface finish conducive to high ginning efficiency. On the basis of the design and development of various rollers with subsequent, performance evaluation studies, eco-friendly RCF washers/rollers have been demonstrated with a reference to techno-commercial and eco-friendliness in ginneries. These newly developed RCF rollers were successful in their operation. These were found more effective and efficient than CCLC roller ginneries. They eliminated chromium related contamination and pollution problems. This cleaner technology is a source-at-control preventive measure such that the cotton ginning and textile industries meet the requirements of environmental standards being enforced by many countries and high quality yarns and fabrics meeting international standards are produced. These ginneries have been tested commercially. This was found to be better in all aspects with reference to cotton technological properties, dye-catch properties and physical and chemical properties of CCLC rollers. It could be used commercially as an alternative in the cotton roller ginning industries for the benefit of the environment, textile and gin mill owners, traders, workers, employees of the Government and ultimately the society.

Abstract: As a new direction for social security system reform in China. the long term care insurance will be an effective supplement for social insurance, which significantly reduces pressure on population aging, and improves living conditions for older people Establishment of piloting long term care insurance as soon as possible in certain areas can help for reducing the execution cost and aging pressure at the current distinct disadvantages, such as the underdeveloped productive forces, imperfect legal system, unshaped medical insurance reform, getting old before being rich, rising expenses for aged care, imperfect commercial insurance system and so on A preliminary design for the long term care insurance is taken ultimately in this paper

Article Title: The Analysis of Knowledge Storage, Intellectual Property Rights Protection Cost and Policy
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: intellectual property rights; knowledge storage; protection cost; policy
Abstract: Under the background of economic globalization, it is becoming a highly controversial issue that what kind of intellectual property rights policy should be adopted by the technology following countries. Based on the existing theoretical model, this paper has analyzed the investment intensity on R&D and the intellectual property protection costs from 2003 to 2007 in China empirically. The conclusion is given that China is a technology following country, and it should implement a relatively looser intellectual property protection policy under the current TRIPs agreement framework.

Article Title: The Cost Management of Construction Project Based on Lean Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate

Author Keywords: Lean thinking; Construction project; Lean management; Cost management of constrction project; Supply chain
Abstract: On the basis of the lean management theory, the lean cost management of the construction project is chiefly discussed in this research paper., the lean supply chain cost management and the lean construction cost of production are also elaborated in this thesis. Taking 37# Puhe Metro Building in Shenyang as an empirical analysis of the construction project cost management, some practical problems in implementing the cost of construction project management are demonstrated in the paper; finally, the lean production management system for improving staff awareness is established, and the market mechanisms for the establishment of the internal market management are introduced. In view of the above, some useful other countermeasures are raised in the end of the paper. We hope that the implementation of project cost management can improve the competitiveness of enterprises as reference.

On the background of the current renovation of the Old City, from the perspective of the government, define the scope of study, introduce the characteristics of land in the Old City, according to the problem of real estate development when the Old City renewal, put forward the concept of Real Estate for Historical and Cultural Renaissance. Author Full Names: Lo Kakkeung; Hui Chiman Eddie; Yau Karho
Article Title: Quality Assurance for Outsourcing of Estate Management and Maintenance Services - The Context of Hong Kong Housing Department
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Quality Assurance; Estate Management and Maintenance Services; Quality Management System; Outsourcing; Hong Kong Housing Authority; Property Service Agent
Abstract: The practice of outsourcing of different works and services has become a popular trend in Hong Kong. The Housing Department (HD) of Hong Kong Housing Authority (HA) is not exception. HD began her outsourcing services in Estate Management and Maintenance Services (EMMS) for her public rental housing (PRH) flats to private property service agents (PSAs) in 1999. Since then, there have been numerous complaints for the inferior quality of EMMS provided by PSAs. To improve the quality of EMMS of PSAs for responsibility and accountability to PRH tenants, this paper has focused on the major principles with reference to ISO 9000 standards to which PSAs are able to fulfill in order to achieve the quality assurance towards EMMS for PRH tenants in Hong Kong. The main focus of this study with reference to ISO 9001: 2008 embraces the 'Customer Focus'; 'Leadership'; 'Involvement of People'; 'Process Approach'; 'System Approach to Management'; 'Continual Improvement'; 'Factual Approach to Decision Making'; and 'Mutually Beneficial Supplier Relationships'. This paper also touches with the new approach of ISO: 2008 on outsourcing requirements on which PSAs as well as HD has to address in order to achieve good quality, timely cost-effective, sustainable and responsive EMMS to PRH tenants of HA.

Authors: Luo, Y; Han, Y; Cnen, Q
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Luo Yan; Han Yu; Cnen Qun
Article Title: Knowledge-based Risk Management in Project Life Cycle
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Knowledg management; Risk management; Risk knowledge database; Project life cycle; Knowledge imparting
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTION
Abstract: With the development of knowledge economy, knowledge is deemed a key factor in management and competition. The concept of Knowledge Management (KM) first emerged in the 1960s with recognition that post-industrial society was characterized more by intellectual. With the application of knowledge management, the risk management efficiency and competency of project organization will be improved.The framework of knowledge-based risk management in project life cycle is established in this paper. First of all, the characteristic of project risk is analyzed from the perspective of knowledge, and then the risk function is proposed based on knowledge management. The process of project risk management based on knowledge management is described with the establishment of risk knowledge database. According to Hall's three-dimensional structure of system engineering, the risk knowledge system in project life-cycle is structured. The contents of project life cycle risk management are detailed from time dimension, logic process dimension and knowledge dimension, respectively. Finally, the important role and advantage of knowledge-based risk management in project life cycle are analyzed.

Article Title: A system-optimization perspective for supply chain network integration: The horizontal merger case
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: System-optimization; Supply chains; Network acquisitions; Horizontal mergers; Supply chain performance metrics; Strategic advantage; Synergy; Transportation and logistics
Keywords Plus: MODEL
Abstract: In this paper, we present a new theoretical framework for the quantification of strategic advantages associated with horizontal mergers through the integration of supply chain networks. The framework is a system-optimization one in which each firm is represented as a network of economic activities associated with manufacturing, distribution, and storage and with explicit capacities imposed on the links. We present the models pre- and post-horizontal mergers and define a measure for the quantification of the gains, if any, associated with the mergers. We illustrate the framework with several numerical examples. For simple classes of mergers we derive formulae for the strategic advantages. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Robin, T; Antonini, G; Bierlaire, M; Cruz, J
Author Full Names: Robin, Th.; Antonini, G.; Bierlaire, M.; Cruz, J.
Article Title: Specification, estimation and validation of a pedestrian walking behavior model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Walking; Pedestrian; Operational level; Microscopic model; Behavior model; Discrete choice model; Forecast model; Cross nested logit model; Dynamic choice set; Specification; Real data; Estimation; Validation; Cross-validation
Keywords Plus: DISCRETE-CHOICE MODELS; PERSONAL-SPACE; INTERPERSONAL DISTANCE; EXPLORATION; BOUNDARY; DYNAMICS; TRACKING
Abstract: We propose and validate a model for pedestrian walking behavior, based on discrete choice modeling. Two main types of behavior are identified: unconstrained and constrained. By unconstrained, we refer to behavior patterns which are independent from other individuals. The constrained patterns are captured by a leader-follower model and by a collision avoidance model. The spatial correlation between the alternatives is captured by a cross nested logit model. The model is estimated by maximum likelihood estimation on a real data set of pedestrian trajectories, manually tracked from video sequences. The model is successfully validated using a bi-directional flow data set, collected in controlled experimental conditions at Delft university. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sun, WF; Li, FH; Zhang, F; Zhang, JM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Sun Weifeng; Li Fenghua; Zhang Fei; Zhang Jingmin
Article Title: Study on Market Risk Situation of Tianjin Real Estate Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Tianjin Real Estate Industry; Market Risk; Attribute Synthetic Assessment Model
Abstract: Tianjin, as one of the four direct municipalities under the Central Government, the economy has developed swiftly in recent years, while real estate as mainstay industry plays more and more important role in this process. Real estate industry plays an important role for Tianjin economy, and grasps the rules of real estate market development and analyses its risk situation has a great practical significance. The study on market risk evaluation of Tianjin real estate is based on the study of Tianjin risk index system. The study has great practical significance for both theory exploration and application of real estate risk. This paper make some research about holistic risk in real estate market from the macroscopically view, clean up a great deal of historic data, puts forward the author's own view on boundary of indexes, and sets a relatively integrated risky indicators system about Tianjin real estate market. Then, make the standard to identify indicators, and design attribute synthetic assessment model and pile cyber-program to evaluate the market risk of Tianjin real estate in recent years. The conclusion of this paper is credible, so it can offer some reference and suggestion for real estate developer, personal housing investor and the government.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Establishment and Management of Partnering under the Joint Venture
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the joint venture; partnering; establishment; management
Abstract: The joint venture is the useful experience supplied by the international projects. The introduction of partnering not only strengthens the idea of cooperation between the original members. At the same time, the owners' partnering status will be established. Domestic projects have used the contractual patterns for many years in which the design is separated from the construction so that the constructability can't be satisfied. Therefore enterprises who have the strategic vision will take the joint venture into consideration. The model based on a voluntary and win-win situation can enhance enterprises' probability of winning the bid. Meanwhile the introduction of partnering is a new tendency based on the harmonious idea. The objective of this paper is to analyze the establishment and the management of partnering under the model of joint venture. The paper addressed several advantages with partnering. It held the view that the process of the establishment can be divided into three steps, and then analyzed its risk management, contract management, operation management and cultural management.

Article Title: Port choice and freight forwarders
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: Conference of the International-Association-of-Maritime-Economists (IAME2003)
Conference Sponsor: Int Assoc Maritime Econ
Author Keywords: Port choice; Selection factors; Freight forwarders; Shippers; Southeast Asia
Keywords Plus: CARRIER SELECTION; TRANSPORTATION
Abstract: In light of the growing supply chain power of 3PLs and very limited empirical studies on port choice from the freight forwarders' perspective, this paper tries to evaluate the major factors influencing port choice from the Southeast Asian freight forwarders' perspective, their decision-making style and port selection process and draw out some policy implications for port operators and authorities. Efficiency is found to be the most important factor followed by shipping frequency, adequate infrastructure and location. Their selection process is complex and a two-stage process and supports the new approach that models ports within the framework of a supply chain. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Research on Mechanism of Tourism Real Estate Promoting Tourism Industry Cluster Growth
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Tourism real estate; Tourism industry cluster; Growth; Mechanism
Abstract: Along with the gradually popularized idea of living elsewhere, leisure and vocation tend to be more diverse than ever before. It has been known in practice that tourism industry cluster growth is diven by tourism real estate. This paper focuses on the dynamic mechanism of tourism real estate promoting tourism industry cluster growth. Furthermore, paper tries to explore the way that cluster integreates various industry performances and effectively accelerates industrial economies. This idea will bring a new vision for tourism real estate enterprises and various enterprises participating in regional economic development, thus promote them to develop new fields of tourism real estate from higher angle. The development of tourism real estate promotes and guides tourism industry cluster growth. The integrated development of tourism real estate mainly refers to the development of theme real estates driven by tourism industry. Through tourism development, regional overall environment can be enhanced. Real estate development strengthens regional industry gathering space.

Authors: Xiong, W; Yuan, JF; Li, QM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xiong Wei; Yuan Jing-feng; Li Qiming
Article Title: The Price Adjustment Mechanism of PPP Project-Based on The Objective Management Theory
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public Private Partnerships(PPPs); Balance of Interests; Questionnaire survey; System Dynamics; Objective management
Abstract: Aiming to balance the interests of the public sector, the private sector and the general public, a price adjustment model is established based on the theory of objective management. A structured questionnaire survey was conducted by focusing on the identified critical objectives, and the weights of the critical objectives influencing the satisfaction of the tripartite were figured out. The quantitative evaluation of the critical objectives was done through expert score method, according to which the tripartite evaluation system of critical objectives was set up. Furthermore, the relationship amongst the critical objectives was identified by using the method of system dynamics, within which the feedback mechanism of the critical objectives was examined. A price adjustment mechanism for PPP projects by the combination of the tripartite evaluation system and the feedback mechanism of critical objectives were finally established.

Article Title: Reputation Game between Teachers and Students in University's Three Independent Elective Course of Physical Education
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: three independent; physical education elective course; reputation game
Abstract: The paper analyzes the influencing factors between teachers and students in university three independent elective courses using game theory. Furthermore, the reputation model which determines whether teachers work hard is built. By this model, the influences on equilibrium relationship between teachers and students can be analyzed. At the same time, it is able to illustrate whether teachers determine to maintain internal causes of reputation under different conditions.

Authors: Ye, YM; Ye, XM; Han, HY
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ye, Y. M.; Ye, X. M.; Han, H. Y.
Article Title: Concept Clarification and Classification for Idle Land
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Idle land; Concept Clarification; classification
Abstract: With the rapid development of real estate market, recent years have witnessed both the insufficiency of land supply and the low efficiency of land utilization. Large proportion of idle land has been a big problem and attracted a national attention after the conveyance and transfer of land use right. Until now, there is no clear definition of idle land in China. Different definitions of idle land adopted by various local land administration departments have resulted in the inconsistency of the statistical data of land areas. This has impeded the survey, monitoring and management of idle land. Based on the international theories of idle land management, this research clarifies the basic concept of idle land, and defines idle land in a broader background. The present research also identifies the definition of idle land, unused land and land in low efficient use, and classifies different types of idle land according to the land ownership, ways of land conveyance and transfer, effects of land supply and land use plans. This paper can be applied to provide a theoretical basis for the identification and management of idle land.

Article Title: A passenger demand model for air transportation in a hub-and-spoke network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Demand model; Route choice; Instrumental variables; Value of travel time; Panel data
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL ITINERARY SHARES; AIRPORT CHOICE; COMPETITION; QUALITY; SERVICE
Abstract: This paper develops an air passenger model that deals with city-pair demand generation and demand assignment in a single framework. Using publicly available and regularly collected panel data, the model captures both time series and cross-sectional variation of air travel demand. The empirical analysis finds that pattern of correlations among alternatives can be described by a three-level nested logit model. Fare, frequency, flight time, direct routing, on-time performance, income, and market distance have significantly effects on air demand. Correcting for the problem of endogenous air fares using instrumental variables yields more plausible estimates of price sensitivity and value of time. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Characterization of traffic oscillation propagation under nonlinear car-following laws
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic oscillation; Describing function; Nonlinear; Car-following law
Keywords Plus: OPTIMAL VELOCITY MODEL; FREEWAY; DYNAMICS; FEATURES; STATES; WAVES; FLOW; SIMULATION
Abstract: Unlike linear car-following models, nonlinear models generally can generate more realistic traffic oscillation phenomenon, but nonlinearity makes analytical quantification of oscillation characteristics (e.g, periodicity and amplitude) significantly more difficult. This paper proposes a novel mathematical framework that accurately quantifies oscillation characteristics for a general class of nonlinear car-following laws. This framework builds on the describing function technique from nonlinear control theory and is comprised of three modules: expression of car-following models in terms of oscillation components, analyses of local and asymptotic stabilities, and quantification of oscillation propagation characteristics. Numerical experiments with a range of well-known nonlinear car-following laws show that the proposed approach is capable of accurately predicting oscillation characteristics under realistic physical constraints and complex driving behaviors. This framework not only helps further understand the root causes of the traffic oscillation phenomenon but also paves a solid foundation for the design and calibration of realistic nonlinear car-following models that can reproduce empirical oscillation characteristics. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Pant, R; Barker, K; Grant, FH; Landers, TL
Author Full Names: Pant, Raghav; Barker, Kash; Grant, F. Hank; Landers, Thomas L.
Article Title: Interdependent impacts of inoperability at multi-modal transportation container terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Inoperability Input-Output Model; Inland port; Disruptive events; Interdependent impacts; Multi-regional impacts
Keywords Plus: INPUT-OUTPUT MODEL; ECONOMIC-IMPACTS; FRAMEWORK
Abstract: This work describes the interdependent adverse effects of disruptive events on inter-regional commodity flows resulting from disruptions at an inland port terminal. To do so we integrate the risk-based Multi-Regional Inoperability Input-Output Model, which measures the cascading regional effects of disruptions to interconnected industries, with models, which simulate port operations such as commodity arrival, unloading, sorting, and distributing. Such models capture three disruption scenarios at the port and provide measures of impact to industries that use the inland port terminal facility. A case study highlights the disruptive effects of a closure of the Port of Catoosa in Oklahoma. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A bottom-up solution for the multi-facility optimal pavement resurfacing problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Pavement resurfacing; Threshold structure; Life-cycle costs; Multiple facilities; Network; Optimization
Keywords Plus: MAINTENANCE; MODEL; OPTIMIZATION; MANAGEMENT; SYSTEM; ALGORITHMS; FRAMEWORK
Abstract: Transportation infrastructure management has been a subject of growing economic importance in recent years due to the magnitude of agency expenditures. Increasingly sophisticated methods have been developed to model pavement deterioration and solve for optimal management strategies. However, it is unclear whether these more complex methods are providing more useful results. This paper presents a simple approach for optimizing the frequency and intensity of resurfacing for multiple highway facilities. It builds upon existing optimization methods for the single-facility, continuous-state, continuous-time problem and corresponding results, which include a threshold structure for optimal solutions. This threshold structure allows for mathematical simplifications and for a straightforward optimization approach to be applied to the multi-facility case. The approach is bottom-up rather than top-down, preserving facility-specific features to develop informative budget allocation results. Application of the approach in a case study indicates that solutions are likely to be robust to deterioration model uncertainty, which is consistent with previous facility-level findings. In addition, the methodology is shown to be robust to the form of the deterioration model. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A scenario decomposition-genetic algorithm method for solving stochastic air cargo container loading problems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Scenario decomposition; Genetic algorithm; Air express cargo loading; Stochastic demands
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL-TIMES; OPTIMIZATION
Abstract: In this study, we develop a solution method for solving air express cargo loading problems under stochastic demands. The method is designed by combining the scenario decomposition and genetic algorithm (GA) techniques. Numerical tests are performed to evaluate the performance of the solution method using data for the Asian operations of an international express carrier. The results show that the solutions obtained from our method are very close to the optimal solutions. Furthermore, our method has an advantage in terms of computation time over the CPLEX optimization algorithm. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Rajesh, R; Pugazhendhi, S; Ganesh, K; Muralidharan, C; Sathiamoorthy, R
Author Full Names: Rajesh, R.; Pugazhendhi, S.; Ganesh, K.; Muralidharan, C.; Sathiamoorthy, R.
Article Title: Influence of 3PL service offerings on client performance in India
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: 3PL providers; Service offerings; Performance indicators; Multiple regression analysis
Keywords Plus: 3RD-PARTY LOGISTICS; STRATEGY; MANUFACTURERS; AMERICAN
Abstract: This paper examines, in the context of outsourcing, the effects of improving the performance indicators of a client to the services offered by a 3PL provider. A research model has been developed and four research hypotheses are analyzed empirically using multiple regression analysis. The results point out that there is a positive influence in the performance indicators for clients who are in association with a 3PL provider. It is proved that the clients distinguish a 3PL provider as providing them with a potential pathway to a more innovative business model. The theoretical, managerial and research implications are also highlighted. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zheng, Z; Ahn, S; Chen, DJ; Laval, J
Author Full Names: Zheng, Zuduo; Ahn, Soyoung; Chen, Danjue; Laval, Jorge
Article Title: Applications of wavelet transform for analysis of freeway traffic: Bottlenecks, transient traffic, and traffic oscillations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Wavelet transform; Freeway bottleneck; Transition; Traffic oscillations
Keywords Plus: NEURAL-NETWORK MODEL; INCIDENT-DETECTION; FEATURE-EXTRACTION; FLOW; ZONE
Abstract: This paper demonstrates the capabilities of wavelet transform (WT) for analyzing important features related to bottleneck activations and traffic oscillations in congested traffic in a systematic manner. In particular, the analysis of loop detector data from a freeway shows that the use of wavelet-based energy can effectively identify the location of an active bottleneck, the arrival time of the resulting queue at each upstream sensor location, and the start and end of a transition during the onset of a queue. Vehicle trajectories were also analyzed using 'NT and our analysis shows that the wavelet-based energies of individual vehicles can effectively detect the origins of deceleration waves and shed light on possible triggers (e.g., lane-changing). The spatiotemporal propagations of oscillations identified by tracing wavelet-based energy peaks from vehicle to vehicle enable analysis of oscillation amplitude, duration and intensity. Authors: Hsu, CI; Li, HC; Liu, SM; Chao, CC
Author Full Names: Hsu, Chaug-Ing; Li, Hui-Chieh; Liu, Su-Miao; Chao, Ching-Cheng
Article Title: Aircraft replacement scheduling: A dynamic programming approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Dynamic programming; Fleet planning; Aircraft replacement schedule
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE NETWORK; MODEL; FREQUENCY; DEMAND
Abstract: This study developed a stochastic dynamic programming model to optimize airline decisions regarding purchasing, leasing, or disposing of aircraft over time. Grey topological models with Markov-chain were employed to forecast passenger traffic and capture the randomness of the demand. The results show that severe demand fluctuations would drive the airline to lease rather than to purchase its aircrafts. This would allow greater flexibility in fleet management and allows for matching short-term variations in the demand. The results of this study provide a useful reference for airlines in their replacement decision-making procedure by taking into consideration the fluctuations in the market demand and the status of the aircraft. Article Title: Locating passenger vehicle refueling stations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Multiple objectives; Refueling station; Alternative fuel vehicles; Facility location; Mixed-integer program
Keywords Plus: HYDROGEN; FUEL; FACILITIES; NETWORK; DESIGN; MODELS
Abstract: The study follows the concept of set cover and vehicle refueling logics to propose a hybrid model with dual objectives, using a mixed integer programming method, to economically site refueling stations to simultaneously serve intercity and intra-city travel. The model can be applied to plan a network of refueling stations for the emerging and/or monopolistic automotive market of alternative fuel vehicles. From a real-life case study, the factors of vehicle range and coverage distance are identified as playing important roles in any solution. Based on the non-inferior solutions, decision makers can thus better formulate viable station-deployment plans. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Cheon, S; Dowall, DE; Song, DW
Author Full Names: Cheon, SangHyun; Dowall, David E.; Song, Dong-Wook
Article Title: Evaluating impacts of institutional reforms on port efficiency changes: Ownership, corporate structure, and total factor productivity changes of world container ports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Port reform; Port ownership; Port corporate structure; Port efficiency; Total factor productivity changes; Malmquist Productivity Index (MPI)
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; PERFORMANCE; ENTERPRISES; TERMINALS; PRIVATE
Abstract: This paper evaluates how port institutional reforms influenced efficiency gains between 1991 and 2004. We constructed a panel data for port ownership, corporate structure, and port inputs and outputs for 98 major world ports, and we implemented the Malmquist Productivity Index (MPI) model. The MPI provides efficiency measures for input combinations that allow for obtaining the outputs in the presence of institutional reforms, ownership changes, main agent problems, technological progress, efficient scale growth, and many other reasons for efficiency and the lack of it. The results illustrate that ownership restructuring contributed to total factor productivity gains. The restructuring induced optimized operation of container terminals, especially for large ports, as it allowed specialized private entities to concentrate on terminal operation and cargo handling services. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Parker, N; Fan, YY; Ogden, J
Author Full Names: Parker, Nathan; Fan, Yueyue; Ogden, Joan
Article Title: From waste to hydrogen: An optimal design of energy production and distribution network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Renewable energy; Logistics network design; Facility location; Hydrogen infrastructure; Freight transport
Keywords Plus: DYNAMIC FACILITY LOCATION; COST HYDROGEN; PROSPECTS; MODEL
Abstract: This paper focuses on evaluating the economic potential and infrastructure requirements of hydrogen production from agricultural residues, a representative green energy pathway. A mixed-integer nonlinear programming model is constructed for finding the most efficient and economical configuration of the whole pathway. Using northern California case studies, we found that hydrogen from agricultural wastes can be delivered at costs similar to producing hydrogen from natural gas, a non-renewable energy source. The potential impact of this energy pathway on local freight transport is also discussed depending on the choice of hydrogen delivery mode. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Technical efficiency and productivity changes in Spanish airports: A parametric distance functions approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport; Total Factor Productivity (TFP); Technical efficiency; Technological change; Parametric distance function
Keywords Plus: UNDESIRABLE OUTPUTS; MAJOR AIRPORTS; PERFORMANCE; BENCHMARKING; METHODOLOGY; DEA
Abstract: This paper contributes to the airport benchmarking literature in two ways. To our knowledge, this is the first attempt at using a stochastic distance function to measure airports' productivity changes while considering multiple outputs. Secondly, we calculate the evolution and decomposition of the Total Factor Productivity (TFP) for Spanish airports. The average rate of productivity showed a slight annual improvement of 0.9%, and the core engine of this was 3% increase in technical progress rather than through efficiency. Results, by airport, identify those needing improvement, to be more attractive in the Spanish airport restructuring program. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chiabaut, N; Leclercq, L; Buisson, C
Author Full Names: Chiabaut, Nicolas; Leclercq, Ludovic; Buisson, Christine
Article Title: From heterogeneous drivers to macroscopic patterns in congestion
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Macroscopic patterns; Heterogeneous drivers; Congestion; Waves
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC FLOW; MODELS; WAVES
Abstract: This paper first presents a method to estimate Newell's car-following model parameters in congestion at a microscopic scale. I-80 NGSim data analysis shows that at this scale driving behaviors vary from one vehicle to the another. Then, relations between stochastic Newell's model with heterogeneous drivers and its associated macroscopic pattern are established. This proves that the mean jam spacing is the arithmetic mean of individual jam spacings whereas the mean wave speed is the harmonic mean of individual wave speeds. These new insights are valuable for (i) calibrating a macroscopic model from individual observations and (it) establishing the equivalence between the stochastic and the well-calibrated deterministic versions of Newell's model for a sufficiently large number of vehicles. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Li, XP; Peng, F; Ouyang, YF
Author Full Names: Li, Xiaopeng; Peng, Fan; Ouyang, Yanfeng
Article Title: Measurement and estimation of traffic oscillation properties
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic oscillation; Periodicity; Magnitude; Frequency spectrum analysis; Detector data; Vehicle trajectory
Keywords Plus: OPTIMAL VELOCITY MODEL; CAR-FOLLOWING MODEL; FEATURES; ORGANIZATION
Abstract: The paper proposes a frequency spectrum analysis approach to improve measurements of traffic oscillation properties (e.g., periodicity. magnitude) from field data. The approach builds on standard signal processing techniques to effectively distinguish useful oscillation information from noise and nonstationary traffic trends. Compared with conventional time-domain methods, the proposed methodology systematically provides a range of information on oscillation properties. This paper also shows how to estimate oscillations experienced by drivers using detector data. Applications to real-world data from two sites show that the dominant oscillation period remains relatively invariant at each site when an oscillation propagates. Although the average oscillation periods displayed in detector data significantly vary across sites. the range of oscillations experienced by drivers are found to be more consistent. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Rouwendal, J; de Blaeij, A; Rietveld, P; Verhoef, E
Author Full Names: Rouwendal, Jan; de Blaeij, Arianne; Rietveld, Piet; Verhoef, Erik
Article Title: The information content of a stated choice experiment: A new method and its application to the value of a statistical life
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Stated preferences; Value of a statistical life
Keywords Plus: WILLINGNESS-TO-PAY; MODELS
Abstract: This paper presents a new method to assess the distribution of values of time, and values of statistical life, over participants to a stated choice experiment. The method does not require the researcher to make an a priori assumption on the type of distribution, as is required for example for mixed logit models. It requires a few assumptions to hold true, namely that the valuations to be determined are constant for each individual, and that respondents make choices according to their preferences. These assumptions allow the derivation of lower and upper bounds on the (cumulative) distribution of the values of interest over respondents, by deriving for each choice set the value(s) for which the respondent would be indifferent between the alternatives offered, and next deriving from the choice actually made the respondent's implied minimum or maximum value(s). We also provide an extension of the method that incorporates the possibility that errors are made. The method is illustrated using data from an experiment investigating the value of time and the value of statistical life. We discuss the possibility to improve the information content of stated choice experiments by optimizing the attribute levels shown to respondents, which is especially relevant because it would help in selecting the appropriate distribution for mixed logit estimates for the same data (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhang, YS; Gong, WQ; Yan, W
Book Editors: Li, NJ; Yang, Q; Zhang, H; Xie, W
Author Full Names: Zhang Yushu; Gong Wenqi; Yan Wu
Article Title: Application of a Novel Cationic Collector in Reverse Flotation Beneficiation of Oolitic Haematite Ore
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Cationic collector; Oolitic hematite; Reverse flotation; Silicon removal
Abstract: Oolitic hematite is one of the most refractory iron ores with complicate mineral compositions and abundant reserves in China. The hematite and limonite in the ore integrate closely with fine particles of collophanite, quartz, chamosite, calcite and chalcedony to form concentric ring structure, making the separation of the minerals extremely difficult. Since the tiny hematite crystal can not be liberated during the grinding of the ore the beneficiation can only be accomplished by recovering iron minerals aggregate with hematite as the major component. The previous research results showed that reverse flotation with fatty acid collectors could remove liberated phosphate minerals but not the quartz, chlorite and silicate minerals. This was because the gangue minerals such as quartz were contaminated by iron on the surface and there were high content of iron in some silicate minerals and high content of silicon in iron minerals, causing the floatability difference between the silicon and the iron minerals very small and thus the separation efficiency very low. Experiments were conducted to beneficiate the ore by reverse flotation with different cationic collectors. The results indicated that the flotation separation efficiency with most cationic collectors such as dodecylamine, ether amine, GE601 or GE609 was not satisfactory. However, a novel cationic collector for silicon removal, EM506 was found to be specifically selective to separate the gangue minerals from the iron ore with an increase of TFe grade from 49% to more than 58% and a recovery of TFe greater than 96%, which provided a promising approach for the beneficiation of the refractory oolitic hematite ore.

Article Title: Discrete choice models with multiplicative error terms
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Discrete choice; Multiplicative specification; Multivariate extreme value; Random scale; Heteroscedasticity
Keywords Plus: COVARIANCE HETEROGENEITY; COMPLEXITY; BEHAVIOR; TRAVEL
Abstract: The conditional indirect utility of many random utility maximization (RUM) discrete choice models is specified as a sum of an index V depending on observables and an independent random term P. In general, the universe of RUM consistent models is much larger, even fixing some specification of V due to theoretical and practical considerations. In this paper, we explore an alternative RUM model where the summation of V and E is replaced by multiplication. This is consistent with the notion that choice makers may sometimes evaluate relative differences in V between alternatives rather than absolute differences. We develop some properties of this type of model and show that in several cases the change from an additive to a multiplicative formulation, maintaining a specification of V, may lead to a large improvement in fit, sometimes larger than that gained from introducing random coefficients in V. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: DeVuyst, E; Wilson, WW; Dahl, B
Author Full Names: DeVuyst, Eric; Wilson, William W.; Dahl, Bruce
Article Title: Longer-term forecasting and risks in spatial optimization models: The world grain trade
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Risk; Barge demand; Mississippi river; Spatial optimization model
Abstract: This study develops a methodology to quantify risks associated with projected commodity flows in a spatial optimization model. In this paper it is applied to the world grain trade which is characteristic of numerous commodities and with complicated and competing logistical channels in world trade. The model provides a longer-run solution by simultaneously allowing for changes in production patterns, trade flows, and intermodal, interport and inter-reach allocation of shipments. Results show that important factors affecting shipments include: changes in demand across countries, delay costs, and the increased domestic use of grains. Findings of interest show delay costs on barges shift movements to rail, other origins and ports. Second, there is much greater uncertainty for projections for more distant periods forward. Finally, the model can be applied similarly to other commodities and/or be used to analyze spatial flows concentrated in other geographic regions. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Credit Default Swaps and Stock Prices: Further Evidence of Mean and Volatility Transmission using a MVGARCH-M Model
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: stock market; CDS market; mean and volatility spillovers; EC and MVGARCH-M models
Keywords Plus: TIME-SERIES; UNIT-ROOT; RISK; BONDS
Abstract: This paper empirically investigates the association between the stock market and the credit default swap (CDS) market in terms of mean and volatility spillovers. The analysis uses 1,612 daily observations from four stock markets (the US, German, UK and Greek markets) and two European CDS indices, along with the error correction (EC) methodology and the multivariable generalized heteroskedasticity in mean (MVGARCH-M) modelling. We find that stock returns across European and US markets are negatively related to European CDS spread changes, that the CDS market seems to lead the stock market (implying that information contents coming from the firm's environment, first, impacts on the CDS market followed by the stock market), and that stock market volatility has a positive impact on CDS spreads.

Article Title: Implementing Global Virtual Engineering Team (GVET): Recommended Practices at Corporate Level
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Outsourcing; Global virtual engineering team (GVET); Virtual team; EPC; Project execution plan
Keywords Plus: TRUST; COMMUNICATION; TECHNOLOGY
Abstract: The use of Global Virtual Engineering Team (GVET) for the execution of engineering projects has been increasingly applied in the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) industry, but identifying the best methods for organizing and managing these geographically dispersed teams is a significant challenge. These teams, organized through communication and information technologies, need to overcome space, time, functional, organizational, national, and cultural barriers for the completion of engineering task. This study identifies and categorizes recommended practices at corporate level for GVET design and implementation by an extensive study and survey from both owner and EPC contractor perspectives. These practices in terms of organization, work processes, communication, quality, and technology provide a wide range of references for owner organizations and EPC contractors to establish and manage GVET according to specific capital project scenarios. The recommended practices also provide researchers with significant subject matter to explore when investigating the effects of these practices upon GVET performance and better understanding the nature and characteristics of GVET.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Sensitivity Analysis on Invisible Demand of Insurance Products
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: invisible demand; insurance products; regression analysis; correlation analysis
Abstract: On the background of studying invisible demand deeply, we draw on the different research areas of invisible demand from the relevant researches of domestic and foreign scholars. In this paper we analyze the comparative difference between insurance products and tangible products from the three perspectives, flexibility and ambiguity and synchronization, highlighting the invisible of insurance products. We then do the correlation analysis and the regression analysis between insurance products and income and consumption. We find that people often tends to keep the consumption of insurance products with income rising, owing to revenue reaching a certain level and avoiding to the desire risk stronger. Finally, new insurance products based on invisible demand will be produced to meet people's demand continuously.

Article Title: Legislation Flaw Research on Project Quality Maintenance System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Quality maintenance; Defects; Project quality insurance; Ten years' liabilities
Abstract: The engineering project quality refers to the ability of satisfying the synthetical requirement for the project quality characters in the national present related law, regulations, the technical standard, the designing documents and the project contract. It includes engineering construction quality in each stage and its corresponding work quality. [1] The fit and unfit quality of construction quality is directly related to people's life and property safety and the social public benefits. Especially after the construction is already in use, the owner, occupier and or the user usually do not possess the specialized knowledge and ability to maintain the project, therefore, it is extremely essential to establish one set of perfect architectural engineering quality maintenance system, and make clear the main body of quality guarantee and the deadline and manner of undertaking the maintenance responsibility. The article analyzes the evolution of quality maintenance system, and points out the existing legislative defects of the maintenance system in our country, such as the theoretical flaws, operational difficulty, potency conflicts, and the technological confusion. It considers the implementation of project quality insurance as an effective mode to solve this problem.

Authors: Erechtchoukova, MG; Chen, SY; Khaiter, PA
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Erechtchoukova, Marina G.; Chen, Stephen Y.; Khaiter, Peter A.
Article Title: Application of Optimization Algorithms for the Improvement of Water Quality Monitoring Systems
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: NETWORK
Abstract: The number of observations is limited by budgetary and other constraints, but the collected data must be sufficient to meet a wide range of monitoring objectives. The process of determining an efficient temporal water quality monitoring design has been formulated as an optimization problem. In the problem, a target level of acceptable uncertainty for a given indicator is specified, and the resultant solution is the smallest set of observation dates sufficient to achieve this level. Solution robustness can be improved by adding a sliding window - a maximum range in deviations of the observation dates that still provide the acceptable level of uncertainty. Application of the proposed approach to a real-world case study suggested an iterative procedure for the improvement of monitoring designs.

Article Title: A FINANCIAL OPTION PRICING MODEL BASED ON LEARNING ALGORITHMS
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT

Author Keywords: Option pricing; Black-Scholes; neural networks; hedging; prediction
Keywords Plus: HEDGING DERIVATIVE SECURITIES; NEURAL-NETWORK; VALUATION
Abstract: The Black-Scholes option pricing model provides theoretical values for the put and call options when do not pay dividends. In this work we compare these theoretical values with the obtained ones by a neural network that is applied to the option pricing market on the Ibex-35 index. Our result shows that the neural network is superior by the Black-Scholes model analyzing the kindness of the adjustment for the ME (mean of the option price errors) and RMSE (root mean square error).

Article Title: Research on Dynamical and Incentive Mechanism on Entrepreneurship of Farmers Return to Hometown
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: entrepreneurship of farmers return to hometown; motivation; bottleneck of entrepreneurship; incentive mechanism
Abstract: It is a complex system project for farmers returned hometown to establish a business. Through using relevant literature combined with the reality, this paper tries to analyze the motivation of inspiring entrepreneurship and the bottleneck in the process of establishing a business from the perspective of promoting rural economic development, and also emphasizes that the inherent qualities of entrepreneurs are fundamental to success, while the external environment plays a key role. In the meanwhile, this paper considers that, to stimulate farmers to establish a business, it is necessary to combine entrepreneurial power with needs and objectives. The author thinks that build an incentive mechanism for farmer's entrepreneurship, propose business planning and foster the mainstay of entrepreneurship is very important, if the government can provide more supporting funds, improve the matching services facilities, innovative training mechanisms and build business service platform can also help a lot.

Article Title: Project Interface Management Evaluation for Construction Enterprise
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Interface management; Performance evaluation; Balanced Scorecard; Value engineering
Abstract: Dased on the definition of interface management, the paper proposed the necessity of interface management performance evaluation, researched the implementation of the specific activities, such as process of physical, organizational and contractual aspects of project interface management, in order to find out the management activities' contribution degree to the achievement of the project, then try to identify the interface management's input and output efficiency, put forward improvement proposal to management activities and strengthen the control of interfaces. Applied Balanced Scorecard principle to summarize the performance in finacial, customers, internal business process, learning and growth, the four indicators of interface management evaluation. Methods and usage of value engineering in interface management performance evaluation was discussed, then the importance of four aspects of the Balanced Scorecard were delivered to the real significant management activities which all included in the physical, contractual and organzational interface management. At last, this method was illustrated by example analysis.

Authors: Li, Y; Wang, XM; Li, M
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li Yue; Wang Xiaoming; Li Ming
Article Title: Research of Sustainable Building Field and Dwelling House Location
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Building Field; Sustainable; Energy flow; Location
Abstract: Building came into being along with the development of human being and gradually developed. The concept of Building field can be defined as the actual existence as same as buildings, the intermediate of energy operation among buildings, between building and the environment, between building and people based on the Physical Field Theory. In order to achieve this equilibrium state, the model of dwelling house location was put forward based on dissipative structure theory and smart growth theory. According to the mass movement equation of classical field and the principle of urban planning, a mathematical model of inhabitant's energy flow was constructed. Taken the Wuhan Economic & Technological Development Zone as the example, the model of building location was also analyzed empirically from the quantitative point of view. It was found that the model of building location could be use to analyze the site selection of multi-solution and make Scientific decision.

Article Title: The Incentive Mechanism of Special Human Capital Investment in Non-Profit Knowledge Organizations
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: special human capital investment; Non-Profit Knowledge Organization (NPKO); incentive
Abstract: Special human capital is the necessary guarantee for organizations development Improvement of employees' special human capital plays a very important role in the organization's development Because It is often not effective that organization invests special human capital into employees, the investment from employees must be incented properly In this paper the concept of non-profit knowledge organization (NPKO) was defined firstly. Then the organizations' characteristic and the feature of employees and their demands were analyzed Secondly, the NPKOs employees were classified into two types basic and special The behaviour of NPKOs employees' human capital investment was discussed on this base Thirdly the influence factors on NPKOs employees' special human capital investment were analyzed through the principal-agent model. Finally the incentive mechanism of employee's special human capital of such organization was discussed

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The development of housing industrialization in our country in view of integrating concept
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: housing industrialization; integration; mass customized
Abstract: Relevant researchers of United Nation have carried out a survey of the situation of housing construction in the world. It is demonstrated after the survey that housing industrialization is the only way of the modernization of housing construction. It has been more than 50 years since the concept of housing industrialization was proposed in China early in the first five-year plan period. However, housing industrialization has not developed substantially as there are still many problems to be solved urgently, such as low labor efficiency in housing construction process, the slow pace of overall technological progress, considerable resource consumption and serious environmental pollution. The housing industrialization must adhere to an effective and sustainable development in order to promote the fundamental conversion in housing construction from extensive and quantitative to intensive and qualitative. The modernization level of housing industry is mainly reflected in the extent of the production industrialization, components commercialization and site-assembly, and in reducing or even avoiding the wet work at site as well as achieving the site assembly of housing (including the interior decoration). Thus, the development of contemporary housing industrialization should be based on the concept of integration with drawing on the experience of the new and high-tech and manufacturing industrialization, and the content involved should be more extensive and in-depth. The concept of integration includes four aspects, which are information integration, physical integration, functional integration and production process integration. The information integration, which is the key to the development of industrialization, leads to the integration of the whole industrial system. In this paper, the definition of industrialization in our country is introduced. Secondly, the relative experiences in the developing process of the housing industrialization abroad and manufacturing industrialization are discussed. Thirdly, industrialization integration system is proposed and elaborated based on the integration theory. At last, aimed at final products, the framework of the housing industrialization and some implementing proposals are suggested in order to achieve demand-oriented market including the mode changes from the piecemeal and manual operation to the integrated industrial production, from simplified pre-fabrication to mass customized.
