Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Accident Prevention in Subway Systems Based on Safety Barriers
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Accidents prevention; Barrier systems; Barrier analysis; China; Safety barrier
Abstract: Subway systems are key components in mass transportation networks, providing rapid and affordable transportation to urban communities. With the numerous benefits afforded by subway transit, a lot of cities begin to construct the subway systems in china. Periodically, safety concerns are raised, most recently in relation to the vulnerability of subways to man-made hazards. Once accident occurs, the magnitude of injuries and casualties will be overwhelmingly disastrous. To examine this issue more carefully, we conducted a structured review of the literature to identify and characterize potential accidents associated with subways. A secondary goal was to use the Hazard-Barrier-Target (H-B-T) model and Swiss-cheese model to specify safety barriers which could achieve risk reduction if implemented. The detailed mechanism by which these barriers behave has been designed in this stage. Then the definition and classification of safety barrier was analyzed. In order to prevent accidents, this paper analyzed the barrier systems in complex systems and the barrier analysis methods. This research may be helpful to urban communities, urban planners, public safety specialists, and others interested in subway safety.

Article Title: Game Analysis on the Impact of Adverse Selection to Corporate Financing
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: adverse selection; corporate financing; game; signal mechanism
Abstract: Adverse selection is a manifestation of asymmetric information and a widespread phenomenon in the market. It affects the transactions among two or more people or businesses. And corporate financing is involving the transactions both creditors and lenders, which means that adverse selection affects the behavior about corporate financing, and the effect is different under the different financing model, which can be revealed well through the game analysis. Signal theory can be used as a guide to reduce or eliminate the adverse effects which the adverse selection led corporate financing to.

Article Title: The Viability of Redeveloping Indigenous Neighborhood Areas in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Viability; Redeveloping indigenous areas; Kampong Baru; Kuala Lumpur Malaysia
Abstract: Kampong Baru is an indigenous area which in located within the central business areas in Kuala Lumpur and is generally underutilised. With fresh plan for comprehensive re-development of the village re-surfacing again lately, it is timely to conduct a study on the viability aspect of the renewal plan taking into consideration the current planning structure as provided for by the local authority which can affect the direction and thus the viability of such development plan. The study seeks to evaluate the viability concept from financial and social perspectives. In so doing, secondary data were collected from various relevant books, articles, publications and the like as well as prime data from several government departments, agencies and private entities. In addition, the ground work was conducted and questionnaires to collect primary data from the landowners in Kampong Baru and several selected key agents that are related to the nature of this study. Once collected, the data is analysed qualitatively to look at the viability from non-financial elements such as the social aspect namely the social perspective. At the end of the study, it is able to draw to several pertinent conclusions of which the most prominent is that social element that lies in the attitude, opinion and aspirations among the people of Kampong Baru play a very important role in ensuring the social viability of re-developing Kampong Baru.

Article Title: Study on CO2 Emission through the Life Cycle of Highways
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: CO2; Emission; Life Cycle; Highway
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTION; ROAD
Abstract: The energy consumption and green house gas generated from the whole life cycle of highways were studied in this paper. The life cycle of highways was divided into four stages-manufacturing of construction materials, construction, maintenance and the demolition stage. The most energy was consumed in the manufacturing stage of construction materials, which accounted for 52.49% of total energy consumption, and followed, by the maintenance stage that is 43.5%. Gas emission in each life cycle stage includes those from energy production and consumption. And gas emissions in the stages of energy consumption are much more than that in the stages of energy production. CO2 emission from the manufacturing of materials is up to 53% of total emission through the life cycle of highways, the second is that from the stage of maintains. The study shows it is effective measures for reducing environmental load in the life cycle of highway to reduce the use of construction materials and improve efficiency of engineering machinery.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Study of the Organization and Management Model of the Large-scale Projet by Local Government Investment
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: localgovernment; Investment; Large-scale project; Model of organization and management
Abstract: This paper analyzes the advantages and disadvantages of current commanding department organization and management models in large-scale project by the local government investment. Although the coordination capacity of the commanding department is strong, but the responsibility is unclear, in short of restraint mechanism and the administration agencies are overlapping, personnel setting up is bloated, management is inefficient, personnel istemperarily knocked together,professional level of staff is incompatible with the management of the project construction and easy to lead rent-seeking behavior. The headquarters is dissolved as the project is completed, and then reformed again when the government invests in new projects, as a result, organization and management of construction projects by the investment of government is repeating at a low level. In order to improve current organization and management situation of large-scale projects which are invested by local government, and adjust to the requirements of modern projects organization and management. This paper has brought forward the idea that the organization and management of large-scale projects which are invested by local government should adopt the models such as construction agent system, tender commissioned type, united management, and analyzed whose adaptability and requirements that should be satisfied with.

Article Title: Real Estate Industry Control Policy in the Process of Rapid Urbanization: A Study in Chongqing, China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urbanization; Real estate; Control policy; Chongqing China
Abstract: When a country or region was in the process of rapid urbanization, the Government would regulate the real estate industry. At present, the urbanization rate of Chongqing is far below that of the other three municipalities In the next 10 years, to promote the construction of the pilot site of rural and urban comprehensive reform, Chongqing will greatly improve the speed of urbanization. Urbanization will bring about increased demand for real estate and rapid increases in prices. It is easy to cause the phenomenon of overheated real estate development and property speculation. In the course of rapid urbanization, in order to guide the healthy development of real estate industry, the Government should set up regulated real estate market and guarantee it operation smoothly, and then regulate the real estate industry through land system, housing security system, tax system, real estate finance system and so on. In a word, the healthy developing real estate plays a great role in improving urbanization.

Article Title: Reporting Frameworks for Financial Instruments in Czech: Czech Accounting Practices versus IFRS
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Financial Instruments; Financial Reporting; IFRS (International Financial Reporting Standards); Czech Republic; Historical Costs Accounting; Fair Value Accounting
Keywords Plus: DERIVATIVES; US
Abstract: During last decades financial accounting faces the shift of financial reporting paradigms from historical costs accounting towards fair value concept. The most visible item of this change is reporting for financial instruments, particularly for financial derivatives. The research presents the particular approach of the analyzed area, namely identifying the particularities of reporting for financial instruments in correspondence to IFRS, through both theoretical description and empirical analysis, and continuously linking the findings to the actual knowledge stage and theories developed in the field. The results show a high level of similarity between Czech accounting principles and IFRS for reporting of financial instruments.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Discussing on Some Wrong Ideas about Quality Guarantee System of Construction Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction Project; Quality Guarantee; Wrong Ideas
Abstract: Quality Guarantee System of construction project is different from general industrial product. In one side, the building process is complex, there are so many enterprises should take charge for its quality, and so many factors affecting quality are dynamic changed. One the other hand, it also maybe cover defect liability leave behind the building process. Therefore, we will make some mistakes if we design Quality Guarantee System of construction project simply as common industrial products. These wrong ideas include as follows: 1. We take quality defects as quality or safety accidents which may impact the safety of main structure. 2. We believe construction enterprises should repair the defects for no charge. 3. We regard Defect Liability Period as quality liability period. 4. We believe that the longer the defect liability period the better it is. When we design the Quality Guarantee System of construction project, we should follow the following principles as conclusion: 1. Quality Guarantee System of construction project should not cover quality accident, it should be used link up with present Quality Accident management provisions. 2. Quality Guarantee System of construction project should not cover maintenance works which has expert maintenance department such as railway project, and the Defect liability Period should not be too long. 3. Quality Guarantee System of construction project should cover defect repairing works and main quality problems which may impact use function in the using process, such as Housing Construction, and the Defect liability Period should not be too short which contacted with the design standards and life cycle.

Article Title: Consolidation effects and inventory portfolios
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Inventory management; Consolidation effect; Inventory portfolio
Keywords Plus: SQUARE-ROOT LAW; CENTRALIZATION
Abstract: This paper presents a formal analysis of the consolidation effect in a wider perspective. While demonstrating that the stock saving structure depends on the interaction between the coefficient of variation of demand and the ratio between inventory ordering and holding costs, this research indicates that the ratio between the standard deviations of lead time at potential facilities is the key variable for consolidation. Sensitivity analyses are also performed to address common managerial issues, which can arise during the consolidation decision, such as the impact on total costs and the assumption of uncorrelated demands. Authors: Winghei, F; Honwan, E; Tsunip, P; Titwan, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Winghei, Franky; Honwan, Edwin; Tsunip, Patrick; Titwan, Ann
Article Title: A research framework for assessing regulatory costs of environmental laws
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Legislative costs; environmental laws; property developers
Keywords Plus: CLIMATE-CHANGE
Abstract: This paper aims to identify the major costs incurred by property developers in complying with various environmental laws. In complying with environmental laws, the interaction of the regulated parties was decisive in ensuring smooth policy implementation. Given that costs induced by regulations could be enormous, this paper also introduces an evaluation system of environmental legislative costs to be established. The development of the proposed system entailed carrying out field interviews with experienced industry practitioners. Results found that environmental laws affected property developments in various aspects, mostly in planning site layouts and obtaining government approvals. Yet the direct costs of compliance were only minor relative to the total project cost. It is the transaction costs e.g. caused by ambiguities or unclearness of statutory requirements that were substantial.

Author Full Names: Wu Min; Daniel, Ho C. W.
Article Title: Is It a Win-Win Concession Period Determination Methodology?
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Concession period; BOT; Win-Win method
Abstract: The concession period is one of the most important decision variables in arranging a successful BOT contract The BOT contracts signed in this practice experienced difficulties in truly protection of the interest of the public, and even caused economic, financial and social problems. This paper discusses a most recent paper Win-Win concession period determination methodology published in the Journal of Construction Engineering and Management. After identifying limitations in the models of that paper, this paper propose an alternative model to determine the concession period in build-operate-transfer (BOT) projects. The new model aims to fully protect interests of both the host government and the private investor. Although the author claimed that his methodology can lead to a win-win concession period, the discusser feels that his deterministic method can not protect fully either the basic interest the concessionaire or that of the host government. ROT concession period deterministic method proposed by the author. In short, in order to lead to a win-win concession period, the deterministic method proposed by the author has to be modified.

Authors: Yang, JB; Yu, WD; Chiu, CT; Cheng, ST; Lim, CC; Wu, CM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Yang Jyh-Bin; Yu Wen-Der; Chiu Chui-Ti; Cheng Shao-Tsai; Lim Chun-Chang; Wu Chih-Ming
Article Title: Lessons Learned from Implementing Performance-Based Contract to Road Maintenance Works
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Performance Based Contract; Road maintenance; Lesson Learned; Taiwan (China)
Abstract: Performance Based Contract (PBC) is a type of contract in which payments for the works are explicitly linked to the contractor successfully meeting or exceeding certain clearly defined minimum performance indicators. PBC measures the contractor's performance of works based on outcomes of the works rather than the outputs of work processes. Although some guidance and template documents are available for helping a government agency to implement PBC procurements, valuable practical cases are still required for the agency for reference. In Taiwan(China), a pilot study has been launched to develop customized PBC contract documents and to collect valuable experiences from demonstrated cases. This paper reviews the current status of implementing PBC for road maintenance globally. Lessons learned from Chinese Taiwan's experience in this area are then collected. Based on the collected lessons learned from Chinese Taiwan's cases, implementing a new contract type to replace the existing ones requires massive communications and systematic education programs for public and private participants. These valuable lessons significantly contribute to efforts of government agencies attempting to implement a PBC contract.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Rethinking The Housing Delivery Concept in Malaysia:Build Then Sell (BTS) Versus Sale Then Build(STB)
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing; Delivery System; Build Then Sell
Abstract: Malaysia has long practising the concept of Sell-then-Build in delivering new houses. The practise has been well accepted where the buyers are bound to share the responsibility to the housing development upon the signing the Sale and Purchase Agreement. The buyers ease the developers financially through progress payments as the development progress. Despite the arrangements, the buyers seldom become the victims as developers went into difficulties. The buyers are normally left waiting for the unit and the outstanding interest payment. To better protect the buyer's interest, the Build Then Sell (BTS) concept has been introduced by the government where housing developers have to complete a housing project before selling it to buyers. The concept is different from the current conventional concept of Sell Then Build (STB). This paper analyses the existing methods of housing delivery in Malaysia. It further reviews the concept of build-then sale (BTS) and efforts made by government to promote the implementation of the concept in improving the delivery of housing in Malaysia. The paper shows that incentives provided failed to encourage the developers to adopt BTS. Despite preventing housing projects from being abandoned, the developers argue the system will burden the developer financially and may result in higher selling prices. The analysis shows that many agree that it is time to ensure only financially capable developers should be in business and the matter can only be resolved if developers are required by law to adopt the build-then-sell model.

Authors: Zhang, H; Wang, XF; Zhang, YL; Zhang, HJ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, H.; Wang, X. F.; Zhang, Y. L.; Zhang, H. J.
Article Title: An Analysis for Financial Risks of the Real Estate in Dalian
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Dalian; Real estate; Financial risk
Abstract: In order to create better and more harmonious real estate financial market, ten indexes selected Influencing the financial risk of real estate in Dalian, which can reflect real estate investment, household consumption and financial environment, based on analysis of the development status and characteristics of real estate market in Dalian, facing risks in financial market in this paper. Which are fixed assets investment, real estate development investment, vacancy area of commercial housing, final completion areas of building, final completion value of building, sales of commercial housing, sale area of commercial housing, region total output value, resident's disposable income, bank loan amount; then we made quantitative analysis to the selected indexes using principal component analysis. The results showed that the main formation factors of financial risk of real estate in Dalian are economic development level, the sale situation and completion situation of commercial housing in the past few years. Moreover, the risk prevention consciousness of real estate financial industry can be improve and the sound development reference of real estate financial industry can be provided through the analysis on financial risk of real estate in Dalian.

Authors: Zhang, Z; Li, SC; Ji, Y
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, Z.; Li, S. C.; Ji, Y.
Article Title: Research on the Contribution of Core Practical Curricula to College Majors in Constructional Engineering Management in Vocational Colleges
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Vocational college; Constructional engineering management; Core practical curricula; Ability
Abstract: The objective of discipline of Constructional Engineering Management in vocational colleges is, for meeting the needs of fore fronted management in the constructional engineering, to develop the practical talents who have the essential theoretical knowledge in the discipline of Constructional Engineering Management, the skills of measurement and valuation in constructional engineering, as well as the ability to manage the engineering cost. This thesis investigates the students and professors of construction engineering management in vocational colleges in forms of questionnaires and interviews. First of all, the essential abilities of construction engineering management are clarified. Secondly, the contribution of the core practical curricula to college students' abilities is analyzed. Finally, suggestions on how to enhance students' abilities are brought forward, which include the following aspects: the designing of core practical courses should be on the premise of developing the students' ability, the integrity of the core practical courses should be highly emphasized, the core practical curricula and the training for professional certificates should be combined, and long-termed and steady internal and external training base should be accelerated.

Authors: Zhang, Z; Du, C; Pan, ZW

Article Title: Research on How the Small and Medium-sized Real Estate Companies Reinforce the Capital-chain under Macro-control of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Small and medium-sized real estate companies; Capital-chain; Macro-control; Financial channels
Abstract: In recent years, the real estate prices in some areas rise excessively, and in order to promote the healthy, steady and orderly growth of China economy. However, the global financial crisis in 2008 leads to the reduction of investment and the high volatility of the real estate market. This essay illustrates the problems of the small and medium-sized real estate companies under the global financial crisis and Macro-control, which include the lack of land handicapping the developing of new projects and the difficulties of financing. Secondly, it analyzes the financial channels and innovations under the circumstance of rapid change of macroeconomic environment, such as limited equity financing, trust financing, listing, entrusted loans, overseas capital, private equity and enterprise alliance. Finally, it gives the suggestions for the small and medium-sized real estate companies on how to resolve the financial problems in the different projects under different developing stages.

Article Title: A gam assessment of quality premia in the dry bulk time-charter market
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight rates; Quality market segmentation; Bulk shipping; Panamax; Time-charters; GAMs
Keywords Plus: ECONOMETRIC-MODEL; FREIGHT; SECTOR; RISK
Abstract: This paper revisits the hypothesis of a quality segmented charter market using dry bulk-Panamax time-charter rates from the shipping boom period of 2003-2007. Through generalized additive models (GAMs) the authors assess whether increasing awareness and regulation over time has brought about a change in charterers' perceptions. The results suggest that freight differentiation has become visible in booming markets with high freight rates. Controlling for contract specific effects such as place of delivery, charter length and number of days forward to delivery, as well as for vessel size and consumption, the paper quantifies quality related differences in physical dry bulk charter rates. Article Title: A supplement to A generalized algebraic model for optimizing inventory decisions in a centralized or decentralized multi-stage multi-firm supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Production-inventory; Lot streaming; Inspection; Complete backorders; The complete/perfect squares method
Keywords Plus: ECONOMIC LOT-SIZE; COMPLETE SQUARES METHOD; SYSTEM; DERIVATIVES; ANALYZE; EPQ; EOQ
Abstract: In this supplement, a number of integrated models under the integer multiplier coordination mechanism is generalized by allowing complete backorders penalized by not only linear but also fixed costs for some/all retailers. The optimal solution to such a three-stage generalized model is algebraically derived, from which optimal expressions for some well-known models are deduced. In addition, an expression for sharing the coordination benefits is modified, and a numerical example for illustrative purposes is presented. A ready future research work involving extension of the generalized model is suggested to conclude the supplement. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Peng, P; Snyder, LV; Lim, A; Liu, ZL
Author Full Names: Peng, Peng; Snyder, Lawrence V.; Lim, Andrew; Liu, Zuli
Article Title: Reliable logistics networks design with facility disruptions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Reliable network design; Facility disruptions; p-Robustness; Metaheuristics
Keywords Plus: HYBRID GENETIC ALGORITHM; LOCATION DESIGN; MODELS; RISK
Abstract: This paper studies a strategic supply chain management problem to design reliable networks that perform as well as possible under normal conditions, while also performing relatively well when disruptions strike. We present a mixed-integer programming model whose objective is to minimize the nominal cost (the cost when no disruptions occur) while reducing the disruption risk using the p-robustness criterion (which bounds the cost in disruption scenarios). We propose a hybrid metaheuristic algorithm that is based on genetic algorithms, local improvement, and the shortest augmenting path method. Numerical tests show that the heuristic greatly outperforms CPLEX in terms of solution speed, while still delivering excellent solution quality. We demonstrate the tradeoff between the nominal cost and system reliability, showing that substantial improvements in reliability are often possible with minimal increases in cost. We also show that our model produces solutions that are less conservative than those generated by common robustness measures. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Bargaining framework for competitive green supply chains under governmental financial intervention
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Green supply chain cooperation; Bilateral negotiation; Nash bargaining game; Government's financial instruments
Keywords Plus: NETWORK EQUILIBRIUM; MANAGEMENT; MODEL; RENEGOTIATION; COORDINATION; FLEXIBILITY; INVESTMENT; CONTRACTS; DISPOSAL; DESIGN
Abstract: This work investigates the problem of negotiations between producers and reverse-logistics (RL) suppliers for cooperative agreements under government intervention. Utilizing the asymmetrical Nash bargaining game with uncertainties, this work seeks equilibrium negotiation solutions to player agendas. Analytical results indicate that financial intervention by a government generates a significant effect on the relative bargaining power of green supply chain members in negotiations. Over intervention by a government may result in adverse effects on chain members' profits and social welfare. Furthermore, a bargaining framework underlying the duopoly-oligopoly context may contribute to a negotiation outcome most profitable for green supply chain members. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhang, GM; Smilowitz, K; Erera, A
Author Full Names: Zhang, Guangming; Smilowitz, Karen; Erera, Alan
Article Title: Dynamic planning for urban drayage operations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Drayage operations; Dynamic vehicle routing problems
Keywords Plus: VEHICLE-ROUTING PROBLEM; TIME WINDOWS; PROGRAMMING ALGORITHM; SCHEDULING PROBLEMS; STOCHASTIC DEMANDS; COLUMN GENERATION; FLEET MANAGEMENT; DELIVERY PROBLEM; TRAVEL-TIMES; OPTIMIZATION
Abstract: This paper develops approaches for incorporating informational and operational dynamics within models for intermodal drayage operations with flexible tasks. Tasks with flexible origins or destinations create an important complexity. We develop models to minimize the cost of drayage moves when flexibility exists. The solution approach generates plans at several decision epochs during the day. The optimization problem at each epoch is a complex multistage stochastic optimization problem: we find good solutions using a two-stage approximation. We show that with such a model, a drayage firm can find high-quality plans even when many tasks are not known initially. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A scenario-based dynamic programming model for multi-period liner ship fleet planning
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Multi-period liner ship fleet planning; Scenario decision tree; Dynamic programming model; Integer linear programming model
Abstract: This paper proposes a more realistic multi-period liner ship fleet planning problem for liner container shipping company than has been studied in previous literature. The proposed problem is formulated as a scenario-based dynamic programming model consisting of a number of integer linear programming formulations for each single planning period, and the model can be solved efficiently by a shortest path algorithm on an acyclic network. A numerical example is carried out to illustrate the applicability of the proposed model and solution method. The numerical results show that chartering in ships may not always be a better policy for a long-term planning horizon though it is much cheaper than buying ships in the short-term. Purchasing ships seems to be a more profitable investment in the long run. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Jou, RC; Hensher, DA; Hsu, TL
Author Full Names: Jou, Rong-Chang; Hensher, David A.; Hsu, Tzu-Lan
Article Title: Airport ground access mode choice behavior after the introduction of a new mode: A case study of Taoyuan International Airport in Taiwan
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Access mode choice; Airport transit system; Mixed logit model; Taiwan survey
Keywords Plus: FRANCISCO BAY AREA; REGION
Abstract: To improve airport ground access at Taoyouan International Airport (TIA) in Taiwan, the government of Taiwan is constructing a mass rapid transit system (TIA MRT) to connect the airport and important traffic hubs such as the Taipei train station and the Taoyouan High Speed Rail station. Using revealed and stated preference data, we investigate the airport ground access mode choice behavior of air passengers who are traveling overseas from Taiwan. A mixed logit model is estimated to identify the preferences of air passengers for the new mode. The results indicate that while out-of-vehicle travel time and in-vehicle travel time are two important factors in affecting outbound travelers' choice of airport access mode, the amount of overall time-savings and the user-friendly nature of the modal offers are also crucial attributes. We show the extent to which travel time improvements associated with public transportation reduces the market share of private transportation and taxi. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Air-cargo capacity allocation for multiple freight forwarders
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Air-cargo; Capacity management; Stochastic model applications
Abstract: We consider a single air-cargo carrier, which wants to allocate cargo capacity to multiple forwarders before a booking horizon starts. A contribution that the carrier earns from each forwarder is based on the actual allotment usage at the end of the horizon. The airline's problem is to choose the allotments that maximize the expected total contribution. We derive a probability distribution of the actual usage by using a discrete Markov chain and solve the problem by using a dynamic programming method. Two heuristics for a large-scale allocation problem are also proposed, and their performances are tested via numerical experiments. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Li, XY; Tian, P; Aneja, YP
Author Full Names: Li, Xiangyong; Tian, Peng; Aneja, Y. P.
Article Title: An adaptive memory programming metaheuristic for the heterogeneous fixed fleet vehicle routing problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Vehicle routing; Heterogeneous fixed fleet; Adaptive memory programming; Path relinking; Metaheuristic
Keywords Plus: PATH-RELINKING; GRASP; SEARCH
Abstract: This paper studies the heterogeneous fixed fleet vehicle routing problem (HFFVRP), in which the fleet is composed of a fixed number of vehicles with different capacities, fixed costs, and variable costs. Given the fleet composition, the HFFVRP is to determine a vehicle scheduling strategy with the objective of minimizing the total transportation cost. We propose a multistart adaptive memory programming (MAMP) and path relinking algorithm to solve this problem. Through the search memory. MAMP at each iteration constructs multiple provisional solutions, which are further improved by a modified tabu search. As an intensification strategy, path relinking is integrated to enhance the performance of MAMP. We conduct a series of experiments to evaluate and demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The broader effects of transportation infrastructure: Spatial econometrics and productivity approaches
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation infrastructure; Spillovers; Spatial econometrics
Keywords Plus: PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE; MANUFACTURING-INDUSTRIES; SPILLOVERS; PERFORMANCE; MODEL
Abstract: The importance of broader economic effects of transportation infrastructure has recently become apparent. Broader refers to impacts beyond the geographic boundaries within which the infrastructure investments are undertaken. Approaches to estimate broader impacts in production and cost function models are evaluated. A contribution of this paper is the empirical demonstration with a cross-section of US states' manufacturing data that ignoring broader effects of a spatially lagged dependent variable can lead to mis-statements of the overall productive impacts of public infrastructure. These inaccuracies can arise because of missing indirect effects and from specification bias that may directly impact the infrastructure elasticity. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Latent class models of international air carrier choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airline; Latent class; Logit; Stated preference; Service quality
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE SERVICE QUALITY; PREFERENCE HETEROGENEITY; MARKET-SEGMENTATION; VARIABLES; DIFFERENTIATION; COMPETITION
Abstract: This paper uses a market segmentation approach to identify airline passengers' potential segments and preferences toward international air carriers. The modeling approaches consist of the stated preference method and the latent class model. The stated choice experiments were designed based on service attributes in the international airline choice context. Empirical data was collected from airline passengers who have flown from Taipei to Tokyo or from Taipei to Hong Kong. The latent class model accommodating preference heterogeneity outperforms the multinomial logit model as indication of a better approach to analyze airline choice behavior. The latent class model with individual socioeconomic and trip characteristics in segment membership functions also improved model fit relative to the corresponding latent class model without individual characteristics. The values of willingness to pay for service attribute improvements vary across international air routes and segments. Passengers are willing to pay more for better service quality. In order to develop effective marketing and operational strategies for the international air travel market, this study highlights the importance of exploring airline choice behaviors by routes and segments. Article Title: Airport capacity and congestion pricing with both aeronautical and commercial operations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airport charges; Capacity investment financing; Commercial revenue; Regulation Market power
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE INDUSTRY; MARKET POWER; INTERNALIZATION; EXPANSION; OLIGOPOLY; BEHAVIOR; CARRIERS; DELAYS
Abstract: In this paper, we study airport decisions on pricing and capacity investment with both aeronautical and concession operations. In addition, the airport under consideration is serving air carriers who have market power. We find that a profit-maximizing airport would over-invest in capacity in the sense that the marginal (social) benefit of capacity is smaller than the marginal (social) cost. This tendency of overinvestment still holds when the private airport is under the regulatory constraint of cost recovery in its aeronautical operation (the dual-till regulation). We also find that the capacity investment by a public airport will be socially efficient in the sense that the marginal benefit of capacity is equal to the marginal cost of capacity. However, somewhat surprisingly, the capacity investment of the public airport will be inefficient if it is under regulatory constraints. Specifically, the airport will also over-invest in capacity, whether it is under a single-till regulation or a dual-till regulation. Finally, it is noteworthy that the inefficiency in airport investment is driven by the interaction between the airport and the carriers who have market power. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The value of reliability
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Welfare; Random duration; Time; Scheduling; Reliability; Variability
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL-TIME; EVOLUTIONARY IMPLEMENTATION; BOTTLENECK MODEL; CONGESTION; DEMAND; QUALITY; VALUATION; CAPACITY; RISK
Abstract: We derive the value of reliability in the scheduling of an activity of random duration, such as travel under congested conditions. Using a simple formulation of scheduling utility, we show that the maximal expected utility is linear in the mean and standard deviation of trip duration, regardless of the form of the standardised distribution of trip durations. This insight provides a unification of the scheduling model and models that include the standard deviation of trip duration directly as an argument in the cost or utility function. The results generalise approximately to the case where the mean and standard deviation of trip duration depend on the starting time An empirical illustration is provided. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Lee, Byung Kwon; Kim, Kap Hwan
Article Title: Optimizing the block size in container yards
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Design of storage blocks; Yard cranes; Cycle times; Container terminals; Transportation
Keywords Plus: AUTOMATED STORAGE; SYSTEMS; TIME; PERFORMANCE; DESIGN; MODELS; SPACE
Abstract: A block is the basic unit of storage space in container terminals. This study proposes two methods for optimizing the block size, by considering the throughput requirements of yard cranes (YCs) and the block storage requirements. To estimate the YC performance, cycle-time models of various handling operations of YCs are analytically derived. Two types of container yards are examined: those with blocks that are laid out parallel to the quay and those laid out vertical to the quay. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Tourmaline Fiber Experimental Study of Indoor Air Purification
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: tourmaline; formaldehyde; indoor air quality; filtration materials; adsorption materials; anion
Abstract: To explore the tourmaline fiber potential to improve indoor air quality characteristics, the paper fibers on the adsorption of formaldehyde and tourmaline tourmaline negative ion fiber were studied. The results showed that tourmaline fibers of low concentrations of formaldehyde in air has good adsorption properties, including tourmaline fiber degradation rate of 76% formaldehyde, tourmaline anion fiber over the launch of up to 5000/cm3. The mechanism of the related theoretical analysis and experimental validation for the development of tourmaline fiber filter and adsorption material of this efficient use of tourmaline fiber to improve indoor air quality of laying a foundation.

Author Full Names: Viti, Francesco; van Zuylen, Henk J.
Article Title: Probabilistic models for queues at fixed control signals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Queuing theory; Probability theory and Markov Chains; Fixed controls; Spillback
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC SIGNALS; DISTRIBUTIONS; WAVES; DELAY; TIME
Abstract: The estimation of queues at signalized intersections is a classical problem in transportation engineering and operations research. Nevertheless. a general theory able to explain how queues form and cause delays to the drivers is still missing. Typically, queue dynamics are modelled as deterministic, causal phenomena, and under rather limiting assumptions: however, especially in urban networks, these are far from being deterministic or certain. This paper presents a new probabilistic queuing model that can explain the dynamic and stochastic behaviour of queues at fixed controlled signals. The probabilistic approach allows one to capture the temporal behaviour of queues, and to measure the uncertainty of a queue state prediction by computing the evolution of its probability in time, assumed any temporal distribution of the arrivals. This can be fundamental information in. e.g., travel time estimation, network reliability, design and planning of urban areas, and to estimate complex effects that can be observed in congested networks such as spillback or gridlock. Comparison with microscopic simulation shows very good consistency both under the assumption of stationary and non-stationary arrival distributions. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yang, H; Xu, W; Heydecker, B
Author Full Names: Yang, Hai; Xu, Wei; Heydecker, Benjamin
Article Title: Bounding the efficiency of road pricing
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Nash game; Inefficiency; Congestion pricing; Traffic equilibria
Keywords Plus: NONATOMIC CONGESTION GAMES; NETWORK EQUILIBRIUM; COST; ANARCHY; DEMAND; INEFFICIENCY; ELASTICITIES
Abstract: This paper deals with the following question associated with congestion pricing in a general network with either fixed or elastic travel demand: what is the maximum efficiency loss of a general second-best pricing scheme due to inexact marginal-cost pricing in comparison with the first-best pricing or system optimum case? A formal answer to this question is provided by establishing an inefficiency bound associated with a given road pricing scheme. An application of the methods is provided for the practical trial-and-error implementation of marginal-cost pricing with unknown demand functions. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Alumur, SA; Kara, BY; Karasan, OE
Author Full Names: Alumur, Sibel A.; Kara, Bahar Y.; Karasan, Oya E.
Article Title: The design of single allocation incomplete hub networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Hub location; Network design; p-hub median; Hub covering; p-hub center
Keywords Plus: ARC LOCATION-PROBLEMS; FORMULATIONS; ALGORITHMS; MODEL
Abstract: The hub location problem deals with finding the location of hub facilities and allocating the demand nodes to these hub facilities so as to effectively route the demand between any origin-destination pair. In the extensive literature on this challenging network design problem, it has widely been assumed that the subgraph induced by the hub nodes is complete. Relaxation of this basic assumption constitutes the starting point of the present work. In this study, we provide a uniform modeling treatment to all the single allocation variants of the existing hub location problems, under the incomplete hub network design. No network structure other than connectivity is imposed on the induced hub network. Within this context, the single allocation incomplete p-hub median, the incomplete hub location with fixed costs, the incomplete hub covering, and the incomplete p-hub center network design problems are defined, and efficient mathematical formulations for these problems with O(n(3)) variables are introduced. Computational analyses with these formulations are presented on the various instances of the CAB data set and on the Turkish network. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Welki, Andrew M.; Zlatoper, Thomas J.
Article Title: How highway safety regulations and enforcement activities affect subcategories of motor vehicle fatalities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Enforcement activities; Highway fatality subcategories; Seemingly unrelated regression
Abstract: This paper uses seemingly unrelated regression analysis and annual Ohio data for 1975-2000 to estimate a model for six different types of motor vehicle fatalities: car occupants, light truck occupants, large truck occupants, motorcyclists, pedestrians, and pedalcyclists. It finds that while certain government highway safety regulations (e.g., speed limits) and enforcement activities (e.g., drunk driving arrests) have life-saving effects, not all groups are beneficiaries. Article Title: Decision support for truckload carriers in one-shot combinatorial auctions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Combinatorial auctions; Bidding; Truckload carriers; Economies of scope; Minimum cost flow problem; Column generation
Keywords Plus: GENERATION; ALGORITHMS; COSTS
Abstract: Combinatorial auctions have become popular for shippers to secure transportation services. It is, however, very difficult for truck carriers to solve bid generation and evaluation problems in combinatorial auctions. The objective of this paper is to develop a bidding advisor to help truckload (TL) carriers overcome such challenging problems in one-shot combinatorial auctions. The proposed advisor integrates the load information in e-marketplaces with carriers' current fleet management plans, and then chooses the desirable load bundles. In this paper, a TL carrier's bid generation and evaluation problems in one-shot combinatorial auctions are formulated as a synergetic minimum cost flow problem by estimating the average synergy values between loads through the proposed approximation. The conventional solution approaches for solving the minimum cost flow problems cannot be applied to the synergetic network flow problem. Thus, we propose a column generation approach to solve this specific network flow problem. The main contribution of this paper is that a TL carrier adopting the proposed advisor can easily determine the desirable bid packages without evaluating all 2(n) - 1 possible bundles of loads, where n is the number of loads. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Kao, LH; Stewart, M; Lee, KH
Author Full Names: Kao, Li-Hua; Stewart, Margaret; Lee, Kai-Hui
Article Title: Using structural equation modeling to predict cabin safety outcomes among Taiwanese airlines
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 11th World Congress of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Flight attendant; Cabin crew; Cabin safety; Safety culture; Safety climate; Structural equation modelling
Keywords Plus: OFFSHORE ENVIRONMENTS; CLIMATE; CULTURE; PERFORMANCE; BEHAVIOR; JOBS
Abstract: The aim of the study was to examine the relationship between safety culture (e.g. management commitment, various work environment factors) and flight attendant safety performance (e.g. rule compliance, crewmember involvement and participation, accident investigation, injury incidence). A comprehensive questionnaire was derived from the Loughborough University Safety Climate Assessment Toolkit and several similar surveys. Additional items were designed for an airline cabin work environment. The questionnaire was distributed to four major Taiwanese national airlines and achieved a valid response rate of 84.65%. Structural equation modeling was used to test a hypothesized model concerning safety culture and cabin safety performance. A variety of fit indices confirmed the overall model fit but not all of the paths in the model were statistically significant. The findings show that safety culture was a predictor of cabin safety outcomes. The results indicated that high management commitment was significantly related to high crewmember participation, and that safe cabin work environment was significantly related to crew-member's individual behavior. However, the findings showed no relationship between management commitment and injury incidence which means injury incidence might not be predicted by management commitment. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Markov models for Bayesian analysis about transit route origin-destination matrices
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bayesian analysis; Markov model; Maximum entropy method; O-D matrix; Transit route
Keywords Plus: INFERENCE; ALGORITHM; COUNTS
Abstract: The key factor that complicates statistical inference for an origin-destination (O-D) matrix is that the problem per se is usually highly underspecified, with a large number of unknown entries but many fewer observations available for the estimation. in this paper, we investigate statistical inference for a transit route O-D matrix using on-off counts of passengers. A Markov chain model is incorporated to capture the relationships between the entries of the transit route matrix, and to reduce the total number of unknown parameters. A Bayesian analysis is then performed to draw inference about the unknown parameters of the Markov model. Unlike many existing methods that rely on iterative algorithms, this new approach leads to a closed-form solution and is computationally more efficient. The relationship between this method and the maximum entropy approach is also investigated. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: Marketing research has an area of extremely wide coverage; we could say that there is no area of marketing business which is not subject to investigation and research, especially when referring to the broadcasting market in general and the television in particular and to component institutions. The omnipresence of mass media is a phenomenon typical of today's civilization and is one of the major components of economic and social interests which gather a very large number of people. Given the vast human and material potential that it uses for its development and the beneficial effects on individuals, mass media, especially television, acts as a factor stimulating the spread of information and knowledge and it increases the quality of life.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Risk Allocation of Public-Private Partnerships in Public Stadium Construction Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public-private partnership (PPP); Public stadium; Risk allocation; Game theory; TOPSIS method
Abstract: As a form of cooperation relationship established by government and private sectors in an infrastructure project, public-private partnership (PPP) promotes both parties to take full advantages of themselves so as to realize a win-win result. Recent years have seen a marked increase in cooperation between the public and private sectors for the development and operation of infrastructure for a wide range of economic activities. In sports field, public stadium belongs to quasi-public goods with the nature of public welfare and externality, which means it is appropriate to be invested in PPP mode. PPP projects are usually subjected to more risks than other traditional construction activities because of their complexity. This paper deals with the reasonable risk allocation of PPP in public stadium construction projects, which is a key factor of successful PPP application. The process of risk allocation between public and private sectors in public stadium construction projects is designed. Game theory and Tops's method based on entropy weight are used to evaluate the risk taking willingness as well as ability of each party in PPP projects. By quantitative analysis, a risk allocation framework is presented to confirm the risk taker in various conditions which would enhance the project's performance. Some suggestions on risk allocation of PPP in public stadium construction projects are also put forward.

In this paper we consider some of the advantages and drawbacks of this time series multiresolution analysis technique for the purpose of obtaining simultaneous time and frequency information for use in determining the periodicity and the modelling of the demand for water and energy.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Guo, N.; Xiao, Y. J.; Yu, S. W.
Article Title: Using project portfolio management tools and techniques to improve coal enterprise's competitive strength
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project Portfolio; Risk; Uncertainty; PPM
Abstract: Coal is a kind of very important energy, and it had played a very important role in the development of Chinese economy, especially after 1980s. Coal enterprises gained a very precious opportunity to develop. Unfortunately, there are still many problems in these enterprises. One of these problems is the dated project management methods. Because of the burst of the global financial crisis, coal enterprises have to face more and more severe situation. Traditional coal enterprises just focus on a single or few aspects, e.g. coal mining. On condition that coal price drops a lot, these enterprises will suffer more. Project portfolio management (PPM) gradually earns more attentions these years, and it has been widely used in a large number of industries. In this paper, the authors try to discuss that use some PPM techniques to improve coal enterprise's competitive strength. For the first, the authors briefly review the history and application of PPM in other industries. And then they introduce some PPM techniques to cope with problems in coal enterprise. At last, they propose some tips for coal enterprises in applying PPM.

Article Title: Non-Profit Organizations: the Guarantee to Implement Corporate Social Responsibility
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: non-profit organizations; corporate social responsibility; promotion; soft power
Abstract: The rise of the Non-profit Organizations and the flourishing development of Corporate Social Responsibility are two remarkable phenomena of the 20th century in the world. Though their historical background and social influence have nothing in common with each other, the Non-profit Organizations as a significant strength in Corporate Social Responsibility movement, have fulfilled special important function for the development of Corporate Social Responsibility. On the basis of detailed expatiation of the forming and connotation of Corporate Social Responsibility, this paper is to explore the impetus of the Non-profit Organizations to the development of Corporate Social Responsibility. After theoretical analysis and quotation of international experiences, authors think that Corporate Social Responsibility has not come into being from self-consciousness of an entrepreneur completely. The civil society and various social movements promote Corporate Social Responsibility to develop fast, and Non-Profit Organizations play an irreplaceable role in this field.

Article Title: Study of Guangzhou house price bubble-Based on state-space model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: housing price; income; bubble; the state-space model
Keywords Plus: STOCK-MARKET; HONG-KONG
Abstract: Previous literature has explored Guangzhou's real estate market bubble problem, by using the perspective of rent receipts to measure the fundamental housing value. This article attempts to apply the state space model as the theoretical foundation, and use Kalman filter as a recursive way of computing method, together with a housing price income model constructed based on the housing price - in Guang-zhou, to track bubble phenomenon. Since there is high proportion of owner-occupied property in Guangzhou; and that the household income is considered a key factor affecting housing price level, this article is from the perspective of household income, by the present asset market model, it sets up housing price model that analysis of the bubble phenomenon, and uses the state-space model that can be estimated characteristics by unobservable variables. The article estimates the price bubble and analyzes the size of the bubble at different times. The housing price in Guangzhou from January 2004 to December 2008 is studied. The results concluded that the housing market bubble peaked in October 2007 at around 43% of the market housing price .........

Article Title: The Essence of the Firm is a Kind of Contract Aggregation with the Core of Last Responsibility Undertaker
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: firm; responsibility; employment; capital rent; profit
Abstract: Employment is a kind of contract relations which the employer gains the usufruct of the capital by defraying capital rent. Capital rent is the right to alienate capital usufruct while profit is the right to take on the payment of capital rent. Corporation is the artificial person who is gaining right by gathering responsibilities and is also the contract aggregation with the core of last responsibility undertaker. The reason why corporation exists is not the transaction costs, however, its persistent existence depends on whether it can take on the corresponding responsibility after gaining right. Money capital and human capital can both employ or be employed by each other, and even an outsider offering no capital can employ capital and labor simultaneously.

Article Title: Organizational Governance Structures in Construction Joint Ventures: A Case Study of China's Three Gorges Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Governance structure; Case study; Three Gorges Project; Joint ventures
Keywords Plus: RESOURCE-BASED VIEW; MANAGEMENT; FIRM; DIVERSIFICATION; ECONOMICS; INDUSTRY
Abstract: The Three Gorges Project (TGP) is the largest hydropower project in China, comprising dams, power plants, and navigation facilities. The total investment and project duration are estimated to be $24.3 billion US dollars and 17 years, respectively. The empirical study is a case study of the 378 JV, one of the major construction joint ventures in the Three Gorges Project. The study of the 378 JV of Three Gorges Project was conducted to evaluate the proposed model. Through the study of the rarely observed evolution of governance structures, the evidence from this case study again replicates the linkage between the hypothesized determinants and governance structure choices and reasonably supports the proposed model. The study shows that cultural difference, trust and motivation for learning have significance impacts on the choices of governance structures by the fact that the unexpected ex-ante status of these model variables will cause the change of governance structure.

Authors: Susilawati, C; Wong, J; Chikolwa, B
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Susilawati, Connie; Wong, Johnny; Chikolwa, Bwembya
Article Title: An Evaluation of Viability of Public Private Partnerships in Social Infrastructure Procurement Projects in Queensland, Australia
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: public private partnership; Australia; social infrastructure
Abstract: Public private partnerships (PPP) have been widely used as a method for public infrastructure project delivery not only locally and internationally, however the adoption of PPPs in social infrastructure procurement has still been very limited. The objective of this paper is to investigate the potential of implementation of current PPP framework in social affordable housing projects in South East Queensland. Data were collected from 22 interviewees with rich experiences in the industry. The findings of this study show that affordable housing investment have been considered by the industry practitioners as a risky business in comparison to other private rental housing investment. The main determents of the adoption of PPPs in social infrastructure project are the tenant-related factors, such as the inability of paying rent and the inability of caring the property. The study also suggests the importance of seeking strategic partnership with community-based organisation that has experiences in managing similar tenants' profiles. Current PPP guideline is also viewed as inappropriate for the affordable housing projects, but the principle of VFM framework and risk allocation in PPPs still be applied to the affordable housing projects. This study helps to understand the viability of PPP in social housing procurement projects, and point out the importance of developing guideline for multi-stakeholder partnership and the expansion of the current VFM and PPPs guidelines.

Article Title: A Study on Organization Structure Innovating and Improving in Real Estate Enterprises under the Circumstances of Global Financial Crisis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Organization structure; Innovation of enterprise; Real estate enterprises; Financial crisis; Environment factors
Abstract: This paper studies the improving and innovating of organization structure in real estate enterprises. The paper offers transformation outlines and an implement strategy that helps the enterprises transform their organization structure effectively and confirms the innovation has the positive effect under the serious circumstances of the global financial crisis. From the angle of enterprise transformation, domestic real estate enterprises shall continuously explore and implement their organizing structure system, in which local market condition, new trends of transformation and enterprises' development stages must be overall considered. Before implementing enterprise organizing structure transformation, do research on external environment factors of enterprise. In this paper, we offer five suggestions on how to confirm key points of implementation and carry out the solution. By analyzing organizing structure problems In a dynamic view, we can conclude that establishing scientific and rational collaborative working system via organizing creative activities, which fits enterprise development, will improve enterprises' competitiveness in a difficult period. It's an important core ability of real estate enterprise that their organizing structures can be changed timely and effectively.

Article Title: The Protection and Inheritance of Historical Culture in Town Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: town construction; historic culture; protection; inheritance
Abstract: As the origin of cities, historical towns were formed in a particular period and circumstance. With the development of the towns, a substantial local culture has been well preserved in buildings and city life, characterizing the physical appearance and human spirit of the city, which distinguish one from another. Furthermore, the considerable historical information carried by historical towns has become the culture capital of urban competitiveness, which makes preservation and renovation of historical towns a hot spot in the new round of urban construction. Taking historic town of Shipu for example, this paper traces back to town culture, and analyzes the manifestation of fishing culture, coastal defense, maritime trade culture and fire fight culture in the process of the development of the town, and further puts forward the significance and functions of the culture, as a kind of capital, in town construction and development.

Article Title: Strategic Partnership of General Engineering Contract Enterprises and Its Evaluation Model Based on RBF Neural Network
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Partnership; Radial Basic Function Neural Network; General Engineering Contract Enterprise
Abstract: The origins of partnering, as a construction management concept, are relatively recent. Partnering is more than a building procurement technique. Partnering in the construction industry emerged in the late 1980s. The use of partnering in the construction industry has many examples of success. In the present era, extensive examples of construction industry can be found in the Unites States, New Zealand, Australia and the UK. For general contracting enterprises' low competitiveness and low-effectiveness in our country, the strategic partnership is introduced into the general contracting business mode. In order to select strategic partners successfully and improve the implementation effectiveness of the above business mode, strategic partnering process and framework for strategic partnering evaluation is presented respectively. And then a comprehensive evaluation model of strategic partnering for general engineering contract enterprise is proposed based on Radial Basic Function Neural Network.

Article Title: Assessment of Land Ecological Security Based on BP Neural Network: An Empirical Study on Zhejiang Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land ecological security; BP neural network; Value assessment; Zhejiang province
Abstract: Land ecology is influenced by the land use. The land ecological security is very important to preserve the sustainability of land use, but the actuality of land ecological security is too bad at present. In order to improve land ecology, it is necessary to assess the land ecological security accurately. Firstly, indicator system for assessment of land ecological security is put forward in this paper, and then an assessment model for land ecological security based on BP neural network is established. Secondly, the analysis date for Zhejiang province is put into BP neural network of the assessment model, and the empirical study on Zhejiang province is done. At last, the values of land ecological security in 11 cities are acquired, and the characteristic of land ecological security in Zhejiang province is analyzed. The results indicate that some measures should be taken to ensure the land ecology in security.

Author Full Names: Zhao, X. B.; Hua, J. G.
Article Title: Research on the Life Cycle Design Thinking for Public Construction Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public Construction Projects; Life Cycle Design; Implementation
Abstract: By and large, public construction projects require a host of investment and social resources, have long operation phases and a great number of users, and exert great influence on the environment, society and economy as well. Hence, in the design phase, it is necessary to pay great attention to the problems which are likely to take place in the construction and operation phases of public construction projects. Based on the review of the research on the Life Cycle Design for products in manufacturing industry, and taking the characteristics of public construction projects into consideration, this paper proposes the conception of the Life Cycle Design thinking for public construction projects, and enumerates nine strategies for the Life Cycle Design thinking, including design for reliability and safety, design for maintenance, design for human, and design for constructability, design for scale-enlarging, design for energy-efficiency, design for recycling, design for emergency and design for life cycle costs optimization. Moreover, this paper discusses the symbol of the final implementation of the Life Cycle Design thinking for public construction projects, and brings forward a process framework to carry out the Life Cycle Design thinking and fulfill the overall objective of the project. This process framework consists of the correspondence between the nine strategies above and the Objective Breakdown Structure of the construction project, the special requirements for the designers, the tendering strategies, the adoption of the constructive suggestion from constructors and even potential users, the effective and efficient communication, and the normal operation of public construction projects as well.
