Article Title: A Study of the Relationship Between Housing Security and Housing Marketization
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: housing security and housing marketization; key issues; government's responsibility; legislation
Abstract: With the basic idea of solving housing problems by the joint development of housing security and housing marketization, this paper analyzes the relationship between housing security and housing marketization from the evolution of the model of housing supply only to find that they can be substituted and are complementary rather than mutually exclusive. Without housing security, there is no stable order in the real estate market. Without housing marketization, no satisfaction of various housing needs can be met. Since the mutual development of them is not uncoordinated in theory, this paper explores the key issues of their coordinated development from security range, high prices in the housing market, the government's responsibilities in security and market, and legislation of housing and so on.

Authors: Zhou, M; Bo, WB; Qian, LW
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhou Ming; Bo Weibiao; Qian Lianwei
Article Title: Study on the Application of BIM Technology in Green Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green project; BIM technology; Green tools
Abstract: As the development of society, we now pay more attention to sustainability in all walks of our daily life. And green project is the main embodiment of application of the sustainable development strategy in construction industry, which generally includes green building design and green construction. But as an emerging thing, there are so many aspects in practice needed to be explored and improved continually. BIM technology is a pertinent tool for which there are significant opportunities to address issues related to sustainability. In this paper, we briefly present the current situation of green project in China and the application of BIM technology at home and abroad. And based this information above, aiming at the fact that traditional green building design and construction methods cannot meet current needs, this paper puts forward a new design and construction approach - integrating BIM technology with green tools(such as LEED, energy analysis software, performance analysis software)to carry out green building design, green construction and even green operation. With the help of this new approach, we can ensure the performance to achieve sufficient green formats points toward certification effectively, avoid many costly redesigns late in the schedule, and redesign buildings to be more energy efficient

Authors: Ziep, T; Wohlgemuth, V; Emmenegger, MF; Reinhard, J; Zah, R
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Ziep, Tobias; Wohlgemuth, Volker; Emmenegger, Mireille Faist; Reinhard, Juergen; Zah, Rainer
Article Title: SQCB - Sustainability Quick Check Tool for Biofuels
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Life Cycle Impact Assessment; fuels from biomass; web-based calculation model; Drupal
Abstract: The paper deals with the conception and technical development of the Sustainability Quick Check for Biofuels (hereafter SQCB). The SQCB is a tool to evaluate the impacts of biofuel production on environment. Against the background of mineral oil tax remission in Switzerland providers or dealers of energy crops or biofuels in developing countries can do a legally non-binding check if their products qualify for this remission. For this purpose a web-based calculation model is developed that does a lightweight material flow analysis. The data needed for the evaluation process consists of two parts. The first part is data provided by the user in the web-based questionnaire. The second part contains LCI material and energy flow data and impact factors from the ecoinvent database and other data from literature and scientific studies. The LCI data is imported into the database via an XML interface. To ensure easy and worldwide accessibility the SQCB is implemented as a web-based, database-assisted application. It was developed as a module for the web content management system Drupal. The evaluation process covers the whole lifecycle of the biofuel including Cultivation, further processing, transport and usage. The user has to provide information about the crop type, the country, the climatic circumstances, the used fertilizers and pesticides and energy and material data for further processing. In the first calculation step the emissions and material flows for the given scenario are calculated for each phase. In the next step these amounts are rated for different methodologies. The results of each phase are cumulated, related to reference data and visualized.

Article Title: State-dependent congestion pricing with reference-dependent preferences
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion pricing; State-dependent pricing; Reference-dependent preferences
Keywords Plus: EXPECTED-UTILITY; TRAVEL-TIME; DISAPPOINTMENT AVERSION; REFERENCE POINTS; PROSPECT-THEORY; RISK-AVERSION; FAIRNESS; ATTITUDES; UNCERTAINTY; INFORMATION
Abstract: Demand and capacity fluctuations are common for roads and other congestible facilities. With ongoing advances in pricing technology and ways of communicating information to prospective users, state-dependent congestion pricing is becoming practical. But it is still rare or nonexistent in many potential applications. One explanation is that people dislike uncertainty about how much they will pay. To explore this idea, a model of reference-dependent preferences is developed based on Koszegi and Rabin (2006). Using a facility yields an intrinsic utility and a gain-loss utility measured relative to the probability distribution over states of utility outcomes. Two types of preferences are analyzed: bundled preferences in which gains and losses are perceived for overall utility, and unbundled preferences in which gains and losses are perceived separately for the toll and other determinants of utility. Tolls are chosen to maximize total expected utility plus revenues. With bundled preferences the toll is set above the Pigouvian level when usage conditions are good, and below it when conditions are bad, in order to reduce fluctuations in utility. With unbundled preferences the direction of toll adjustment is less clear and depends on whether supply or demand is variable. For both types of preferences tolls are sensitive to the strength of gain-loss utility. If gain-loss utility is moderately strong, a state-independent toll can be optimal. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. Authors: Mazaré, PE; Dehwah, AH; Claudel, CG; Bayen, AM
Author Full Names: Mazare, Pierre-Emmanuel; Dehwah, Ahmad H.; Claudel, Christian G.; Bayen, Alexandre M.
Article Title: Analytical and grid-free solutions to the Lighthill-Whitham-Richards traffic flow model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: LWR model; Traffic flow; Grid-free numerical scheme; Variational method
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; KINEMATIC WAVES; VARIATIONAL FORMULATION; BOUNDARY-CONDITIONS; CONSERVATION-LAWS; ALGORITHM
Abstract: In this article, we propose a computational method for solving the Lighthill-Whitham-Richards (LWR) partial differential equation (PDE) semi-analytically for arbitrary piecewise-constant initial and boundary conditions, and for arbitrary concave fundamental diagrams. With these assumptions, we show that the solution to the LWR PDE at any location and time can be computed exactly and semi-analytically for a very low computational cost using the cumulative number of vehicles formulation of the problem. We implement the proposed computational method on a representative traffic flow scenario to illustrate the exactness of the analytical solution. We also show that the proposed scheme can handle more complex scenarios including traffic lights or moving bottlenecks. The computational cost of the method is very favorable, and is compared with existing algorithms. A toolbox implementation available for public download is briefly described, and posted at http://traffic.berkeley.edu/project/downloads/lwrsolver. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Qian, C; Chan, CY; Yung, KL
Author Full Names: Qian, Chen; Chan, Ching-Yuen; Yung, Kai-Leung
Article Title: Reaching a destination earlier by starting later: Revisited
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation; Dynamic traffic network; Shortest path
Keywords Plus: VEHICLE-ROUTING PROBLEM; TIME-WINDOW NETWORK; OPTIMIZATION ALGORITHM; SHORTEST PATHS
Abstract: This paper simulates a dynamic traffic network by embedding an extra nonlinear delay function to represent traffic lights (or a similar regular delay) in each arc (or link), and it was shown that a late start driver may catch up with one who started earlier, subject only to the condition that they pick the same path (or the same shortest path), and overtaking will never be made. Moreover, a theoretical lower bound value to guarantee the sustainability of the FIFO principle in a dynamic traffic network was also derived. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Chow, Joseph Y. J.; Regan, Amelia C.
Article Title: Network-based real option models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Real option; Project selection; Network design; Stochastic demand; Radial basis function; Multi-option least squares Monte Carlo simulation
Keywords Plus: DESIGN PROBLEM; DEMAND UNCERTAINTY; OPTIMIZATION; CONGESTION; AMERICAN
Abstract: Building on earlier work to incorporate real option methodologies into network modeling, two models are proposed. The first is the network option design problem, which maximizes the expanded net present value of a network investment as a function of network design variables with the option to defer the committed design investment. The problem is shown to be a generalized version of the network design problem and the multi-period network design problem. A heuristic based on radial basis functions is used to solve the problem for continuous link expansion with congestion effects. The second model is a link investment deferral option set, which decomposes the network investment deferral option into individual, interacting link or project investments. This model is a project selection problem under uncertainty, where each link or project can be deferred such that the expanded net present value is maximized. The option is defined in such a way that a lower bound can be solved using an exact method based on multi-option least squares Monte Carlo simulation. Numerical tests are conducted with the classical Sioux Falls network and compared to earlier published results. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Fu, XW; Dresner, M; Oum, TH
Author Full Names: Fu, Xiaowen; Dresner, Martin; Oum, Tae H.
Article Title: Effects of transport service differentiation in the US domestic airline market
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Low cost carrier; Product differentiation; Almost ideal demand
Keywords Plus: EXCESS DEMAND FUNCTIONS; POTENTIAL COMPETITION; ELASTICITIES; HYPOTHESIS; SYMMETRY; INDUSTRY; SYSTEM; ENTRY; TESTS
Abstract: This study proposes a framework to identify and measure the extent of product differentiation among services provided by transportation firms, and applies it to the US domestic airline markets. By formulating and estimating an Almost Ideal Demand System and a set of price response equations for competing carriers, we investigate empirically the degree of substitutability between the services provided by Full Service Airlines (FSAs) and Low Cost Carriers (LCCs). Our results indicate that there is a significant differentiation in services provided by FSAs and LCCs. As a result, the presence of LCCs alone will not ensure healthy competition in a market. Therefore, it is important for public policy makers to attempt to maintain competition between FSAs even in the markets where LCCs have substantial market shares. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sumalee, A; Zhong, RX; Pan, TL; Szeto, WY
Author Full Names: Sumalee, A.; Zhong, R. X.; Pan, T. L.; Szeto, W. Y.
Article Title: Stochastic cell transmission model (SCTM): A stochastic dynamic traffic model for traffic state surveillance and assignment
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Cell transmission model discrete time bilinear stochastic system; Dynamic link model; Macroscopic stochastic dynamic traffic model; Traffic flow
Abstract: The paper proposes a first-order macroscopic stochastic dynamic traffic model, namely the stochastic cell transmission model (SCTM), to model traffic flow density on freeway segments with stochastic demand and supply. The SCTM consists of five operational modes corresponding to different congestion levels of the freeway segment. Each mode is formulated as a discrete time bilinear stochastic system. A set of probabilistic conditions is proposed to characterize the probability of occurrence of each mode. The overall effect of the five modes is estimated by the joint traffic density which is derived from the theory of finite mixture distribution. The SCTM captures not only the mean and standard deviation (SD) of density of the traffic flow, but also the propagation of SD over time and space. The SCTM is tested with a hypothetical freeway corridor simulation and an empirical study. The simulation results are compared against the means and SDs of traffic densities obtained from the Monte Carlo Simulation (MCS) of the modified cell transmission model (MCTM). An approximately two-miles freeway segment of Interstate 210 West (I-210W) in Los Ageles, Southern California, is chosen for the empirical study. Traffic data is obtained from the Performance Measurement System (PeMS). The stochastic parameters of the SCTM are calibrated against the flow-density empirical data of I-210W. Both the SCTM and the MCS of the MCTM are tested. A discussion of the computational efficiency and the accuracy issues of the two methods is provided based on the empirical results. Both the numerical simulation results and the empirical results confirm that the SCTM is capable of accurately estimating the means and SDs of the freeway densities as compared to the MCS. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Arentze, TA; Ettema, D; Timmermans, HJP
Author Full Names: Arentze, Theo A.; Ettema, Dick; Timmermans, Harry J. P.
Article Title: Estimating a model of dynamic activity generation based on one-day observations: Method and results
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Travel-demand modeling; Activity-based modeling; Time use; Dynamic activity generation; Estimation
Keywords Plus: ACTIVITY-EPISODE GENERATION; TRANSPORTATION; VARIABILITY; RHYTHMS; SYSTEM
Abstract: In this paper we develop and explore an approach to estimate dynamic models of activity generation on one-day travel-diary data. Dynamic models predict multi-day activity patterns of individuals taking into account dynamic needs as well as day-varying preferences and time-budgets. We formulate an ordered-logit model of dynamic activity-agenda-formation decisions and show how one-day observation probabilities can be derived from the model as a function of the model's parameters and, with that, how parameters can be estimated using standard loglikelihood estimation. A scale parameter cannot be identified because information on within-person variability is lacking in one-day data. An application of the method to data from a national travel survey illustrates the method. A test on simulated data indicates that, given a pre-set scale, the parameters can be identified and that estimates are robust for a source of heterogeneity not captured in the model. This result indicates that dynamic activity-based models of the kind considered here can be estimated from data that are less costly to collect and that support the large sample sizes typically required for travel-demand modeling. We conclude therefore that the proposed approach opens up a way to develop large-scale dynamic activity-based models of travel demand. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yu, J; Goos, P; Vandebroek, M
Author Full Names: Yu, Jie; Goos, Peter; Vandebroek, Martina
Article Title: Comparing different sampling schemes for approximating the integrals involved in the efficient design of stated choice experiments
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Discrete choice experiment; Pseudo-Monte Carlo; Quasi-Monte Carlo; Gauss-Hermite quadrature; Faure sequences; Extensible shifted lattice points; Halton sequences; Scrambling; Spherical-radial transformation
Keywords Plus: LOW-DISCREPANCY; SEQUENCES; MODEL; VALUATION; ROBUST; CONSTRUCTION; SIMULATION
Abstract: The semi-Bayesian approach for constructing efficient stated choice designs requires the evaluation of the design selection criterion value over numerous draws taken from the prior parameter distribution assumed when generating the design. The semi-Bayesian D-criterion value of a design is then calculated as the average value of the D-errors over all the draws taken. The traditional way to take draws from a distribution is to use the Pseudo-Monte Carlo approach. However, other sampling approaches are available as well. Examples are Quasi-Monte Carlo approaches using Halton sequences, Faure sequences, modified Latin hypercube sampling and extensible shifted lattice points, a Gauss-Hermite quadrature approach and a method using spherical-radial transformations. Not much is known in general about which sampling scheme is most efficient for calculating semi-Bayesian D-errors when constructing efficient stated choice designs. In this study, we compare the performance of these approaches under various scenarios and identify the most efficient sampling scheme for each situation. The method based on a spherical-radial transformation is shown to outperform the other methods when small numbers of draws are used. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The moderating roles of risk and efficiency on the relationship between logistics performance and customer loyalty in e-commerce
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Customer loyalty; e-Commerce assessment criteria; Logistics; Risk; Efficiency
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE; OPERATIONS CAPABILITY; MARKETING CAPABILITY; INTEGRATED LOGISTICS; ELECTRONIC COMMERCE; PRODUCT INNOVATION; FIRM PERFORMANCE; SERVICE QUALITY; LAST-MILE
Abstract: Using data from online customer ratings, we explore how the relationships between logistics performance and customer loyalty are affected by risk characteristics of products and efficiencies of the websites. Risk is defined in terms of price and ambiguity of products. Efficiency is interpreted as the ability of the websites to achieve good ratings in terms of operational factors (such as satisfaction of customers with product specifications, refunds/returns, prices, management accessibility, etc.) and also achieve good ratings in terms of customer loyalty. Our results show that efficiency, but not risk, is a significant moderator of the impact of logistics performance on customer loyalty. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Continuous kinematic wave models of merging traffic flow
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Kinematic wave models; Merging traffic; Riemann problems; Cell Transmission Models; Distribution schemes; Supply-demand space; Stationary states; Interior states; Boundary fluxes; Invariant merge models
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; SCHEMES; GODUNOV; NETWORK
Abstract: Merging junctions are important network bottlenecks, and a better understanding of merging traffic dynamics has both theoretical and practical implications In this paper, we present continuous kinematic wave models of merging traffic flow which are consistent with discrete Cell Transmission Models with various distribution schemes. In particular, we develop a systematic approach to constructing kinematic wave solutions to the Riemann problem of merging traffic flow in supply-demand space. In the new framework, Riemann solutions on a link consist of an interior state and a stationary state, subject to admissible conditions such that there are no positive and negative kinematic waves on the upstream and downstream links, respectively In addition, various distribution schemes in Cell Transmission Models are considered entropy conditions In the proposed analytical framework, we prove that the stationary states and boundary fluxes exist and are unique for the Riemann problem for both fair and constant distribution schemes We also discuss two types of invariant merge models, in which local and discrete boundary fluxes are the same as global and continuous ones With numerical examples, we demonstrate the validity of the analytical solutions of interior states, stationary states, and corresponding kinematic waves Discussions and future studies are presented in the conclusion section. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Park, S; Lee, TE; Sung, CS
Author Full Names: Park, Sukun; Lee, Tae-Eog; Sung, Chang Sup
Article Title: A three-level supply chain network design model with risk-pooling and lead times
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Location-inventory model; Risk-pooling; Lead time; Lagrangian relaxation; Supply chain management
Keywords Plus: STOCHASTIC INVENTORY SYSTEMS; SAFETY STOCK CONSIDERATIONS; LOCATION NEWSBOY PROBLEM; DISTRIBUTION CENTERS; WAREHOUSE LOCATION; EXPECTED COSTS; TABU SEARCH; ALGORITHM; DEMAND; TRANSPORTATION
Abstract: This paper considers a single-sourcing network design problem for a three-level supply chain consisting of suppliers, distribution centers (DC's) and retailers, where risk-pooling strategy and DC-to-supplier dependent lead times are considered. The objective is to determine the number and locations of suppliers and DC's, the assignment of each location-fixed DC to a supplier and that of each retailer to a DC, which minimizes the system-wide location, transportation, and inventory costs. The problem is formulated as a nonlinear integer programming model, for which a two-phase heuristic solution algorithm is derived based on the Lagrangian relaxation approach. Numerical experiments show that the proposed heuristic is effective and also efficient. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Access control policies without inside queues: Their properties and public policy implications
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Access control; System optimum; Inside queue; Equitable/fair control
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; RAMP; NETWORKS
Abstract: An access control policy that eliminates all queues beyond the entry points to a network has obvious benefits, which include smooth travel and predictable travel times inside the network. Yet it has never been proven, to the best of our knowledge, whether excluding inside queues yields sub-optimal network performance or, in other words, allowing inside queues can actually further reduce the system travel cost Moreover, it is not clear whether an optimal control policy derived from efficiency considerations can also be a fair policy to all road users. This paper provide answers to these questions in the context of a monocentric network. By analyzing the structure of the access control problem considering all feasible policies (with/without inside queues), we show that the minimal system cost realizable by access control can be obtained without directly solving a non-convex optimization program, and can indeed always be achieved by a control policy excluding all of the inside queues. These optimal policies are defined by a polyhedral set and a Finite Generation Algorithm can be applied to derive the analytical form of this set The optimal policies are not unique in general, thus making it possible to achieve both minimal system cost and fairness simultaneously. (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: A novel modeling approach for the fleet deployment problem within a short-term planning horizon
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Liner shipping; Containership; Fleet deployment; Mixed integer programming; Linearization
Abstract: This paper is concerned with model development for a short-term fleet deployment problem of liner shipping operations. We first present a mixed integer nonlinear programming model in which the optimal vessel speeds for different vessel types on different routes are interpreted as their realistic optimal travel times. We then linearize the proposed nonlinear model and obtain a mixed integer linear programming (MILP) model that can be efficiently solved by a standard mixed integer programming solver such as CPLEX The MILP model determines the optimal route service frequency pattern and take into account the time window constraints of shipping services. Finally, we report our numerical results and performance of CPLEX on randomly generated instances. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: From the systems point of view this paper discusses the form of transportation system at macro-level and analyses the development of this system coordinated with economic growth, energy resource, environmental pollution, population density, and arable land. A group of critical function is created to describe the coordinating relationships. Based on these functions the relationship among different impact elements is established. The way to dominate transportation development is also addressed to keep it at the moderate level.

Authors: Frejinger, E; Bierlaire, M; Ben-Akiva, M
Author Full Names: Frejinger, E.; Bierlaire, M.; Ben-Akiva, M.
Article Title: Sampling of alternatives for route choice modeling
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Route choice; Choice set generation; Sampling of alternatives; Path size
Abstract: This paper presents a new paradigm for choice set generation in the context of route choice model estimation. We assume that the choice sets contain all paths connecting each origin-destination pair. Although this is behaviorally questionable, we make this assumption in order to avoid bias in the econometric model. These sets are in general impossible to generate explicitly. Therefore, we propose an importance sampling approach to generate subsets of paths suitable for model estimation. Using only a subset of alternatives requires the path utilities to be corrected according to the sampling protocol in order to obtain unbiased parameter estimates. We derive such a sampling correction for the proposed algorithm. Estimating models based on samples of alternatives is straightforward for some types of models, in particular the multinomial logit (MNL) model. In order to apply MNL for route choice, the utilities should also be corrected to account for the correlation using, for instance, a path size (PS) formulation. We argue that the PS attribute should be computed based on the full choice set. Again, this is not feasible in general, and we propose a new version of the PS attribute derived from the sampling protocol, called Expanded PS. Numerical results based on synthetic data show that models including a sampling correction are remarkably better than the ones that do not. Moreover, the Expanded PS shows good results and outperforms models with the original PS formulation. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Supply-chain partnership performance
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supplier-retailer partnerships; Partnership performance; Empirical research; Regression analysis; Retail industry; Consumer-packaged goods; Korea
Keywords Plus: JOINT VENTURES; MANAGEMENT; IMPACT; NETWORKS; COLLABORATION; COORDINATION; ALLIANCES; INVENTORY; QUALITY; SYSTEMS
Abstract: We model the strategic as well as the operational dimension of performance of supplier-retailer partnerships in terms of five factors: (1) information exchange: (2) trust; (3) joint partnership management; (4) relationship-specific assets; and (5) partner asymmetry. Our paired data are from 74 supplier-retailer partnerships in the consumer-packaged goods industry. As a result we found that the factors that best model strategic performance are different from those that best model operational performance. All companies are in Korea and the retailers include international companies like Carrefour, Tesco, and Wal-Mart while suppliers include Coca-Cola, Kimberley-Clark, and Nestle. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Graham, DJ; Crotte, A; Anderson, RJ
Author Full Names: Graham, Daniel J.; Crotte, Amado; Anderson, Richard J.
Article Title: A dynamic panel analysis of urban metro demand
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Urban metro; Demand; Dynamic panel; GMM
Keywords Plus: RESTRICTIONS; ELASTICITIES; TRANSPORT; SERVICE
Abstract: A dynamic panel model is used to estimate the effect that fares. income and quality of service have on demand for a sample of 22 urban metros. The estimated price elasticity is -0.05 in the short run and -0.33 in the long run. The estimated long run income elasticity is small but positive (0.18), indicating that metros are perceived as normal goods. The quality of service elasticities are positive and substantially higher than the absolute Value of fare elasticities. The implication is that quality of service improvements, rather than fare reductions, may be more effective in increasing metro patronage. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Geroliminis, N; Karlaftis, MG; Skabardonis, A
Author Full Names: Geroliminis, Nikolas; Karlaftis, Matthew G.; Skabardonis, Alexander
Article Title: A spatial queuing model for the emergency vehicle districting and location problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Emergency response; Accidents; Spatial queues; Location models
Keywords Plus: FACILITY LOCATION
Abstract: Emergency response systems in urban areas should be located to ensure adequate coverage and rapid response time. We develop a model for locating emergency vehicles on urban networks considering both spatial and temporal demand characteristics such as the probability that a server is not available when required. We also consider that service rates are not identical but may vary among servers and are dependent upon incident characteristics: corresponding districting and dispatching problems are also integrated in the location model. The model is applied using real data for locating freeway service patrol vehicles and results are compared with existing coverage and median models. Results show improvements in the mean response time particularly in cases of high demand for intervention when compared to 'traditional' models. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: On the recursive estimation of vehicular speed using data from a single inductance loop detector: A Bayesian approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bayesian analysis; Recursive estimation; Single inductance loop detector; Space-mean speed measurement; Vehicular speed
Keywords Plus: ALGORITHM
Abstract: This paper investigates the recursive estimation of vehicular speed using the information provided by a single inductance loop detector (ILD). A statistical model for space-mean speed measured by an ILD is developed, upon which a Bayesian analysis is carried out to estimate vehicular speed. This results in a set of recursive formulae which is analytically nice and neat. The incurred computational cost for updating the estimate of vehicular speed is kept to be a minimum. As a by-product, a simple method for the calibration of the effective vehicle length of an ILD is also developed. The proposed method is illustrated using simulation studies and a practical example. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Optimal infrastructure condition sampling over space and time for maintenance decision-making under uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Infrastructure management; Inspection; maintenance; and rehabilitation; decision-making; Optimization under uncertainty; Condition assessment; Spatial sampling
Keywords Plus: OPTIMAL INSPECTION; REPAIR POLICIES; MANAGEMENT
Abstract: Infrastructure management is the process through which inspection, maintenance, and rehabilitation (IM&R) decisions are made to minimize the total life-cycle cost. Measurement, forecasting, and spatial sampling are three main sources of errors introducing uncertainty into the process. The first two uncertainties are captured in the infrastructure management literature. However, the third one has not been recognized and quantified. This paper presents a methodology where the spatial sampling uncertainty in question is captured and the sample size is incorporated as a decision variable in an optimization framework. An illustrative realistic example is presented to demonstrate an application of the developed framework. The results indicate that by not addressing the sampling uncertainty and decisions, the optimum IM&R decisions would not be achieved, and consequently, marked unnecessary overspending could take place. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Alias, Anuar; Yusoff, Wan Zahari Wan; Samad, Zulkiflee Abdul
Article Title: The Financial Evaluation of Transportation Project In Malaysia: A Case Study of Putrajaya Monorail Transit System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: financial evaluation; transportation project; investment return; viability
Abstract: This paper explores a financial evaluation of the proposed transportation project of the Putrajaya Transit System Line 1 (PMT1) in term of investment return to the concessionaire. One of the key elements in the planning of Putrajaya is to provide an efficient transportation system befitting a city design for the 21(st) century. The formation of transportation strategy has to be undertaken with a view to satisfying as far as possible, free of congestion and has minimal levels of air and noise pollution. In relation to this, most of the concessionaires are ambivalent about assessing the worth of investment return with regards to infrastructure project because of the multi-faceted issues involved in evaluation of such investment. Thus, an adjusted financial evaluation is introduced with application of Discounted Cash Flow (DCF), Net Present Value (NPV) and Internal Rate of Return (IRR) as main tools to evaluate the project. This approach is applied to prove the financial viability and feasibility of PMT1 project according to respective proposed business plan. Therefore, the concessionaire is able to evaluate the profitability and the possibility of investing in this type of concession project.

Authors: Chen, KK; Chang, CT; Lai, CS
Author Full Names: Chen, Kee-Kuo; Chang, Ching-Ter; Lai, Cheng-Sheng
Article Title: Service quality gaps of business customers in the shipping industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Service quality; SERVQUAL; CFA; MANOVA
Keywords Plus: EXPECTATIONS; PERCEPTIONS; PERFORMANCE; REASSESSMENT
Abstract: This paper extends the gaps model of [Zeithaml, V.A., Parasuraman, A., Berry, L 1990. Delivering Quality Service: Balancing Customer Perceptions and Expectation. The Free Press, New York] from the service provider to the business customer side by examining two service quality (SQ) gaps. One is the SQ gap between types of business customers and the other is the SQ gap among employee statuses of business customers. Besides that, the five-factor SERVQUAL measure as the initial hypothesized model is also tested. The applicability of SERVQUAL to measuring the perceived SQ of customers in the shipping industry of Taiwan is rejected empirically. The existence of the two hypothesized gaps is verified by the method of MANOVA. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Spillover Risk and Innovation Protection in Industrial Clusters:the Role of Trade Associations
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: knowledge spillover; spillover risk; innovation protection; trade association
Abstract: knowledge spillover can improve competitiveness of both the cluster and individual firms. But it may also cause spillover risk when a firm's technological secrets are exposed to rivals and when members become reluctant to invest in technology innovation because they can be free rider to depend on the achievement of others. Innovation protection is needed to prevent illegal imitation and promote innovations. Trade associations can play important role in preventing free rider of innovation and promoting cooperation through logic of collective actions. Three functions related to innovation protection are described.

Article Title: Social Impact Assessment of Current Housing Policies-Based on Stakeholders Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing policy; Social impact assessment; Stakeholder analysis; Alienation; Mitigation of social impact
Abstract: Traditional enterprise theory states that the enterprise goal is to maximize profits, while the shareholder theory suggests that enterprise's aim is to provide wealth for stakeholder and society effectively (Wang Huangming, 2007). A housing policy would have comprehensive social impacts, and this would have direct or indirect effect on the interests and actions of all stakeholders. Thus, actions of stakeholders would ultimately affect the efficiency of a housing policy. From a viewpoint of stakeholders' analysis, an analysis framework was developed to evaluate the social impacts of current housing policies. The results shows that there is no effective interest balance mechanic in current housing policies thus leading to asymmetric interest pattern, and alienation of stakeholders' action prohibit the effects of housing policies. So, the social impacts of a housing policy should be evaluated completely from a viewpoint of stakeholder analysis; public involvement should be encouraged; mitigation of social impact should be made to balance benefits of stakeholders; and play a role of housing policies.

Article Title: Production Mode of Mass Customization in Housing Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: MC (Mass Customization); Housing industry; Demand; Platform; Designing
Keywords Plus: PLATFORMS
Abstract: Today production mode of housing industry is like that of car industry in 1920s, which the mass production domains the whole industry. The mass production mode can well control cost, but it can't meet customers' individual demands. Especially today when the era that houses were extremely lacking has passed in our country, the weakness of the mass production mode began to emerge. Then the housing companies have to make greater efforts to market their common products to the masses in competitive environment. But the mass customization production mode can help the housing companies solve this difficult problem. This article points out that the application of mass customization in housing industry is to constitute product platform, and improve the methodology to develop product platform for architectures. Then the article discusses the production system which includes acquiring customers' demand, ascertaining relationship between designing modules and specific demands, product designing, construction organization, etc. organization this system, the article information system framework to section of the whole production system.

Article Title: Research of Based AOP RBAC Model for Distributed Application
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: RBAC; AOP; authorization
Abstract: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) is an important technology for information resource access control. This paper analyses the traditional information resource access control. It identifies three issues: (1) how to simplify the object control, (2) how to express policy dynamically, and (3) how to inject role object with action. It extends prior research by the modeled ADRBAC (Based-AOP Distributed RBAC) architecture to solve these problems, and outlines its key technologies. Finally, it highlights the corresponding implements.

Authors: Jiang, HA; Liu, CB; Chang, YA
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jiang Huai; Liu Changbin; Chang Yuan
Article Title: Research on Operation and Management of Natural Disasters Resistance Risks
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Natural disasters; Linear programming; Risk costs; Disaster prevention and mitigation
Abstract: Foreign countries pay much attention to the research on natural disaster so as to finding out the strategies for disaster prevention and mitigation. China's domestic economic and people's living have been greatly threated. The overlapping and simultaneous occurrences of different type of disasters bring the difficulties for the prevention and emergency response work, and the domestic economic and people's life and property have faced terrible attacks. Therefore, it can be seen that the natural disaster resistance work is urgent and indispensable. Thus, the establishment of risk management system of natural disaster resistence is necessary and sigfinicant. This paper firstly adopts natural disaster linear programming theory to optimize the costs that each industry has for natural disasters resistance; then AHP method is used for categorizing the industries exposed to natural disasters so as to determine the major ones for disaster prevention and mitigation. Finally, a series of management measures are recommended. By establishing natural disasters management system, developing effective techniques and drafting specified measures, the loss caused by natural disasters can be minimized.

Author Full Names: Lau, K. H.; Lam, T., I
Article Title: Property Price Movements and the Linked Exchange Rate in Hong Kong SAR - Do they interact?
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Property price movents; Linked exchange rage; Hong Kong SAR
Abstract: Since 1980s, Hong Kong has been emerging as an international financial centre where economic activities are as prosperous as the property market, as the HKD follows the rise and drop of the USD rather than vice versa, it could also be said that the linked exchange rate links the USD to the performance of the property prices in Hong Kong, both of residential property and commercial offices. Hong Kong SAR has been adopting a Linked Exchange Rate (LER) in relation to the US dollar since 1983, which allows the US-HK exchange rate to fluctuate within a narrow band. Despite numerous other factors affecting property prices (such as land supply, interest rate, per-capita income, etc.), empirical evidence seem to indicate that property prices indices in Hong Kong have moved in relation to exchange rate indices. Yet, from regression analysis, there are still different levels of influence for commercial and residential properties. This paper traces the relationships and offers a discussion on the economic phenomena forming the backdrop, as well as drawing examples from other Asian cities as reported in the literature.

It is an important way to realize the science and technology development strategy of our country, promote the construction of regional innovation system. In order to develop this platform, it is necessary to construct the supply model of multiple subjects, strengthen intergovernmental cooperation, adopt public service model of whole of government, and enhance the government capacity of governing by network.

Article Title: New concept of careful surveillance - a real challenge for insurance firms
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: risk; management; solvability; surveillance
Abstract: The methods by which the competent authorities measure solvability at the insurance firms' level are different from one country to another, and the lack of a similar model of calculus may represent a barrier in the manifestation of free competition on the insurance market. And so, on the basis of a common market, in an attempt to protect the interests of the insurers as well as the insured, it becomes more necessary that all insurance companies are submitted to the same requirements in regard to their capacity to honor at any moment their obligations to the insured as well as a third party.

Article Title: Based on the V Model for the Program progress of Visualized Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: progress management; program; visualized management; V model
Abstract: The complexity of program itself decide the difficulty of program progress management. The designs and researches of visualized model for the progress of program management put forth wider application scope and space for efficient management. At the same time, visualized models offer a feasible method and thought for exactitude and efficiency of progress management decisions. From the owners' point of view, we control progress by using visualized model, the V model, and draw a contrast with traditional methods such as Gantt chart, Network. On the basis of traditional methods, we combine the theory of Critical Chain and the software of Program Management just like P3e/c to control the progress, which can reflects the process of progress control intuitively and extracts an inherent law conveniently. Finally owners can improve efficiency and quality of progress control and carry out effective analysis on model's function or legitimacy by vision.

Authors: Ren, R; Wen, J; Cheng, H
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ren, R.; Wen, J.; Cheng, H.
Article Title: The Function of Engineering Breakdown Structure (EBS) in Project Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering Breakdown Structure; Whole Life-cycle; Project Manegement
Abstract: With the development of the national economy and technological progress, the large projects are in great demand, and the corresponding level of their project management has becoming higher and higher. Therefore, there is a demand for further investigation on the engineering system in the project management, especially the engineering object system. The introduction of Engineering Breakdown Structure (EBS) can start from the project itself, study on the project engineering system, optimize and allocate each professional system that constitute the engineering system in the whole life-cycle continuously. In this paper, based on the concept of EBS, it is analyze the differences between EBS and WBS, discuss the principles and methods of EBS, and also bring the idea of EBS to the project management in whole life-cycle, build the cost structure matrix and information structure matrix in life-cycle. The proposal of EBS is propitious to ensure the systematic and integrity of the project in construction, help to establish the organizational responsibility system of the project, and also help to manage the cost and information system, final is contributive to achieve the successful project management from the perspective of optimal life-cycle. The management idea of EBS used in the construction project will offer direction and reference to the other projects for the future.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Large-scale Construction Project Organization Management Mode in the Railway Construction Enterprise
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: large-scale railway construction project; organization management mode; project command department; railway construction enterprise
Abstract: In 2009, Chinese railway infrastructure investments up to 6,000 billion yuan, it has become one main way to stimulate domestic demand and promote Chinese economic development. In this paper, the characteristics of the large-scale railway construction project such as the large number of investment, the cross-regional construction and the need of various branches and subsidiary companies to participate in one construction enterprise are firstly analyzed. Secondly, the limitation of the two degree management mode (that is headquarters-project management department mode) and the advantages of the three degree management mode (headquarters-command department-project management department mode) for the construction management are studied. On this basis, three types of three degree management mode - the coordination-based command department mode, the construction-based command department mode and mix-coordination & construction-based command department mode are analyzed, including their separate characteristics, organization structures and the relations and differential responsibilities with the company headquarter and the project management department. Finally this paper studies how to implement the three-degree management mode and the relative management suggestions. The study has great academic and realistic meanings to improve the construction management efficiency in practice and promote the inside reform for the railway construction enterprise.

Article Title: An investigation of the effectiveness of advanced modeling tools on the forecasting of daily PM10 values in the Greater Athens Area
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: NEURAL-NETWORKS; PREDICTION; PM2.5
Abstract: The present paper discusses the effectiveness of advanced modeling tools as a means of forecasting daily PM10 values, presenting as a case study the Greater Athens Area. The effectiveness of the described approaches is judged against mature forecasting approaches (e.g. linear regression and neural networks) in terms of absolute prediction error metrics and the confusion matrix, which shows the ability to correctly predict exceedances of the regulatory limit. Finally, a new approach is presented that incorporates the short-term dynamics of the PM10 time series into the forecasting model as explanatory variable.

Article Title: Recreational Business District (RBD): Functional Innovation to Improve the Competitiveness of Cities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Recreational business district; Competitiveness; Functional innovation; Public space
Abstract: Recreational business district has gradually become a focus of commercial real estate development as an important part of urban recreation and open space. Against the backdrop of growing recreational business district, allied studies on its function and development are very meaningful. Form the perspective of regional economy and urban development the important role of recreational business district in the city is established. The paper reviews summary of relevant studies and defines the basic concepts. We regard recreational business district as a research starting point, and study core functions of recreational business district. Recreational business district is a kind of specific area which will display urban life and culture comprehensively. With diverse functions urban recreational business district also has a top priority in the city development. By tapping into feature innovation of recreational business district, to achieve the synergy and interaction between the overall brand cities and urban operations, tourism, home and country of origin etc. sub-brands. It can effectively enhance the overall value and competitiveness. At last, this article puts forward the countermeasures to innovative features of commercial recreation district.

Article Title: Study of Real Estate Investment Risk Decision-Making Model Based on Theory of Utility-Attribute Synthetic Assessment
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Tianjin Real Estate Industry; Market Risk; Attribute Synthetic Assessment Model
Abstract: Domestic investment market is further open as China joins WTO. The real estate is being an important investment direction in national economy. The real estate as one of the basis, pillar and precursor of the national economy, its status is consolidated day by day and the investment cost increases year by year.Real estate industry plays an important role for economy of Tianjin, and it is of practical significance to grasp the rules of real estate market development and analyses its risk situation. This paper make some research about holistic risk in real estate market from the macroscopically view, clean up a great deal of historic data, put forward the author's won view on boundary of indexes, and set a relatively integrated risk indicators system about Tianjin real estate market. Then, make the standard to identify indicators, at the same time, design attribute synthetic assessment model and pile cyber-program to evaluate the market risk of Tianjin real estate in recent years. The conclusion of this paper is credible, so it can offer some reference and suggestion for real estate developer, personal housing investor and the government.

Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate

Author Keywords: construction project; project information management; project information portal; SPS
Abstract: By the era of knowledge economy, the value of information has been playing an extremely important role in the process of market prosperity. Effective management for information resource, is not only the necessary means for a modern enterprise to survive and develop, but also is the preference of national economy for sustainable, rapid growth. It has become an inevitable trend to use modern information technology to improve the project management methods. According to the present situation of construction project management based on information technology in national construction enterprises, the design for project informatin management system by the use of PIP technology has been mentioned. As the core of the SPS software development, PIP technology is quite proper to set up information management platform for collaboration, which is in line with characteristics of project information management. It's aimed to improve domestic construction industry informationization from the point of PIM and enhance competitiveness as well as enterprises' production efficiency.

Article Title: Research of Coordinated Development about Tourism and Real Estate Based on Coupling Theory
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: coupling theory; tourism; real estate; coordinated development
Abstract: Since the beginning of the 21st century, China's tourism has ushered in the leisure time. As social economy developed rapidly, pace of life become quickly, people hope come on to the nature and experience travel by relaxed and pleasure way. In the situation of time and money were limited, big city periphery region which has good tour resources foundation depend on the big city's good location traffic conditions, becomes people's favorite choice for weekend or the short-term vacation. Tourism is changing from tourists to leisure-type and vacation-type whiles the development of China's economy and the prosperity about traveling industry. Real estate investment have begun to slowly infiltrate to the tourism industry and promote tourism as a subject of real estate project development upsurge of the rise of a new round of China's economic growth point and the new trend in real estate investment. Tourism and real estate industry coupled-the emergence of tourism real estate, has become inevitable. Based on the perspective of coupling theory, this paper is to study the coordinated development of tourism and the problems of real estate, then, the conclusions can be drawn at last.

It can help enterprises face competitive market and make control policies on brain drain to match their overall strategies. This article is going to deeply analyze the brain drain situation in our country and its influences and identify the reasons behind such behavior from the view of object coincidence theory After that some suggestions on how to give effective control will be discussed

Article Title: Research on Developmental Stage of Chinese Real Estate Finance Based on Fuzzy Pattern Recognition
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Fuzzy pattern recognition; Developmental stage; Real estate finance
Abstract: Being pillar industry of national economy, Chinese real estate industry has been in a faster developmental stage than before. Seen from the developmental condition of capital market and the demand of developing capital, China it has built the foundation to develop the real estate financial market to some extend. At this time, to study the real estate financial market in a theoretical way is good for developing the real estate financial market healthily. In this paper, the developmental stage and condition of Chinese real estate finance is researched systematically on base of pattern recognition model by introducing data of 2003, 2006 and 2007, which sets up a good foundation for the following forecast research on the real estate finance market. The result of this paper has important reference value for the study of industrial finance in the view of a whole industry and gives a new solution for quantitative study in the research field of industrial finance.

Article Title: An Evaluation of Building Contractors in Jiangsu Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Operation efficiency; Contractor; Data envelop analysis; Cluster analysis
Abstract: The development of building contractors in China is vital to the national economy. The level of operation and the competitiveness of the contractors would influence the development of the building industry. In accordance to the empirical analysis of the operation efficiency of the 85 contractors in Jiangsu Province, the results clearly describe the development level of building contractors. This analysis provides information to the Jiangsu government to formulate the regulations and policies to enhance the operation efficiency in the building industry. Current research is to analyze the situation of the Chinese building contractors in recent years and to investigate their operation levels whether have been met the requirements of the further development. The paper suggests an evaluation model to the supervision departments and construction market parties to evaluate and to improve the operation level of building contractors in construction market. The analysis and recommendations for improvement should be beneficial to the Chinese government and building contractors.

Article Title: The Optimization and Control of the Total Life Cycle Cost of Dalian Some Super-high Construction Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6

Abstract: How to analyze and control life cycle cost of the construction project becomes the theory and practice question that the present stage urgent needs to solve.The life cycle of the construction project is very long, the uncertainty of economical movement, when we analyze the life cycle cost, the annual cost displays certain extent fluctuation. In view of the above question, this article solves this problem through the system simulation, and give some measures of the optimization and control to LCC about a extra-high construction project in Dalian, using the obtaining simulation model to carry on simulation on the total life cycle cost of that project, gets its total life cycle cost, then analyses it, gives the rationalization proposal of the total life cycle control.

Author Keywords: Real estate bubbles; Real estate indicator; Measurements analysis
Abstract: Real estate bubble is a form of real estate economy fluctuation, and its appearance will also aggravate real estate economy fluctuation. There is no doubt that the real estate needs to develop on and on, and it's also necessary for us to take reasonable methods to measure real estate bubble and make early warning to it. Therefore, both the center and local government should maintain sharp vigilance in this problem, and fully bring the effect of real estate economy to pull the domestic demand to grow. This paper chooses three kinds of indicators, including real estate price indicator, real estate need indicator and real estate supply indicator, through systematic analysis, to analyze the severity of real estate bubbles which is based on the distance between actual value and benchmark. By studying Nanning real estate bubble measurements from 2003 to 2008, this paper could distinguish whether there are real estate bubbles in Nanning, meanwhile to put forward some effective advices to avoiding the emergence of real estate bubbles.

Article Title: A threshold model of social contagion process for evacuation decision making
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Network science; Evacuation decision making; Warning propagation; Complex networks; Contagion model
Keywords Plus: NETWORKS
Abstract: Individual evacuation decisions are often characterized by the influence of one's social network. In this paper a threshold model of social contagion, originally proposed in the network science literature, is presented to characterize this social influence in the evacuation decision making process. Initiated by a single agent, the condition of a cascade when a portion of the population decides to evacuate has been derived from the model. Simulation models are also developed to investigate the effects of community mixing patterns and the initial seed on cascade propagation and the effect of previous time-steps considered by the agents and the strength of ties on average cascade size. Insights related to social influence include the significant role of mixing patterns among communities in the network and the role of the initial seed on cascade propagation. Specifically, faster propagation of warning is observed in community networks with greater inter-community connections. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: On a mean field game approach modeling congestion and aversion in pedestrian crowds
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Mean field games; Interacting populations; Nash equilibrium; Rational expectations; Flow of pedestrians; Lane formation
Keywords Plus: RATIONAL-EXPECTATIONS; FLUID-MECHANICS; FLOWS; APPROXIMATION; DYNAMICS; SYSTEMS
Abstract: In this paper we present a new class of pedestrian crowd models based on the mean field games theory introduced by Lasry and Lions in 2006. This macroscopic approach is based on a microscopic model, that considers smart pedestrians who rationally interact and anticipate the future. This leads to a forward-backward structure in time. We focus on two-population interactions and validate the modeling with simple examples. Two complementary classes of problems are addressed, namely the case of crowd aversion and the one of congestion. In both cases we describe the model and present numerical solvers (based on the optimization formulation and the partial differential equations respectively). Finally we present numerical tests involving anticipation phenomena and complex group behaviors such as lane formation. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chiou, TY; Chan, HK; Lettice, F; Chung, SH
Author Full Names: Chiou, Tzu-Yun; Chan, Hing Kai; Lettice, Fiona; Chung, Sai Ho
Article Title: The influence of greening the suppliers and green innovation on environmental performance and competitive advantage in Taiwan
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Green supply chain management; Green innovation; Competitiveness; Environmental performance
Keywords Plus: PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT; MANAGEMENT; CHAIN; INTEGRATION; TECHNOLOGIES; LOGISTICS; MODEL
Abstract: Recently, many companies have recognized the concepts of green supply chain management or supply chain environmental management. However, relatively little research attention has been devoted to the consideration of relations between greening the supply chain, green innovation, environmental performance and competitive advantage. Hence, this paper aims to bridge this gap by providing empirical evidence to encourage companies to implement green supply chain and green innovation in order to improve their environmental performance, and to enhance their competitive advantage in the global market. A model is constructed to link the aforementioned constructs. Data were collected through a questionnaire-based survey across 124 companies from eight industry sectors in Taiwan. The data are analyzed using Structural Equation Modeling and the results from the final measurement model are used to evaluate the structural model that verifies the significance of the proposed relationships. A prominent result of this study is that greening the supplier through green innovation contributes significant benefits to the environmental performance and competitive advantage of the firm. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bai, Y; Hwang, TS; Kang, S; Ouyang, YF
Author Full Names: Bai, Yun; Hwang, Taesung; Kang, Seungmo; Ouyang, Yanfeng
Article Title: Biofuel refinery location and supply chain planning under traffic congestion
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Biofuel refinery location; Supply chain planning; Traffic congestion; Mixed-integer program; Lagrangian relaxation; Branch-and-bound
Keywords Plus: FLOW-DEPENDENT COSTS; ASSIGNMENT PROBLEM; BIOMASS; BIOENERGY; TRANSPORT; MODEL
Abstract: This research focuses on planning biofuel refinery locations where the total system cost for refinery investment, feedstock and product transportation and public travel is minimized. Shipment routing of both feedstock and product in the biofuel supply chain and the resulting traffic congestion impact are incorporated into the model to decide optimal locations of biofuel refineries. A Lagrangian relaxation based heuristic algorithm is introduced to obtain near-optimum feasible solutions efficiently. To further improve optimality, a branch-and-bound framework (with linear programming relaxation and Lagrangian relaxation bounding procedures) is developed. Numerical experiments with several testing examples demonstrate that the proposed algorithms solve the problem effectively. An empirical Illinois case study and a series of sensitivity analyses are conducted to show the effects of highway congestion on refinery location design and total system costs. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Analysis of traffic congestion costs in a competitive supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Competitive facility location game; Traffic congestion costs
Keywords Plus: QUANTITY COMPETITION; AIRLINE INDUSTRY; LOCATION; MARKET; MODELS; EQUILIBRIUM; OLIGOPOLY; MANAGERS; IMPACT; FIRMS
Abstract: We study a competitive facility location problem with identical suppliers competing in multiple markets subject to distribution network congestion. We first analyze the solution of a symmetric competitive location game and discuss the firms' facility location and equilibrium market supply decisions. Then, we utilize the model to provide analytical characterization of the effects of traffic congestion costs on equilibrium distribution flows. These analytical results permit qualitative characterization of how changes in congestion levels and costs affect equilibrium location and distribution decisions. The results of extensive numerical studies serve to further illustrate the effects of traffic congestion costs on location, market supply quantity, and distribution decisions. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Soriguera, F; Rosas, D; Robusté, F
Author Full Names: Soriguera, F.; Rosas, D.; Robuste, F.
Article Title: Travel time measurement in closed toll highways
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Highway travel time measurement; Toll highways; Toll ticket data
Keywords Plus: VEHICLE REIDENTIFICATION; SPEED
Abstract: Travel time for a road trip is a drivers' most appreciated traffic information. Measuring travel times on a real time basis is also a perfect indicator of the level of service in a road link, and therefore is a useful measurement for traffic managers in order to improve traffic operations on the network. In conclusion, accurate travel time measurement is one of the key factors in traffic management systems. This paper presents a new approach for measuring travel times on closed toll highways using the existing surveillance infrastructure. In a closed toll system, where toll plazas are located on the on/off-ramps and each vehicle is charged a particular fee depending on its origin and destination, the data used for toll collection can also be valuable for measuring mainline travel times on the highway. The proposed method allows estimating mainline travel times on single sections of highway (defined as a section between two neighboring ramps) using itineraries covering different origin-destinations. The method provides trip time estimations without investing in any kind of infrastructure or technology. This overcomes some of the limitations of other methods, like the information delay and the excess in the travel time estimation due to the accumulation of exit times (i.e. the time required to travel along the exit link plus the time required to pay the fee at the toll gate). The results obtained in a pilot test on the AP-7 toll highway, near Barcelona in Spain, show that the developed methodology is sound. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An integrated model for stock replenishment and shipment scheduling under common carrier dispatch costs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Shipment consolidation; Vendor-managed inventory; Common carrier
Keywords Plus: VENDOR-MANAGED INVENTORY; CONSOLIDATED SHIPMENTS; TRANSPORTATION; DECISIONS; POLICIES
Abstract: We examine a joint inventory replenishment and shipment scheduling problem that arises in the context of a vendor-managed inventory (VMI) arrangement. Since a temporal shipment consolidation policy is being implemented, the inventory requirements at the vendor are affected by the timing and quantity of shipment release. The vendor's problem is to determine an integrated policy for inventory replenishment and shipment release and to set its parameters. We develop analytical models for computing such integrated policies where it is economical to use common carriage for outbound transportation. We propose algorithmic approaches to set the optimal policy parameter values. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
