Article Title: The α-reliable mean-excess traffic equilibrium model with stochastic travel times
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Travel time reliability; Travel time budget; Mean-excess travel time; User equilibrium; Variational inequality
Keywords Plus: ALTERNATING DIRECTION METHOD; PERFORMANCE RELIABILITY; TRANSPORT NETWORK; ROAD NETWORKS; RISK; ASSIGNMENT; CAPACITY; METHODOLOGY; UNCERTAINTY; FORMULATION
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new model called the a-reliable mean-excess traffic equilibrium (METE) model that explicitly considers both reliability and unreliability aspects of travel time variability in the route choice decision process. In contrast to the travel time budget (TTB) models that consider only the reliability aspect defined by TTB, this new model hypothesizes that travelers are willing to minimize their mean-excess travel times (MEET) defined as the conditional expectation of travel times beyond the TTB. As a route choice criterion, METT can be regarded as a combination of the buffer time measure that ensures the reliability aspect of on-time arrival at a confidence level a, and the tardy time measure that represents the unreliability aspect of encountering worst travel times beyond the acceptable travel time allowed by TTB in the distribution tail of 1 - alpha. It addresses both questions of how much time do I need to allow? and how bad should I expect from the worse cases? Therefore, travelers' route choice behavior can be considered in a more accurate and complete manner in a network equilibrium framework to reflect their risk preferences under an uncertain environment. The METE model is formulated as a variational inequality problem and solved by a route-based traffic assignment algorithm via the self-adaptive alternating direction method. Some qualitative properties of the model are rigorously proved. Illustrative examples are also presented to demonstrate the characteristics of the model as well as its differences compared to the recently proposed travel time budget models. Article Title: Airline competition and network structure
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Fully-connected networks; Hub-and-spoke networks; Brand loyalty; Fully-served markets; Partially-served markets
Keywords Plus: HUB-AND-SPOKE
Abstract: This paper studies airline networks and their welfare implications in an unregulated environment. Competing airlines may adopt either fully-connected (FC) or hub-and-spoke (HS) network structures: and passengers exhibiting low brand loyalty to their preferred carrier choose an outside option to travel so that markets are partially served by airlines. In this context, carriers adopt hubbing strategies when costs are sufficiently low, and asymmetric equilibria where one carrier chooses a FC strategy and the other chooses a HS strategy may arise. Quite interestingly, flight frequency can become excessive under HS network configurations. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Effect of block width and storage yard layout on marine container terminal performance
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Seaport container terminal; Maritime shipping; Block width; Terminal design; Gross crane rate; Simulation
Keywords Plus: DISCRETE-EVENT SIMULATION; OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; CRANE DEPLOYMENT; PORT; SYSTEM; MODEL; OPTIMIZATION; NETWORK; BERTH; TRANSSHIPMENT
Abstract: Block widths ranging from two to fifteen rows in a marine container terminal are evaluated by a fully-integrated, discrete event simulation model. Experiments consider dozens of yard configurations and four container terminal settings that are designed to reproduce the microscopic, stochastic, real-time environment at a multiple-berth facility. Results show that the quay crane rate is concave with respect to block width when the yard storage capacity and amount of yard equipment is constant. The optimal block width ranges from 6 to 12 rows depending on the amount of equipment deployed and the size, shape, and throughput of the terminal. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An effective genetic algorithm for the fleet size and mix vehicle routing problems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Genetic algorithm; Single parent crossover; Local search; Fleet size and mix vehicle routing problem
Keywords Plus: HETEROGENEOUS FLEET; EVOLUTIONARY ALGORITHM
Abstract: This paper studies the fleet size and mix vehicle routing problem (FSMVRP), in which the fleet is heterogeneous and its composition to be determined. We design and implement a genetic algorithm (CA) based heuristic. On a set of twenty benchmark problems it reaches the best-known solution 14 times and finds one new best solution. It also provides a competitive performance in terms of average solution. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Measuring the performance of multimode bus transit: A mixed structure network DEA model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Network DEA model; Efficiency; Effectiveness; Transit performance
Keywords Plus: EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to propose a mixed structure network data envelopment analysis (MSNDEA) model which allows a representation of a parallel production serial connection of consumption processes in a unified framework and hence can be used to simultaneously estimate the production efficiency, service effectiveness and operational effectiveness of multimode transit firms. To do this, Taiwan's bus transit system is selected for the empirical applications. The main advantages of the MSNDEA model are in contexts where internal linkage and shared inputs between activities can be considered in this model, and the model structure is more realistic than the conventional one. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lu, JL; Chou, HY; Ling, PC
Author Full Names: Lu, Jin-Long; Chou, Hung-Yen; Ling, Pei-Chuan
Article Title: Investigating passengers' intentions to use technology-based self check-in services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 11th World Congress of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Technology-based self check-in services; Technology acceptance model; Behavioral intentions; Airline passengers
Keywords Plus: INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY; ACCEPTANCE MODEL; ADOPTION; USAGE; DETERMINANTS; SATISFACTION; EXTENSION; ATTITUDES; GENDER
Abstract: As more and more airlines have introduced technology-based self check-in services, it has become increasingly important to understand the factors affecting airline passengers' attitudes toward this new form of check--in services and also their intentions, especially from Asian passengers' perspectives. An empirical study was conducted among Taiwanese airline passengers using the technology acceptance model (TAM) as the basic research model while considering additional factors for further analysis such as external stimuli, perceived service quality, perceived behavioral control, need for service, and perceived risk. The findings revealed that attitude and external stimuli best explain passengers' behavioral intentions to use the kiosks, whereas perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use have little effect on their intentions. These findings suggest that airlines in Taiwan should persuade passengers to acquire a more positive attitude toward the new check-in kiosks and should consider implementation of incentive strategies in encouraging passengers to adopt the self check-in service. Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Ex Post Evaluation Method of Railway Construction Project's Benefit - Based on the Triple Performance Evaluation Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Ex post evaluation; Triple performance evaluation model; AHP; Space distance method
Abstract: The conventional ex post evaluation method of railway construction project has three steps. Firstly, set up the evaluation index system with three dimensions benefit of economy, society and environment. Then, calculate these indices. In the end, evaluate the benefits above and the project's comprehensive benefit by qualitative analysis. This method's main disadvantage is the evaluation results couldn't be indicated by one single index and the non-professionals couldn't understand the conclusion's meaning exactly. The disadvantage also makes it difficult in comparing of benefits among different railway lines and different periods of same line. Aiming at this disadvantage, this paper applies the triple performance evaluation model which can be used in the business performance evaluation in the railway construction project's ex post evaluation. The evaluation model is established based on analytic hierarchy process (AHP) and space distance method. It indicates that the evaluation results with one single index. So the new evaluation model is easier to compare. Finally this paper also explored how to use this model into practice.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: Semantic modeling of temporal information in a database for biotope inventories
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Database queries often include explicit or implicit temporal reference. Explicit queries ask e.g. for information in a given year or time period, and implicit queries e.g. look for information about changes over time like growth in a certain area. Our datacenter nature and landscape (DNL) is basically a relational database with thematic data combined with a geographic information system (GIS) holding spatial data. The DNL has been semantically enriched with a bilingual eco- ontology and corresponding algorithms (semantic search, reasoning, consistency checking). The main purpose of the ontology is to allow open and intuitive search facilities for non-expert users. However so far there is no semantic support for temporal queries included yet. Spatio-thematic information is stored in an OWL/DL ontology. Therefore an approach for temporal information is searched which fits seamless in the existing environment. Temporal information is available in the DNL database, however it is often given in a very coarse granularity (months or years), sometimes it is entirely missing. As a consequence the challenge of semantic support for temporal queries in the DNL, also includes handling vague and incomplete temporal information. The work presented here, starts from typical temporal user queries (which were collected in use cases) and checks different approaches for their usability in our real-world eco-database DNL. It is found, that a subset of Allen's interval algebra relations, which actually corresponds to RCC-5 relations best fits Our needs. It is planned to be integrated into the existing thematic ontology in order to allow spatio-temporal and thematic queries.

Article Title: Comparative Study of China's Provincial Human Resource Development Level
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: human resource development; factor analysis; cluster analysis; provincial comparison
Abstract: This paper committed a comparative study and evaluation to the status of China's provincial human resource development through establishing a indicator system of regional human resource development. Using methods of factor analysis and cluster analysis, we get the result that Beijing has the highest level of human resource development, Shanghai and other five provinces and cities rank in the second category, which belong to the less developed regions, which is still far behind Beijing. Zhejiang and other eight provinces rank in the third category, which are general area of human resource development. Jilin and other fifteen provinces rank in the fourth category, which are underdeveloped regions in human resource development.

Article Title: Explore Innovation Dynamics of Online-Game Industry: A Case Study of Shanda's Platform Enterprise Reform
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: platform enterprise; online game; radical innovation; strategy alliance
Abstract: This case study is to explore a new form of strategy alliance in innovation industry, especially where radical innovations are crucial but the implementation needs excess resource to carry out. Online game industry is selected for its innovation-intensive nature. The methodology of case study is adopted for the real-field research in Shanda Interactive Entertament Limited. Implicit from the case is important for most high-technology industries, which indicates that in order to maintain the activeness of industrial innovation dynamics, the leading companies in the industry could share their knowledge and resource with small start-ups to create sustainable innovative business ecology.

Authors: Chen, HX; Zhang, JB; Ge, ZB
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chen, H. X.; Zhang, J. B.; Ge, Z. B.
Article Title: The Economic Growth Mode of China's Real Estate Development Industry Based on the Cobb-Douglas Production Function
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: C-D production function; China; Economic growth; Extensive degree; Intensive degree; Real estate development
Abstract: Many studies point out that the economic growth of Chinese real estate development industry should change from extensive to intensive type, but there is rarely quantitative judgment or analysis about this. In this paper, a production function model is established to estimate the extensive and intensive degree of Chinese real estate development industry based on the Cobb-Douglas production function, and an empirical analysis of Chinese real estate development industry from 1997 to 2007 is given: Analysis shows that, in Chinese real estate development industry, economic growth is driven by investment and economies of scale are increasing in recent years, intensive utilization rate of land is higher than funds and labors since 2003, composite intensive degree is less than 0.5 in most years, extensive and extensive-reigned economic growth of real estate development industry appear in turn. The composite intensive degree is increased from 2003-2007 than 1997-2002, but only a little bit more than zero. More effective measures should be taken to accelerate economic growth of Chinese real estate development industry from extensive to intensive style.

Article Title: Research on Legal Issues of the Realization of the Priority Right to Be Repaid on the Construction Project Fund
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project found; Priority right; Legal mortgage right
Abstract: To solve the problems of project payment in arrears in construction industry, the article 286 of Contract Law (1999) stipulated the contractor's priority for construction fund. with the emergence and development of social law, the law has gradually inclined to the vulnerable groups that need special protection. It is obvious that the article 286 of the Contract Law has provided an interpretation of the priority right to be repaid on the project fund for protecting the vulnerable groups. However, due to the deficiencies of the relevant law, the realization of the right is not ideal, based on analysis the nature of the said right, it put forward some countermeasures and suggestions, in order to provide a reference for solving the realization of the priority right to be repaid on project fund. Therefore, this paper starts with defining the nature of right for the priority right to be repaid on the project funds, and then analyses encountered obstructive factors during the process of realization. Finally, it put forwards some countermeasures in order to protect the right of contractors and peasant workers.

Abstract: In the highly competitive market conditions, the enterprise as an independent economic entity, profit enterprises are subject eternity. ISO9000 quality management system certification is to improve quality management, perfect quality management system an effective way. Brought about by the increase in corporate earnings, which includes tangible increase in sales, market share expansion, but also including corporate intangible assets increased job efficiency. Will help to reduce internal failure costs and external failure costs, reduce duplication of audit costs incurred. Will also have a must add to the cost of expenses such as authentication, prevention costs and appraisal costs and so on. These three aspects together, affect the level of business efficiency. The increase in revenue, cost reduction is not a quality management system certification can provide a natural advantage, it depends on the quality management system certification of validity, the only serious business in accordance with the requirements of ISO9000 standards, and ongoing continuous improvement, to help Quality Management System Certification exert the effectiveness of the enterprise for better results

Article Title: The Scale and Limit of Government
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: the size of government; government consumption; public product; market growth
Abstract: With the deepening of the socialization of national economy, the public section of economy shows a 'Wagner trend' both in quantity and in proportion and consequently causes the increasing growth of government scale. The increase meets the demands of high efficiency in allocation of key element resources and improves the growth and development of public goods market. However, there is a limit to the size of government. How to scientifically define the size of government is an important and practical issue to be seriously studied and resolved in China's administrative reform.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Real Estate Market Risk and Early Warning of Guangzhou City
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; Risk; Early warning; Guangzhou
Abstract: Since 2005, Chinese real estate prices in major cities have been rising rapidly and then spreading to other parts of the country. This question has caused wide public concern from national regulatory authority to common people. Once again, local governments attach importance to the research on risk prewarning of real estate market. The risk of real estate market is of objectivity and inevitability, but local governments at each level should predict and eliminate the risk by means of macroeconomic control. This is the purpose and significance of this paper. Based on yellow warning methods in macro-economic warning system and statistical data of Guangzhou in 1995-2008, the paper chooses the rate of growth of real estate average prices as precaution index, the growth rate of architectural and non-metallic materials price, the growth rate of under-construction area, the ratio between sale area and completed area in real estate are selected as leading indicators, CPI as isochronous and lag indicators by means of tcorrelation analysis. Diffusion Indexes are built based on those indexes, and risk evaluation on real estate market in Guangzhou city between 1997 and 2008 is made. After this, the precaution signals are given between 2009 and 2010.

Authors: Jiang, LX; Cheng, H; She, JJ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jiang Lixuan; Cheng Hu; She Jianjun
Article Title: Knowledge Management Applied in MTR project management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; urban metro project; project management; life cycle
Abstract: China is entering rapid development of urban MTR construction stage, many local MTR construction projects have been launched one after another. In order to accomplish a project in high-quality and efficiency, any further advance in the management of Whole Life Cycle should be realized by means of knowledge management. How to make the similar projects fulfilling the application of shareable knowledge, to reduce the probability of repeatability error, to improve operating efficiency, to ensure investment effect; and how to raise the whole level of MTR project management through knowledge management, are the problems that need to be solved. This article focuses on three levels of knowledge management application in the MTR project management: The first one is the KM of every main party involved in the MTR project, and based on it the Metro project sponsor or project management enterprise takes knowledge integration and management into consideration from the angle of Whole Life Cycle. The second level is KM application in city metro networks construction. Due to the formation of urban metro networks undergoing a very long period, knowledge accumulation, knowledge utilization and knowledge innovation can continually improve the decision-making and operability of municipal government in metro project, and the expert group commissioned by government can in particular be a primary actor. Thirdly, it is about KM application in inter-urban metro project. As China's urban metro projects are implemented widely, the entire level of metro project management can be greatly improved through knowledge sharing and knowledge innovation among cities, MTR association may play an important role.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The empirical study on the volatility relationship between real estate market and capital market in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate market; capital market; quantitative study
Abstract: First of all, the article selects the real estate investment growth rate and sales growth rate as the key variables of operation in real estate market. The actual utilization of foreign capital and the bank loan are on the representatives of the operation of capital markets. Secondly, this paper examines the fluctuating relationship between real estate market and capital market using the dates from 1998 to 2007 in our country to provide quantitative evidence and addition. for the study in two markets. Finally, it draws following conclusions through the study: (1) From the descriptive statistics and trend analysis, the fluctuating relationship in two markets is consistent, except for a great fluctuations in 1991-1994. The fluctuations gradually smooth during the rest. (2) The cointegration analysis and vector error correction (VEC) model shows a balanced relationship at the length of period exists in the two markets; the general interaction of time-delay is 2 to 4 years. Actual utilization of foreign investment is on the positive effect of real estate investment, and is the negative effects of real estate sales. But real estate investment and sales are being reflected positively by bank loans. (3) Granger causality test shows that the growth rate of real estate investment, real estate sales and growth rates were both cause and effect relationship between the use of foreign capital. The bank loan is with a one-way causal relationship to the property market, but the contrary does not hold. (4) The impulse response and analysis of variance showed that in the capital market the use of foreign capital to the real estate market is greater impact and contribution than the bank loans.

Article Title: Identifying Critical Sustainability Criteria and Indicators for Australian Highway Infrastructure Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Sustainable development; highway infrastructure; construction management; project delivery; Delphi
Keywords Plus: DELPHI
Abstract: Incorporating sustainability principles in construction works is both critical and beneficial. However, the lack of common understanding on what constitutes sustainability in real-life projects causes difficulty to push sustainability agenda forward. As a result, sustainability deliverables are not tangible at the project level or simply neglected. Under such circumstance, policies on sustainability remain largely ideological and are often not realized to its full potentials. To move forward, sustainability criteria and indicators are to be agreed upon among the industry professionals. This paper discusses the preliminary findings of Delphi study, an integral part of a QUT research, aimed at identifying critical sustainability criteria and indicators for Australian highway infrastructure projects. It paves the way for further identification of solutions for each critical indicator at a subsequent stage. It is expected that integrated decision-making guidelines on sustainability for Australian road infrastructure projects will be developed at the end of the research.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Economic Incentive Mechanisms for Promoting the Application of Renewable Energy in Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Renewable Energy; Application in Construction; Economic Incentive mechanism; Multifaceted Subjects
Abstract: Application of renewable energy can effectively reduce the consumption of fossil energy; it will not only produce large economic benefit, but also bring favorable environmental benefit. However, resulted from lacking of effective incentive mechanism, the proportion of applying renewable energy in construction is still very low. On the basis of learning from advanced experiments of developed countries, through analyzing the problems arising from the application of renewable energy in construction, this paper identifies the key problems. Depending on the theories of sustainable development and green building, addressing the solution on external problems as the main object, this paper analyses and designs incentive principles, objects, methods and steps, proposes the incentive methods for different levels of both central and local governments, which directed forward multifaceted subjects, such as real estate development companies, manufacturing enterprises, housing consumers, R&D enterprises and intermediary service organizations. The study result provides foundations for constituting and implementing economic incentive policy on applying renewable energy in construction in China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Risk Management in the Views of the Stakeholders for Public Private Partnerships
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public Rrivate Partnership; Risk Management; Stakeholder Management
Abstract: PPP model has been applied in the industry of transportation, education, medical, environmental protection and others. There has been a marked increase in co-operation between governments and private sector. In China, nowadays, PPP is the effective measures to resolve the problem of lack of capitals and fees for the higher education.PPP model can bring in the private capital to help government to increase the investment of education.In the paper, the case study in dormitory development PPP project in Shenzhen University was applied to analyze the risks identification and allocation. Consequently, the stakeholder management program was introduced and researched in the process of risk management. It was indicated that understanding and implementing the Stakeholder Management (SM) was an essential step towards creating a strong initiatives for stakeholder involvement in the PPP project. It was feasible to manage risks in the views of stakeholder management and set up the SM model to assist the project management. The recommendations provided by the paper can act as a potential tool to the PPP project development.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Technology Innovation System Based on Knowledge Management in Construction Engineering
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Technology innovation; Knowledge management; Construction engineering; Social Network Analysis
Abstract: Industry, government and universities all over the world have demonstrated a heightened interest in innovation as a driver of economic growth. Technology innovation plays an important role in construction engineering, so the study on technology innovation in construction engineering is absolutely necessary for better management of technology innovation. In this paper Technology Innovation System (TIS) is proposed based on knowledge management which consists of five sub-systems, including: (1) Environmental Sub-system; (2) Target Sub-system; (3) Object Sub-system; (4) Behavior Sub-system;(5) Organization Sub-system; Each sub-system presents its own characteristics in technology innovation process. The core of TIS is knowledge management, and knowledge flows in each sub-system first, then it flows among all sub-systems. But numerous characteristics of construction engineering are not conducive to knowledge management in TIS, such as multi-parties own different knowledge styles, uncertainty, the R&D and technology innovation are usually separated processes, etc. In this paper Social Network Analysis is introduced to facilitate knowledge management, besides the framework of Social Network Analysis is presented in the end.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Study on the Sustainable Development of Nanjing Depending on its History and Culture's Tradition
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban Development Planning; Notion of Culture; Project Management; Friendly Environment; Abstemious Resources; Harmonious Society
Abstract: Nanjing forms its unique cultural style and urban taste within its long-term development and developed quickly since the Chinese reform and opening-up and its scale is continuous increasing. Depending on the history and culture's tradition of Nanjing city, by looking the city's sustainable development as a kind of systems engineering and using the theory of protect management, the paper discusses how to utilize the abundant Nanjing's nature resources of history and culture to impulse Nanjing forming a sustainable development's method with the distinctive characteristics, friendly environment and abstemious resources combining with the modern urban planning method and the burgeoning propaganda medium technology of city for upgrading the city taste and the life quality which goes with the sound economic development and building the Nanjing's harmonious society soon. This paper also hopes to give the decision makers of city building some useful advice about city propaganda presentation, environmetnal pollution treatment, bringing in personnel, building soft environment, making laws and policies and resource's intensive utilization.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Method of Inherent Defect Insurance Ratemaking
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: inherent defect insurance; premium rate; ratemaking
Abstract: With the rapid development of economy, the large-scale quick construction brought about a large number of quality defects, also caused a huge waste of social resources and endangered personal safety, however, the legal means to resolve quality defect disputes in the construction project is inefficiency and high-cost. Governments are seeking for an effective solution. Through inspecting the way to deal with the similar problems in the western countries, it was found that the inherent defect insurance system is an effective way. Studying reasonable ratemaking methods of inherent defect insurance can reduce its casualness and uncertainty, which also has important practical significance to popularize this insurance. The thesis first analyzed the component of inherent defect insurance rate, then determined the pure premium rate model applying the mathematical statistics method and the additional rate according to the specific operations of insurance companies, and finally adjusted the premium rate based on the risk analysis of specific underwriting projects. This method possessed certain operability and provided a new thought for the ratemaking of inherent defect insurance.

Authors: Xie, LL; Ning, Y; Ren, JS; Le, Y
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xie Linlin; Ning Yan; Ren Junshan; Le Yun
Article Title: Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation of Management System Validity for Large-scale Complex Programmes - Based on the Case of the World Expo 2010 Shanghai China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scale complex projects; Validity; Project Management system; Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation; the World Expo 2010 Shanghai
Abstract: Effective project management system plays a vital role in integrative management and systematical control of large-scale complex projects. By evaluating the validity of project management system, the merits and demerits in project management system may be found and successful practices, weakness and the potential risks in project management practice can be discovered. It is important for optimizing project management system and improving the performance of project management. In order to evaluate quantitatively the validity of project management system, an integrative evaluation index system and a fuzzy comprehensive evaluation model for large-scale complex project management systems are established in this paper. With the 2010 Shanghai World Expo project management system taken as a case study, it is found that the validity index of this project management system is 0.88, which can be seen as a benchmark level. The successful experiences in the design and operation of the management system in 2010 Shanghai Expo Programme make it a benchmark model for management systems of other large-scale complex projects at home or overseas.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu, Y. G.; Wu, S. H.
Article Title: The strategic analysis and research for the higher education for construction management of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Higher education for construction management; Development for educational subject; Construction industry
Abstract: Along with the reforming and opening policy and the large scale urbanization, the higher education for construction management of China has been developing rapidly. Meanwhile, depending on continuous exploration, innovation, construction and development, nearly 200 universities have started construction management specialty around China so far. After entering the new century, due to the rapid development of economic globalization and the China's entry into WTO, it is very important for our country to seek for more and higher qualified construction management professionals so that we can handle the serious market competition. To achieve this, the innovation of the mechanism for cultivating construction management professionals should be emphasized. Furthermore, since construction industry plays an important role in China's economy, the topic of how to develop the higher education for construction management has been concerned by different social circles of our country. By employing the statistic and comparative method, the paper not only analyzes the obstacles existed in the current mode of China's higher education for construction management under the conditions of global competition and cooperation, but also presents strategic suggestions concerning the developing access to the higher education for construction management of China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research of Flexible Information System of Real Estate Enterprise Cost Control Based on SOA
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: SOA; Cost control information system; Real estate enterprises; Flexible
Abstract: In order to reply on the constantly changing market environment, the management information system design has tended towards flexibility while the research is rare in the real estate industry. This paper uses the term flexible to describe the reaction capacity of the cost control system, and then extends it to the research of the flexible cost control system for real estate enterprises. Based on the analysis of the main contents and operation flow of the real estate cost control system, the paper utilizes service-oriented architecture (SOA) to put forward a five-tier structure of the flexible information system, and therefore designs a reconfigurable and extensible cost control system of the real estate enterprise. The whole system has the advantages of both low cost of development and maintenance. Furthermore, the system can provide fast, safe, convenient and the value-added service for real estate enterprises, thereby increases its operation benefit and market competitive power.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Relationship between Real Estate Price and Financial Market
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate price; variance decomposition; financial market; impulse response function
Abstract: Real estate industry is a capital-intensive industry, which is highly dependent on the financial market. In recent years, real-estate industry has enjoyed rapid development in China. Along with the changes of supply-demand relation and financial market in China's real estate market, the relationship structure of the real estate price and financial market changes gradually. The study on the relevant changes of the two markets has an important practical significance for macro-control. The paper makes a dynamic analysis on the real estate price and financial market in China by means of vector autoregression model (VAR), establishes a VAR model respectively according to the data of 2001-2005 and 2006-2008 and initially discusses the structure change of real estate price and financial market during 2001-2008 through analyzing the transfer effect of each financial market impact on real estate price in the two VAR models as well as the contribution degree of each variable in financial market to real estate price by utilizing impulse response function and variance decomposition.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on the Management of Design of the EPC Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: EPC project; Design; Management
Abstract: Design is an important phase in the performance of an international EPC (Engineering, Procurement and Construction) project. The design work is the basis of the order, purchase and transport of the main equipment for the project and it will also influence the program of the construction, and finally affect the time for completion of the whole project. Therefore, the management of the design work is to be treated as the master key in the performance of the contract of the project. This paper discusses the problems and countermeasures in the management design through a cement plant project in Middle East.

Authors: Wu, D; Yin, YF; Lawphongpanich, S
Author Full Names: Wu, Di; Yin, Yafeng; Lawphongpanich, Siriphong
Article Title: Optimal selection of build-operate-transfer projects on transportation networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Build-operate-transfer scheme; Mathematical program with equilibrium constraints; Network modeling; Pricing
Keywords Plus: ROAD NETWORK; MATHEMATICAL PROGRAMS; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; DESIGN; ALGORITHMS; CONTRACTS; MODEL
Abstract: This paper considers the problem of how to select highway projects for the build-operate-transfer (BOT) development with the objective of improving the social benefit while ensuring the marketability of those selected. The problem can be viewed as a tri-level leader-follower game and is formulated as a mixed integer program with equilibrium constraints. Without solving the associated problem, we show that optimal tolls and travel times on selected BOT highways can be determined from their attributes under mild assumptions. This leads to an efficient heuristic algorithm for solving the project selection problem. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Shiwakoti, N; Sarvi, M; Rose, G; Burd, M
Author Full Names: Shiwakoti, Nirajan; Sarvi, Majid; Rose, Geoff; Burd, Martin
Article Title: Animal dynamics based approach for modeling pedestrian crowd egress under panic conditions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Pedestrians panic; Biological entities; Self-organization; Crowd dynamics; Evacuation; Scaling
Keywords Plus: ARGENTINE ANT; MOVEMENT
Abstract: Collective movement is important during emergencies such as natural disasters or terrorist attacks, when rapid egress is essential for escape. The development of quantitative theories and models to explain and predict the collective dynamics of pedestrians has been hindered by the lack of complementary data under emergency conditions. Collective patterns are not restricted to humans, but have been observed in other non-human biological systems. In this study, a mathematical model for crowd panic is derived from collective animal dynamics. The development and validation of the model is supported by data from experiments with panicking Argentine ants (Linepithema humile). A first attempt is also made to scale the model parameters for collective pedestrian traffic from those for ant traffic, by employing a scaling concept approach commonly used in biology. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Xu, JJ; Yip, TL; Marlow, PB
Author Full Names: Xu, Jane Jing; Yip, Tsz Leung; Marlow, Peter B.
Article Title: The dynamics between freight volatility and fleet size growth in dry bulk shipping markets
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight markets; Freight volatility; Fleet size; GARCH
Keywords Plus: TERM STRUCTURE; SPOT; PRICES; SCALE; RATES
Abstract: This paper studies the relationship between the time-varying volatility of dry bulk freight rates and the change of the supply of fleet trading in dry bulk markets. An abundance of research has been done to understand the time-varying characteristics of freight rate volatility, yet few have discussed the determinants of freight volatility. We therefore examine freight volatility against the changes in fleet size and other shipping market variables over January 1973-October 2010. The study employs a two-step model specification. The first step is the measurement of freight rate volatility through an AR-GARCH model; the second step is the analysis of the relationship between freight rate volatility and fleet size growth through a GMM regression. We confirm similar findings in the literature that freight rate volatility is time varying. Furthermore, the results reveal that the change in fleet size positively affects freight rate volatility, while the spot rate volatility of Capesize dry bulk exhibits a stronger reaction to the change in fleet size. The results of this study contribute in a general sense to understanding the systematic risk of shipping markets. Crown Copyright (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Masih-Tehrani, B; Xu, SH; Kumara, S; Li, HJ
Author Full Names: Masih-Tehrani, Behdad; Xu, Susan H.; Kumara, Soundar; Li, Haijun
Article Title: A single-period analysis of a two-echelon inventory system with dependent supply uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dependent supply disruptions; Multi-source and assembly structures; Supermodular and orthant dependence orders; Copula; Optimal inventory policy; Performance bounds
Keywords Plus: RANDOM YIELD; STOCHASTIC DEMAND; ASSEMBLY SYSTEMS; CAPACITY; MODELS; PERFORMANCE; MANAGEMENT
Abstract: Disruptions and random supplies have been important sources of uncertainty that should be considered in the design and control of supply chains. There have been many real world examples in which a single catastrophic event has simultaneously degraded the capabilities of several suppliers leading to considerable erosion of profits and goodwill for a company. However, the literature on analytical models that account for the dependence nature of disruptions and its impact on supply chain performance is sparse. In this paper, we consider an m-manufacturer, 1-retailer, newsvendor inventory system with stochastically dependent manufacturing capacities, caused by random disruptions that may simultaneously inflict damages to the capacities of the manufacturers. We develop the structural/analytical properties of key performance measures and optimal inventory policies for the multi-source and assembly inventory systems. We show that stochastic dependence in disruptions can have opposite effects on system performance in the multi-source and assembly systems. While risk diversification is preferred in the multi-source system, risk concentration is preferred in the assembly system. Our results also suggest that, if the retailer ignores the effect of dependent disruptions, then in the multi-source structure, it would underestimate the cost, overestimate the fill rate, and order more units than the optimum; however, in the assembly structure, the opposite would happen. We perform a comprehensive numerical study to validate our analytical results and generate useful managerial and operational insights for effective risk management of supply chains in the presence of dependent supply uncertainty. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Panayides, PM; Lambertides, N; Savva, CS
Author Full Names: Panayides, Photis M.; Lambertides, Neophytos; Savva, Christos S.
Article Title: The relative efficiency of shipping companies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Shipping firms; Relative efficiency; Fundamental analysis
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; STOCHASTIC FRONTIER MODEL; OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY; BOOK VALUE; DEA; PRODUCTIVITY; PERFORMANCE; VALUATION; EARNINGS; EQUITY
Abstract: This paper contributes to the maritime transport literature by examining the relative efficiency of firms in the three key sectors of the shipping industry, i.e. dry, wet and container shipping. Two relative efficiency models are developed to assess relative market and relative operating performance efficiency. The theoretical framework of fundamental analysis is adopted to derive the inputs and outputs in the efficiency models which are assessed using data envelopment and stochastic frontier analysis. Shipping companies were found to exhibit average market efficiency. Market and operating performance efficiency of maritime firms is not consistent. Tanker companies are more market efficient whereas container shipping firms are found to have high operating performance efficiency but were market inefficient. Dry bulk firms were found to have the lowest ratings of market efficiency. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Buhrkal, K; Zuglian, S; Ropke, S; Larsen, J; Lusby, R
Author Full Names: Buhrkal, Katja; Zuglian, Sara; Ropke, Stefan; Larsen, Jesper; Lusby, Richard
Article Title: Models for the discrete berth allocation problem: A computational comparison
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Berth allocation problem; Container terminals; Mixed integer programming
Keywords Plus: SEARCH; HEURISTICS; ALGORITHM
Abstract: In this paper we consider the problem of allocating arriving ships to discrete berth locations at container terminals. This problem is recognized as one of the most important processes for any container terminal. We review and describe three main models of the discrete dynamic berth allocation problem, improve the performance of one model, and, through extensive numerical tests, compare all models from a computational perspective. The results indicate that a generalized set-partitioning model outperforms all other existing models. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Operational macroscopic modeling of complex urban road intersections
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic flow modeling; Intersection modeling; Cell-transmission model; Kinematic waves
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; KINEMATIC WAVE MODEL; TRAFFIC FLOW; SIMULATION; NETWORK; ASSIGNMENT; MERGE
Abstract: This article describes a new approach to the macroscopic first order modeling and simulation of traffic flow in complex urban road intersections. The framework is theoretically sound, operational, and comprises a large body of models presented so far in the literature. Working within the generic node model class of Tampere et al. (2011), the approach is developed in two steps. First, building on the incremental transfer principle of Daganzo et al. (1997), an incremental node model for general road intersections is developed. A limitation of this model (as of the original incremental transfer principle) is that it does not capture situations where the increase of one flow decreases another flow, e.g., due to conflicts. In a second step, the new model is therefore supplemented with the capability to describe such situations. A fixed-point formulation of the enhanced model is given, solution existence and uniqueness are investigated, and two solution algorithms are developed. The feasibility and realism of the new approach is demonstrated through a synthetic and a real case study. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The econometric estimation of airports' cost function
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airport cost functions; Hedonic outputs; Marginal costs; Input prices; Stochastic frontier
Keywords Plus: ALLOCATIVE INEFFICIENCY; TECHNICAL INEFFICIENCY; FRONTIER; EFFICIENCY; INDUSTRY; WINBUGS; MODELS; BIAS
Abstract: The econometric estimation of cost functions has been proposed in the literature as a suitable approach in order to obtain estimations of marginal costs, efficiency levels and scale elasticities for transport industries. However, regarding the airport industry, no significant attention has been paid in developing an airport-specific estimation methodology rather than adapting the procedures applied to other industries. The lack of comparable airport data is one of the causes which could explain the scarcity of this literature in the past, as well as the use of very limited approaches to explain airport technology. This paper tries to overcome these limitations by developing an airport-specific methodology to estimate a multi-output long-run cost function using an unbalanced pooled database on 161 airports worldwide. The specification of hedonically-adjusted aircraft operations, domestic and international passengers, cargo and commercial revenues in the output vector, as well as the calculation of input prices are discussed. Both technical and allocative inefficiencies are specified in the model using a Stochastic Frontier method that has been estimated through Bayesian Inference and Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yao, T; Friesz, TL; Wei, MM; Yin, YF
Author Full Names: Yao, Tao; Friesz, Terry L.; Wei, Mike Mingcheng; Yin, Yafeng
Article Title: Congestion derivatives for a traffic bottleneck
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion option; Congestion derivative; Bottleneck model
Keywords Plus: USER EQUILIBRIUM; ROAD CONGESTION; DEPARTURE TIME; ROUTE CHOICE; MODEL; CAPACITY; HIGHWAY; NETWORK; COST
Abstract: Historically, congestion pricing is considered to be an efficient mechanism used to decrease total social cost by charging users' true costs including congestion externalities. Congestion pricing under uncertainty has been relatively little studied. In this paper, we review the literature on deterministic congestion pricing and introduce possible sources of uncertainty for a simple bottleneck. We show that, when prices involve exogenous uncertainty that is independent of the central authority and of individual drivers, total social cost may be expressed in closed form as a function of departure time and uncertainty. We also show that there is a class of financial derivatives based on congestion that have the potential to reduce total social cost. In particular, such derivatives are shown to have the potential to alter drivers' departure behavior and reduce drivers' risks of high variance in trip costs, including congestion tolls. Finally, numerical formulations and examples are given to justify the robustness of our results with respect to more general congestion uncertainty. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The impacts of congestion on commercial vehicle tour characteristics and costs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Congestion modeling; Carrier costs; Urban freight; City logistics
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC CONGESTION; ROUTING PROBLEMS; TIME; BEHAVIOR; PERCEPTIONS
Abstract: Analytical modeling and insights, numerical experiments, and real-world tour data are used to understand the impact of congestion on urban tour characteristics, carriers' costs, and distance/time traveled. This paper categorizes tours into three classes based on their tour efficiency and variable costs structure. Travel time/distance between customers and depot is found to be a crucial factor that exacerbates the negative impacts of congestion. Travel time variability is a significant factor only when travel time between depot and customers is considerable in relation to the maximum tour duration. For each customer, it is possible to define a dimensionless coefficient that provides an indication of the relative impact of congestion on routing constraints. Congestion also affects carriers' cost structure, as congestion worsens the relative weight of wages and overtime escalates and the relative weight of distance related costs decrease. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chipman, H; George, E; Lemp, J; McCulloch, R
Author Full Names: Chipman, Hugh; George, Edward; Lemp, Jason; McCulloch, Robert
Article Title: Bayesian flexible modeling of trip durations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Markov Chain Monte Carlo; Boosting; Ensemble modeling
Abstract: Recent advances in Bayesian modeling have led to stunning improvements in our ability to flexibly and easily model complex high-dimensional data. Flexibility comes from the use of a very large number of parameters without fixed dimension. Priors are placed on the parameters to avoid over-fitting and sensibly guide the search in model space for appropriate data-driven model choice. Modern computational, high dimensional search methods (in particular Markov Chain Monte Carlo) then allow us to search the parameter space. This paper introduces the application of BART, Bayesian Additive Regression Trees, to modelling trip durations. We have survey data on characteristics of trips in the Austin area. We seek to relate the trip duration to features of the household and trip characteristics. BART enables one to make inferences about the relationship with minimal assumptions and user decisions. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Herrera, Juan C.; Bayen, Alexandre M.
Article Title: Incorporation of Lagrangian measurements in freeway traffic state estimation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Lagrangian sensing; Traffic state estimation; GPS-enabled cell-phones; Probe data collection
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; CONSERVATION-LAWS; DENSITY; ASSIMILATION; WAVES
Abstract: Cell-phones equipped with a global positioning system (GPS) provide new opportunities for location-based services and traffic estimation. When traveling on-board vehicles, these phones can be used to accurately provide position and velocity of the vehicle as probe traffic sensors. This article presents a new technique to incorporate mobile probe measurements into highway traffic flow models, and compares it to a Kalman filtering approach. These two techniques are both used to reconstruct traffic density. The first technique modifies the Lighthill-Whitham-Richards partial differential equation (PDE) to incorporate a correction term which reduces the discrepancy between the measurements (from the probe vehicles) and the estimated state (from the model). This technique, called Newtonian relaxation, nudges the model to the measurements. The second technique is based on Kalman filtering and the framework of hybrid systems, which implements an observer equation into a linearized flow model. Both techniques assume the knowledge of the fundamental diagram and the conditions at both boundaries of the section of interest. The techniques are designed in a way in which does not require the knowledge of on- and off-ramp detector counts, which in practice are rarely available. The differences between both techniques are assessed in the context of the Next Generation Simulation program (NGSIM), which is used as a benchmark data set to compare both methods. They are finally tested with data from the Mobile Century experiment obtained from 100 Nokia N95 mobile phones on I-880 in California on February 8, 2008. The results are promising, showing that the proposed methods successfully incorporate the GPS data in the estimation of traffic. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Dadkar, Y; Nozick, L; Jones, D
Author Full Names: Dadkar, Yashoda; Nozick, Linda; Jones, Dean
Article Title: Optimizing facility use restrictions for the movement of hazardous materials
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Hazardous materials; Routing; Game theory
Keywords Plus: GAME-THEORY; RISK; RELIABILITY; NETWORK
Abstract: The modeling tools that have been developed over the last 25 years for the identification of routes for hazmat shipments emphasize the tradeoffs between cost minimization to the shipper/carrier and controlling the natural consequences that would stem from all accident. As the terrorist threat has grown, it has become clear that a new perspective. which allows for the representation of the goals and activities of terrorists, must be incorporated into these routing models. Government agencies can determine which specific facilities to restrict for each class of material and for which times of the day and/or week. This paper develops a game-theoretic model of the interactions among government agencies. shippers/carriers and terrorists as a framework for the analysis It also develops an effective Solution procedure for this game Finally. it illustrates the methodology on a realistic case study. (C) 2009 Elsevier Lid All rights reserved.

Authors: Lee, DH; Cao, JX; Shi, QX; Chen, JH
Author Full Names: Lee, Der-Horng; Cao, Jin Xin; Shi, Qixin; Chen, Jiang Hang
Article Title: A heuristic algorithm for yard truck scheduling and storage allocation problems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container terminal operations; Yard truck scheduling; Storage allocation; Heuristic algorithm
Keywords Plus: CONTAINER TERMINALS; OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; SPACE ALLOCATION; VEHICLES
Abstract: The yard truck scheduling and the storage allocation are two important decision problems affecting the efficiency of container terminal operations. This paper proposes a novel approach that integrates these two problems into a whole. The objective is to minimize the weighted sum of total delay of requests and the total travel time of yard trucks. Due to the intractability of the proposed problem, a hybrid insertion algorithm is designed for effective problem solutions. Computational experiments are conducted to examine the key factors of the problem and the performance of the proposed heuristic algorithm. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Principles of micro-behavior commodity transport modeling
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Commodity transport modeling; Commodity flow; Freight traffic; Shipper behavior; Carrier behavior; Agent-based modeling; Market simulation
Abstract: This paper presents an agent-based approach to commodity transport modeling. It assesses the effects of behavior-oriented transport policy measures while taking complex logistics reaction patterns into account. It is structured by modules describing company generation, supplier choice, shipment-size choice, carrier choice and tour construction. The behavior of individual actors is simulated using normative logistics models and accumulated market knowledge. Using a bottom-up approach, shippers and carriers interact through simulated auctions of transport contracts resulting in the generation of tours. Simulations using the model prototype INTERLOG calibrated with German data demonstrate the capabilities and limitations of this approach. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Effect of Minimum Wage Regulation on Employment
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: minimum wage regulation; 'Labor Contract Law'; employment effect
Keywords Plus: FAST-FOOD INDUSTRY
Abstract: We use survey data of 439 enterprises in GuangDong and FuJian provinces and DID method to compare the effect of minimum wage regulation in 2007 and 2008. In 2008 minimum wage regulation hurt the employment of peasant-workers more severely than in 2007, while not hurting the employment of urban workers more severely. Futher analysis proves the reason for the former is the more strict supervision condition caused by the enaction of 'Labor Contract Law',while the reason for the latter being the dual employment system in which the rights of urban workers has been protected more perfectly than peasant-workers all along. These remind us 'Labor Contract Law' may affect employment indirectly by enforcing other regulation measures such as minimum wage regulation.

Author Keywords: population ageing; public finance; fiscal policy
Abstract: China faces significant population ageing over the next 40 years This will increase public spending on pensions, health care, and subsidies of social welfare, while tax revenues will fall This paper analyzes the fiscal challenges China faces due to ageing population, some existing problems were discussed under the current public expenditure and tax system, and finally some possible options of fiscal policy were put forward to cope with the population ageing

Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: BIM; Large-scale projects; Information management
Abstract: At present, the architecture industry has also welcomed an unprecedented peak time along with fast economic development of our country. The proportion of the large-scale projects which occupies in the social fixed assets investment is also getting higher and higher. Large-scale projects' own characteristics determine its' huge amount of information. If its information lack of management, that will make the efficiency and accuracy of the transmission of information greatly reduced, resulting in the low efficiency of the project management. This article holds that the integration of information is the key to the information management of projects, and an important way of information integration is to construct building information model. After analyzing the characteristics of information management of the large-scale projects, this article introduced the concept of the building information model. On the basis of that, this article researched information management of the large-scale projects based on the building information model, and finally discussed the suggestions of successful uses of building information model in information management of large-scale projects.

Author Full Names: He, H. Q.; Xu, Y. S.
Article Title: A Research on the Informatization Capacity Maturity Model for Construction Enterprise in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Informatization; CMM; Construction enterprise
Abstract: Informatization is the developing trend of construction management, and the research on the maturity of it is useful to the strategic selection and implementation of construction enterprise informatization. In this paper, the definition of informatization maturity and importance of maturity model are analyzed from a professional angel and the chief framework of informatization maturity is established on the basis of software capability maturity theory. The contents of the framework include five subsystems such as management capacity maturity, implementation capacity maturity, software capacity maturity, personnel capacity maturity and environment capacity maturity. The integrated informatization capacity maturity evaluation framework of construction enterprise is composed of these five aspects. The present paper puts forward an elementary model of building enterprise informatization maturity based on the analysis on the concept and significance of building enterprise informatization and informatization maturity. This model will provide valuable instruction to the implementation of informatization in building corporations.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on PPP contract models for Urban Rail Transit (URT) projects and related risk analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: URT (Urban Rail Transit); PPP (Public Private Partnership); SPC (special purpose company); Financing
Abstract: In light of the eleventh five-year plan (2006-2010), the Chinese Government sets the development of URT as a focus of urbanization and modernization. Now, total 15 mega-cities in China have submitted construction planning of URT system and another 15 mega-cities are under preparation. By 2010, total 55 lines (1500km) of URT will be put into operation in 15 cities of PRC, with total investment over 600 billion RMB. From 2010 to 2015, another 1700km URT lines will be under construction. In long-future, by 2050, China will own an URT system with rail-length over 4500km(1), which means pretty huge capital investment. Due to intensive investment, capital shortage appears to be the biggest barrier to the Government. With such a background, as a good alternative to public financing, PPP (Public Private Partnership) is testified far more than a pure financing method. So PPP is also helpful to deliver Urban Rail Transit products. This thesis is based upon the principle that public sector in China has heavy financial pressure, while social private investors would like to win as much profit as possible in URT this new field, by means of involvement or/and investment. Therefore, I summarize here several possible PPP contract models which are applicable to URT projects in China. Detailed model structures will be analyzed, together with allocation of accompanied risks respectively (Public vs. Private sector). In detail, the contract models can be BTO (Build - Transfer - Operate), SBOT (Subsidy in Build - Operate - Transfer), BSOT (Build - Subsidy in Operate - Transfer) and BLT (Built - Lease - Transfer). In addition, they will be analyzed intergraded with land-development thinking. At the end, as a summary, a table-form comparison of above four PPP contract models will be made, with criteria like who founds SPC, Ownership of SPC (Special Purpose Company) and its assets, Operated by, Financing, Refinancing, Risk distribution, Operation efficiency, Financial

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jiang Shijie; Lv Weisheng; Shen Liyin; Zhou Li
Article Title: The Relationship between Infrastructure Investment and Coordinated Urban and Rural Development in China and its Significance: A Review
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Infrastructure Investment; Coordinated Urban and Rural Development; Relationship; Equality; Efficiency
Abstract: With economic growth in the west, the theory of equality and efficiency has gone through three major stages: from the end of 19th century to early 20th century, welfare economics represented by economic interventionism, neo-classic synthesis and welfare economic school advocated the priority of equality; following World War II, scholars, mainly those believing in economic liberalism, promoted the priority of efficiency and free market mechanism as a countermeasure against efficiency crisis emerging from the western countries. On the basis of equality and efficiency, the article aims at expounding the relationship between infrastructure investment and coordinated urban and rural development from political, economic and social perspectives. In addition, by commenting on the studies in this field, this article reviews the history of coordinated urban and rural development, and envisions the future and significance of studying the relationship between infrastructure investment and coordinated urban and rural development. Table I.

Article Title: Evaluating 'Process of project delivery' between PRC and EU aid funded projects on a project site
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: processes of project delivery; donor aid
Abstract: A process is a group of activities designed to transform a set of inputs into the desired outputs. A well-defined set of processes, supported and implemented by various teams in performing the process is a key to project management. This paper evaluates the processes of project deliveries during the execution stage on a project site. It is based on a case study construction project of two different donor-aid funded projects under PRC Government and the EU aid program respectively. The processes of project deliveries on that particular project site were based on two different approaches and arrangement of which, they reflect respective donor countries/organization procedures and preferences for such project deliveries. The two funded projects were executed approximately at the same time in a particular project site and managed by the client's representative under a 'special arrangement'. The two projects were bonded by the conditions of contract between respective donor agencies and the contractors. In addition, under this 'special arrangement', a Service Contract, Memorandums of Understanding (MoU) and Terms of References (ToR) between various project parties were signed to help define roles and responsibilities during the projects' execution.
