Article Title: Setting the Margin Level of Stock Market in China-An Empirical Research Based on Extreme Value Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: margin trade; margin level; extreme value theory; VaR; ARMA-GARCH
Abstract: The problem of Margin level is the key issue of margin trading. The ratio of margin trading can be set based on the VaR of stock market. We use extreme value theory (EVT) for estimating the tail of the residual distribution of the ARMA-GARCH model. Our method for estimating VaR can overcome the errors of non-independent distribution estimated on EVT. We choose shanghai stock index and other three stocks of different volatility as empirical example. The result can be a reference as the ratio of margin trading in China.

Article Title: Dynamic network design for reverse logistics operations under uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Reverse logistics; Dynamic network design; Stochastic programming; Simulated annealing
Keywords Plus: PRODUCT RECOVERY; LOCATION PROBLEM; OPTIMIZATION; ALGORITHM; MODEL
Abstract: The design of reverse logistics network has attracted growing attention with the stringent pressures from environmental and social requirements. In general, decisions about reverse logistics network configurations are made on a long-term basis and factors influencing such reverse logistics network design may also vary over time. This paper proposes dynamic location and allocation models to cope with such issues. A two-stage stochastic programming model is further developed by which a deterministic model for multiperiod reverse logistics network design can be extended to account for the uncertainties. A solution approach integrating a recently proposed sampling method with a heuristic algorithm is also proposed in this research. A numerical experiment is presented to demonstrate the significance of the developed stochastic model as well as the efficiency of the proposed solution method. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Li, J; Zou, PXW; Cheng, H
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li Jie; Zou, Patrick X. W.; Cheng Hu
Article Title: Balancing Parties' benefits and understanding the risks in PPP highway Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: PPP; highway projects; private investors; users; benefits; risk
Abstract: Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) have been increasingly used globally to procure highway projects. Participants in such projects come to project negotiation with different concerns and objectives. For example, private investors and their financiers seek to reap adequate returns on investment within a short timeframe in sufficiently stable environments. Government wants to maximize productivity efficiency, ensure the project achieves relevant quality, environmental standards and social objectives. Publics pay tolls and other charges for using the highway. Therefore, balancing different party's objectives are necessary. Based on review of existing highway concession contracts, this paper argues toll adjustment is the most important measure to balance project participants' benefits during the contract concession period. Following this, the paper proposes toll adjustment should consider not only economic risks to protect investor's benefit, but also service performance risks to ensure users' interest. At last, based on literature review, risks with respect to toll adjustment were identified from private investors' and user's perspectives respectively.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Analysis of the Financing of Hydropower Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Hydropower; Projects Financing; Private Investment
Abstract: At present, hydropower is the only energy source that's both renewable and economically viable, making it possible to meet energy demand while contributing to the achievement of world environmental targets. However, many hydro schemes are financially uncompetitive when judged over the short term against other power generation technologies. This study focuses on the financing trends of hydroelectric projects, exploring the financing structure of hydropower project and details the different ways hydro projects are financed, discussing the private investment in the sector and also examine factors facing private hydropower investments, describing the critical role of multilateral and bilateral institutions in the hydropower project development and financing process, the impact of financing on tariffs costs and also demonstrates the interaction among the overall cost and specific financing variables, exploring different financial mechanisms and policies to promote hydropower investments in less developed countries. The study suggests the need for longer-term financing, more domestic funding and additional financing supports to better suit hydropower characteristics.

Article Title: Evolution of Community Structure of Local Construction Enterprises in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction industry; enterprise community; general contractor; specialist; evolution
Keywords Plus: POPULATION ECOLOGY; ORGANIZATIONS; DYNAMICS
Abstract: As the local construction enterprises in China are experiencing a special historic period of the structural evolution, it is badly needed to make analysis and interpretation concerned. By using the theory of organizational ecology, the composition of the communities of construction enterprises is analyzed. Comparing the existence status of the populations of general contractors and specialists of the construction industry in Shaanxi, Jiangsu and Zhejiang provinces, it is found that with the dimensions like the contract sum, enterprise assets, number of employees, total profit amount, etc. the general contractors have a higher resources occupancy ratio, whereas the specialists have a lower resources occupancy ratio; the degree of the evolution of the community structure of the construction enterprises in different regions is considerably different from each other. From the angle of the competition between the organization populations, the influencing factors of the dynamics of the community structure of construction enterprises are analyzed. Based on the resources partitioning theory, the direction of the evolution of the community structure of construction enterprises is expounded. The research results are conducive to the boosting of the evolution process of local construction enterprises and increasing the productivity of construction industrial organizations.

Article Title: Study in the Housing Guarantee System of Low and Middle -income Residents
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the low and middle -income residents; housing guarantee system; affordable house; low-rent housing; housing accumulation fund
Abstract: In recent years, As China's sustained rapid economic growth, the urbanization process speeds up, people's living has been greatly improved. How to resolve properly low-income groups guarantee of housing during the process of urban construction and development has become one of the key issues to maintain social stability, fully realize well-off, and promote the healthy development of cities.By in-depth analysis of the existing affordable housing system, low-rent housing system and housing accumulation fund system, the paper points out that China's housing security system's problems, Compared with major developed countries experiences and practices, it proposes path selection in China's housing security system development, its significance lies in China's housing security system for that stage of the development of their suggestions. Construction of low-income guarantee housing system is a complex engineering, at this stage insist the principle that the Government is in charge of guarantee housing construction so as to expand the size and scope of protection. To explore the mode of operation of closed-end guarantee housing, so that it is effective in the operation of guarantee policies.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Decision Making to Support an Integrated Infrastructure Supply Chain Industrial Ecological Approach within Public Private Partnerships
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: interdependencies; emergent properties; complex adaptive systems; public private partnerships; fuzzy logic
Abstract: Supply chains are complex adaptive systems for which final performance depends upon numerous interdependent decisions made by numerous firms which synthesise inputs from various resources systems. The dynamic interdependent behaviour of social, economic, material and informational resource systems within eco-industrial settings that support the built environment life cycle supply chains can be studied at the supply chain level. The impact of megaprojects is significant and holds promise to explore the impact of decisions on various systems as it combines project and system boundaries. Megaprojects considered as major events within systems can produce critical revolutionary impacts on the systems within which they are embedded. The decisions that are made on megaprojects are central to risk management. Typically major infrastructure projects are procured through a form of public private partnership (PPP). The core principle of PPP is value for money which refers to the best available outcome attempting to take account of all benefits, costs and risks over the whole life of the procurement. In this paper the focus is on Australia where there has been considerable activity in the use of PPPs. With recent national infrastructure packages proposed to stimulate the economy due to the global financial crisis, decision modelling on risks is a relevant and critical matter not only in practice but also in the research community. PPPs encourage the whole-of-lifecycle approach in the procurement and management of public sector assets by transparently recognising the costs and risks associated with the whole life of the required service or facility, thus integrated whole of life supply chains can be considered. By creating a single point of responsibility for an entire project from inception through operation, a strong incentive is created for thinking about the effects that a design or construction decision will have on the effectiveness and efficiency of managing and maintaining a facility during its operational life. The decision to procure holistic supply chains becomes a much more viable commercial reality in the PPP environment than previously considered in the usual commercial construction spot transactional approach. These types of decisions tend to be imprecise, approximate and complex requiring justification and reasoning logic rather than the classical 'truth' logic. The purpose of this paper is to develop a theoretical decision framework which combines interdependency and multi-valued logic for supply chain procurement modelling..

Article Title: Environmental Protection Measures of Highway and its case analysis in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate enterprises; Niche; Real estate market
Abstract: Along with day-by-day growth of highway construction in China, highway makes great contribution for China's economy and social development. Meanwhile, highway also has brought many adverse effects to environment along its route and caused a series of environment questions, such as soil erosion, noise, waste gas and dust pollution. Environmental protection measures of Shanghai-Nanjing expansion highway are introduced, including water pollution preventing measures, noise prevention measures, measures of conservation of water and soil, measures of waste gas and dust processing, reduction spoil ground and temporary land area, and so on, which can provide reference for establishing environmental protection system of China's highway.

Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Abstract: Consumer preferences can be influenced by the choices of other consumers in many ways. For example, through imitative (or bandwagon) and escaping (or snob) behaviors. Consumption choices are adopted with regard to a reference group. In this paper we propose a model in which agents can be not only locally connected to their reference group but, in some degree, also globally connected to all agents. The result is a network structure in which consumers are the nodes, and links are given by local and global interactions. In particular, links between agents belonging to different social groups can only be given by the presence of global interaction whereas local interaction creates a link between agents of the same class. The first aim of the paper is the building of a general model. The second one is the study, in a particular simplified case, of the dynamic behaviours of the model arising with different weights given to the local or to the global interactions. The main result of the paper is given by the determination of the conditions for the coexistence of different types of attractors (fixed points, periodic cycles and chaotic attractors) and by the numerical study of the global bifurcations that change the qualitative nature of the attractors and the structure of the basins of attraction.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Standard Bridge Engineering Supply Chain Operation Behavior Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Supply Chain Operations Reference Model; Simulation; Construction projectcomponent
Abstract: With the improvement of the construction technology, there are many new construction technologies introduced on the construction project. This paper tries to use systematic approaches for analysis and design of the construction supply chain operation model. Use of conventional procurement method may avoid material suspension or shortage, but earlier material entry in precast yard increases not only cost of material management but also cost of repeated handling, and interest loss due to excessive buy-in of material is intangible expenditure. Solving these sorts of the problems could rely on an efficient construction project supply chain management. According to the Supply Chain Operations Reference Model, SCOR Model of Supply Chain Council, SCC in 1996 and based on this model and application to the SCOR Model, this research places focus on the supply demand behaviors of the Taiwan High Speed Railroad (HSR) construction process as a case study. This paper uses the concept of SCOR Model and appliance to Dynamic Simulation software, namely, SIMPROCESS, trying to assist in establishing a hierarchical model to explore the behavior of construction supply chain process and developing a performance evaluation method which can help improve supply chain management (SCM) of the construction project. This study put forward a set of systematic methodology of supply chain analysis and design.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Housing Affordability Comparison of Chinese Big Cities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: House Price-to-Income Ratio; Housing Affordability Index; Payment-to-Income Ratio; Surplus after Mortgage Payment and Basic Expenditure
Abstract: In recent years, housing is a theme that concerned by most Chinese citizens. There exist vast differences in house prices among different cities in China, especially in large cities. So this paper collects the dates of house prices and family income from 2000 to 2008 in ten large Chinese cities in order to analyze residential housing affordability. A new indicator for Surplus after Monthly Mortgage Payment and Basic Expenditure is introduced in this study. Most cities experienced a great increase in both housing prices and house price-to-income ratio during the period 2005-2007. All these cities experienced a house price-to-income ratio decrease in 2008. The results indicate that house prices in all the sample cities are a burden for their citizens. Average-income families from Nanjing, Wuhan, Shenzhen, Chengdu and Chongqing enjoy better housing affordability than those in Beijing, Tianjin, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Hangzhou. At last, some policy suggestions are also provided.

Authors: Wu, HM; Zhang, X; Duan, XW
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wu Hongmei; Zhang Xing; Duan Xuewu
Article Title: Comparison of Construction Safety Legislation Framework between China and Other Developed Countries and Regions
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Comparison studies; construction safety; legislation frameworks; proposals
Abstract: The construction industry plays a major role in the economy of China. Along with the amazingly quick development of the construction industry, there happened many accidents in the construction site which have caused fatal personal injury and economic loss. Many countermeasures are adopted, such as legislative, economical, culture and scientific measures, etc. to deal with the problems, in which, undoubtedly, the legislative measure is the most important one. Hence this paper focuses on issues relating to the legislative framework. As legislative framework for construction safety was just initially established in China, it is far from satisfactory and therefore, further improvement is required. Some recommendations for improving the performance of legislative framework for construction safety in China are put forward in this paper based on comprehensive literature review and comparison research. All of the studies are based on the current safety legislation situations in construction industry in China, compared with those of developed countries and regions. At first, the current legislative framework relating to construction safety in China is introduced. Then comparatively analyses on it with those of USA, UK and Hong Kong are undertaken. The advanced experiences in these developed countries and regions are summarized and then recommendations relevant to China are put forward. It is proposed that safety considerations must be made from the very beginning of the construction planning to the back-out of the buildings. Then, this work is of extremely importance and urgency to promote the development of legislative framework on construction safety in China.

Authors: Xu, PP; Chan, E; Lam, P
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu Pengpeng; Chan, Edwin; Lam, Patrick
Article Title: A Framework for Energy Efficiency Retrofits of Existing Buildings (EEREB) in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: existing buildings; energy efficiency retrofits; energy saving
Abstract: Building sector contributes a large part of total energy consumption. For the past 20 years, Building Energy Consumption in China has been increasing at more than 10% each year. Currently, there are nearly 40 billion m2 buildings in China. 95% of existing buildings in China are highly-energy-consuming. The potential energy saving for existing building energy efficiency retrofits in China is massive. According to the characters of existing buildings' energy consumption, buildings energy consumption is divided into 5 categories. Because of the complicated energy consumption characters in China, there are many technological, managerial, and economical obstacles to conduct EEREB in China. Three main obstacles are analyzed in this paper: (1) lack of basic statistics data of energy consumption, (2) lack of money, (3) lack of policy support within the decision making process. At last, a framework for EEREB in China. This framework indicates government should combine with market and public together to organize the EEREB, and create a good environment to clear the obstacles and support the EEREB project.

Authors: Yu, WD; Yang, JB; Tseng, JCR; Liu, SJ; Chang, PL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Yu Wen-der; Yang Jyh-bin; Tseng, Judy C. R.; Liu Shen-jung; Chang Pei-lun
Article Title: Enhancing Engineering Services with Integrated Proactive Knowledge Management Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering consulting; Knowledge management; Proactive problem-solving; Business intelligence
Abstract: Knowledge management (KM) has become one of the most commonly adopted approaches to enhance the engineering services. However, the traditional KM methods suffered in their reactive mode of problem solving. This paper presents a newly developed integrated model, namely Integrated Proactive Knowledge Management Model (IPKMM), for proactive mode of KM that improves the drawbacks of the traditional approaches. The conceptual framework of the proposed proactive KM model is described. A leading engineering consulting firm of Taiwan (China) was selected for case study to implement the proposed model. The KM performance of the proposed model is evaluated with a defined Business Intelligence Index (HI). It is found from the case study that the proposed IPKMM can significantly improve the efficiency of problem-solving capability and thus can enhance the engineering services for the engineering consulting firms. This research proposes a novel model, namely Integrated Proactive Knowledge Management Model (IPKMM) for proactive problem solving.

Authors: Zeng, D; Lai, M; Yin, S
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zeng, D.; Lai, M.; Yin, S.
Article Title: Research on Impact Factor of Existing Residential Buildings Energy-efficient Retrofitting of North China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Existing residential buildings; Energy-efficient retrofitting; Structural equation model
Abstract: Since last year, when the energy-efficient retrofit for existing residential buildings was started in Northern areas of China, it has got great achievements in some provinces. But there exist obvious differences in the schedule of the work among the fifteen provinces. So we wanted to know how to eliminate the differences and find the policy instruments to push schedule for energy-efficient retrofitting to profitability. According to the problem, the investigation and survey situation of existing residential building energy efficiency retrofitting of part provinces and cities of North China is regarded as cut-in point of research, to propose the relation assumption among the impact factors of energy efficiency retrofitting mode, such as retrofitting principal, retrofitting content, retrofitting capital, and retrofitting effect, etc., the measurement index of each impact factor is regarded as variable, to establish the initial structural equation model. In this article, it utilizes the survey and research data of Tianjin, Shanxi, Inner Mongolia, Shandong, and Ningxia, etc. in the early of 2009, to establish the structural equation modeling to research the impact factor to existing residential building energy efficiency retrofitting of North China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Study of Profit Allocation among the Contractors of the Construction Supply Chain Based on the Shapley Value Method
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the construction supply chain; contractors; the Shapley value method; profit allocation
Abstract: This paper will consult to the methods of the profit allocation in the supply chain of some industries, combine with the cooperation features of contractors in the construction supply chain, and raise the opinion to analysis the issue of profit allocation among the contractors in construction supply chain with the Shapley value method. It will set up a profit allocation model among contractors in the construction supply chain based on the Shapley value method, and supply a guideline for the profit allocation among contractors in the construction supply chain. That is equality and mutual benefits, justice, benefits complemented with risk. Anciently, the profit allocation of each behalf set down in the contract item may exist some disadvantages and deficiency because of the information dissymmetry. This model will improve this and inspire the enthusiasm of the contractors in the construction supply chain, making their cooperation developed consistently and healthily, forming a long-term system of sharing benefits and risk, mutual benefit, and finally to realize the purpose of fair and reasonable profit allocation among the contractors.

Article Title: Intelligent System's Cultivation of Elite Talents and Construction of Management Regulations
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: property management; intelligent system; elite talents; management regulations
Abstract: The Intelligent Buildings and Intelligent Communities' property management ability is directly associated with the personal qualities and the number of administrators involved. It is necessary to ensure the enforcement of regulations and bring attention upon the ability development and training of employees. This paper will discuss some of the property management's business regulations which can reflect the prominent characteristics of Intelligent Buildings' property management. A complete employee training process of the elite talented mostly includes education degree training, short term training, and other trainings ranging five levels. Management companies also need to be dependant on various equipment and communication systems' specifically specialized, corresponding maintenance, care regulations, and executing regular inspections. Furthermore, establishing a complete information and document organization regulation, in addition to classifying, concluding the automated system and equipment data in order to countermeasure as well as to prevent the unexpected.

Author Full Names: Zhu, X. Q.; Huang, W. J.
Article Title: Research on the method of construction proect bidding evaluation base on improved BP neural network
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Cconstruction project; BP neural network; Bid evaluation
Abstract: Now the construction market in China has carried out competitive bidding for international and domestic enterprises, and a growing number of construction projects determine their contractors by bidding. Evaluation is the core of the project bidding and it is a critical, detailed and comprehensive work. Whether the method of bid evaluation is scientific, rational or not, it will lead to the success or failure of the entire bidding work directly. So it is very important. This paper focus on project bidding evaluate method, of which the process is characterized by the existence of multiple criteria. However, existing methods used in bid evaluation all have their limitations. Therefore this paper proposes a construction project bidding method based on an improved BP neural network. This method resolves the problem of no-linear of each influencing factor. With applying the function of self-learning and self-adapt based on the additional momentum algorithm, the convergence rate of neural network can be improved. Moreover it can avoid the local optimum of neural network and improve the precision of solution for project bidding evaluate. Through the simulated test, the scientificalness and effectiveness of this model is verified.

Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Article Title: Romanian labour market face to face with the economic crises
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Labour market; Economic environment; Economic crises; Unemployment; Work place; Instability; Dynamic
Abstract: The labour market, as a subsystem of the economy, is more vulnerable than the other markets as against the negative influences generated by the evolution of the economic environment. Considering these, we can say that the Romanian labour market represents a good example to demonstrate how difficult it is to create the conditions that could make labour supply more adaptive and flexible in a very dynamic business environment, to satisfy a very exigent labour demand taking into account the technology evolution and to built new and high quality work places. In the last almost two decades, the evolution of the Romanian labour market was spectacular. But, the global economic crises, which have begun in the end of 2008, will reduce the economic activity not only in Romania. As effects of this evolution, the labour market will be strong imbalance, a lot of Romanian workers will return for a safe work place, but the national economy will be not capable to help them. The subject of this paper is to make some appreciations about what could happen in the future and how the Romanian firms and authorities could react to one of the biggest issue of economic crises, respectively the unemployment and the instability of the work places in a very disturbing economic environment.

Article Title: Confidence interval estimation for path flow estimator
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Origin-destination estimation; Path flow estimator; Stochastic user equilibrium; Sensitivity analysis; Confidence interval
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC-COUNTING LOCATION; DESTINATION MATRIX ESTIMATION; STOCHASTIC USER EQUILIBRIUM; TRIP TABLE ESTIMATION; SENSITIVITY-ANALYSIS; MODELS; INCONSISTENCIES; ASSIGNMENT; QUALITY
Abstract: The uncertainty of an origin-destination (O-D) trip table estimate is affected by two factors: (i) the multiplicity of solutions due to the underspecified nature of the problem, and (ii) the errors of traffic counts. In this paper, a confidence interval estimation procedure for path flow estimator (PFE) is developed for assessing the quality of O-D trip tables estimated from traffic counts. The confidence interval estimation consists of two parts: (i) a generalized demand scale (GDS) measure for quantifying the intrinsic underspecified nature of the O-D estimation problem at various spatial levels, and (ii) an error bound to quantify the contribution of input errors (traffic counts) to the estimation results. Numerical results using PFE as the O-D estimator show that the proposed confidence interval estimation procedure is able to separate the two sources of uncertainty in constructing the confidence intervals at various spatial levels. Simulation results also confirm that the proposed quality measure indeed contain the true estimates within the defined confidence intervals. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Zheng, ZD; Ahn, SY; Chen, DJ; Laval, J
Author Full Names: Zheng, Zuduo; Ahn, Soyoung; Chen, Danjue; Laval, Jorge
Article Title: Freeway traffic oscillations: Microscopic analysis of formations and propagations using Wavelet Transform
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Car-following behavior; Lane-changing maneuver; Stop-and-go traffic; Traffic oscillations; Wavelet Transform
Keywords Plus: DYNAMICS
Abstract: In this paper we identify the origins of stop-and-go (or slow-and-go) driving and measure microscopic features of their propagations by analyzing vehicle trajectories via Wavelet Transform. Based on 53 oscillation cases analyzed, we find that oscillations can be originated by either lane-changing maneuvers (LCMs) or car-following (CF) behavior. LCMs were predominantly responsible for oscillation formations in the absence of considerable horizontal or vertical curves, whereas oscillations formed spontaneously near roadside work on an uphill segment. Regardless of the trigger, the features of oscillation propagations were similar in terms of propagation speed, oscillation duration, and amplitude. All observed cases initially exhibited a precursor phase, in which slow-and-go motions were localized. Some of them eventually transitioned into a well-developed phase, in which oscillations propagated upstream in queue. LCMs were primarily responsible for the transition, although some transitions occurred without LCMs. Our findings also suggest that an oscillation has a regressive effect on car-following behavior: a deceleration wave of an oscillation affects a timid driver (characterized by larger response time and/or minimum spacing) to become less timid and an aggressive driver less aggressive, although this change may be short-lived. An extended framework of Newell's CF model is able to describe the regressive effect with two additional parameters with reasonable accuracy, as verified using vehicle trajectory data. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Strategic fit in the general freight motor carrier industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Motor carriers; Operating efficiency; Technological change; Malmquist productivity index; Strategic focus
Keywords Plus: TRUCKING INDUSTRY; DATA ENVELOPMENT; UNITED-STATES; OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY; PRODUCTION COMPETENCE; MULTIPLE COMPARISONS; FIRM PERFORMANCE; SCALE ECONOMIES; DEREGULATION; INFORMATION
Abstract: This study investigates the impact of choosing a particular strategic focus or foci on operational productivity by means of the Malmquist Productivity Index as applied to a consistent sample (for the period 1999-2003) of 69 general freight motor carriers. The results show that general freight motor carriers, regardless of the strategic focus or foci pursued, did not link these strategic positions to an operational posture that reflected both operating efficiency and technological change. An interesting bifurcation is found with regard to the strategic foci of the cm market niche and firm size growth, with the former of these two strategic foci having a positive impact on operating efficiency and the latter having a positive impact on technological change. Article Title: Bus congestion, optimal infrastructure investment and the choice of a fare collection system in dedicated bus corridors
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bus; Fare payment method; Running speed; Congestion; Operator cost; Travel time
Keywords Plus: TRANSIT SYSTEMS; PUBLIC TRANSPORT; SCALE ECONOMIES; LINE MODEL; OPTIMIZATION; SERVICE; SIZE; SUBSIDIES; POLICIES; DESIGN
Abstract: Microeconomic optimisation of scheduled public transport operations has traditionally focused on finding optimal values for the frequency of service, capacity of vehicles, number of lines and distance between stops. In addition, however, there exist other elements in the system that present a trade-off between the interests of users and operators that have not received attention in the literature, such as the optimal selection of a fare payment system and a designed running speed (i.e., the cruising speed that buses maintain in between two consecutive stops). Alternative fare payment methods (e.g., on-board and off-board, payment by cash, magnetic strip or smart card) have different boarding times and capital costs, with the more efficient systems such as a contactless smart card imposing higher amounts of capital investment. Based on empirical data from several Bus Rapid Transit systems around the world, we also find that there is a positive relationship between infrastructure cost per kilometre and commercial speed (including stops), achieved by the buses, which we further postulate as a linear relationship between infrastructure investment and running speed. Given this context, we develop a microeconomic model for the operation of a bus corridor that minimises total cost (users and operator) and has five decision variables: frequency, capacity of vehicles, station spacing, fare payment system and running speed, thus extending the traditional framework. Congestion, induced by bus frequency, plays an important role in the design of the system, as queues develop behind high demand bus stops when the frequency is high. We show that (i) an off-board fare payment system is the most cost effective in the majority of circumstances: (ii) bus congestion results in decreased frequency while fare and bus capacity increase, and (iii) the optimal running speed grows with the logarithm of demand. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Malighetti, P; Meoli, M; Paleari, S; Redondi, R
Author Full Names: Malighetti, Paolo; Meoli, Michele; Paleari, Stefano; Redondi, Renato
Article Title: Value determinants in the aviation industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society (ATRS)
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc (ATRS)
Author Keywords: Airlines; Airports; Valuation; Value drivers
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE ALLIANCES; VALUE-RELEVANCE; VALUATION; PERFORMANCE; INFORMATION; COMPETITION; STOCKS; FARES
Abstract: This paper analyses the value determinants for both airports and airlines. The analysis is based on a sample of 24 airport operators and 87 airlines, listed on international financial markets on 31 December 2007. We analyse the value drivers for both airlines and airports by studying the determinants of the Tobin's Q. On average the market valuation of airport operators is higher than that of carriers. On the whole we show that ownership concentration has a positive impact, while size and state ownership are, on average, detrimental for the market valuation. Further, other industry-specific variables are statistically significant. Airport valuation is positively influenced by size, return on assets and the growth in terms of number of passengers. Airlines valuation is statistically higher for low-cost companies, while age and route number have a negative impact on market valuation. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Schmöcker, JD; Fonzone, A; Shimamoto, H; Kurauchi, F; Bell, MGH
Author Full Names: Schmoecker, Jan-Dirk; Fonzone, Achille; Shimamoto, Hiroshi; Kurauchi, Fumitaka; Bell, Michael G. H.
Article Title: Frequency-based transit assignment considering seat capacities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Transit assignment; Frequency-based; Seat capacities
Keywords Plus: MODEL; NETWORKS
Abstract: This paper proposes a frequency-based assignment model that considers travellers probability of finding a seat in their perception of route cost and hence also their route choice. The model introduces a fail-to-sit probability at boarding points with travel costs based on the likelihood of travelling seated or standing. Priority rules are considered; in particular it is assumed that standing on-board passengers will occupy any available seats of alighting passengers before newly boarding passengers can fill any remaining seats. At the boarding point passengers are assumed to mingle, meaning that FIFO is not observed. as is the case for many crowded bus and metro stops, particularly in European countries. The route choice considers the common lines problem and an user equilibrium solution is sought through a Markov type network loading process and the method of successive averages. The model is first illustrated with a small example network before being applied to the inner zone of London's underground network. The effect of different values passengers might attach to finding a seat are illustrated. Applications of the model for transit planning as well as for information provision at the journey planner stage are discussed. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The impact of item substitutions on production-distribution networks for supply chains
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Decentralized supply chain; Production-distribution network; Item substitution; Effect analysis
Keywords Plus: DESIGN; MODEL
Abstract: This study investigates the effects of various factors relevant to item substitution strategy on two-echelon production-distribution networks in decentralized supply chains. The item substitution strategy replaces preset items with alternatives to fulfill customer demands. The independent factors for the substitution strategy include substitution scope and available options. The moderators for the strategy include the dual sourcing strategy, substitution amount, and the echelons of the production-distribution network. The results of the experiment show that the item substitution strategy modulated by three moderators improved supply chain profit compared to cases where the strategy was not used. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Huang, YX; Chen, CW; Fan, YY
Author Full Names: Huang, Yongxi; Chen, Chien-Wei; Fan, Yueyue
Article Title: Multistage optimization of the supply chains of biofuels
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Bioethanol production; Sustainability; Energy supply chain; Multistage mix-integer optimization model; Lingocellulosic biomass
Keywords Plus: FACILITY LOCATION; ETHANOL; DESIGN; ENERGY; MODEL
Abstract: In this study, a mathematical model that integrates spatial and temporal dimensions is developed for strategic planning of future bioethanol supply chain systems. The planning objective is to minimize the cost of the entire supply chain of biofuel from biowaste feed-stock fields to end users over the entire planning horizon, simultaneously satisfying demand, resource, and technology constraints. This model is used to evaluate the economic potential and infrastructure requirements for bioethanol production from eight waste bio-mass resources in California as a case study. It is found that, through careful supply chain design, biowaste-based ethanol production can be sustained at a compatible cost around $1.1 per gallon. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Container port efficiency in emerging and more advanced markets
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container ports; Efficiency; Emerging markets; Data envelopment analysis; DEA
Keywords Plus: STOCHASTIC FRONTIER MODEL; COMPETITIVENESS; PERFORMANCE; TERMINALS; ASIA
Abstract: The literature on container port efficiency has typically centered on ports in advanced markets or comparisons within regions. This study compares the efficiency of port operations in emerging markets (ERIC and the Next-11) with the more advanced markets (G7). We use data envelopment analysis to evaluate the container ports based on the import and export cargo volumes in 2005. Our results suggest that none of the ports in the advanced markets are role models for the field. This study provides a first step towards gaining insights into port efficiency in emerging markets. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Shintani, K; Konings, R; Imai, A
Author Full Names: Shintani, Koichi; Konings, Rob; Imai, Akio
Article Title: The impact of foldable containers on container fleet management costs in hinterland transport
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container transportation; Container fleet management; Empty container; Foldable container; Hinterland transportation
Keywords Plus: ALLOCATION; PORT
Abstract: This paper analyzes the possibility to save container fleet management costs in repositioning empty containers through the use of foldable containers. We model this entire empty container flow as an integer programming problem with different strategies in empty container flow itinerary. The model is used to carry out numerical experiments that optimize the empty container repositioning in the hinterland, where there are serious empty container repositioning problems caused by extremely imbalanced trades. The study finds that foldable containers can substantially save on repositioning costs compared to the use of standard containers. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bröcker, J; Korzhenevych, A; Schürmann, C
Author Full Names: Broecker, Johannes; Korzhenevych, Artem; Schuermann, Carsten
Article Title: Assessing spatial equity and efficiency impacts of transport infrastructure projects
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Trans-European networks; Infrastructure policy; Spatial computable equilibrium
Keywords Plus: INTERNATIONAL-TRADE; REGIONAL ECONOMY; COSTS; GEOGRAPHY; MODEL
Abstract: Policy decisions on transport infrastructure investments often require knowledge of welfare effects generated from using these infrastructures on a detailed regional level. This is in particular true for the EU initiative promoting the development of the trans-European transport (TEN-T) networks. As projects within this initiative affect regions in different countries, incentive compatible financing schemes cannot be designed without knowing where the benefits accrue. Furthermore, this initiative is also intended to contribute to the cohesion objective on a community scale, and only with regional impact studies one can assess to which extent these objectives are attained. As standard cost-benefit analysis is unable to assign benefits to eventual beneficiaries in the economy, we develop and apply a spatial computable general equilibrium (SCGE) model as a suitable alternative. The model has a household sector and a production sector with two industries, one producing local goods, the other producing tradables. Regions interact through costly trade, with trade costs depending, among others, on the state of the infrastructure. New links reduce trade costs, which changes trade flows, production, goods prices and factor prices and thus eventually the welfare of households in different regions. We present the formal structure of the model, the calibration procedure and the data sources for calibrating the model and estimating the trade cost reductions stemming from new transport links. As the model is only able to quantify effects related to trade in goods we also suggest a simplified approach to add effects stemming from passenger transport. We apply the methods to a policy experiment related to the TEN-T priority list of projects. We quantify project by project the social return, check whether significant benefit spillovers to countries not involved in financing might prevent realization of projects in spite of their respective profitability from European wide point of view, and finally we evaluate the contribution of each project to the spatial cohesion objective. Our results confirm sceptical views on EU involvement in infrastructure policy that have been expressed in the literature. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Xie, C; Lin, DY; Waller, ST
Author Full Names: Xie, Chi; Lin, Dung-Ying; Waller, S. Travis
Article Title: A dynamic evacuation network optimization problem with lane reversal and crossing elimination strategies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Evacuation planning; Transportation network design; Lagrangian relaxation; Tabu search; Dynamic traffic assignment; Cell transmission model
Keywords Plus: DECISION-SUPPORT-SYSTEM; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; TRANSPORTATION; CITY; PLANS; GIS
Abstract: This paper discusses a dynamic evacuation network optimization problem that incorporates lane reversal and crossing elimination strategies. These two lane-based planning strategies complement one another by increasing capacity in specific directions through the evacuation network. A bi-level network optimization model is formulated, in which the upper level aims at optimizing the network evacuation performance subject to the lane-reversal and crossing-elimination constraints and the lower level conveys a cell transmission-based dynamic traffic assignment problem. An integrated Lagrangian relaxation and tabu search method is devised for approximating optimal problem solutions through an iterative optimization-evaluation process. The numerical results of implementing the developed modeling and solution approach to a synthetic network and a real-world example application justify its theoretical and practical value. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Investigating the effects of economies of scope on firms' pricing behavior: Empirical evidence from the US domestic airline industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Economies of scope; Belly cargo; Airfares; Contingency framework; US airline industry
Keywords Plus: SOUTHWEST-AIRLINES; DUOPOLY MARKETS; AIRCRAFT SIZE; COMPETITION; ALLIANCES; ENTRY; PASSENGER; FARES; CARGO; MODEL
Abstract: This study investigates to what extent cross-product (belly cargo) output affects (passenger ticket) prices in the US domestic airline industry. The empirical analysis indicates that greater cargo volumes generally result in lower air fares, presumably as a result of the airlines' realization of economies of scope. This magnitude of this price effect, however, depends on certain firm and route market characteristics. The findings of this study add to extant research on economies of scope, multi-product yield management and airline pricing and provide important insights for policy makers and airline managers alike. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: According to the specific geological conditions of Beiminghe iron mine and its mining methods, collapse height of the roof of mined out area is calculated with empirical formula firstly. Secondly, the numerical model is established based on the surrounding rock and the goaf replaced with collapse body, and FLAC3D software gob is used to simulate the final settlement value of iron mine. And based on the results, he subsidence control plan accordingly put forward. Results and treatment options has a certain reference value for predicting the depth and range of subsidence area formed and choosing the treatment program of caving mining.

Article Title: Shortest path problem considering on-time arrival probability
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Arriving on-time; A priori shortest path; First-order stochastic dominance; Bellman's principle of optimality; Label-correcting
Keywords Plus: VARYING TRANSPORTATION; ROUTE GUIDANCE; ALGORITHM
Abstract: This paper studies the problem of finding a priori shortest paths to guarantee a given likelihood of arriving on-time in a stochastic network. Such reliable paths help travelers better plan their trips to prepare for the risk of running late in the face of stochastic travel times. Optimal solutions to the problem can be obtained from local-reliable paths, which are a set of non-dominated paths under first-order stochastic dominance. We show that Bellman's principle of optimality can be applied to construct local-reliable paths. Acyclicity of local-reliable paths is established and used for proving finite convergence of solution procedures. The connection between the a priori path problem and the corresponding adaptive routing problem is also revealed. A label-correcting algorithm is proposed and its complexity is analyzed. A pseudo-polynomial approximation is proposed based on extreme-dominance. An extension that allows travel time distribution functions to vary over time is also discussed. We show that the time-dependent problem is decomposable with respect to arrival times and therefore can be solved as easily as its static counterpart. Numerical results are provided using typical transportation networks. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A nested decomposition approach for solving the paratransit vehicle scheduling problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Paratransit; Vehicle routing; Dial-a-ride; Column generation; Mathematical decomposition; Pickup and delivery problem with time windows
Keywords Plus: A-RIDE PROBLEM; COLUMN GENERATION; DELIVERY PROBLEM; TRANSPORTATION; ALGORITHM; PICKUP
Abstract: The paratransit vehicle scheduling problem involves scheduling a fleet of specially equipped vehicles for serving transportation needs of disabled and elderly people. It is also referred to as a dial-a-ride problem, and it can be classified as a multi-depot pickup and delivery problem with time windows and side constraints. The column generation approach constitutes one of the effective methodologies to solve this problem. However, in order to cope with the complexity of the problem, it is commonly applied in two consecutive stages: clustering and routing. First, clusters of customers are formed who will receive service together; next, vehicle routing decisions are made subject to the clustering decisions. This paper develops a nested column generation method, which integrates clustering and routing decisions, thus extending the applicability of the column generation approach in the context of the subject problem. The proposed method is implemented and applied to solve a problem faced by the transit authority of a mid size Us city. A detailed account of implementation experience is provided. The computational results, based on actual data, indicate that problem instances with up to 680 requests and 48 vehicles can be solved within 2% of optimality under mild assumptions, and a 12% performance improvement over a well-established manual planning system can be achieved. Authors: Zhang, JY; Kuwano, M; Lee, B; Fujiwara, A
Author Full Names: Zhang, Junyi; Kuwano, Masashi; Lee, Backiin; Fujiwara, Akimasa
Article Title: Modeling household discrete choice behavior incorporating heterogeneous group decision-making mechanisms
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Intra-household interaction; Group decision-making mechanisms; Latent class modeling; Heterogeneity; Bayesian approach; EM algorithm; Car ownership
Keywords Plus: INTRAHOUSEHOLD INTERACTIONS; MAXIMUM-LIKELIHOOD; TASK COMPLEXITY; JOINT CHOICE; LOGIT MODEL; ALLOCATION; TRAVEL; SEGMENTATION; VEHICLE; CONTEXT
Abstract: To represent heterogeneous group decision-making mechanisms in choice behavior, this paper attempts to develop a new household discrete choice model by integrating different types of household choice models based on latent class modeling approach under the principle of random utility maximization, where household utility function at each model is defined to theoretically reflect its members' preferences and intra-household interaction. A latent class corresponds to a particular group decision-making mechanism. The proposed model can deal with not only the choice situations where multiple household members involved in joint decision are known a priori, but also the situations where the involved members are unknown. As a case study, three types of household utility functions are dealt with: multi-linear. maximum and minimum types, in the context of couples' car ownership behaviors. Due to the limited sample size, paired combinations of the three utilities are examined and compared. Using the data collected in two Japanese cities in 2004, the effectiveness of the proposed household decision model is empirically confirmed. It is found that changes of utility combinations result in very complicated variations in both signs and values of the model parameters and choice probabilities by multi-linear utility show small variations across different combinations. Article Title: Geographical Diversification Strategies of Leading International Construction Firms: An Empirical Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Geographical diversification; International construction; Financial performance; International diversification
Abstract: The global construction market is cyclic, dependant, risky, fragmented, and highly competitive. To survive and succeed in this market, contractors often choose to distribute their resources, capital and efforts over multiple country markets to minimize their exposure to the harsh environment of the global construction market. Hence it is no surprise that geographical diversification strategies have been implemented by leading international construction firms for many years back across the world. However how to diversify geographic presences across multiple country markets to achieve optimal strategic effects is contingent upon many internal and external factors and is not very well understood. Through the analysis of cross-sectional data provided by Engineering News Record (ENR) and sampled top international construction firms, characteristics of their geographical diversification strategies are identified and the relationship between financial performance and geographic coverage is explored. Theoretically, the findings provide a better understanding of the geographical diversification strategies of leading international construction firms; practically, they provide international contractors benchmarking information and management implications to evaluate, formulate, or adjust their geographical diversification strategies.

Article Title: Research on the Void Construction Project Contract and Its Legal Effects: Mainland China Perspective
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction project contract; Void contract; Validity
Abstract: A Construction Project Contract (CPC) is a contract by which a contractor agrees to construct a project and an employer agrees to pay the price therefore. According to article 269 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, CPCs include contracts for project surveying, design and construction. Like other ordinary contracts, Construction Project Contracts are created when owners and contractors mutually agree to a transaction. A contract may outwardly appear to satisfy all the requirements of a valid contract. However, it is difficult to determine the validity of a contract in the Chinese construction industry. There are circumstances which can cause a Construction Project Contract to become void, and those circumstances may not be easy to be determined. Hence, this paper mainly discusses about construction contract. It also intends to identify on what circumstances a Construction Project Contract will be rendered void and what is the legal effects.

Authors: Kyriakidis, I; Karatzas, KD; Papadourakis, G
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Kyriakidis, Ioannis; Karatzas, Kostas D.; Papadourakis, George
Article Title: Using Preprocessing Techniques in Air Quality forecasting with Artificial Neural Networks
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: POLLUTION
Abstract: Data quality is one of the fundamental issues influencing the performance of any data investigation algorithm. Poor data quality always leads to poor quality results. In the investigation chain, the data selection phase is followed by the preprocessing phase, which results in increased data quality, while in parallel it demands the highest time resources of the overall data investigation chain. The preprocessing phase includes the handling of missing data, handling of the Outliers, data de-trending and data smoothing. The methods that are used in the preprocessing phase are usually not sufficiently reported in the literature of environmental data analysis and knowledge extraction. The current paper investigates the performance of several methods in all phases of the preprocessing chain of environmental data, by emphasizing in the use of ICT (Information & Communication Technology) methods for the materialization of such preprocessing tasks, and by making use of the air quality as the environmental domain paradigm.

Article Title: Based on the method of JIT for the arrangement of program construction site
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: JIT; program management; constraction site
Abstract: It's limited to the public space resources to program construction, and schedule of project and program is depend on the use of the limited space resources. When we arrangement the construction site, especially the temporary facilities, the factor of consideration is limited to the use of space resources of a single project. As a result, it makes a great harassment to each contract on the site of producing yard and mixing plant that when and where they can use. On the precondition of construction period, owners should use a plan as a whole of the program group space, and make coordination use of it in each contract. From the owners' point of view, use the method of JIT to design the arrangement of program group construction site. Through the zero inventory method of JIT, owners can strengthen plans to reduce the press and disorder from construction site. In this paper, we even draw a contrast in arrangements of the temporary facilities based on the methods of Critical Chain and P3/e, and analyze the characteristic, advantage and running program of JIT, then achieve the effective raising of utilization rate of the site facilities to reduce cost, improve efficiency and make sure of construction period.

Author Full Names: Liu, Z. J.; Hao, L. P.
Article Title: Study on Construction Enterprises Management Information System Application Strategy and Suggestions
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: MIS Application; Construction Enterprise Management; Strategy; Suggestion
Abstract: How to avoid construction enterprise MIS application failures? Currently there are wide-ranging debates. Some people considered that information technology is not mature and the conditions of construction enterprises are complex, these make the MIS application failures, people need to wait for. Some also expressed that since some construction enterprise MIS system applications have been successful, it could be said that it is the time to application and the wrong methods make the failures; if people use correct methods, they will success. Some people believe it is too expensive to realize the MIS application, small and medium-sized enterprises could not afford. Some think it is caused by a lack of relative professionals and etc. In this paper, the authors point out that practitioners ought to understand the nature of the problems more thoroughly and find the way to solve. There are too many ideas taken for granted when applying MIS. Generally corporate MIS application strategy can be divided as three kinds, these are input orientated (software application); process orientated (process reengineering); output orientated (performance), and the authors believe the last one is best. That means our application object is to provide the correct information to right person in right place at right time, and finally improve the corporate performance. People should apply knowledge transfer theory when analyzing the problems and this is also a good way for construction enterprises to improve the MIS application and for MIS service companies to improve the quality of products and services. If construction enterprises need some management knowledge that they don't have, they should emphasize tacit knowledge transfer work. They need to build effective mechanism to carry out the knowledge transfer work; they need to develop a variety of tools to improve the communication between the construction enterprises and MIS development companies. If construction enterprises do not need some information management knowledge, they should take effective methods to decrease the relative cost of in every MIS application phase, such as using Internet, outsourcing, renting IT equipments and etc, and finally they can improve the effects of MIS applications.

Abstract: The logistics informationization system is not only the core of the modern logistics, but also the core competitiveness of the third-party logistics enterprises. This paper analyzes the necessity of the third-party logistics enterprises' realizing informationization and then anatomizes the actuality and problems of the informationization construction of small and medium third-party logistics enterprises in China, and at last it puts forward some methods and suggestions of how to accelerate the informationization construction of small and medium third-party logistics enterprises.

Authors: Ma, T; Zuo, JA; Liew, CL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ma, Tony; Zuo, Jian; Liew, C. L.
Article Title: Relationship contracting in South Australia - A public sector's experience
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Relationship (collaborative) contracting; traditional procurement; South Australia
Abstract: Construction projects are commonly procured through competitive tendering and the lowest tender price usually wins the bid. The different objectives and focuses of the participating parties have created dissatisfaction and adversarial relationships. The traditional procurement approach has long been accused of being responsible for the poor public image of the construction industry its poor performance and confrontational disputes. The South Australian public sector recently adopted an innovative approach by means of collaborative contracting for their health projects. A case study approach was used in this paper to investigate the project participants' comments on this alternative procurement route. The results indicated that this relationship-based contracting has gained more acceptances from the industry. With more relevant experiences and understanding, the local industry is likely to employ this approach more often in the future, not just in the public sector, but also potentially in the private sector.

Article Title: Research on Flexible Model of Practical Teaching in Project Management Profession
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project management profession; Practical teaching; Flexible model; Innovation capability
Abstract: The link of Practical Teaching of Project Management Professional Education plays an important role in improving the overall quality of students and developing students' innovation capability. In order to further build a highly efficient system of project management professional practice education, to ensure and improve the quality of training project management personnel effectively, so as to meet the requirements of the professionals in the ever-changing global economic situation, to conduct a comparative research on the status quo of practical link in project management major in colleges and universities at home and abroad is compared and studied. According to the current economic situation, focusing on project management professional training objectives, analyzing the basic status quo and existing problems of project management professional practical teaching, the existing problems of project management professional practical link in our country are to be found out. In order to clarify the work experience's real needs for project management professionals' capacity, the project management professional capacity-building objectives are compartmentalized through the research. A flexible model of ideas is put forth, which are set up by project management professional practical teaching. Meanwhile a relation schema of each link in practical teaching is built and a number of specific recommendations are put forward, which are close to the practice of project management in projects management professional practical teaching.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Sales Risk Control of the Real Estate Development Project Based on System Dynamics
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; Risk control; System dynamics; Sale
Abstract: the most powerful trait of the system dynamics approach is its ability of processing the high-order, non-linear systematic problems with multiple feedbacks and complicated time-varying. The real estate sale is a typical misalignment dynamic process, which involves many social, administrative, economic and artificial factors. From the system dynamics view, the paper applies the real estate risks management theory and establishes risk control model for real estate development project which involves the factors of advertisement effect, sales effect, purchasing speed, sales speed, the recruitment of potential customers and so on. After limiting model boundary and defining model parameter value, it utilizes systems dynamics special-purpose software Vensim to carry on the simulation to the model, and makes the analysis to the simulation results of two main factors of the model, the sales speed and the increasing number of the latent purchasing family, thus exploring the internal law of the real estate sales system. Based on the model and simulation results, we recognize and determine the advertisement effect, the sales effect, the supporting service and the quantity of purchasing power as the risk control point of marketing model. Then we apply the software of Vensim to conduct the sensitive test to these four risk control points, and make the thorough analysis to the sensibility of the risk control point based on the system dynamics theory and the internal links of the models' factors. Considering all the above, we proposes the pertinent sales risk control measures.
