Authors: Missia, DA; Tolis, EI; Karanikolas, D; Kosmidis, C; Markou, A; Mavrovouniotou, S; Bartzis, JG
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Missia, D. A.; Tolis, E. I.; Karanikolas, D.; Kosmidis, C.; Markou, A.; Mavrovouniotou, S.; Bartzis, J. G.
Article Title: Volatile Organic Compounds measurements at schools in Kozani, Greece
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: indoor air quality; schools; Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC); priority substances; formaldehyde; Field and Laboratory Emission Cell (FLEC)
Abstract: The present study discusses the steps towards the development of an integrated IT system to perform risk assessment for the factor affecting human health in indoor environments. The system, termed as BEMES (BUMA Exposure Modelling Expert System) combines three different models to model circulation flow in closed spaces, model the behavior and fate of volatile pollutants and estimate population exposure. It is constructed within the frame of BUMA project to estimate to the impact of building materials as indoor Pollutants. More specifically, the study is focused around VOCs (BTEX, terpenes, aldehydes and ketones) measurements at three high priority locations (schools) in the city of Kozani, Greece. Weekly indoor and outdoor VOC measurements were conducted using Radiello (R) passive samplers in each tested room and outdoors. Additionally data from the Field and Laboratory Emission Cell (FLEC) instrument were used to evaluate the contribution of building materials in the indoor concentration levels. The VOC concentration data show a considerable diversity due to the different indoor emission sources, ventilation rates and outdoor concentrations. Formaldehyde indoor levels range from 8.2 to 56.9 mu g/m(3) while benzene levels are high reaching: 18 mu g/m(3). Building material emissions seem to contribute mainly in the levels of formaldehyde indoors and clearly other Sources exist.

Article Title: Study on Multi-Project Management Model in Real Estate Enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate enterprises; Multi-project management; Project portfolio selection; Resource allocation; Performance evaluation
Abstract: The application process of multi-project management model in real estate enterprises is discussed in this paper. First of all, the portfolio selection model is established because of resource constraints. Then the dynamic multi-project resource allocation model is established on the basis of resource constraints and logical relationships. Furthermore, since the matrix organization has some disadvantages, a new organization model for multi-project management is brought up. Finally, after the performance evaluation index system for single project management is established with Analytic Hierarchy Process and the Expert Scoring Method, the whole performance of multi-project management is evaluated with the project priorities. The portfolio selection model and the dynamic multi-project resource allocation model are established in this paper, then the multi-project organization structure is introduced, finally the performance of multi-project management is evaluated with the project priorities. This study has certain reference value to multi-project management in real estate enterprises, which can improve operational efficiency and enhance competitiveness of enterprises.

Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Article Title: Specifics of the Corporate Governance for Implementing Bankruptcy Law Reforms in the Czech Republic
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: corporate governance; bankruptcy law; institutional framework; management board
Abstract: The article describes the institutional framework of the Czech economy and its functioning problems which are manifested when securing a desired pace of the economic and social development in the Czech Republic. It is based on the assessment of the Czech Republic's position according to the characteristics of institutional quality within the EU. A growing attention has been paid to the indicators of the institutional quality of the economy in the Czech Republic in recent years. This trend is apparent especially when assessing the effectiveness of companies. Quality of corporate environment and corporate management are to a large extent regarded as significant factors affecting the business sphere effectiveness. The data source used for comparing the quality indicators of the Czech corporate environment and corporate management with the EU member countries is based mainly on the results of researches carried out by OED, EIU and researches within the competitiveness year-books by WEF and IMD. Mostly they are soft data, combined with selected statistical indicators or with data concerning practices of legal systems. The institutional quality measurability is in fact only indirect, which limits the rate of international comparability as well as comparability in the course of time.

Author Full Names: Simon, Mak Kam Choi; Wah, Poon Sun
Article Title: Proactive Financial Planning by Construction Contractors in Hong Kong
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Financial management; Contractors; Hong Kong; Construction costs; Financing
Abstract: In Hong Kong, small and medium sized firms make up 99% of all construction contractors. These small and medium sized firms account for 44% of the total market share. The remaining 56% is owned by a small number of large firms which dominate the market. Financial barriers might have hindered the growth of these firms. Smaller firms, in particular those who work primarily as subcontractors to the larger ones, are not inclined to any form of forward financial planning, as they perceive such planning as difficult and time-consuming. This paper aims to find out if proactive financial planning could help contractors overcome the barriers by gaining more support from commercial banks. A survey has been conducted with contractors and banks to investigate the extent contractors adopt proactive financial planning in their operations and how they benefit from doing so. Conclusions are drawn based on quantitative and qualitative analyses of the data, as well as comments made by contractors interviewed. It has been found that Hong Kong contractors, particularly the smaller ones, are not proactive enough in financial planning, which can otherwise help them maintain healthy cash flow and gain financial support from banks.

Article Title: Research on the Highway Preventive Maintenance Strategy System for Sustainable Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Preventive maintenance; Strategy syste; Sustainable developmen; Highway
Abstract: Along with the advancement of the international communities' awareness of sustainable development, it's necessary to do something improvement with highway which is one of major infrastructure of national economy. For example, how to maintain long-term and dynamic development of highway with the national economy, social environment, how to use limited funds effectively for construction and obtain the best pavement performance in the service life. In recent years, foreign engineers lead the concept of preventive maintenance into pavement management system, through the establishment of preventive maintenance strategy system, engineers combine the long-term reconstruction, medium-term rehabilitation and short-term preventive maintenance in order to achieve pavement preservation. It researches the foreign preventive maintenance strategy system, discussing the content of the system, attenuation model of the pavement performance, the appropriate implementation time and pavement condition of preventive maintenance measures, the impact factors, evaluation of its economic effect. In the trend of infrastructure construction corresponding to the policy of sustainable development, this article looks forward to the urgency of establishing this system in our country, achieving long-term effectiveness of the highway.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Research on Corporate Governance Mechanism of the Product Market Competition-Managerial Incentives and Monitoring based view
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: product market competition; incentive; monitor; corporate governance effectiveness
Abstract: This paper builds and solves the Hotelling model in which the effects of competition on the monitoring behavior of shareholders are analyzed along with incentives supplied to the managers. The results show that managers are unambiguously given stronger incentives and monitored more closely in more competitive environments so that they will improve their effort level to improve the firm's operating performance. In additional, the relationship among the product market competition, piece rate and monitoring level depends on the average market share of firms: when the firm does not obtain the average market share, the more intensive competition is, the lower piece rate and monitoring level can be needed; when the firm has obtained the average market share, the more intensive market competition is, the higher piece rate and monitoring level can be also needed.

Authors: Tsai, LK; Chin, HW; Liao, HH; Tsemg, HP
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Tsai Lung-Ken; Chin Hao-Wei; Liao Hsien-Hsing; Tsemg Hui-Ping
Article Title: Developing an Option Framework for Predicting Default Probability of Construction Firms
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Barrier Option; Failure Probability; Construction Industry
Abstract: The construction industry in the United States has several unique characteristics that sharply distinguish it from other sectors of the economy. Evaluating the failure probability of construction firms has always been an important topic. Generic models for all sectors tend to be too general and lack of ability to deal with construction industry due to the particular financial characteristics; and few researches specifying on construction industry. This research apply the barrier option model to corporate default prediction, which is a new method that have not provide to construction industry. This research provides a framework of contractor default prediction based on barrier option model. First of all, we collect a cross-section of construction firms that are listed in the North America of recent 30 years. The empirical results show that the implied barriers are statistically significant. Next, failure probability implied by barrier option model can be estimated. We test the predictive ability of implied failure probability against several previous models, and find that it has good ability of bankruptcy prediction in construction industry.

Article Title: Integration of Buddhism and Sport from the Perspective of Health-Physical and Mental Unity, Exterior and Interior Practice
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: health; Buddhism; thinking; sport; unity; body and mind
Abstract: Body and mind are two parts of a human being. Their healths are basic to human beings' health. The core of Buddhism is to keep one's mind peaceful, no showing off, no competing. While when it comes to sport, the case is quite different. Sport is action-oriented, whose aim is to be faster, higher and stronger. Through competition, it shows the beauty of speed and strength, as well as the coordination of physical muscles. Therefore, body and mind are both contradictory and united in exterior and interior, in stillness and action, in gentleness and firmness. To make them work well is to unite body and mind into one. Based on the above, the article studies and analyzes the relationship between Buddhism and sport, talks about their roles in keeping healthy. It also shows how they are the bases of health, how to practice them and how to unite their thinking system.

Article Title: The Interaction and Coordination between International Trade and the Environment in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: sustainable development; international trade; environment; externality; comparative advantage
Abstract: This paper investigates the interaction and coordination between China's international trade and environment We try to explore the Impact of China's free trade on the environment, and due to the presence of externalities, the difficulties and challenges for China's environment protection We combine the available empirical evidence and China's actual situation, and yield some clearly conclusion First, China's past economic growth model indeed caused many negative effects on the environment, which is mainly composed by composition and scale effects of free trade However, we can now take advantage of free trade to carry out a wide range of remedies Second, Chinese government should improve the system of property rights by strengthen environmental legislation and regulations to address market failures, but we are opposed to unilateral trade and environmental agreements, because It will result in the loss of social welfare

Abstract: Ecological migrant in flood storage areas is a special vulnerable group The construction of the minimum living security system and poverty-eradication for migrants in flood storage areas appear to be urgent particularly, which has become an important topic in the process of building a socialist harmonious society Based on some research information of the living and production developments of the migrants in the middle and lower reaches of Yangtze River flood storage areas, this paper studied the construction of the minimum living security system in the area, analyzed the emerging issues in its construction process Then posed the related development strategies, pointed out capable person start enterprise adds people obtain employment and one village one product are the good poverty-eradication model for migrants in flood storage areas

Author Full Names: Yuan Hongping; Lu Weisheng; Hao Jianli
Article Title: A Framework for Integrating Construction and Demolition Waste Management Studies
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction and demolition waste; Waste management; NVivo; Construction; Framework
Keywords Plus: ENVIRONMENTAL-MANAGEMENT; PREFABRICATION; MINIMIZATION; CLASSIFICATION; TECHNOLOGY; REDUCTION
Abstract: Research works into construction and demolition (C&D) waste have been undertaken from different perspectives over the last fifteen years; however, there is no systematic integrated framework for synthesizing such diverse forms of research approaches and results. First it outlines the methodology for producing the framework. It is followed by the demonstration of the framework. Then it moves on to the analysis and discussions of the framework. Lastly, conclusions are drawn. It is anticipated by following the framework, readers including both practitioners and researchers can quickly grasp a general picture of the C&D WM research as published in current literature. This paper describes a framework developed for integrating C&D waste management (WM). Several steps are adopted in developing the framework and NVivo 8.0 was used for analyzing frequency occurrence. Based on the analysis results generated by using NVivo, a framework for systematically integrating C&D WM studies was developed. The value of the framework developed can help researchers to use it as a reference model. And the conclusion that deep and integrated C&D WM research can help in determining further directions will be discussed

Article Title: Research on the Key Problems in Large-Scale Project Management and Organization
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scale projects; Project management; Project organization; Self-organization management; Virtual construction; Labor management
Abstract: So far many successful experiences have been made in the project management models and the integrated management tools and so on of the large-scale projects in China, however, due to the scale of large projects too large and complex, which many deep-seated problems have also exposed in the implementation process. While China's central government has formulated the 10 measures and made arrangements for 4 trillion Yuan investments to boost domestic demand for the next two years. This paper analyzes the problems of the management model for the government and owners, management level, centralization and decentralization, public bidding and the management after bidding, the overall coordination of supervision, interface management, construction general contracting management and labor management etc., and put forward a decentralized self-organizing management model and some enlightening recommendations with the author's practical construction experiences of large projects in the Guangzhou University Town, the University Park in Zhuhai and so on.

Author Full Names: Daganzo, Carlos F.; So, Stella K.
Article Title: Managing evacuation networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: InFO; Evacuation models; Maximum flows; Ramp metering; Traffic assignment; Wardrop
Abstract: This paper proposes a non-anticipative, adaptive, decentralized strategy for managing evacuation networks. The strategy is non-anticipative because it does not rely on demand forecasts, adaptive because it uses real-time traffic information, and decentralized because all the information is available locally. It can be used with a failed communication network. The strategy pertains to networks in which no links backtrack in the direction of increased risk. For these types of networks, no other strategy exists that can evacuate more people in any given time, or finish the evacuation in less time. The strategy is also shown to be socially fair, in the sense that the time needed to evacuate all the people exceeding any risk level is, both, the least possible, and the same as if less-at-risk individuals did not participate in the evacuation. The strategy can be proven optimal even when backflows happen due to driver gaming. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Doan, K; Ukkusuri, S; Han, LS
Author Full Names: Doan, Kien; Ukkusuri, Satish; Han, Lanshan
Article Title: On the existence of pricing strategies in the discrete time heterogeneous single bottleneck model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Single bottleneck; User equilibrium; System optimal; Toll strategies; Heterogeneous commuter
Abstract: In this paper, we study the pricing strategies in the discrete time single bottleneck model with general heterogeneous commuters. We first prove that in the system optimal assignment, the queue time must be zero for all the departures. Based on this result, the system optimal problem is formulated as a linear program. The solution existence and uniqueness are discussed. Applying linear programming duality, we then prove that the optimal dual variable values provide an optimal toll with which the system optimal solution is also an equilibrium solution. Extensive computational results are reported to demonstrate the insights gained from the formulations in this paper. These results confirm that a system optimal equilibrium can be found using the proposed approach. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Hub location problems in transportation networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Integer programming; Hub location; Urban transportation; Liner shipping; Decomposition; Lagrangian relaxation; Local search
Keywords Plus: GENETIC ALGORITHM; SPOKE NETWORK; FORMULATIONS; SIZE
Abstract: In this paper we propose a 4-index formulation for the uncapacitated multiple allocation hub location problem tailored for urban transport and liner shipping network design. This formulation is very tight and most of the tractable instances for MIP solvers are optimally solvable at the root node. While the existing state-of-the-art MIP solvers fail to solve even small size instances of problem, our accelerated and efficient primal (Benders) decomposition solves larger ones. In addition, a very efficient greedy heuristic, proven to be capable of obtaining high quality solutions, is proposed. We also introduce fixed cost values for Australian Post (AP) dataset. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Hernández, S; Peeta, S; Kalafatas, G
Author Full Names: Hernandez, Salvador; Peeta, Srinivas; Kalafatas, George
Article Title: A less-than-truckload carrier collaboration planning problem under dynamic capacities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Collaborative logistics; Freight transportation; Less-than-truckload trucking; Minimum cost flow
Keywords Plus: OPERATIONS; NETWORKS; TRUCKING; TIME
Abstract: This paper addresses the deterministic dynamic single carrier collaboration problem for the small- to medium-sized less-than-truckload (LTL) industry. It is formulated as a binary (0-1) multi-commodity minimum cost flow problem and solved using a branch-and-cut algorithm. Its inherent network structure is exploited to generate the lower bounds to the branch-and-cut algorithm using the network simplex method and by relaxing the integrality constraints. Results from numerical experiments indicate inherent trade-offs at the higher degrees of collaboration between waiting for more affordable collaborative capacity and incurring higher holding costs. They also suggest that collaborating LTL carriers experience increased capacity utilization. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A splitting rate model of traffic re-routeing and traffic control
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Re-routeing; Day to day re-routeing; Within day re-routeing; Responsive signal control; Pitchfork bifurcation
Keywords Plus: EQUILIBRIUM ASSIGNMENT; SIGNAL CONTROL; ALGORITHMS; INFORMATION; STABILITY; BEHAVIOR; NETWORK
Abstract: The paper presents an idealised dynamical model of day-to-day or within-day re-routeing using splitting rates at nodes, or node-exit flows, rather than route-flows. It is shown that under certain conditions the dynamical model gives rise to a sequence of link flow vectors which converges to a set of approximate Wardrop equilibria. A special dynamical signal green-time re-allocation model is added; the combination is also shown (in outline) to converge to the set of approximate consistent equilibria under certain conditions. Finally the paper uses model network results to illustrate a method of designing fixed time signal timings to meet different scenarios. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Sun, D; Clinet, A; Bayen, AM
Author Full Names: Sun, D.; Clinet, A.; Bayen, A. M.
Article Title: A dual decomposition method for sector capacity constrained traffic flow optimization
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic flow management; Dual decomposition; Large scale Linear Program
Keywords Plus: GROUND-HOLDING PROBLEM; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; DECISION-MAKING MODEL; MANAGEMENT; WORKLOAD
Abstract: An aggregate air traffic flow model based on a multicommodity network is used for traffic flow management in the National Airspace System. The problem of minimizing the total travel time of flights in the National Airspace System of the United States, subject to sector capacity constraints, is formulated as an Integer Program. The resulting solution achieves optimal delay control. The Integer Program implemented for the scenarios investigated has billions of variables and constraints. It is relaxed to a Linear Program for computational efficiency. A dual decomposition method is applied to solve the large scale Linear Program in a computationally tractable manner. A rounding algorithm is developed to map the Linear Program solution to a physically acceptable result, and is implemented for the entire continental United States. A 2-h traffic flow management problem is solved with the method. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Kros, JF; Nadler, SS; Chen, HZ
Author Full Names: Kros, John F.; Nadler, S. Scott; Chen, Haozhe
Article Title: The adoption and utilization of online auctions by supply chain managers
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Online auctions; Supply chain cost management; Supplier collaboration; Revenue enhancement
Keywords Plus: REVERSE AUCTIONS; INTERNET; BUYER; PROCUREMENT; IMPACT
Abstract: This study contributes to the online auction literature by empirically examining the differences across three groups (current users, past users, and nonusers) in terms of their emphasis on supplier collaboration, cost management, and sales revenue and profit enhancement. The paper further compares the online auction usages for maintenance/repair/operations and shipping and transportation services across high and low groups in supplier collaboration and cost management. A survey of supply chain professionals coupled with appropriate statistical analysis was employed to investigate adoption and utilization of online auctions. Study findings indicate significant differences between users and nonusers. Study findings specifically indicate that current online auction users have a greater belief in the auctions as a cost containment tool than past or nonusers. It was also found that nonusers place a greater level of importance on supplier collaboration and sales revenue and profit enhancement than either current or past users. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: CO2 emissions: Are land-use changes enough for California to reduce VMT? Specification of a two-part model with instrumental variables
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Two-part model; Instrumental variables; Density; VMT; Land use; Compact development; Self-selection
Keywords Plus: RESIDENTIAL CHOICE; TRAVEL; DEMAND; IMPACT; BEHAVIOR; DENSITY
Abstract: With vehicle miles of travel increasing at a faster pace than population, one strategy being actively pursued by both state and local governments is compact development. California recently passed legislation that aggressively promotes sustainability by endorsing and rewarding compact development. Likewise, the California Air Resources Board has set a statewide reduction target of 5MMT of greenhouse gas reductions from land use, based largely on achieving compact development patterns. In this paper, we use a multivariate two-part model with instrumental variables, which corrects for residential location self-selection bias. We use a much larger and more geographically representative travel survey on household travel patterns and socio-economic characteristics than represented in previous California studies: this allows us to robustly consider other influences on travel. Our results indicate that, all else equal, a 10% in residential density would reduce VMT by 1.9%. This elasticity is larger than the reported in previous econometric studies for the US, and specifically for California. However, as we show, the magnitude of this impact is still low considering reasonable ranges for policies aimed to increase residential density. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Wang, JYT; Lindsey, R; Yang, H
Author Full Names: Wang, Judith Y. T.; Lindsey, Robin; Yang, Hai
Article Title: Nonlinear pricing on private roads with congestion and toll collection costs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion pricing; Two-part pricing; Private roads; Toll collection costs
Keywords Plus: 2-PART TARIFFS; SERVICES; MONOPOLY; COMPETITION; INTERNET; BENEFIT; MATTER
Abstract: Nonlinear pricing (a form of second-degree price discrimination) is widely used in transportation and other industries but it has been largely overlooked in the road-pricing literature. This paper explores the incentives for a profit-maximizing toll-road operator to adopt some simple nonlinear pricing schemes when there is congestion and collecting tolls is costly. Users are assumed to differ in their demands to use the road. Regardless of the severity of congestion, an access fee is always profitable to implement either as part of a two-part tariff or as an alternative to paying a toll. Use of access fees for profit maximization can increase or decrease welfare relative to usage-only pricing for profit maximization. Hence a ban on access fees could reduce welfare. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Traffic assignment by paired alternative segments
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User-equilibrium; Traffic assignment; Quick-precision; Route flows; Proportionality
Keywords Plus: ALGORITHM; DECOMPOSITION; ENTROPY; MODEL
Abstract: The static user-equilibrium (UE) traffic assignment model is widely used in practice One main computational challenge in this model is to obtain sufficiently precise solutions suitable for scenario comparisons, as quickly as possible. An additional computational challenge stems from the need in practice to perform analyses based on route flows, which are not uniquely determined by the UE condition Past research focused mainly on the first aspect. The purpose of this paper is to describe an algorithm that addresses both issues. The traffic assignment by paired alternative segments (TAPAS) algorithm, focuses on pairs of alternative segments as the key building block to the UE solution A condition of proportionality, which is practically equivalent to entropy maximization, is used to choose one stable route flow solution. Numerical results for five publicly available networks, including two large-scale realistic networks, show that the algorithm can identify highly precise solutions that maintain proportionality in relatively short computation times (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Article Title: Scheduling trucks in cross-docking systems: A robust meta-heuristics approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Logistics; Distribution; Scheduling; Cross-docking; Meta-heuristics; Hybrid simulated annealing (HSA); Hybrid variable neighborhood search; (HVNS); Taguchi method
Keywords Plus: TIME; INVENTORY; ALGORITHM; SEARCH
Abstract: In a cross-docking system, trucks must be scheduled to minimize the total flow time of the system. This problem is NP-hard, and this study proposes two hybrid meta-heuristics hybrid simulated annealing and hybrid variable neighborhood search to solve it by achieving the best sequence of truck pairs. The Taguchi method serves to reveal the best robustness of these algorithms. To demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed methods, especially for large-sized problems, this study solves various test problems, and the Computational results clearly reveal that the proposed methods outperform previous approaches. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Introduction to special issue of Transportation Research Part B Modelling non-urban transport investment and pricing
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Transport infrastructure; Investment; Pricing
Abstract: This special issue of Transportation Research Part B is concerned with the state of the art modelling approaches applied to transport infrastructure issues. Six papers have been included, utilizing either partial or general equilibrium models in order to develop economic assessments of large, inter-urban transport modes. The papers as a group highlight the importance of accounting for the market environment and competition among infrastructure providers, assessing economic and regional equity issues in a wider context, acknowledging the risks of misrepresentation of project benefits and reducing network dimensionality in order to assist the development of second opinions in cost-benefit analyses. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A continuum approximation approach to reliable facility location design under correlated probabilistic disruptions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Reliable facility location; Continuum approximation; Spatial correlation; Disruption
Keywords Plus: ANALYTIC MODEL; SYSTEM-DESIGN; MAXIMUM; VEHICLE; TRANSPORTATION; CONFIGURATION; FAILURES; DISTANCE; ZONES
Abstract: This paper studies the reliable uncapacitated fixed charge location problem (RUFL) where facilities are subject to spatially correlated disruptions that occur with location-dependent probabilities (due to reasons such as natural or man-made disasters). If a facility fails, its customers are diverted to other facilities and incur excessive transportation cost. We develop a continuum approximation (CA) model to minimize the sum of initial facility construction costs and expected customer transportation costs under normal and failure scenarios. The paper presents ways to formulate the correlation among adjacent facility disruptions, and incorporates such correlations into the CA model. Numerical experiments are conducted to illustrate how the proposed model can be used to optimize facility location design, and how the correlations influence the total system cost. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: McCollum, David L.; Ogden, Joan M.
Article Title: Future impacts of coal distribution constraints on coal costs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Rail; Capacity; Infrastructure; Investment; Hydrogen; Scenario
Abstract: This study seeks to identify potential capacity constraints within the US rail network that could limit expanded use of coal for electricity generation and hydrogen fuel production. We estimate the costs of alleviating those constraints under various scenarios of future coal demand growth. By 2050, coal transportation is projected to increase 35-90% necessitating rail capital investments of $1.5-11.0 billion. These investments are within the range of historical expenditures in the railroad industry, so it is unlikely that delivered prices of coal will necessarily increase or that rail capacity will be a barrier to a future coal-based Hydrogen Economy. Article Title: Consistent node arrival order in dynamic network loading models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dynamic traffic assignment; Network loading; Kinematic wave theory; Continuous-flow models; Route trajectories
Keywords Plus: VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; USER OPTIMAL ASSIGNMENT; KINEMATIC WAVES; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; HIGHWAY
Abstract: Dynamic network loading (DNL) models need to address both the behavior of traffic at different roadway elements (sections, merges and diverges) as well as the propagation of flows along routes. Most models presented so far devote more attention to one of the two issues. This paper aims to achieve consistent integration between the two components, focusing in particular on the order of arrival to nodes. A novel concept of anticipated arrival order (AAO) is proposed to describe the number of vehicles expected to choose a certain downstream link at a diverge road-node as a function of the total number of vehicles that arrived at this road-node. An iterative procedure is proposed. In each iteration. a route flow propagation model is used to determine the AAO for the entire modeling horizon; then, a traffic behavior model uses the AAO to determine cumulative volumes for the entire horizon. Computational results show that this unique non-chronological heuristic approach to DNL can indeed provide consistent solutions so that residual FIFO violation is monitored. The proposed model is an analytic macroscopic model with continuous flows. We chose to examine the AAO concept using a traffic flow behavior that follows the kinematic waves model with a triangular flow-density relationship. The single-link model is converted to an equivalent variations problem and solved on a dense discrete intra-link time-space mesh by a standard least-cost-path algorithm for acyclic graphs. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Bao Hai-jun; Wang Li-yuan; Li Mo-yun; Xu Baogen
Article Title: Application of Set Pair Analysis to Suitability Evaluation of Rural Housing Land
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing land; Suitability Evaluation; Set Pair Analysis; Xiuzou District in Jiaxin County of Zhejiang Province
Abstract: At present, it exists these problems in rural areas-Land settlements scattered, low volume and poor living facilities, which seriously restrict the socio-economic development in rural areas. The purpose of this study is to explore the method of evaluating the suitability of housing land in land readjustment. Evaluating the suitability of housing land is the basic job in land readjustment. The paper attempts to use a new method which is Set Pair Analysis Method to evaluate the rural land for construction's grade. Method of set pair analysis and case study were applied. The results construct a set pair model of suitability evaluation of housing land thorough establishing an index system. It is concluded that the model can provide a feasible solution, as the case is studied in Xiuzhou District, Jiaxing City, Zhejiang Province.

Article Title: Framework of Job-Plan-Based Performance Evaluation for Value Engineering Study
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Value engineering study; Job plan; Performance evaluation
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTION
Abstract: Value Engineering (VE) is an organized application of common sense and technical knowledge to locate and eliminate unnecessary project costs. Currently, the acceptance rate of Value Engineering Study (VES) recommendations and total potential savings are considered the principal performance indicators of a YES. In reality the success of a VES depends on numerous interrelated factors that are not easy to control by a VES team. However, a study team can ensure the success of a VES by fully implementing a YES job plan. This study proposes a framework for VES performance evaluation model. Two questionnaires, distributed to VE practitioners in Taiwan, were conducted to collect related data for the research. Factor analysis was used to build the framework model which consists of six evaluation aspects and 32 evaluation items. The framework model can be used to assess the performance of a YES. It can be expanded to a full scale performance evaluation model and used by a YES team for self-diagnosis, improvement, and motivation in achieving enhanced performance.

Authors: Corani, G; Rizzoli, AE; Salvetti, A; Zaffalon, M
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Corani, G.; Rizzoli, A. E.; Salvetti, A.; Zaffalon, M.
Article Title: Reproducing human decisions in reservoir management: the case of lake Lugano
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: The objective of this study is to identify a model able to represent the behavior of the historical decision maker (DM) in the management of lake Lugano, during the period 1982-2002. The DM decides every day how much water to release from the lake. We combine hydrological knowledge and machine learning techniques to property develop the model. As a predictive tool we use lazy learning, namely local linear regression. We setup a daily predictor, which achieves good accuracy, with a mean absolute percentage error around 8.5%. Yet, the behavior of the model is not fully satisfactory during the floods. In fact, from an interview with a domain expert, it appears that the DM can even update the release decision every 6 hours during emergencies. We have therefore developed a refined version of the model, which works with a variable time step: it updates the release decision once a day in normal conditions, and every 6 hours during emergencies. This turns out to be a sensible choice, as the error during emergencies (which represent about 5% of the data set) decreases from 9 to 3 m(3)/sec.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Han Yu; Gao Qiaoming; Luo Yan; Huang Youliang
Article Title: Method of Large-scale Public Building's Risk Assessment
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scale public building; Risk assessment; Reliability assessment; Vulnerability analysis; Environment & Social influence
Abstract: Large-scale public building whose floor area is more than 20000m(2) contains office building, commercial building, tourism building, science building, education building, civilization building, public health building, communication building and traffic building. Large-scale public building has characteristics of large form and massing, hard to build, wide social influence, a large number of service objects and densely populated. Large-scale public building is an open complex system and its risk is made up of reliability risk, security risk and sustainable development risk. Large-scale public building's risk has characteristics of numerous origins, complicated relations, highly uncertainty and enormous impact. So the method of large-scale public building's risk assessment is different from others, it is a quantitative and qualitative integrated systems assessment method, which is in the systems perspective and to the essence and unique characteristics of large-scale public building's risk. To reliability risk, we put particular emphasis on system reliability assessment. To security risk, we put particular emphasis on security risk source assessment and system vulnerability analysis. To sustainable development risk, we put particular emphasis on environment and social risk influence assessment, the variable of which is time. The final result of large-scale public building's risk assessment is comprehensive synthesis of such three risk assessment results.

Article Title: Survey and Analysis of the Affordable Housing in Harbin City
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Affordable housing; Current condition; Survey; Harbin
Abstract: Affordable housing policy was gradually established with the development of economic system reform, especially the housing system reform. As further asking for establishing a comprehensive housing supply system which should give priority to affordable housing, this resulted in the rapid development of affordable housing all over the country. Harbin started to construct affordable housing from 1996([2]). Over eighty affordable housing projects have been constructed until now, including houses constructed by working units for their employees, accommodating a large number of low- and middle-income families. This paper started by reviewing the development of affordable housing in Harbin City. Then, it surveyed the composition of residents, location and transportation of the sites, housing types, housing quality, and local infrastructures of 8 affordable housing districts through interview and questionnaires. The problems of the current policy of affordable housing were analyzed according to the results of the survey. At last, several suggestions were put forward to improve the affordable housing policy.

Abstract: For 30 years after the reform and opening up, governments and Financial institutions have given great funds support to the development of agriculture and rural economy, which has promoted the development of agriculture production and non-agricultural economy greatly In this way, farmers' income has been enormously improved By setting up VAR models, using methods, such as, cointegration test, vector autoregression, variance decomposition, this paper explores the contribution difference of public Finance and commercial Finance to farmers' income growth in China from different angles Basing on empirical analysis, this paper points out the main current policy tendency for financial agricultural support from public policy perspective

Authors: Saraga, DE; Sfetsos, A; Andronopoulos, S; Chronis, A; Maggos, T; Vlachogiannis, D; Bartzis, JG
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Saraga, Dikaia E.; Sfetsos, Athanasis; Andronopoulos, Spyros; Chronis, Alexandros; Maggos, Thomas; Vlachogiannis, Diamando; Bartzis, John G.
Article Title: An investigation of the parameters influencing the determination of the number of particulate matter sources and their contribution to the air quality of an indoor residential environment
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: POSITIVE MATRIX FACTORIZATION; PARTICLE-SIZE DISTRIBUTIONS; SOURCE APPORTIONMENT; CHEMICAL-COMPOSITION; ATMOSPHERIC AEROSOL; ULTRAFINE PARTICLES; IDENTIFICATION; URBAN; PM2.5; FINE
Abstract: Indoor air quality depends on the presence of both indoor and outdoor particle sources each of which produces different particles' size distribution that may have mortality and morbidity effects. Positive Matrix Factorization (PMF) is a mathematical (statistical) procedure for identifying and quantifying the sources of air pollutants at a receptor location. A critical step in PMF is the number of factors determination and the present study aims at discussing this critical issue, by applying PMF on particles size distribution measurements data in a residential environment, in Athens, Greece. A main focal point of the present research is the investigation of the temporal behaviour of the particles size, as recorded in the time series, closely relating the averaging period of the utilised data with the number and type of factors in the PMF. The analysis is based on the estimation of the spectral properties of data and estimation of the integral time scale using the autocorrelation properties of the series. Furthermore, different factor analysis techniques have been applied, namely the rotated Principle Component Analysis (rPCA) and the Independent Component Analysis (ICA) and the results have been compared to PMF results.

Article Title: Evaluation by simulation of the social acceptability of agricultural policies for water quality
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: modelling; meta-model; simulation; sociology of the organised action; concrete system of actions; social acceptability; agricultural policies; water quality
Abstract: The Concert'Eau is a three years project launched in October 2006 to demonstrate the opportunity to involve agricultural actors of a territory to propose and apply new practices more in line with the need for preservation of water resources and natural environments. We present in this paper the sociological dimension of this multidisciplinary work, which focused on the evaluation of the social acceptability of these practices. This evaluation is based on the formalization of a well-experienced social theory, the Sociology of the Organized Action.

Author Full Names: Wang Hongqiang; Xu Yongmou; Zhang Yingjie
Article Title: New Requirements for Qualities of Commodity Building in Harmonious Society
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Energy-saving building; Harmonious society; Energy efficiency standards
Abstract: Aside from requirement on structure security, applicability, durability, the commodity building should also be required to be green and energy-saving in its quality, so as to build a resource-conserving and environmental-friendly society in the context of developing harmonious society. Though, it is of huge significance for China to develop green and energy-saving buildings, to match these new requirements, we still have many obstacles to overcome, for example, firstly, it is against the principle of maximizing interests to the developer in that more capital input is a must for green and energy-saving buildings; secondly, most people fail to realize the importance of green and energy-saving housing, and thus are reluctant to pay more for them; finally, the state not stipulating compulsory quality standards, the developer would naturally seek maximal profits rather than green and energy-saving building. To develop China's green and energy-saving housing, we have the following tasks to accomplish: (1) Intensifying publicity and education: following the strategy of sustainable development and building harmonious socialist society, and considering the element of full-life cycle investment, we should raise the awareness of the developer and the consumer on green and energy-saving building, make them recognize the immediacy of energy conservation in building and the importance of developing green and energy-saving housing. (2)The government should formulate adequate policies and regulations to facilitate the development of green and energy-saving housing. (1)Changing the standards on green and energy-saving building from state recommended standards to state compulsory standards. (2)Strengthening government supervision over the links of commodity housing development project. (3)Bringing into full play the role of public supervision. (4)Severely punishing those who violate the relevant rules of the state compulsory standard and rewarding the good.

Authors: Wu, YZ; Chen, J; Zhang, XL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wu, Y. Z.; Chen, J.; Zhang, X. L.
Article Title: On urban underground space development among land intensive use: from China's perspective
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land intensive use; Urban underground space(UUS); Development
Abstract: Currently,our country has already entered the accelerating period of the urbanized advancement. It is strengthening urban underground space (USS) development that has the important theoretical and practical significance for realizing the reasonable intensive use of urban land resource and socio-economic sustainable development. This paper took the land intensive use as an angle of view, carried on the analysis of the reason which caused disparity between the our country's UUS development and the overseas'. Through referencing the successful experience of raising the land intensive use's level by using UUS development from the overseas, and considering the actual situation of our urban land utilization development, the paper also proposed that by way of formulating scientific and reasonable UUS plan, carrying on large-scale and high-level constructions of urban derground space like subway, underground highway, underground complex and so on, in order to serve the purpose of urban land intensified use effectively, obtain the reasonable urban spatial content with the limited land, and solve the contradiction of land resource protection and the socio-economic development reasonably.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Discussion on the Valuation Ability Training of Construction Management Undergraduates
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction valuation; Practice teaching; Ability training
Abstract: The construction valuation is one of the basic professional skills for the undergraduates of construction management specialty. The teaching practice has showed that the inadequate teaching time, the weak reading ability of construction drawing and the teaching of bill valuation are the main problems in construction cost courses teaching at present. In order to enhance the students' capacity of construction valuation, this paper analyzes the status of construction cost courses teaching and its problems existing in detail on the basis of clearing the requirements of construction valuation, and discuses how to improve the courses teaching and practical teaching activities of the construction cost courses. The paper holds some important approaches to enhance the practical construction valuation capacity of undergraduates of construction management specialty, including forming a coherent curriculum system of construction cost courses, increasing the curricular content of practical training, coordinating reasonably the relationship between valuation and cost management, unified teaching materials and local requirements, quota valuation and bill valuation.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Risk characterization and proposals for sustainable development during financial crisis: a study of real estate enterprises in Wuhan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate industry; sustainable development; financial crisis; risk; policy suggestion
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to seek an effective solution for promoting sustainable development of the real estate industry (RE!) during the period of this global financial crisis. Methods of case studies, interview survey and questionnaire analysis are employed. Based on a recent survey of real estate enterprises in Wuhan, this paper list the critical risks and discuss its reasons. Current REI risks include: rapid decline in the attractiveness of the industry, risk of a negative chain reaction, ill-suited assets-liabilities structure of the enterprises, low turnover rate of the industry, unconsciousness of risk prevention and risk management system, unethical business practices on market competition, insufficient investment in science and technology and the conflicts of public policy. The above-mentioned risks to some extent out of control because of the negative influence on which the global financial crisis exert. These definitely pose a grave threat to the sustainable development of REI. It is suggested to accelerate the marketization of the land use, to improve the efficiency of administrative examination and approval, the government-subsidized houses policy need to be regulated to keep these houses' trade-off in a closed cycle operation, to increase investment on science and technology research and promote its application, to reform local financial policies, to strengthen accurate research on the related field. Last, enterprises should adjust its strategies promptly.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Dynamic Alliance in Housing Project for Low-income Families
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing Project for low-income families; Construction-Agent System; Dynamic Alliance; Mode of Operation; Governance Structure
Abstract: Along with education and health care, housing in socialist societies is considered as one of the most fundamental social needs. Housing provision in a socialist country is generally characterized by the dominance of public housing. Based on the analysis of the shortage in the traditional Construction Agent System of housing project for low-income families, Dynamic Alliance is presented. Dynamic Alliance formed involves market opportunity identification, alliance mode selection, alliance partner selection, alliance project management and alliance benefits distribution five links. This article provides analysis in detail about the above five links of dynamic alliance in housing project for low-income families and finally put forward effective dynamic alliance operation Suggestions. It suggests that dynamic Alliance in housing project for low-income families successful operation will be favorable for innovation mechanism of supply for public goods and finally realize the housing guarantee policy performance.

Authors: Zahari, W; Yusoff, W; Alias, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zahari, Wan; Yusoff, Wan; Alias, Anuar
Article Title: The Development of the Iskandar Malaysia (IM) from the Bumiputera's Perspective
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Iskandar Malaysia (IM); Bumiputera's interest and ownership
Abstract: The development plan of the Iskandar Malaysia (IM) at the southern peninsular of Malaysia has created an unpleasant response regarding the bumiputera interests. This arises due to some inquiries as to what extent the IM development has taken into account the Bumiputera ownership interests, and how well it will be preserved. The objectives of the study are: (1) to acquire the Bumiputera's perception about the IM development: (2) to discover the challenges and barriers faced by the Bumiputeras caused by the IM development; (3) to identify strategies in ensuring the right and ownership of the bumiputeras under the IM development will be appropriately preserved. The primary data in this research was collected using semi-structured interviews and questionnaires. The research is focused on the Nusajaya development area which covers nearly 1000 hectares. Respondents of the study are divided into three groups of Bumiputera's community i.e. high-income group (professionals involved in the IM development, i.e. planners and engineers, developers, contractors, businessman etc.), medium income group (government's servants, teachers, private sectors workers etc.) and low income group (fishermen, farmers, at traditional village's settlement area etc). The findings show that the majority of the Bumiputeras are actually in favour of the IM development plan; however, they are concerned with some possible threat that the priority interest of the Bumiputera ethnic will gradually disappear due the development of the IM. Therefore, the Iskandar Region Development Authority (IRDA) is supposed to give serious consideration to this issue. Consequently, it is recommended that the development plan of the IM be re-evaluated in order to ensure that the Bumiputera's interests are not mistreated. All concerned parties must be appropriately responsive to ensure the priority of Bumiputera ethnic is well preserved and will not be neglected in the future.

Authors: Zhang, XD; Zhang, XH; Yuan, JY
Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Author Full Names: Zhang, Xuedong; Zhang, Xuehong; Yuan, Jinying
Article Title: The Path of the Legalization of China's Privately-placed Funds
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: publicly-offered fund; privately-placed fund (PPF); private equity fund (PEF); legalization
Abstract: With the development of China's financial market and the growth of private wealth, our potential privately-placed funds (PPFs) investors are growing rapidly. The legalization of PPFs is becoming a well discussed topic. Now, China is active in achieving privately-placed norms by publishing laws and regulations to the legalization of PPFs. This article presents a brief overview and types of PPFs in China, and then proposes the practical significance of the development of China's PPFs. The article is aim at pointing out the existing problems in current forms and then provides some suggestions to the legalization of China's PPFs.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Residential Spatial Differentiations and Social Exclusions in Urban Areas of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: residential spatial differentiation; social exclusion; residential segregation; community and neighborhood; urbanization
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to develop a study frame of urban residential space differentiation and social exclusion, in which there is an interaction among economics, policy, social-cultural environmental forces. In some urban and external areas of China residential spatial differentiation is becoming more and more significant, which has lead to residential segregation and social exclusion. In this paper, an analysis framework for the urban residential spatial differentiation and social exclusion was developed, in which economic, institutional, social cultural and external environmental factors interact. The results show that the gaps in both occupations and incomes are the economic foundation of residential spatial differentiation; misappropriate policy arrangements in housing, land use and household registration system are the institutional foundation; the changes of neighborhood relationships are the social-cultural foundation; and rapid urbanization strengthens this process. So as to construct harmonious societies and communities, various measurements involved with politics, economy and social-culture should be made to inhabit residential spatial differentiation and to eliminate residential segregation and social exclusion.

Authors: Meena, PL; Sarmah, SP; Sarkar, A
Author Full Names: Meena, P. L.; Sarmah, S. P.; Sarkar, A.
Article Title: Sourcing decisions under risks of catastrophic event disruptions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain risk; Supplier selection; Sourcing strategy; Supply disruption risks; Service level
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY BASE
Abstract: In this paper, a supplier selection problem is studied under risks of supplier failure due to the catastrophic events disruption. An analytical model is developed to determine the optimal number of suppliers considering different failure probability, capacity, and compensation. An algorithm is designed to find the optimal solution and numerical study is carried out to illustrate the model. Results of numerical study and sensitivity analysis provide useful guidelines for managers to select the optimal number of suppliers under the risks of supply disruption. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lu, MS; Huang, SM; Shen, ZJM
Author Full Names: Lu, Mengshi; Huang, Simin; Shen, Zuo-Jun Max
Article Title: Product substitution and dual sourcing under random supply failures
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Supply chain disruptions; Product substitution; Dual souring
Keywords Plus: INVENTORY MODELS; DOWNWARD SUBSTITUTION; STOCHASTIC DEMAND; DISRUPTION RISKS; CHAIN; SYSTEM; DIVERSIFICATION; UNCERTAINTY; STRATEGIES
Abstract: Product substitution can mitigate supply chain disruptions. However, it may not be very effective without multiple sourcing. In this paper, we consider a supply chain with two downward substitutable products. The products can be ordered from an unreliable supplier or a reliable but more expensive supplier. It is found that in an optimal sourcing policy the higher-grade product should be preferred over the lower-grade product. A sufficient condition is given for an optimal policy where only the higher-grade product is dual-sourced. The effect of substitution is contrasted with the non-substitution case. Numerical study shows the impact of demand variability and correlation on the effect of product substitution and the corresponding optimal sourcing policy. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Jenelius, E; Mattsson, LG; Levinson, D
Author Full Names: Jenelius, Erik; Mattsson, Lars-Goran; Levinson, David
Article Title: Traveler delay costs and value of time with trip chains, flexible activity scheduling and information
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion; Disruption; Delay cost; Reliability; Schedule; Value of time
Keywords Plus: CHOICE; VALUATION; PATTERNS; MODELS; UK
Abstract: The delay costs of traffic disruptions and congestion and the value of travel time reliability are typically evaluated using single trip scheduling models, which treat the trip in isolation of previous and subsequent trips and activities. In practice, however, when activity scheduling to some extent is flexible, the impact of delay on one trip will depend on the actual and predicted travel time on itself as well as other trips, which is important to consider for long-lasting disturbances and when assessing the value of travel information. In this paper we extend the single trip approach into a two trips chain and activity scheduling model. Preferences are represented as marginal activity utility functions that take scheduling flexibility into account. We analytically derive trip timing optimality conditions, the value of travel time and schedule adjustments in response to travel time increases. We show how the single trip models are special cases of the present model and can be generalized to a setting with trip chains and flexible scheduling. We investigate numerically how the delay cost depends on the delay duration and its distribution on different trips during the day, the accuracy of delay prediction and travel information, and the scheduling flexibility of work hours. The extension of the model framework to more complex schedules is discussed. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zou, L; Oum, TH; Yu, CY
Author Full Names: Zou, Li; Oum, Tae H.; Yu, Chunyan
Article Title: Assessing the price effects of airline alliances on complementary routes
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society (ATRS)
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc (ATRS)
Author Keywords: Complementary alliances; Airfare; Double marginalization
Keywords Plus: AIRFARES
Abstract: This paper investigates the impacts of complementary alliance on airfares. The conventional wisdom argues that complementary airline alliances reduce airfares for passengers on the flow-through routes as a result of the elimination of double marginalization and efficiency gain. On the other hand, since complementary alliances help improve connecting services through one-stop check-in, better schedule coordination, etc., passengers are willing to pay higher prices for the enhanced services. That is, complementary alliances have both positive and negative effects on airfares for flow-through tickets that counteract each other. The net impact, therefore, is uncertain, a priori. Our theoretical model shows that the overall effects of complementary alliances on airfares depend on the relative strengths of the airfare reducing effects due to cooperative pricing setting and the increased willingness to pay for services improvements. Our empirical analysis based on data from the North trans-Pacific markets in October 2007 finds that member airlines of Star Alliance and Skyteam Alliance appear to charge significantly higher prices for through-tickets than the sum of segment fares on complementary routes, whereas for oneworld Alliance members, the upward and downward effects on airfares seem to counterbalance each other. Moreover, the price markup for through ticket is higher for business passengers than for leisure passengers. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhou, GH; Hui, YV; Liang, LA
Author Full Names: Zhou, Guanghui; Hui, Yer Van; Liang, Liang
Article Title: Strategic alliance in freight consolidation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight consolidation; Strategic alliance
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE ALLIANCES; DISPATCH; MARKETS; MODELS
Abstract: The utilization of unfilled space in dispatching trucks requires collaboration among aligned partners. We consider two collaboration modes: strategic alliance and full collaboration, where outbound shipments could be reassigned among the partnering agents in freight consolidation with shipment delivery deadline. The effects of partnership are studied in an economic model where the product substitutability in price setting and discount offer are introduced. We adopt a simulation approach to find the optimal shipment dispatching plan in collaborative freight consolidation. A comprehensive analysis is presented to identify those factors which affect profit performance and collaboration decisions. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Leiva, C; Muñoz, JC; Giesen, R; Larrain, H
Author Full Names: Leiva, Carola; Carlos Munoz, Juan; Giesen, Ricardo; Larrain, Homero
Article Title: Design of limited-stop services for an urban bus corridor with capacity constraints
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Public transit; Network design; Route design; Express services; Limited-stop services; Bus rapid transit (BRT)
Keywords Plus: TRANSIT NETWORK DESIGN; ALGORITHM; OPTIMIZATION; ASSIGNMENT
Abstract: In high-demand bus networks, limited-stop services promise benefits for both users and operators, and have proven their attractiveness in systems such as Transmilenio (Bogota, Colombia) and Transantiago (Santiago, Chile). The design of these services involves defining their itinerary, frequency and vehicle size, yet despite the importance of these factors for the network's efficiency, no published works appear to provide the tools for designing high-frequency unscheduled services on an urban bus corridor, minimizing social costs. This paper presents an optimization approach that minimizes these costs in terms of wait time, in-vehicle travel time and operator cost. Various optimization models are formulated that can accommodate the operating characteristics of a bus corridor, given an origin-destination trip matrix and a set of services that are a priori attractive. The models then determine which of these services should be offered at what frequencies and with which type of vehicles. A case study in which the model is applied to a real-world case of a bus corridor in the city of Santiago, Chile, is presented and the results are analyzed. Finally, the model is used on two different demand scenarios establishing which type of services tend to be good candidates on each case and providing preliminary insights on the impact of some key parameters. Article Title: Long haul freight network design using shipper-carrier freight flow prediction: A California network improvement case study
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Freight network design; Public investment; Goods movement
Keywords Plus: SIMULATED ANNEALING APPROACH; ALGORITHM
Abstract: Transportation network design is a method for analyzing the interactive benefits of transportation projects applied to a network. In this paper, a network design model is developed for long haul freight movements which are represented by relationships between shippers and carriers. Additionally, an explicit capacity constraint is used to divert traffic volume from congested links. A case study based on the California transportation network is implemented to examine the effectiveness of this model when applied to a large network. A geographic information system is used to facilitate data management and analysis of the results. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
