Authors: Zhang, P; Wong, SC; Dai, SQ
Author Full Names: Zhang, Peng; Wong, S. C.; Dai, S. Q.
Article Title: A conserved higher-order anisotropic traffic flow model: Description of equilibrium and non-equilibrium flows
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Hyperbolic conservation laws; Physically bounded solution; Unstable equilibrium; Stop-and-go waves
Keywords Plus: SPEED-DENSITY RELATIONSHIP; ENTROPY SOLUTIONS; FUNCTIONAL FORM; KINEMATIC WAVES; CONTINUUM MODEL; MULTICLASS; NETWORK; ROADS
Abstract: This paper takes into account three regimes for the description of traffic dynamics, which include the introduction of a pseudo-density transformed from the velocity, the pressure as a function of the pseudo-density and the relaxation of velocity to equilibrium. The resultant characteristic variables can be used to measure the deviation of the phase state to a desired state and derive physically bounded solutions. Taking the pseudo-density as a conserved variable, the approach is able to describe both equilibrium and non-equilibrium flows in a systematic and unified manner, and thus complex traffic phenomena. The theoretical properties of the model are thoroughly investigated, and numerical examples are used to demonstrate the ability of the model to reproduce some notable traffic phenomena. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: User heterogeneity and bi-criteria system optimum
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User heterogeneity; System optimum; Pareto optimum; Traffic equilibrium; Networks
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC NETWORK EQUILIBRIUM; ROAD NETWORKS; MULTICLASS; TIME; VALUES; MODEL
Abstract: For a traffic network with fixed demand of heterogeneous users in terms of their different values of time (VOT), the system performance can be measured either in time unit by the total system travel time (in short, system time), or in monetary unit by the total system travel cost (in short, system cost). Thus we have two different objectives for network optimization, i.e. to minimize system time and to minimize system cost, which naturally gives rise to a bi-objective minimization problem. A Pareto optimum of this bi-objective optimization problem represents a bi-criteria system optimum for network optimization in the sense that, at each Pareto optimum, neither system time nor system cost can be further reduced without increasing the other one. In this paper we prove that any Pareto optimum can he decentralized into multi-class user equilibrium by positive anonymous link tolls. We then bound the system performance gap when optimized by the two different criteria. Specifically, we provide answers to the following questions: When system time is minimized, how far could the corresponding system cost deviate from its minimum value? Conversely, when system cost is minimized, how far could the corresponding system time deviate from its minimum value? More generally, how far can the system time and system cost at a given bi-criteria Pareto optimum deviate from their respective single-criterion based system optimum? (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Pels, E; Njegovan, N; Behrens, C
Author Full Names: Pels, Eric; Njegovan, Nenad; Behrens, Christiaan
Article Title: Low-cost airlines and airport competition
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 11th World Congress of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Soc
Author Keywords: Low-cost airlines; Nested logit; Competition analysis; Airports; Cross-price elasticities
Keywords Plus: AREA
Abstract: An important question from the viewpoint of competition analysis in the air transport industry is the extent to which low-cost airlines operating from a secondary airport compete with full-service airlines serving a main airport in a multiple airport region. In this paper we address the issue of the competition between full-service and low-cost airlines serving adjacent airports in the Greater London using econometric estimation of demand structure (own- and cross-price elasticities). Our analysis follows the methodology in (Pels, E., Nijkamp, P., Rietveld, P., 2000. Airport and airline competition for passengers departing from a large metropolitan area. journal of Urban Economics, 48 (1), 29-45, Pels, E., Nijkamp, P., Rietveld, P., 2003. Access to and competition between airports: a case study for the San Francisco Bay area. Transportation Research Part A: Policy and Practice, 37 (1), 71-83). It is based on the nested logit model which we use to capture three key dimensions of passenger choice: air fare, surface-access costs and frequency. We obtained estimates of the own- and cross-price elasticities, which was the focus of our interest. On the basis of our understanding of the industry dynamics we find these estimates, especially of the cross-price elasticities, to be on the low side. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Discriminate by rough set methodology to Select Compound or Portfolio Relationships Oriented in Taiwan IT Industry
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Relations Oriented Selection model; Compound Relationship; Portfolio Relations; Discriminate Analysis; Rough set
Keywords Plus: MODEL
Abstract: With the rapidly change of business environment, the inter-organization in Supply chain has been transferred from simple relations to complex relations, Compound or Portfolio Relationships. Purpose of this study is integrated external/internal resource and maintained flexible volatility of inter-organization to increase the competitive advantage for organization. Most literatures of inter-organization in supply chain are focused on each simple relations or portfolio relations about their types and features. This study uses rough set methodology to discriminate nature relations between compound relationships oriented and portfolio relationships oriented. The theoretical framework model concerning the influence factors of the different selection between inter-organization in Supply Chain. We hope this research will construct a selection model of relationship in supply chains by discriminate analysis and Rough set methodology to provide reference for further academic and practical studies

Article Title: Reasonable costs in the public practice of audit
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: audit; cost/benefit test; sample; conformity tests; detailed tests; audit samples
Abstract: Achieving the objective of the audit mission - the identification of the extensively denatured financial information in financial situations - needs to consider reasonable costs, and that is why in collecting the audit samples, the exhaustive technique for verifying the information of the financial situations (of the whole examination, 100% of all financial information) was replaced by the sampling technique. The International Audit Standards [1] defines the sampling technique as the method of applying the audit procedures to less than 100% of the elements that compose the balance of account, transaction classes, providing equal possibilities for all the elements to be selected for audit samples. Collecting audit samples in order to find financial errors means applying tests of validating the details of the financial information which. together with the conformity tests applied upon the internal control procedures used by the audited entity constitute the essence of the audit mission. Based on the accomplished tests, the errors discovered in the financial declarations are considered significant if these had been familiar they would affect the decisions of a rational user of the financial declarations. The objectives of the study aim an evaluation of the methodology and of the problems encountered by the auditors in accomplishing certain audit missions with reasonable costs. The successfully achieved cost/benefit test cannot be accomplished without the auditors to proceed to the selection of the most adequate sample policies when planning the activities of collecting the audit samples. The results obtained in such a professional deliverance can be carried out in a systematic and detailed approach of the audit risk. The main objective is to emphasize the multiple possibilities of developing a certain specific analysis on the studied issue, and that of sketching its pronounced applicative nature.

Article Title: Sustainability of adaptive reuse of industrial buildings - a case study in Hong Kong
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Adaptive reuse; industrial buildings; Hong Kong; sustainable development
Keywords Plus: REGENERATION
Abstract: The United Nations Asia-Pacific Leadership Forum on 'Sustainable Development for Cities' convened by China and United Nations was hosted by the Hong Kong Government of SAR in 2004. In the forum, the Hong Kong Declaration on Sustainable Development for Cities, which encourages cities, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region, to develop comprehensive strategies on environmental protection, social, and economic development, was adopted as strategies on sustainable development in Hong Kong. The study called 'Sustainable Development for the 21st Century' (SUSDEV 21) aimed at introducing the concept of sustainability into decision making. The SUSDEV 21 guiding principles were developed to summarize the issues that represent sustainability in Hong Kong and focus on 8 key areas of sustainability. They are: economy, health and hygiene, natural resources, society and social infrastructure, biodiversity, leisure and cultural vibrancy, environmental quality, and mobility. The paper presents the 8 key areas of sustainability as stated in SUSDEV 21 across three key aspects in term of economic, social, and environment. The scope of study is related the sustainability of adaptive reuse of industrial buildings in Hong Kong. A case study of Jockey Club Creative Arts Centre, funded by The Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust with a donation of HK$69.4 million, is analyzed and used to illustrate how the vacant industrial building is changed to be a cultural and creative arts centre. It is a successful case to explain sustainable development in Hong Kong.

Article Title: Research on Modern Real Estate Enterprises Culture Construction Based on Knowledge Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; real estate enterprise; enterprise culture
Abstract: From the perspective of knowledge management the enterprise culture not only contains the enterprise culture activities or image design but also includes its staff identifying with the value concept of enterprise system arrangement and enterprise development strategy, and is embodied comprehensively in enterprise knowledge. Therefore, the modern real estate enterprises should attention and promote knowledge management for enterprise culture construction. Knowledge Management has put forward many new requirements for modern real estate enterprises culture construction, which requires the enterprise build its knowledge environment and establish its knowledge system, then shape the enterprise culture which can let the members work according to the thoughts of the enterprise. The relationship between enterprise culture and knowledge management is analyzed in this paper, and the modern real estate enterprises culture structure hierarchy is probed into under the background of knowledge management, based on these the thoughts of the modern real estate enterprise culture construction is put forward to build the culture atmosphere for enterprise implementing knowledge management.

Article Title: Infiltration of the New Japanese-Style Management System for an Enterprise Union-Case Study of a Japanese Electrical Appliance Company
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Three Sacred Treasures; New Japanese-Style Management System; Enterprise Union; Case Study
Abstract: The New Japanese-Style Management System was introduced by the Japan Business Federation in 1995 to reinforce the Three Sacred Treasures that are peculiar to the management style in Japan. This paper investigates the penetration and influence of the New Japanese-Style Management System on the enterprise union and union members as well as labor-management relations by providing examples such as testimonials and documents. The purpose of this is to observe how the union deals with various company measures and how these measures are exchanged between the union and management. This paper treats a certain electrical equipment manufacturer and its labor union to conduct this research.

Authors: Funk, B; Möller, A; Niemeyer, P
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Funk, Burkhardt; Moeller, Andreas; Niemeyer, Peter
Article Title: Integration of Environmental Management Information Systems and ERP systems using Integration Platforms
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Since the 90s there have been a number of research projects attempting to model the environmental impact of products in ERP systems and so integrate environmental impacts into the operative decision-making and communication of companies with their customers. Such concepts have however so far failed to become comprehensively established in practice because of the high initial costs. In this paper we propose an approach and a reference architecture that allows an increasing level of automation when calculating environmental impact by using existing data from external databases. We concentrate on the operations of a company that would like to make environmental impact data available to its customers.

Keywords Plus: DIVERSITY
Abstract: In the complicated environment, global virtual teams must conduct effective conflict management, which is significant for teams to achieve their goals and improve performance. This paper analyzes the reasons of conflicts in global virtual teams, and explores their conflict management strategies in order to provide references for their conflict management practice.

Authors: Hu, X; Dong, XJ; Liu, D
Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Author Full Names: Hu Xin; Dong Xue-jing; Liu Dong
Article Title: Empirical Study on the Performance of Xian's FDI
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: performance; Xian; FDI
Abstract: This paper summarizes the development and feathers of FDI in Xian city during the past two decades. By the comparison of FDI inflows in Xian with other sub-provincial capital cities, and a time series observation of Xian's FDI, an estimate for FDI performance in Xian is given, which based on the analysis of such aspects as economic growth, capital formation, industrial structure, contribution on tax and international trade, etc. Some results and conclusions are provide that Xian is still in the extensive economy growth stage, depending much on capital and labor input. However, due to relatively small capital stock, FDI's contribution to Xian's economy and society is limited. While it takes a fast growing tendency of FDI inflows in Xian. At the end, the authors give some suggestion on attracting FDI to Xian and other western cities.

Article Title: From Graph Theory to Models of Economic Networks. A Tutorial
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Keywords Plus: RESEARCH-AND-DEVELOPMENT; DYNAMICS; GROWTH; COLLABORATION; CENTRALITY; INNOVATION; OWNERSHIP
Abstract: Networks play an important role in a wide range of economic phenomena. Despite this fact, standard economic theory rarely considers economic networks explicitly in its analysis. However, a major innovation in economic theory has been the use of methods stemming from graph theory to describe and study relations between economic agents in networks. This recent development has lead to a fast increase in theoretical research on economic networks. In this tutorial, we introduce the reader to some basic concepts used in a wide range of models of economic networks.

Authors: Lei, FM; Liu, XD; Wang, MY
Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Author Full Names: Lei, Fumin; Liu, Xiaodong; Wang, Mingyu
Article Title: Two Properties of Cooperative Interval Games and the Core of the Minimum Cost Spanning Tree Interval Games
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: cooperative interval games; minimum cost spanning tree interval games; interval cores; tree solutions
Keywords Plus: UNCERTAINTY; DIVISION
Abstract: In this paper, cooperative interval games are studied. Two properties are obtained. (1) For two cooperative interval games with the same player sets, if each corresponding interval has a common point and length of each corresponding interval has the same ratio, when the game with the bigger intervals has no-empty interval cores, then the smaller one has also. (2) The necessary and sufficient conditions of the interval core set is no-empty are got, by using the left game and the right game of a cooperative interval game. Meanwhile, the interval core of the minimum cost spanning tree interval game is studied. The two results are received. (1) The interval core set is no empty, if the length of each interval is the same. (2) The interval core set is no empty, if the cores of the left game and the right game are compositive. Furthermore, the tree interval solution of the game is immediately received from the graph, if the tree solutions of the left game and the right game are compositive.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Analysis and Empirical Study of Regional Commercial Locations' Non-optimum
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Location; Commercial micro-location; Value; Region
Abstract: Commercial micro-location is a specific position occupied by a commercial entity in the city block or by the city street. Many people have done research on commercial micro-location from a single view, and few from the regional perspective. This paper studied the regional commercial micro-locations and found that regional commercial micro-locations' non-optimum is universal. It tried to find the reasons that caused the phenomenon. The reasons included: the value of the regional commercial micro-locations satisfied the survival of the commercial entities inside, the owners' location choices for the commercial entities were limited rationality, the optimum of a single commercial micro-location's value was not equal to that of the regional commercial micro-locations' value, and the first inning effect. It pointed out that low value of the regional commercial micro-locations would hinder the development of the regional commerce. By choosing one part of Danfeng Street in Nanjing to do an empirical study, it proved the regional commercial micro-locations' non-optimum. At last, it made a conclusion and gave some advices to improve the value of regional commercial micro-locations.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Risk Evaluation of PFI Projects with Many-sided of Viewpoint
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: PFI; Risk evaluation; Stakeholders; Many-sided viewpoint; Fuzzy Borda number
Abstract: PFI is a procurement method which secures private funding for public institutions in return for part-privatization on public project construction. Nowadays, it is very popular and widely exercised in developed countries, in the meanwhile, the study on the management and decision-making of PFI projects is becoming a hotspot in domestic. Contrast to the traditional public projects, PFI projects has their own characteristics in terms of the establishment for the risk system's architecture and the risk evaluation method. Exactly the same risk may induce entirely different effect to individual subjects. So, while the government makes the decisions on PFI projects, in order to evaluating the feasibility with an objective and many-sided viewpoints, a great deal of factors should be considered. Among all these factors, risk factor is an essential and absolutely necessary aspect. We present a risk evaluation indicators architecture. On the basis of analysis of project stakeholders, especially combined the group opinions of three main stakeholders: government, SPC, user (the public), subsequently, this paper put forward a many-sided viewpoint approach by means of the fuzzy Borda number analytical method based on grid-get. If the object to be evaluated consists of several proposed PFI project, the result of many-sided viewpoints evaluation can be used to rank the priority for decision-making. On the other hand, if the object contains only single PFI projects, however, the evaluation result reflects the risk level of the project. At last, this paper verify the feasibility, affectivity and availability of the architecture through a case example, the result show that the approach is simple to use and applicable to various comprehensive evaluations.

Author Full Names: Li, J. R.; Lin, Z. R.
Article Title: Survey on the Construction Waste Management in Shen Zhen
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction waste management; Shenzhen; Site visit; Questionnaire survey; Propositions
Abstract: The extensive development and redevelopment of the city have led to amazing increase in construction and demolition waste (C&D waste) in Shenzhen. C&D waste management is becoming a big pressure to the local government. This paper investigates the actual state of construction waste management in Shenzhen by site visit and questionnaire survey. Numerous construction sites were visited and questionnaires were collected from engineers and managers on site in order to obtain first-hand data. The results reveal there are a few insufficiencies of current construction waste management during the building construction. The essential reasons are explored, and subsequently several propositions are presented for improving the situation. It is necessary to establish a comprehensive management framework including legal measures, economic measures and technical measures. Regulation and legislation is the most direct way to tackle external issues; strict supervision is needed to ensure the regulation be exerted effectively and efficiently; economic measures are also able to makes external effectiveness internalization.

Authors: Mao, P; Cheng, H; Wang, XD
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Mao Peng; Cheng Hu; Wang Xudong
Article Title: Study on Organization Structure of Programme Management Based on Information Entropy
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Programme management; Organization structure; Information entropy; Integrated team
Abstract: As China's economy grows fast, more and more large-scale projects are launched. Large-scale projects, normally consist of several or even dozens of sub-projects, are in fact multi-program featured with long construction period and significant complexion. Therefore, the construction management of large-scale projects are very challenging. The execution of large-scale projects involves the owner, consultants, designers, contractors, subcontractors and suppliers. The large-scale project gets fast development in China, and the common organization structures of project management can not meet the need of programme management increasingly. In this paper, an organization structure of integrated programme management mode is proposed according to the characteristics of information flow in the execution of programme. Based on the theory of information entropy, an information entropy model of organization structure is constructed. Several different organization structures are analyzed and compared by the model and the suitability of integrated programme management organization structure is confirmed.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Risk and Strategy of the Supply Chain in Real Estate Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Supply Chain in Real Estate; Characters; Risk Identification; Strategies
Abstract: Supply Chain Management (SCM) is one of the most advanced theories in the 21(st) century, while its application is still immature in the field of real estate in China. This paper mainly focused on the risk of SCM during the operation of the whole project. First of all, it analyzed the characters of real estate development based on the supply chain management. Secondly it identified risks of crucial links in the supply chain, and pointed out three major supply chain risks the-risk of information transmission resulting from Bullwhip Effect, the risk of moral hazard resulting from principal-agent problem and the risk of adverse selection resulting from asymmetry information. Thirdly, it summarized the corresponding measures for different risks, such as maintaining supply chain flexibility, establishing information network, improving incentive mechanism, transferring risks through contracts. Finally, the paper has a discussion on future research trend.

Authors: Passuello, A; Bojarski, A; Schuhmacher, M; Jiménnez, L; Nadal, M
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Passuello, Ana; Bojarski, Aaron; Schuhmacher, Marta; Jimennez, Laureano; Nadal, Marti
Article Title: Evaluating long-term contamination in soils amended with sewage sludge
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: multimedia environmental model; diffusive transport; amended soils; persistent organic pollutants; long-term contamination
Keywords Plus: PERSISTENT ORGANIC POLLUTANTS; MASS-BALANCE; FATE; CHEMICALS; MODEL
Abstract: Sewage sludge application on agricultural fields is a managing practice of increasing use because of its benefits to soil and crops. However, if not well controlled, Sludge application may lead to soil contamination. In Europe, threshold values for sewage Sludge amendment have only been derived for heavy metals; and there is not any legal limitation for persistent organic pollutants (POPs) concentration in sewage sludge. In order to evaluate the fate of these contaminants in the soil matrix, a multimedia model was developed and executed for a case-study. The model, which was applied to different POPs, was used to predict the transport between soil phases (air, water, organic matter and mineral matter) based on fugacity values. In general terms, the simulation results showed a tendency of reaching a constant value through the simulation time for all the contaminants. The removal rate was highly correlated with the high-life in soil, which was found to be the most sensitive parameter of the analysis. No significant differences were found in the results for the two types of soil evaluated, characterized by different textures, pH, organic matter and nutrient content. The model here developed is considered to provide reliable results to predict the environmental fate of POPs in sewage sludge-amended soils. In the future, the feasibility to apply the model to other chemical pollutants, such as volatile compounds, will have to be studied.

Article Title: Research on Municipal Infrastructure Investment Supervision Mechanism Innovation-A Case Study on Xi'an
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Infrastructure; Investment supervisio; Supervision corporation accreditation; Mechanism innovation
Abstract: The non-commercial characteristics of the municipal infrastructure investment itself decide that it must be invested by the government. The corruption and low efficiency which existed in now society in the government investment fields in China has been of concern to the community. Despite the local governments have taken different measures to solve those problems, it has many troubles to interrupt us do it better. The investment efficiency of municipal infrastructure depends on its supervision mechanism. There are four investment supervision models which we summarize in China, those are Project Corporation, capital construction department, specialist agency and project agency models. This paper has studied those models of municipal infrastructure and reveals that the limited investment supervision periods, the single supervision way, the unreasonable supervision systems make many troubles to the investment supervision systems. As those problems exist in the municipal infrastructure investment supervision fields, it is necessary to reform the present investment supervision mechanism. To complete the system of holding the legal person responsible for non-commercial projects and reform the investment supervision mechanism helps the supervision mechanism to run smoothly and efficiently. The implementation of project investment supervision is important and essential in the whole lifecycle. The innovation of supervision corporation accreditation from project legal person is proved as an effective mechanism to improve supervision level based on a case study on Xi'an.

Article Title: Co-Evolutive Models for Firms Dynamics
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Keywords Plus: MINIMUM SPANNING-TREES; BAK-SNEPPEN MODEL; SIZE DISTRIBUTION; GROWTH; ZIPF
Abstract: This paper considers the Bak-Sneppen (B&S) Self-Organized Criticality model originally developed for species co-evolution. We focus both on the original application of the model on a lattice, and on scale-free networks. Stylized facts on firms size distribution are also considered for the application of the model to the analysis of firms size dynamics. Thus, the B&S dynamics under the uniform, Normal, lognormal, Pareto, and Weibull distributions is studied. The original model is also extended by introducing weights on links connecting species, and examining the topology of the resulting Minimum Spanning Tree (MST) of the underlying network. In a system of firms a MST may evidence the template of the strongest interactions among firms. Conditions that lead to particular configurations of a MST are investigated.

Authors: Tao, L; Wong, KW; Hui, CM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Tao, L.; Wong, K. W.; Hui, C. M.
Article Title: Public Rental Housing for Migrant Workers in China: A Case Study in Shenzhen
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: migrant workers; housing settlement; public rental housing; Shenzhen
Abstract: This paper investigates migrant workers' housing conditions in China having regard to the current housing policies, with particular reference to Shenzhen. It tries to explore how to address the migrant workers' housing problems. Migrant workers are the labors who leave their original places of household registration and flock to more economically developed regions without official residential status. Under the Household Registration System (hukou) in China, they are not covered by the Mainstream Housing Distribution System. As a result, many of them can only turn to low-rent houses, which are usually provided by the private sector with inferior quality, inadequate facilities and safety problems. Besides, company quarters and construction sites also comprise a relatively small part of their housing source. Based on a review of literature and relevant policies, as well as interviews with government officials and academics in Shenzhen, this paper begins by introducing the migrant workers and their housing conditions. Second, it examines the availability of housing policies for migrant workers. The third section examines the availability of the public rental housing for migrant workers and the corresponding implementations with a particular reference to Shenzhen. Moreover, a comparison between Shenzhen and Hong Kong concerning the Public Rental Housing is made to find the gaps and conclude further suggestions for public rental housing development in Shenzhen. Lastly, main points arising from the discussions are summarized and some suggestions are put forward.

Article Title: Research on System of Power grid Project Life Cycle Design
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Power grid project; Life cycle design; Power grid design
Abstract: The power grid is the important infrastructure which is critical to the state energy security and national economy development. The power grid construction and operation assume the basic task of providing safe, economic, clean and sustainable electricity to the development of economy and society. The security and efficiency of the power grid operation will bring enormous economic and social benefits to the whole society. On the situation of advocating sustainable and scientific development in our country, based on features of power grid project, learning from product life cycle design technology and method, the system of power grid project life cycle design was construct. The contents of power grid project life cycle design were introduced comprehensively. The power grid project life cycle design will influence improving power grid project construction and operation level, constructing harmony power grid and advancing scientific and technological innovation of power grid project construction.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Few Comments on An Alternative Analysis of Inventory Costs of JIT and EOQ Purchasing
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: EOQ; JIT; Cost indifference point; Mathematics errors
Abstract: Economic Order Quantity (EOQ) purchasing and Just-in-time (JIT) purchasing are two competing approaches for managing material procurement in theory. While modeling the physical plant space for the selection of the purchasing approach, a recent study[1] suggested that JIT purchasing was always the preferred purchasing approach, provided that it could capitalize upon inventory physical plant space reduction. Via pure mathematical derivation, this paper spots a number of errors in the models developed in a previous paper published in the International Journal of Physical Distribution & Logistics Management (IJPDLM). Those models focus on the scenarios where the Just-In-Time (JIT) system may unfavorably increase or favorably decrease the cost of placing an order, or favorably decrease the inventory holding cost per unit.

Authors: Wu, YZ; Hu, PY; Lu, D
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wu, Y. Z.; Hu, P. Y.; Lu, D.
Article Title: On the impact of implementing the urban-rural construction land use scale controlled by restricted quotas towards land management at county level: Based on the practice of general land-use planning in Zhejiang province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: General land-use planning; Urban-rural construction land; Shuang-gua-gou land use policy
Abstract: In China, the general land-use planning is playing one of vital roles in regional socio-economy. However, many flaws were exposed during the implementation of the previous general land-use planning, such as the rapid decreasing of cultivated land, the land extensive use, irrational expansion of urban boundary, and so on. The accelarating urbanization, with the increasing demand of construction land, relatively slow integration process of rural and urban areas and increasingly serious food security, has brought up the question of how to achieve the permanently sustainable use of land resources in the recent round of general land-use planning. Based on the practice of land-use planning in Zhenhai and Suichang, which are two counties located Zhejinag province, the paper is to discuss the possible impact of the new quotas, which are the control of the total of urban-rural construction land use scale to the future land management at county level. The Shuang-gua-gou land use policy, which means that to increase urban construction land use scale is restricted by decreasing rural construction land use scale correspondingly, is discussed. This study shows that the implementation of the new quotas play a great role in its social, economic and ecological effect such as promoting the intensive use of land, guiding the urban expanding orderly, innovating the cultivated land protection model, establishing the exit mechanism of rural construction land, vindicating the regional ecological security. Moreover, it is considered to balance fairness and efficiency during land-use quotas allocation base on that the paper analyzes the realization form of the control of the urban and rural construction land general scale in different region with different economic level. Finally, the paper proposes a bunch of relevant land use policy to help carry out the scientific development concept in land management.

Article Title: Vocational Qualification System and Education of Engineering Management Professionals
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Vocational qualification; Specialty of engineering management; Talents training; Curriculum
Abstract: To adapt to the trend of standardization development and internationalization, China has set up a vocational qualification system involved with the whole process or several stages of real estate management and project management. Vocational qualification system selects and educates quantities of professionals who meet the need of market economy, and it also promotes China's human resource development to be integrated into international standards. Vocational qualification system puts forward a new request to the education of engineering management professionals. Universities should consider how to readjust the specialties, how to institute the courses and how to improve teaching materials, so as to turn out professionals that meet the needs of society. On the other way, vocational qualification system also puts forward a new request to the students of engineering management specialty: they should have the ability to combine theory with practice and improve the capability of practice, so as to meet social needs.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Issues of the Organizational Change from an Engineering Consultant to a General Contractor in Chinese Taiwan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Organizational Change; Engineering Consultant; General Contractor
Abstract: For decades, Taiwanese engineering consultants have served the government as agents and specialized in project planning, designing, monitoring, and construction management. As public agencies tend to deliver construction projects through construction management at risk and design-build delivery methods in recent years, more and more engineering consultants begin to consolidate construction projects as a general contractor and this becomes an innovative mode of business for most engineering consultants and would influence the development of the construction industry in Taiwan(China). This study attempts to evaluate the market competitiveness of engineering consultants in the construction market and organizational transformation strategies from an engineering consultant to a general contractor. In this paper, one of the largest engineering consultants in Taiwan (China) has been studied as a benchmark case with a comparative study on other consultants. Through broad interviews with experts and questionnaire surveys, the experience from various engineering consultants are gathered and analyzed. The competitive strategy in the construction market is evaluated. Possible obstacles as well as the resistances of organizational changes are also addressed, including an evaluation of job satisfaction of the personnel in engineering consultants and the attitudes of the personnel when they face the organizational changes.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Land use planning and intensive utilization for urban land
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land planning; Urban Land; Land resources; Intensive utilization
Abstract: Using the documentation method and causality method, This paper had analyzed the reality of urban land use in China, and conclude that the use of urban land in china is extensive, which is reflected in the following aspects: lacking of coordination in urban system panning results in low efficiency of metropolis and the inefficiency of small cities; the positioning of urban planning and construction is too large, and cities have developed by means of extensive expansion; the urban industrial structure is similar in the same region, which leads to a low utilization rate of construction; resource-based cities develop unsustainably; urban facilities shortage coexisted with the land resources waste lead to low efficiency. In view of the problems of the intensive utilization for land resources, some advises and countermeasures were proposed, such as land-use planning should be improved in the following aspects: improve the land-use planning of urban development strategy, different cities take different policies and patterns of urban development in accordance with the regional characteristics; improve the urban system and establish convenient infrastructure; improve the regional urban development planning in order to avoid repeated construction; set up sustainable industrial development planning of resource-based cities; control the disorder expansion of land use in cities by delimiting urban growth boundary (UGB); increase the threshold of land use to guide the urban development; control the order of land development and construction of public facilities; establish a evaluation index system of sustainable development of regional industry planning, land use planning, and complete the administrative, economic, technological and other measures of the evaluation index system.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Judgment Standard of Construction Project Management Process
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction project; Management process; Evaluation index; Judgment standard
Abstract: This paper summarized the characteristics of construction project management process and studied the judgment method to measure it. It chose and analyzed 11 pieces of literatures about process evaluation index, then calculated the use rate of each index. An evaluation index set of project management process is formulated in this study. The evaluation index set includes eight indexes that are process cost, process time, process quality, process efficiency, reliability and stability, customer satisfaction, flexibility, process management and innovation. The eight indexes can systematically and comprehensively reflect the characteristics of construction project management process. Then a judgment standard of project management process is constructed according to the evaluation index set. The judgment standard divides the construction project management process into five ranks, especially are informal level, fundamental level, developing level, standard level and lean level. This judgment standard can reasonably evaluate project management process and lay a foundation for process optimization and decision.

Abstract: This paper firstly analyzes the current situation of Chinese Three Strata of Industry and economic development from 1978 to 2007, then studies the changing trend of Chinese Three Strata of Industry labor productivity and the effect of it on the Chinese economic growth, in the end this paper analyzes the comparative labor productivity of the Three Strata of Industry, the results show that the GDP growth of China is relative with the comparative labor productivity of the Three Strata of Industry.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Low-rent Housing System Design in Baoding City
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Low-rent housing; Housing security; Low-income families; Rent subsidies
Abstract: Low-rent housing, as an important part of China's housing security system, is a kind of social relief designed for resolving housing problems of low-income urban residents. In Baoding, the medium-sized city of Hebei Province in China, the low-rent housing policy was firstly introduced in 2004, and now all the eligible urban poor have benefited from it according to the present standard formulated in the relevant policy. But this kind of housing security is the one at a low level. Because the establishment of low-rent housing system in Baoding is at early stage, there are some institutional problems such as incomprehensive housing security scope, lacking of physical distribution mode in rent subsidies, unreasonable determining mode of rent subsidies, lacking of dynamic adjustment mechanism, unitary source of funds for low-rent housing construction, etc. After the analysis of above problems, this paper advances principles which should be followed in low-rent housing system design-government dominating principle, dynamic adjustment principle, moderate housing security principle, multiform and multilevel housing security principle, priority of rent subsidies mode principle. Then based on the local conditions of Baoding City, this paper proposes detailed countermeasures on the low-rent housing system design which are listed as follow: i) Extending security scope of low-rent housing and raising the standard of rent subsidies; ii) Changing the present person-oriented security mode of rent subsidies into the family-oriented one with multilevel structure, and constituting dynamic adjustment mechanism of rent subsidies; iii) Building or purchasing residential property used as low-rent housing, constructing physical distribution mode, defining the target population and making a clear standard of such mode; iv) Broadening the channel of fund-raising for low-rent housing system construction by introducing social capital and new financial instruments.

Article Title: Indicators Building and Incentives of Evaluation on Government Officials
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: public human resources; assessment; motivation
Abstract: The theory of Human resources management stems from the development and maturity of modern business administration theory, but because of the essential difference between the public administration departments and the enterprises, the theory couldn't be applied to instruct the public human resources management. Therefore, this article take the core functions (Performance evaluation and incentives) of human resources management as the theoretical starting point for research, firstly it carried on the analysis of achievements inspection and the incentive mechanism of the Chinese present public human resources management, summarized the flaws and the insufficiencies, then profited from the modern enterprise human resources management theory, simultaneously combined with the reality of the public administration, designed a series of inspection indicators, taking these as the basis, correspondingly took the practical and feasible invigorative measures, in order to promote our country's public human resources management.

Authors: Tsai, MT; Saphores, JD; Regan, A
Author Full Names: Tsai, Mei-Ting; Saphores, Jean-Daniel; Regan, Amelia
Article Title: Valuation of freight transportation contracts under uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Truckload contract; Option pricing; Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process; Uncertainty; Derivatives; Spot market
Abstract: This paper applies concepts from the theory of Real Options to hedge uncertainty in transportation capacity and cost using derivative contracts, called truckload options. We make three contributions. First, we provide a closed-form pricing formula for basic truckload options when the truckload spot price on a given lane follows a simple mean-reverting process. Second, since only monthly statistics about truckload spot prices are currently available, we provide an approach to estimate the parameters needed to value truckload options. Finally, a numerical illustration based on real data shows that truckload options could be valuable to both shippers and carriers. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An analysis of third-party logistics performance and service provision
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Third-party logistics; Service capabilities; Performance
Keywords Plus: RESOURCE-BASED VIEW; STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT RESEARCH; SUPPLY CHAIN; COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE; USEFUL PERSPECTIVE; FUTURE-PROSPECTS; CEO PERSPECTIVES; IMPACT; TAXONOMY; INDUSTRY
Abstract: The aim of the research described in this paper is to evaluate the relationship between the service capabilities and performance of UK and Taiwanese third-party logistics (3PL) providers. A study is presented based on a recent survey. The results identify the most important services offered by 3PLs and the most important aspects of 3PL operational performance. The results also suggest that excellence in operations is more important than wide-ranging service provision. Furthermore, the research suggests that the range of service provision offered by 3PLs does not directly influence the 3PLs' financial performance. However, 3PL providers with service capabilities that correspond to the key priorities of customers will gain superior financial performance through a better operational performance. Similarities and differences between logistics practices in the UK and Taiwan are highlighted. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Time effect of low-cost carrier entry and social welfare in US large air markets
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society (ATRS)
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc (ATRS)
Author Keywords: LCC; Impact on airfare; Time effect of entry; Social welfare
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE INDUSTRY; BEHAVIOR; COMPETITION; AIRPORT
Abstract: In this study we empirically analyzed the airfare level at which most low-cost carriers (LCCs) entered the market, what impacts LCCs had on the airfares of incumbent carriers, whether the impacts differed depending on how many LCCs existed in a market and on whether LCC(s) entered a full-service carrier (FSC)'s hub airport or an adjacent airport, whether the low-airfare impact continued for the years following entry, and finally what are the welfare implication of LCCs' entries. We modeled and estimated the simultaneous demand and price (pseudo-supply) equation to derive these four economic impacts of LCCs' entries by using published data of 1998. Our main findings are that the impact of LCCs' entries did not differ between the entry year and the second year and the social welfare gains are substantial, and 90% of welfare gains come from the gain in consumers surplus. Author Keywords: System optimum dynamic traffic assignment; Cell transmission model; The Merchant-Nemhauser (M-N) model; Marginal cost analysis; Flow holding back
Keywords Plus: TIME-VARYING FLOWS; VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; CONGESTED NETWORKS; DEPARTURE TIME; ROUTE CHOICE; TRANSMISSION MODEL; DESTINATION
Abstract: A cell-based variant of the Merchant-Nemhauser (M-N) model is proposed for the system optimum (SO) dynamic traffic assignment (DTA) problem. Once linearized and augmented with additional constraints to capture cross-cell interactions, the model becomes a linear program that embeds a relaxed cell transmission model (CTM) to propagate traffic. As a result, we show that CTM-type traffic dynamics can be derived from the original M-N model, when the exit-flow function is properly selected and discretized. The proposed cell-based M-N model has a simple constraint structure and cell network representation because all intersections and cells are treated uniformly. Path marginal costs are defined using a recursive formula that involves a subset of multipliers from the linear program. This definition is then employed to interpret the necessary condition, which is a dynamic extension of the Wardrop's second principle. An algorithm is presented to solve the flow holding back problem that is known to exist in many discrete SO-DTA models. A numerical experiment is conducted to verify the proposed model and algorithm. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Gupta, G; Goodchild, A; Hansen, M
Author Full Names: Gupta, Gautam; Goodchild, Anne; Hansen, Mark
Article Title: A competitive, charter air-service planning model for student athlete travel
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Air-service planning; Charter airline competition; Fleet assignment model; Fleet routing model; Fleet scheduling; Student athlete
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE FLEET ASSIGNMENT; HUB-AND-SPOKE; TIME WINDOWS; DELIVERY PROBLEM; DYNAMIC PICKUP; SCHEDULE DESIGN; PER-SEAT; TRANSPORTATION; DEMAND; MARKETS
Abstract: This paper presents a model for planning an air charter service for pre-scheduled group travel. This model is used to investigate the competitiveness of such an enterprise for student athlete travel in conference sports. The relevant demand subset to be served by a limited charter fleet is identified through a comparison with existing scheduled travel options. Further, the routing and scheduling of the charter aircraft is performed within the same framework. Through this modeling a method for formulating and accommodating continuous time windows and competitive market dynamics in strategic planning for a charter service is developed. Computational improvements to the basic model are also presented and tested. The model is applied to the Big Sky Conference for the 2006-2007 season, quantifying the benefits to the students from such a service and the change in expenditure associated with such a benefit for various assumptions about operations and value of time. The findings indicate the lack of spatial or sport based patterns for maximizing benefit, indicating the absence of simplistic rules of thumb for operating such a service, and validating the need for the model. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Kuo, A; Miller-Hooks, E; Mahrnassani, HS
Author Full Names: Kuo, April; Miller-Hooks, Elise; Mahrnassani, Hani S.
Article Title: Freight train scheduling with elastic demand
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight transport; Elastic demand; Simulation; Multicommodity network flows; Train scheduling; Forward markets
Keywords Plus: COLUMN GENERATION; MODEL; TIME; OPERATIONS; OPTIMIZATION; TIMETABLES; SIMULATION; STRATEGY
Abstract: A train slot selection model based on multicommodity network flow concepts is developed for determining freight train timetables for scheduling rail services along multiple interconnected routes. The model seeks to minimize operating costs incurred by carriers and delays incurred by shippers while ensuring that the schedules and demand levels are mutually consistent. A column generation-based methodology is proposed for train slot selection to meet frequency requirements. This methodology is embedded in a simulation-based iterative framework, where demand for rail services is re-computed in accordance with the train schedule obtained by solving the freight train scheduling problem. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A modified ant colony optimization algorithm for multi-item inventory routing problems with demand uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Inventory routing problems; Ant colony optimization algorithm
Keywords Plus: VENDOR-MANAGED INVENTORY; DECOMPOSITION APPROACH; SYSTEM; COSTS; TRANSPORTATION; STRATEGIES
Abstract: This paper addresses an integrated model that schedules multi-item replenishment with uncertain demand to determine delivery routes and truck loads, where the actual replenishment quantity only becomes known upon arrival at a demand location. This paper departs from the conventional ant colony optimization (ACO) algorithm, which minimizes total travel length, and incorporates the attraction of pheromone values that indicate the stockout costs on nodes. The contributions of the paper to the literature are made both in terms of modeling this combined multi-item inventory management with the vehicle-routing problem and in introducing a modified ACO for the inventory routing problem. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yang, H; Leung, CWV; Wong, SC; Bell, MGH
Author Full Names: Yang, Hai; Leung, Cowina W. V.; Wong, S. C.; Bell, Michael G. H.
Article Title: Equilibria of bilateral taxi-customer searching and meeting on networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Competitive equilibria; Traffic network; Meeting function; Market friction; Taxi industry
Keywords Plus: SERVICES; MODEL; COMPETITION; MARKET
Abstract: This paper proposes an equilibrium model to characterize the bilateral searching and meeting between customers and taxis on road networks. A taxi driver searches or waits for a customer by considering both the expected searching or waiting time cost and ride revenue, and a customer seeks a taxi ride to minimize full trip price We suppose that the bilateral taxi-customer searching and meeting occurs anywhere in residential and commercial zones or at prescribed taxi stands, such as an airport or a railway station We propose a meeting function to spell out the search and meeting frictions that arise endogenously as a result of the distinct spatial feature of the area and the taxi-customer moving decisions. With the proposed meeting function and the assumptions underlying taxi-customer search behaviors, the stationary competitive equilibrium achieved at fixed fare prices is determined when the demand of the customers matches the supply of taxis or there is market clearing at the prevailing searching and waiting times in every meeting location We establish the existence of such an equilibrium by virtue of Brouwer's fixed-point theorem and demonstrate its principal operational characteristics with a numerical example. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Author Full Names: Wang, David Z. W.; Lo, Hong K.
Article Title: Global optimum of the linearized network design problem with equilibrium flows
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Transportation network design problem
Keywords Plus: VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY CONSTRAINTS; SENSITIVITY-ANALYSIS; CONTROL FORMULATION; TRAFFIC CONTROL; ALGORITHMS; MODELS
Abstract: The road network design problem, typically formulated as a bi-level program or a mathematical program with equilibrium constraints, is generally non-convex. The non-convexity stems from both the traffic assignment equilibrium conditions and the non-linear travel time function. In this study, we formulate the network design problem as a single-level optimization problem with equilibrium constraints, and then we transform the equilibrium constraints into a set of mixed-integer constraints and linearize the travel time function. The final result is that we cast the network design problem with equilibrium flows into a mixed-integer linear program, whose solution possesses the desirable property of global optimality, subject to the resolution of the linearization scheme adopted. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Giallombardo, G; Moccia, L; Salani, M; Vacca, I
Author Full Names: Giallombardo, Giovanni; Moccia, Luigi; Salani, Matteo; Vacca, Ilaria
Article Title: Modeling and solving the Tactical Berth Allocation Problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Berth allocation; Quay crane assignment; Container terminal management
Keywords Plus: OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; CONTAINER TERMINALS; HEURISTICS; MANAGEMENT; SEARCH
Abstract: In this paper we integrate at the tactical level two decision problems arising in container terminals: the berth allocation problem, which consists of assigning and scheduling incoming ships to berthing positions, and the quay crane assignment problem, which assigns to incoming ships a certain quay crane profile (i.e. number of quay cranes per working shift). We present two formulations: a mixed integer quadratic program and a linearization which reduces to a mixed integer linear program. The objective function aims, on the one hand, to maximize the total value of chosen quay crane profiles and, oil the other hand, to minimize the housekeeping costs generated by transshipment flows between ships. To Solve the problem we developed a heuristic algorithm which combines tabu search methods and mathematical programming techniques. Computational results on instances based on real data are presented and compared to those obtained through a commercial solver. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: China has started environmental protection performance management of local Party and government leaders since 1999, but the effect is not ideal as seen from the implementation in each place. According to analysis, the reasons include the single subject of environmental protection performance assessment of local Party and government leaders, incomplete process of environmental protection performance management of local Party and government leaders, difficult quantization of environmental protection performance of local Party and government leaders, low informationization degree of environmental protection of local governments, insufficient theoretical research and practice of environmental protection performance management of local Party and government leaders, and imperfect essential work of environmental protection performance management of local Party and government leaders, etc.

Article Title: Dynamic price dispersion in airline markets
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airline industry; Revenue management; Dynamic price dispersion
Keywords Plus: INTERNET; DEMAND
Abstract: This study analyzes the factors that explain the variations of daily airfares across fare histories, or dynamic price dispersion. Empirical analyses show that dynamic price dispersion is significantly influenced by demand characteristics variables such as population, income and the share of business passengers, as well as by competitive pressures stemming from the presence of low-cost carriers, but not by the competition intensity. The impact of these variables intensifies as the departure date approaches. These results imply that in the presence of low-cost carriers, full-service carriers tend to adopt a more aggressive high-low pricing strategy. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Defensive purchasing, the safety (dis)advantage of light trucks, and motor-vehicle policy effectiveness
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Motor-vehicle safety; Network externalities; Light trucks; CAFE standards
Keywords Plus: FUEL-ECONOMY STANDARDS; SPORT-UTILITY VEHICLES; OFFSETTING BEHAVIOR; AUTOMOBILE SAFETY; PICKUP TRUCKS; VALUATION; IMPACTS; DEMAND; RISKS; TAXES
Abstract: We model motor-vehicle choice when a consumer's utility from a particular vehicle depends in part on that vehicle's expected safety, and thus on the vehicle choices made by other consumers with which (s)he may collide. Calibration of model parameters suggests that light trucks do impose an externality on cars and that increasing the proportion of light trucks in the fleet harms truck and car owners alike. The marginal private cost of accidents from light truck ownership relative to cars is of ambiguous sign and may even represent a large safety disadvantage. Analyses that omit expected vehicle safety will overestimate the impacts of policies such as gasoline taxes or changes to fuel economy standards on the fleet, and underestimate the impacts of vehicle crash-compatibility design changes. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A note to life cycle cost for railway condition monitoring
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Life cycle cost; Condition monitoring systems; Railway systems; Point mechanisms
Keywords Plus: PROGNOSTICS; DIAGNOSTICS; POINTS; WEAR
Abstract: Life cycle cost (LCC) calculation for railway condition monitoring is important to identify and measure benefits to be obtained when condition monitoring is applied to railway system and is achieved in [Marquez, G.F.P., Lewis, W.R., Tobias, M.A., Roberts, C., 2008. Life cycle cost for railway condition monitoring. Transportation Research Part E 44 (6), 1175-1187]. In this paper, the formula presented in [Marquez, G.F.P., Lewis, W.R., Tobias, M.A., Roberts, C., 2008. Life cycle cost for railway condition monitoring. Transportation Research Part E 44 (6), 1175-1187] for savings in penalty cost is rephrased and its extraction from probability theory is presented. In addition, one of the terms used in the formula is redefined and its formulation is updated. Thus, the mathematical base of the LCC calculation is enhanced with updates presented in the paper. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Li, JQ; Mirchandani, PB; Borenstein, D
Author Full Names: Li, Jing-Quan; Mirchandani, Pitu B.; Borenstein, Denis
Article Title: A Lagrangian heuristic for the real-time vehicle rescheduling problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Vehicle scheduling; Schedule disruption; Lagrangian heuristic; Rescheduling
Keywords Plus: DECISION-SUPPORT FRAMEWORK; SHORTEST PATHS; ALGORITHM; MODEL
Abstract: When a public transit vehicle breaks down on a scheduled trip, one or more vehicles need to be rescheduled to serve that trip and other service trips originally scheduled for the disabled vehicle. In this paper, the vehicle rescheduling problem (VRSP) is investiaged to consider operating costs, schedule disruption costs, and trip cancellation costs. The VRSP is proven to be NP-hard, and a Lagrangian relaxation based insertion heuristic is developed. Extensive computational experiments on randomly generated problems are reported. The results show that the Lagrangian heuristic performs very well for solving the VRSP. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: The development of the grid technology under the background of Internet2 has impacted currently available intelligent business operation model. Refer to the mutation of this entire technology background, enterprises can establish a sort of grid-based on-demand intelligent business model to satisfy people's increasing demands to electronic commerce. Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Expropriation of Collective Land and Compensation Issues in Construction Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land expropriation compensation; land use rights granting; evaluate; complete compensation; market price
Abstract: with the development of real estate and the boost of urbanization, the state-owned stock land can't meet the demand of construction land and expropriation of country's collective land becomes necessary. How to compensate is the core issue in the process of the land expropriation. Under current compensation system, the average annual output value of agricultural products and the original purposes of the land are the main bases. The government offers low compensation payment correspondingly to the farmers according to those and then gains the increment income by granting the land use rights. Such a compensation model ignores the role of market mechanism and is interfered too much by the administrative departments. Obviously the land-lost farmers' interests cannot be guaranteed and problems are inevitable in the practice of the land expropriation. For the reform of the current compensation system, the experiences of the developed countries in which land compensation fee is decided by the market are worth referencing. Currently, if we adopt the price of land use rights granting to compensate the farmers that is a better method because it not only reflects the market price of the land in some sense, but also can balance the interests among the governments, the farmers and land users, thereby avoid abuse expropriation by the government for gaining the increment income. Moreover, after several decades of reform on the land use system, a mature land use rights market and the land appraisal system have come into being in China; A batch of independent land appraisal institutions and professional land appraisers have appeared. All these create conditions for evaluating the price of land use rights granting. The price of land use rights granting which is equal to the land grant fee paid by the first land users who will use the land for decades, is not the price of land ownership. After expropriation the farmers have lost land ownership, so the compensation is not complete. The government always could gain the land income again and again by granting land use rights constantly. Nevertheless, because of the limit of the Chinese special land system and other factors, it is impossible to implement the complete compensation as developed countries at present. The government should continue to increase the compensation payment which may come from the state-owned stock land granting fee to the land-lost farmers. When all conditions are appropriate, the complete compensation will be carried out though it is a long way to reach it.
