Article Title: ROMANIAN AUDIT FIELD DEALING WITH NEW TERMS -Internal Audit and its new BRA method
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: internal audit; business risk audit; assurance; added-value; risk; business
Abstract: The requirements of the Romanian and international business market characterized, by a continuous change, lead economic enteties to a strategy conception that has a great importance to their survival in the market. In this context, the internal audit gives the economic entities the right assurance regarding the control over their activities and the right direction for improving these activities. Regarding to these statements, the paper wants to underline the that Romania audit field is facing new orientation, from the taditional audit methodes to a new methode-Business Risk Audit. The business risk audit specific elements are the orientation to the concepts: value added and assurance and we will try to demonstrate with arguments given in the article that these are even the most important ones for the development of audit field.

Authors: Debrezion, G; Pels, E; Rietveld, P
Author Full Names: Debrezion, Ghebreegziabiher; Pels, Eric; Rietveld, Piet
Article Title: Modelling the joint access mode and railway station choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Departure railway station choice; Access mode choice; Nested logit model
Keywords Plus: DEMAND
Abstract: This study models the choices of Dutch railway users. We find a steeper negative distance effect on the utility of departure stations accessed by the non-motorized modes of walking and bicycle as compared to the motorized modes of car and public transport. Availability of parking places and bicycle standing areas have a positive effect on the choice of departure railway stations accessed by car and bicycle. respectively. Public transport frequency has a positive whereas travel time has a negative effect on the choice of departure stations accessed by public transport. The derived rail service quality index (RSQ1), which provides a measure of rail accessibility to all other stations, has a significant and positive effect on the choice of departure stations accessed by all modes. The outcome of this paper can be used to develop a comprehensive railway accessibility indicator for neighbourhoods, for hedonic pricing studies. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Ding, LY; Jia, L; Fu, FF; Luo, HB; Wu, XG
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ding Lieyun; Jia Lu; Fu Feifei; Luo Hanbin; Wu Xianguo
Article Title: Research on Safety Standards System of Urban Rail Transit
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban rail transit; Safety management; Safety standards; Sstandard system; System-level
Abstract: Safety standards strongly support the regulation and control of the construction and operation management of urban rail transit, but there are still issues of incomplete, outdated or duplicated content, unavailable to form a complete system. This paper studied the current situation and features of urban rail transit safety management, and based on Accident-causing Theory, proposed the direction of building the safety standards system for urban rail transit. Besides, based on the system safety engineering theory, risk analysis and security control of the entire life-cycle theory, proposed the contents of safety standards and developed the system model of urban rail transit safety standards. This system covering the three aspects of management, entity and behavior in the whole process of safety control, cleared the content of management, entity, behavioral safety standards system, and proposed system-level of safety standards. Finally, by combing the existing safety standards in China, it points out that some existing relevant standards provide the basis for establishing safety standards system of urban rail transit.

Abstract: China is facing a grim situation of social inequality now. The unfair of Chinese society find expression in unjust of the income distribution and resources haves. The crux is the opportunity under the state monopoly is unfair It led to a part of groups have had the gap of initial cost of development. State monopolies are a pattern choice of the system design under a certainly special history It gives rise to the one being widely ignored problem: the unequal allocation of resources as part of a direct impact on businesses and citizens of resources enjoyed by the Issue of fairness, social groups, certain groups have more than others the priority of possession, enjoy equal opportunities of social resources been destroyed This article focuses on income and resource allocation from the perspective of state monopoly and social equity relationship

Article Title: E-business for Construction Supply Chain Integration
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction supply chain; supply chain integration; e-business
Abstract: To achieves the supply chains integration in construction has been advocated for a long time and it was deemed an effective solution to resolve many problems in construction. Because of the structure and current practice of the construction industry, however, the speed of integration is slow and the effect is unapparent. The emergence of e-business has provided an opportunity for furthering the goals of supply chain integration in construction. By adopting the e-business approaches, members within the construction supply chain link, cooperate and communicate more closely, and information sharing, intra-team collaboration, real-time communication, multiparty transactions can be implemented. This paper first analysis the problem exists in CSC and explores the impact of e-business on CSC integration from the perspective of information sharing, coordination and collaboration and inter-linkage of organizations. Finally, it highlights business environment integration and procurement system construction for the application of e-business.

Article Title: Thoughts on a New Model ---the Balance of Multi-regional Cultivated Land Occupation-Compensation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: cultivated land; balance of multi-regional cultivated lands occupation -compensation; industry; model innovation
Abstract: Facing the severe situation of farming lands continuously decreasing, China has raised the counter-measures of cultivated land occupation-compensation and industry feeding agriculture. Many researches have been done on the cultivated land occupation-compensation and industry feeding agriculture and government supporting policies,which considered mainly based within some administration area range, while few researches go to treat the land resource as a whole body, even fewer researches based on the cooperation between the East, Middle and West range and Northeast area within the whole country under the conditions of the market economy, especially from the point of multi-regions. This article comes up with the new model of such public resource exchange--- multi-regional cultivated land occupation-compensation and industry feeding agriculture, which comprehensively emphasizes developing the agriculture strength of the middle and west areas, the, northeast regions and the advantages of the secondary and the tertiary sectors in the developed seaside areas, and suggests the way to realize the multi-regional integration of land resources.

Authors: Kek, AGH; Cheu, RL; Meng, Q; Fung, CH
Author Full Names: Kek, Alvina G. H.; Cheu, Ruey Long; Meng, Qiang; Fung, Chau Ha
Article Title: A decision support system for vehicle relocation operations in carsharing systems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Carsharing; Decision support system; Optimization; Simulation
Abstract: This paper presents a novel three-phase optimization-trend-simulation (OTS) decision support system for carsharing operators to determine a set of near-optimal manpower and operating parameters for the vehicle relocation problem. Tested on a set of commercially operational data from a carsharing company in Singapore, the simulation results suggest that the manpower and parameters recommended by the OTS system lead to a reduction in staff cost of 50%, a reduction in zero-vehicle-time ranging between 4.6% and 13.0%, a maintenance of the already low full-port-time and a reduction in number of relocations ranging between 37.1% and 41.1%. Article Title: Decision Support System for Multi-Criteria Evaluation of Construction Safety Management under Fuzzy Envirornment
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: NSFDSS; Evaluation; Construction safety management; Multi-criteria decision
Keywords Plus: CHINA
Abstract: Construction safety management is a function of many factors, besides it is dynamic and complex. Safety management evaluation is useful to provide a scientific basis for the safety management decision and accident prevention. Non-structural fuzzy decision support system (NSFDSS) is a multi-criteria decision tool to accommodate explicitly the fuzziness of judgments in the evaluation process. In this paper, NSFDSS was applied in the prioritization of evaluation criteria based on some additional advantages identified. Using a numerical example which was drawn from the national standard in China, the applicability of the proposed method in the evaluation of construction safety management was demonstrated. Finally, the validation is made to show the reliability and objectivity of the model. The organization of this paper is as follows: In Section 2, the background and description of the proposed NSFDSS is briefly introduced. In Section 3, an illustrative numerical example is presented. In Section 4, a sort of comparison is made to demonstrate the validation of the proposed model. Finally, conclusions are presented in Section 5.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Policy Output, Public Input and Government-leading Integration of Urban Agglomeration: Game Process in Inframarginal Framework
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: unban agglomeration; inframarginal economics; public input; policy output
Keywords Plus: INSTITUTIONS; FEDERALISM
Abstract: The problem of the government-leading urban agglomeration is how to coordinate the financial autonomous sub-governments' public input and their individual industry policies for the long-run interest of the loose-economic-federation city circle. The sub-governments in the individual position of policy output mostly consider the local enterprises' short-run interests and the GDP growth in their own districts. Therefore the equilibrium of integrated public input level may deviate from the expected outcome of urban agglomeration and the enterprises' performance in their own districts. Under the framework of inframarginal analysis on the decision of enterprises, it would shed light on the game process of Primate and Non-Primate cities' policy outputs and the effects of public input on industry which are induced by different transaction efficiencies. Finally, it explains the relation between the structure of policy output and urban economic development, and gives adjusted policy for urban agglomeration and city circle plan.

Authors: Neag, R; Pascan, I; Masca, E
Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Author Full Names: Neag, Ramona; Pascan, Irina; Masca, Ema
Article Title: The cash flow information in the context of future accounting rules for small businesses
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Cash flow information; Users of financial information; Usefulness of cash flow information; Simplification of accounting rules; Differential reporting
Abstract: In Romania, the presentation of Statement of cash flows is compulsory only for certain entities, while cash flow information represents an essential component of analyze. The main objectives of our study are: (i) to identify which companies should prepare a Statement of cash flow using just the turnover for the main criteria; (ii) to identify, in direct relation with the size of the company, the real users of information provided by financial statements; (iii) to identify the purpose of cash flow information in the financial management of the entity and the main users of this information; (iv) to identify if the economic field needs simplified accounting regulation. We hypothesize that, although an entity should prepare a cash flow statement just if it is compulsory, the need for this kind of information will determine the potential users to require information based on a cash-flow analysis. Even thought our study was focused on the cash flow information (like financial statement or like relevance of inflow and outflow of cash) at enterprise level, the conclusions revealed can be extended. The small businesses do not need sophisticated accounting and reporting regulations. The accounting regulatory regimes must recognize differences between larger and smaller enterprises and between those that are listed and unlisted and/or non publicly accountable.

Article Title: Government Recapitalization for State-owned Commercial Banks: Process and Efficiency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: government recapitalization; state-owned commercial banks; efficiency
Abstract: Since 1998 Chinese government has provided capital recapitalization for four major state-owned commercial banks with the ways such as the issue of special treasury bonds, stripping off the non-performing assets (NPAs) and the use of foreign exchange reserves In this way, the capital adequacy ratio has been much increased and stockholding system transformation has been carried out in the banks. Government recapitalization has a positive correlation with the efficiency of banks. Moreover, competitiveness of banks could be enhanced with government capital recapitalization and stockholding system transformation.

Abstract: The high frequency of Public Crisis and its serious aftereffects determine the significance of crisis management Under constraint of crisis management, scientific and effective government decision-making depends on strong support which comes from the management system For the primary problem appears in crisis decision-making, government need institutional arrangement for the crisis decision-making. Through Institutionalizing accountability system of crisis decision-making, consummating the information management system, establishing performance management system, strengthening the establishment of early warning system, building up the education and learning system of public crisis and intensifying intendance system so as to heighten the level of government decision-making

Authors: Sébastien, D; Courdier, R; Conruyt, N; Sébastien, N; Tanzi, T
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Sebastien, Didier; Courdier, Remy; Conruyt, Noel; Sebastien, Nicolas; Tanzi, Tullio
Article Title: Specimen's behavior management: A masterpiece for Biodiversity Information System's representation
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: information system; biodiversity; behavior; immersion; simulation
Abstract: With the relatively recent awareness of the fragility of the natural world environment (Rio Conference Earth Summit in 1992), Information Systems (IS) trying to identify and help to manage biodiversity have proliferated. Given the various data that they contain, they are complex applications, hardly accessible to the general public. At the same time, new communication systems allow a more natural assimilation of information: three-dimensional representations of immersive virtual worlds, also known as metaverses. By putting users in a reality reproduction built from IS, all information can be represented in a consistent virtual environment. But turning IS's data in a coherent metaverse is not a trivial process. Depending the IS's structure and the availability of meta-data, several virtual worlds, representing several level of details, can be generated. Mirror worlds, that try to reproduce reality, are poorly represented without complementary information, not usually stored in Biodiversity Information System (BIS). This paper presents a new component dedicated to the management of specimen's behavior in BIS. By describing the same action through three aspects of its representation (textual, graphical, and formal rules for agents based simulation), combined to the systematic hierarchical model, it is possible to improve the immersive experience of several users, from the general public to the specialists.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Siao, F. C.; Lin, Y. C.
Article Title: Developing the Assistant Interface Management and Sharing System in Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction management; Interface management; Coordination and collaboration; Information technology
Abstract: Construction phase usually is affected directly for the high or low quality of design phase in construction, good efforts of design will make project ongoing smoothly. Drawings and documents are outcomes of design, included combined services drawing (CSD) and structural electrical and mechanical drawing (SEM) which they are one of the interface integrated tools, and are basis for construction engineering. However, integrated interface management concept into design phase should be able to decrease problems because the opinions of related participants are combined. Currently, any problem about design efforts is found and then the meeting is held for these problems, more opinions will be combined into one or more strategies to address problems via coordinating in the meeting but this traditional approach waste some costs, i.e. waiting time which before the meeting is holding, and printed data cost. However, this paper combines the traditional concept with Information technology (IT) to develop the Assistant Interface Management and Sharing (AIMS) system to enable engineers and managers to acquire these drawings and documents and provide any opinions effectively for those drawings and documents. This system is based on the coordination and collaboration concept, it can enable experts in anywhere to provide their experience for design efforts via web technology. Owners or managers also are easier to understand the situations about these drawings and documents in this system, and if there are any problems, they can make some further decisions via experts' opinions. This system provides the environment platform for users to manage and control those drawings and documents, and users can track any changes of the drawing and document in AIMS system. The goal of this study is to combine drawing and document management model with web-based information system, to provide a web-based interface management environment for drawing and document management in construction projects, and to develop modules for managing drawings and documents.

Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Article Title: Fiscal Reform - Thy Name Is Coordination - Harmonisation!
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Fiscal reform; harmonisation; coordination; EU taxes; direct/indirect taxes
Abstract: The affiliation to the common European market implies coordination - harmonisation in several fields of general interest, the fiscal one being one of the most important. This fact is required by the necessity that the national fiscal systems do not impinge on the four fundamental freedoms enlisted in the Treaty regarding the creation of the European Community, as any impingement of this nature would turn the very concept of common market void. Actually, the procedure of coordination - harmonisation is a procedure opposed to competition and it assumes an agreement among the national fiscal systems, thus achieving an ordered and coherent whole, although its composing parts were not identical.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Coordinated Urban-Rural Development and Newly Revision of Comprehensive Land Use Planning
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Coordinated urban-rural development; Comprehensive land use planning; Cultivated land protection
Abstract: The proposition of coordinated urban -rural development strategy will have a significant impact on the relationship between urban and rural areas in the process of China's transformation and modernization. But implementation of the previous land use planning falls behind of its corresponding requirement, which is not only in no favor of narrowing the gap between urban and rural areas, but also directly led to the disorder development, non-perspective layout, a waste of resources, and environmental damage. Realization of coordinated urban-rural development is considered a crucial strategy for solving the three-dimensional-rural issue. However, implementation of the previous land use planning falls behind of its corresponding requirement. This paper proposes that newly comprehensive land use planning needs to be adjusted with regard to its objective and content, and various level of land use planning need to be conducted with different concerns in realization of coordinated urban-rural development. Comprehensive land use planning is suggested a key essential to command the coordinated urban-rural development, which provides the policy with land guarantee.

Authors: Xie, LL; Ren, JS; Wang, YS; Zhang, Y
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xie Linlin; Ren Junshan; Wang Yousong; Zhang Yan
Article Title: A Study on Risk Management of Construction Standards under the Background of GPA
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: GPA; Construction standards; Grey theory; Risk Evaluation; Risk management
Abstract: Chinese government has started the application and related negotiation on joining GPA (Government Procurement Agreement). Hence the construction standards in China will be faced with multi-factor, multi-level and nonlinear risks in the enactment, enforcement and supervision after China's entry into GPA. As effective risk managements of construction standards is important for the realization of the objectives of government procurement, it is of great significance in both theory and practice to explore the risk management methods of construction standards in order to meet the GPA' requirements. For the complicated functioning mechanism and grey, fuzzy characteristics of the risks, a thought and related method of risk management of construction standards are proposed in this paper based on grey theory. Firstly, under GPA situation the risks facing construction standards in life-span were distinguished with the flow chart method. Then the hierarchy structures of multi-layer risk factors, composed of objective layer, criterion layer and sub-criterion layer, were set up. With interview with specialists and questionnaires, the risk factors of construction standards were evaluated and standard categories of risk grades were set up. The weights of different risk factors were determined by using the subjective weighing method. Definite weighted functions of risk factors in different grey categories are established based on grey theory, and a multi-layer grey evaluation model of risks of construction standards were proposed finally. According to the calculation results from the model, management strategies of risks of construction standards under GPA situation were put forward.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Study on Supervised Payment Mechanism for Construction Delay in Taiwan, China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Delay; Supervised Payment Mechanism; The Principles for Handling Public Construction Contractors' Delay to Progress Events
Abstract: Time is crucially important in most construction projects. In dealing with non-excusable delay of the contractors, the alternatives of the employers include to request the contractor to submit revised program and expedite, to terminate the contract and to claim for delay damages. Above all, there is an aged practice of construction industry in Taiwan, China called 'supervised payment mechanism', which is aimed to prevent the crackup that may caused by delay and to expedite the progress of the project. The purpose of the supervised payment mechanism is to prevent the suspension and delay of the outstanding project, as well as to secure the payment of the subcontractors when a contractor of the project is in a financial crisis. In this paper the international practices of dealing construction delay are introduced. This introduction is used for the comparison with the supervised payment mechanism in Taiwan, China. In the following the applications of this mechanism are illustrated. The issues and the difficulties the mechanism has encountered are addressed too. It is hoped this study will help the reforms of the supervised payment mechanism of Taiwan, China, and also be beneficial for both Taiwan, China and international contractors.

Article Title: Research of Performance Management Model Construction under Zero Time Competition
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: zero time; performance management; model
Abstract: The zero time competitive has offered many new topics for enterprise performance appraisal and management, enterprises should adjust performance management model continuously according to the environment The paper has analyzed the new features of performance management in zero time enterprise based on the connotation of it, and built a new performance management model based on a balance of control and flexibility, and established a protection mechanism to ensure the operation of the new model.

Authors: Yang, J; Zhang, GM; Wong, J
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Yang, Jay; Zhang, Guomin; Wong, Johnny
Article Title: Raised Floor System Applications for Refurbishing Office Spaces
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: office building; refurbishment; decision support; raised floor systems
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTABILITY
Abstract: While raised floors as a building component has been around since the 70's, its application in terms of a holistic system in the fit-out of commercial office buildings has not been fully embraced due to some inherent problems and negative perceptions of the stakeholders involved. Today, the new generation of raise floor systems (RFS) offers a suite of innovative and integrated products and solutions, and as such are not only suitable for the changing office space requirements, but also capable of meeting the smart and sustainable challenges, which are becoming the prerequisite in the refurbishment of existing buildings. As there has been a prediction for continued growth in refurbishment projects in major cities around the globe, RFS as an alternative methodology warrants new examination and highlight. This paper introduces research recently completed in Australia that provided a holistic approach to the application of RFS enabled by intelligent building technologies, and examined key issues of project development when refurbishing commercial office buildings. It focuses on the constructability of RFS, and how it will respond to smart feature requirements in buildings while extending service life, meeting new organisational change and workplace health needs for applications in today's office environment. It also introduces key project procurement issues and the integrated decision support when dealing with the refurbishment of office buildings. The paper recommends procurement strategies as well as the justification of adopting the RFS technology in the Australian office building sector. Given the current economic downturn, refitting as opposed to new build projects will come onto the spotlight. This paper will provide valuable information for building owners and developers alike when contemplating the retrofit of office buildings.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Critical Factors Influencing Building Service Upgrade in Heritage Property
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Heritage building; Mechanical service; Electrical service; Refurbishment; Critical factors
Abstract: Heritage buildings enrich our lives and communities, providing a window back into the past where our very own origins and possible ancestors resided. Conservation of heritage buildings is significant. However, aged building services popularly exist in the heritage properties and need urgent upgrades to satisfy the changing organizational, environmental and technological requirements for modern business operations. To encourage the positive use and protection of heritage buildings, extra attention must be paid to the design, construction and management of building service systems inside. It requires creativity to respect the original design and materials while meeting current building codes and occupant needs. Heritage buildings often pose unique problems to the building service design because they do not conform to the generic types of present-day construction. Also, management of heritage buildings and their building systems often has to strike a balance between retaining original building features and accommodating new technologies and equipment. A recent research was carried out to investigate an integrated refurbishment of heritage buildings with modern building services, with focuses on mechanical and electrical services. A postal questionnaire was used to explore industry practitioners' opinion on the constraints imposed on the service upgrade in heritage properties. Preliminary findings were presented in this paper. It is hoped that the research findings help industry practitioners make informed decisions in the planning, design, coordination and installation of building service upgrades and refurbishment works in heritage buildings.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Reflections on the Current Plight of Construction Labor Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Labor management; Migrant workers; Vocational training; Virtual reality technology
Abstract: Construction labor management is an important component of project management. However, the current situation of construction labor management is bad. A large number of unstable construction migrant workers with low quality and the construction of large-scale modernization are incompatible. As an example, the current plight and cause of construction labor management of construction services market in Guangdong province are analyzed in this paper. The independent labor subcontract companies are still being difficult and labor contractors will exist in quite a long time. The necessity and feasibility of construction enterprises setting up their own relatively stable labor force or labor service companies are analyzed. Last, some government policies and financial advice are proposed, for example, the professional training institutions to provide vocational skills and safety training for construction workers, the use of virtual reality technology to enhance training effectiveness, and promoting construction migrant workers to form labor unions etc.

Authors: Zheng, L; Zhu, L; Zhang, X; Zhao, HB
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zheng Lei; Zhu Lei; Zhang Xing; Zhao Haibo
Article Title: Empirical Analysis of Jury Reliability in the Process of the Evaluation of Bid
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Evaluation of Bid; Jury Reliability; Kendall Coefficient; Empirical Analysis
Abstract: The most important function of Nanjing Construction Project Trade Center (NJCPTC) is to offer the service of evaluating the bid for the employer to select a suitable contractor. In this process, the juries, who have been randomly selected from the Construction Evaluation Expert Database of Jiangsu Province, evaluate the bid and deicide/recommend the bidder who will obtain the project. Moreover, the Rater Reliability definition, which has been widely used in the field of Education Statistics, has been introduced. Based on it the jury reliability definition has been introduced too. It is well known that, there are many methods to analyze the Rater Reliability, such as Spearman Correlation Coefficient Method, Kappa Coefficient Method, Column Affiliated Coefficient Method, Kendall Coefficient, Krumbach a and Many Series Correlation Analysis and so forth. After comparing the advantages and the disadvantages among these methods, the Kendall Coefficient has been selected to analyze the jury reliability, and the Chi-square test has been used to examine the significance test for Kendall Coefficient Then the data from an Evaluation of Bid Report which is made of three parts marked with part I /part II / part III, has been analyzed to verify the Jury Reliability. Meanwhile, the Kendall Coefficients have been calculated. According to the result of empirical analysis, it could be concluded that the evaluation of bid in the Evaluation of Bid Report is credible. However, the evaluation of part If in the report is inconsistent and incredible, which may show that there are some disputes when evaluating the part II. In the end, the measures to improve the jury reliability, such as adding a link of jury reliability checked, making full use of the present procedure which includes studying the bidding documents, interpellation and clarification, dispute resolution, deviation adjustment, increasing the training for the juries in the Construction Evaluation Expert Database of Jiangsu Province, normalizing the work of preparing the bidding documents, have been put forward.

Authors: Zou, PXW; Rose, S; Jie, L
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zou, Patrick X. W.; Rose, Simon; Jie, Li
Article Title: To Bid or Not to Bid: Risk Analysis at Tendering of D&C Building Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Bid; risk analysis; tendering stage; D plus C; survey
Abstract: The outcomes of design and construct building projects are largely dependent on the ability of head contractors to manage risks associated with the project. The tendering stage provides the first opportunity for head contractors to identify, analyze and respond to project risks and to make the decision of bid or not to bid. The main aim of this research was to examine the head contractors' current risk management (RM) understandings, perception and practice at tender stage. Survey questionnaires were used to collect data. The research findings indicate that the main benefits of RM at tender were the increased ability to take risks and develop realistic project plans, while the biggest obstacles to its implementation were inadequate resources and time. The most commonly known and used risk analysis technique was intuition/judgment/ experience. Also, head contractors had a preference for qualitative risk analysis techniques, though there appeared to be no attitudinal barrier to the implementation of quantitative risk analysis techniques at the tender stage.

Authors: Shiomi, Y; Yoshii, T; Kitamura, R
Author Full Names: Shiomi, Yasuhiro; Yoshii, Toshio; Kitamura, Ryuichi
Article Title: Platoon-based traffic flow model for estimating breakdown probability at single-lane expressway bottlenecks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic breakdown; Breakdown probability; Platoons; Desired speed distribution; Expressways bottlenecks
Abstract: This study investigates the mechanism of traffic breakdown and establishes a traffic flow model that precisely simulates the stochastic and dynamic processes of traffic flow at a bottleneck. The proposed model contains two models of stochastic processes associated with traffic flow dynamics: a model of platoon formation behind a bottleneck and a model of speed transitions within a platoon. After these proposed models are validated, they are applied to a simple one-way, one-lane expressway section containing a bottleneck, and the stochastic nature of traffic breakdown is demonstrated through theoretical exercises. Authors: Nealer, R; Weber, CL; Hendrickson, C; Matthews, HS
Author Full Names: Nealer, Rachael; Weber, Christopher L.; Hendrickson, Chris; Matthews, H. Scott
Article Title: Modal freight transport required for production of US goods and services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight movement; Commodity flow; Modal freight transportation; Supply chain; Input-output analysis
Abstract: In this paper we develop a model which approximates the upstream supply chains for embodied transportation in products. The sector with the largest embodied freight transportation in consumption is petroleum products followed by government services, construction, and food products. Overall, pipeline contributes 7% to the total embodied freight movement per sector. air transport is generally under 1%, water is 5%, and rail and truck transportation are the most dominant modes (14% each) for domestic freight transportation for the average sector. International water is the largest mode (60%) even compared to domestic modes, and international air contributes less than 1%. (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Properties of a well-defined macroscopic fundamental diagram for urban traffic
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion; Urban traffic; Macroscopic modeling; Arterials; Hysteresis
Keywords Plus: EXISTENCE
Abstract: A field experiment in Yokohama (japan) revealed that a macroscopic fundamental diagram (MFD) linking space-mean flow, density and speed exists on a large urban area. It was observed that when the highly scattered plots of flow vs. density from individual fixed detectors were aggregated the scatter nearly disappeared and points grouped along a well defined curve. Despite these and other recent findings for the existence of well-defined MFDs for urban areas, these MFDs should not be universally expected. In this paper we investigate what are the properties that a network should satisfy, so that an MFD with low scatter exists. We show that the spatial distribution of vehicle density in the network is one of the key components that affect the scatter of an MFD and its shape. We also propose an analytical derivation of the spatial distribution of congestion that considers correlation between adjacent links. We investigate the scatter of an MFD in terms of errors in the probability density function of spatial link occupancy and errors of individual links' fundamental diagram (FD). Later, using real data from detectors for an urban arterial and a freeway network we validate the proposed derivations and we show that an MFD is not well defined in freeway networks as hysteresis effects are present. The datasets in this paper consist of flow and occupancy measures from 500 fixed sensors in the Yokohama downtown area in Japan and 600 loop detectors in the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area Freeway network in Minnesota, USA. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Generalized extreme value (GEV)-based error structures for multiple discrete-continuous choice models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Discrete-continuous models; Kuhn-Tucker (KT) demand systems; Multiple discreteness; MDCEV; GEV; Cross-nested error structure
Keywords Plus: CONSUMER DEMAND; TIME-USE; FORMULATION
Abstract: This paper formally derives the class of multiple discrete-continuous generalized extreme value (MDCGEV) models, a general class of multiple discrete-continuous choice models based on generalized extreme value (GEV) error specifications. Specifically, the paper proves the existence of, and derives the general form of, closed-form consumption probability expressions for multiple discrete-continuous choice models with GEV-based error structures. In addition to deriving the general form, the paper derives a compact and readily usable form of consumption probability expressions that can be used to estimate multiple discrete-continuous choice models with general cross-nested error structures. The cross-nested version of the MDCGEV model is applied to analyze household annual expenditure patterns in various transportation-related expenses using data from a Consumer Expenditure Survey in the United States. Model estimation results and predictive log-likelihood based validation tests indicate the superiority of the cross-nested model over the mutually exclusively nested and non-nested model specifications. Further, the cross-nested model was amenable to the accommodation of socio-demographic heterogeneity in inter-alternative covariance across decision-makers through a parameterization of the allocation parameters. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The impact of landbridge on the market shares of Asian ports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Landbridge; Port market share; Rout choice model; Quantitative analysis; Monte Carlo simulation
Keywords Plus: FREIGHT; TRANSPORTATION; NETWORK; AREA; HUB
Abstract: This paper develops a mathematical model to quantify the market share of a given port. A Monte Carlo simulation based algorithm is proposed to estimate the port market share. A study is subsequently conducted to explore the characteristics of the landbridge system in China and Southeast Asia. and the impact of the landbridge system on the market shares of Asian ports is evaluated using the proposed approach for three scenarios. The competitiveness of the Malacca and Singapore Straits is also illustrated by analyzing the changes in the market share of Singapore port with respect to value of time. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Reducing bunching with bus-to-bus cooperation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bus bunching; Transit operations; Adaptive control
Keywords Plus: HOLDING PROBLEM; TIME
Abstract: Schedule-based or headway-based control schemes to reduce bus bunching are not resilient because they cannot prevent buses from losing ground to the buses they follow when disruptions increase the gaps separating them beyond a critical value. (Following buses are then overwhelmed with passengers and cannot process their work quick enough to catch up.) This critical gap problem can be avoided, however, if buses at the leading end of such gaps are given information to cooperate with the ones behind by slowing down. This paper builds on this idea. It proposes an adaptive control scheme that adjusts a bus cruising speed in real-time based on both, its front and rear spacings much as if successive bus pairs were connected by springs. The scheme is shown to yield regular headways with faster bus travel than existing control methods. Its simple and decentralized logic automatically compensates for traffic disruptions and inaccurate bus driver actions. Its hardware and data requirements are minimal. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Decision support for yard capacity, fleet composition, truck substitutability, and scalability issues at seaport container terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Seaport container terminal; Yard capacity; Terminal scalability; Gross crane rate; Simulation
Keywords Plus: OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; CRANE DEPLOYMENT; SIMULATION; SYSTEM; TRANSSHIPMENT; OPTIMIZATION; PERFORMANCE; TRANSPORT; VEHICLES; NETWORK
Abstract: This paper presents the results of nine independent studies that link a seaport container terminal's long-run average quay crane rate to various strategic and tactical decisions made by the terminal operating company. New numerical results on yard capacity, fleet composition, truck substitutability, and terminal scalability issues are obtained using a fully-integrated, discrete event simulation model of a vessel-to-vessel transshipment terminal that is designed to reproduce the microscopic, stochastic, real-time environment at a multiple-berth facility. These are the first such studies to be conducted using a fully-integrated simulation model of a non-automated container terminal. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Intermodal logistics: The interplay of financial, operational and service issues
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Intermodal; Logistics; Hub networks
Keywords Plus: HUB LOCATION; FREIGHT TRANSPORT; AIR TRANSPORTATION; ALGORITHMS; ECONOMIES; NETWORKS; FACILITIES; SEARCH; COSTS
Abstract: This research addresses strategic planning for an interregional, hub based, intermodal logistics network operated by a logistics service provider. A tabu search meta-heuristic is used to solve a mathematical optimization model that extends the p-hub median model for interacting hub location-allocation problems to the domain of intermodal logistics. An empirical study based on a subset of US freight flows shows that intermodal logistics networks differ significantly from traditional over-the-road logistics networks in their hub locations, network structure, and their use of direct and inter-hub shipments. Furthermore, intermodal logistics networks are more sensitive to changes in service requirements and costs. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A generalized algebraic model for optimizing inventory decisions in a centralized or decentralized multi-stage multi-firm supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Production-inventory; Lot streaming; Inspection; The perfect squares method
Keywords Plus: ECONOMIC-LOT-SIZE; BUYER VENDOR COORDINATION; COMPLETE SQUARES METHOD; RANDOM DEFECTIVE RATE; WASTE-DISPOSAL MODEL; PRODUCTION SYSTEM; DERIVATIVES; DELIVERY; REWORK; COSTS
Abstract: First of all, a number of integrated models with/without lot streaming under the integer multiplier coordination mechanism is generalized by allowing lot streaming and three types of inspection for some/all upstream firms. Secondly, the optimal solutions to the three- and four-stage models are individually derived, both using the perfect squares method, which is a simple algebraic approach so that ordinary readers unfamiliar with differential calculus can easily understand how to obtain the optimal solution procedures. Thirdly, optimal expressions for some well-known models are deduced. Fourthly, expressions for sharing the coordination benefits based on Goyal's (1976) scheme are derived, and a further sharing scheme is introduced. Fifthly, two numerical examples for illustrative purposes are presented. Finally, some future research works involving extension or modification of the generalized model are suggested. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Adler, N; Pels, E; Nash, C
Author Full Names: Adler, Nicole; Pels, Eric; Nash, Chris
Article Title: High-speed rail and air transport competition: Game engineering as tool for cost-benefit analysis
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airlines; High-speed rail; Network optimization; Applied game theory; Infrastructure pricing
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL; DEMAND; CHOICE; IMPACT; TRAIN; PRICE; AIRCRAFT; MODEL
Abstract: This research develops a methodology to assess infrastructure investments and their effects on transport equilibria taking into account competition between multiple privatized transport operator types. The operators, including high-speed rail, hub-and-spoke legacy airlines and regional low-cost carriers, maximize best response functions via prices, frequency and train/plane sizes, given infrastructure provision, cost functions and environmental charges. The methodology is subsequently applied to all 27 European Union countries, specifically analyzing four of the prioritized Trans-European networks. The general conclusions suggest that the European Union, if interested in maximizing overall social welfare, should encourage the development of the high-speed rail network across Europe. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Barcos, L; Rodríguez, V; Alvarez, MJ; Robusté, F
Author Full Names: Barcos, L.; Rodriguez, V.; Alvarez, M. J.; Robuste, F.
Article Title: Routing design for less-than-truckload motor carriers using Ant Colony Optimization
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Less-than-truckload operations optimization; Freight transportation; Ant Colony Optimization; Vehicle routing design
Keywords Plus: FREIGHT TRANSPORTATION; NETWORK DESIGN; SYSTEM
Abstract: One of the most important challenges that confronts less-than-truckload carriers serving many-to-many distribution networks consists of determining how to consolidate flows of small shipments. The objective is to determine a route for each origin-destination pair that minimizes the cost while still guaranteeing a certain level of service. This research studies different aspects of the problem and provides a metaheuristic algorithm (based on Ant Colony Optimization techniques) capable of solving real-life problems in a reasonable computational time. The viability of the approach has been tested with a real case in Spain and encouraging results have been obtained. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Stability of user-equilibrium route flow solutions for the traffic assignment problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic assignment; Stability; Maximum entropy; User equilibrium
Keywords Plus: SENSITIVITY-ANALYSIS; VARIATIONAL-INEQUALITIES
Abstract: This paper studies stability of user-equilibrium (UE) route flow solutions with respect to inputs to a traffic assignment problem, namely the travel demand and parameters in the link cost function. It shows, under certain continuity and strict monotonicity assumptions on the link cost function, that the UE link flow is a continuous function of the inputs, that the set of UE route flows is a continuous multifunction of the inputs, and that the UE route flow selected to maximize an objective function with certain properties is a continuous function of the inputs. The maximum entropy UE route flow is an example of the last. On the other hand, a UE route flow arbitrarily generated in a standard traffic assignment procedure may not bear such continuity property, as demonstrated by an example in this paper. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A nonparametric efficiency analysis of German public transport companies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Public transport; Buses; Efficiency analysis; Nonparametric methods; DEA; Bootstrapping
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; BRITISH BUS INDUSTRY; FRONTIER MODELS; TECHNICAL EFFICIENCY; DETECTING OUTLIERS; COST EFFICIENCY; SCALE; ECONOMIES; TRANSIT; RETURNS
Abstract: In this paper, we present a nonparametric comparative efficiency analysis of 179 communal public transport bus companies in Germany (1990-2004). We apply both deterministic data envelopment analysis (DEA) and bootstrapping to test the robustness of our estimates and to test the hypothesis of global and individual constant returns to scale. We find that the average technical efficiency of German bus companies is relatively low. We observe that the industry appears to be characterized by increasing returns to scale for smaller companies. These results would imply increasing pressure on bus companies to restructure. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An empirical analysis of airport slot trading in the United States
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion management; Airport slot; Secondary market; Manipulative behavior
Keywords Plus: ECONOMIES; DENSITY
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to examine whether the manipulative or strategic behaviors of slot-holding carriers have resulted in restricted market entry and service expansion by other carriers, especially rival carriers, at the four US airports that have secondary slot markets. Airport congestion and flight delays at many major airports have become a serious problem. It has been suggested that a secondary slot market is one of the most practical options for addressing airport congestion, which would increase the possibility of competitive entry and efficient use of scarce resources. A secondary slot market would work in the same manner as a congestion toll system or an auction system, provided that carriers' manipulative or strategic behaviors do not have serious effects on slot trading. However, the empirical effects of slot markets have not been investigated systematically. This paper examines empirically whether carriers' manipulative or strategic behaviors have impeded effective functioning of slot markets. Slot transfer data from four US airports between 1994 and 1999 were examined using regression analysis. Results of the analysis are mixed, suggesting that the most effective way of congestion management depends on conditions unique to each airport, and that subsequent interventions should reflect those conditions. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Congestion pricing, slot sales and slot trading in aviation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airport congestion; Congestion pricing; Slot trading; Tradable permits; Second-best
Keywords Plus: ROAD TRANSPORT EXTERNALITIES; AIRPORT CONGESTION; OPTIMAL TAXATION; MARKET POWER; CARRIERS; CAPACITY; RIVALRY
Abstract: This paper studies the regulation of an airline duopoly on a congested airport. Regulation should then address two market failures: uninternalized congestion, and overpricing due to market power. We find that first-best charges are differentiated over airlines if asymmetric, and completely drive out the least efficient airline from the market. This is not generally the case for an undifferentiated charge, which is found to be a weighted average of first-best charge rules for the two airlines, and is less-than-optimally efficient because of its inability to differentiate between them. Tradable slots may yield the first-best outcome if the congestion externality is relatively important and the market power distortion relatively unimportant, but may be less efficient than non-intervention when the reverse is true. Abstract: Colloidal sedimentary iron deposit is the most widely distributed, the largest marine reserves sedimentary iron deposit. The geological survey has been submitted to 212 minerals, identification of iron ore reserves of 3.72 billion tons of resources, reserves of iron ore resources in China total about 6%. Such a long time because of refractory ore can not be developed and utilized. However, the mineralization of different periods and forming conditions so that the process of ore deposits are also large differences in mineralogical characteristics. Marine sediments by different types of iron ore deposits in the process mineralogy studies, the results show that: although the main iron mineral deposits such as hematite, limonite, siderite, magnetite, etc., the main pulse minerals are quartz, oolitic glauconite, feldspar, mica, calcite, muscovite, stone marrow and so on, need to remove the minerals such as phosphate rock, but unlike deposits, its main iron mineral type and content, grain degree and nature of change is embedded in a great bout, and thus constitute a single or complex process type deposits; The gangue of quartz, calcium and magnesium mineral content to different ore deposit output pH. Deposits and various types of process classification process development and utilization of minerals is closely related to pollution of those toxic, pollution of those toxic ore mineral processing nature of technical routes with different companies at the different smelting slag, silicate component of the dressing product requirements are also different; ore the main process of iron minerals mineral characteristics change, decided to concentrate mineral product grade and recovery. This paper describes the importance of such deposit process and the pollution of those toxic classification process route selection guidance.

Article Title: Pre-distribution and post-distribution cross-docking operations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Cross-docking; Logistics; Inventory
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY CHAIN; INVENTORY; ALLOCATION; RISK; REPLENISHMENT; POLICIES; SYSTEM; MODEL
Abstract: In this paper, we construct analytical models for distribution strategies with two major types of cross-docking, pre-distribution cross-docking (Pre-C) and post-distribution cross-docking (Post-C). A traditional distribution center system is also discussed for comparison purposes. Three models are compared pair-wisely. Analytical results show that, Pre-C is preferred for environments with shorter supply lead time and lower uncertainty of demand, without the benefits of risk-pooling, The Post-C mitigates the weakness of the Pre-C at the expense of higher operations cost spent at the cross-dock. Numerical experiments are conducted to support our results and explore other findings. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Brabec, M; Maly, M; Pelikán, E; Konár, O
Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Author Full Names: Brabec, Marek; Maly, Marek; Pelikan, Emil; Konar, Ondrej
Article Title: Consumption model calibration and related statistical problems
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: calibration; natural gas consumption modeling; Bayesian approach; statistical model; time-varying calibration model; model generalizability
Abstract: In this paper, we will discuss a problem pertinent to many situations in which a statistical model is developed on a sample of individuals (describing their trajectories), but then it is applied on a much larger population of interest. Typical examples occur in natural gas and other energy consumption contexts. Due to various deficiencies of the original sample-only based model, due to possible inconsistencies between sample and the population as a whole, and/or due to inherently different nature of the available sample and populational data (their measurement, error properties, etc.), calibration arises as a natural way to improve original model. We will introduce a formal and flexible, time-varying statistical model of state-space nature, from which such a calibration will come out as one of the products.

Article Title: A Study of the Influence of AEO Authorization on Chinese Customs External Auditing
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: trade facilitation; trade security; AEO authorization; customs external auditing based on risk management
Abstract: In order to realize the double objectives of international trade facilitation and security, the Framework of Standards to Secure and Facilitate Global Trade introduced the concept of Authorized Economic Operator. With consideration of features and capacity of customs external auditing, the AEO authorization becomes a new task for customs auditing under the new situation. Therefore, the paper is to conduct a research on a series of reforms involved in the customs external auditing after the introduction of AEO authorization.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP

Article Title: Risk Analysis of EPC Project Based on ISM
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Risk Management; Interpretive Structural Modeling (ISM); Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC)
Abstract: Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC), is the general way for a constructor to deliver the construction or project products. According to the construction contract, the constructors conduct the project's engineering, procurement and constructing. A number of qualitative and quantitative risk analysis methods have a current problem which is lack of systematization and strategy in risk analysis. It is necessary for EPC project to clear the relationship among different risks before risks appear because the probability of some risk may be changed if one risk event occurred. Aiming at this, Interpretive Structural Modeling (ISM) method which is the most effective solution for the problem was introduced into the risk analysis of EPC project. 11 main risks of the EPC contractors summarized via group brainstorming were assessed by ISM method. Then a Risk-Structure-Figure was set up which shows a clear relationship among the 11 risks. The conclusion is of great value to the quantitative risk analysis, such as Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP), etc.

Article Title: Shareholding Networks and Centrality: An Application to the Italian Financial Market
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Abstract: In this paper we studied the Shareholding Network (SN) embedded in the Italian Stock Market (MIB). We identified the central companies both in the role of transferring information flows and controlling companies. To this end we used betweenness and flow betweenness centrality measures, together with in and Out degree. We tested the scale-free property on in and out degree, betweenness and flow betweenness centrality. The effect of external shocks to SN and the different extent on which companies react to them are measured relating asset volatility and betweenness.

Article Title: Research on Spatial Difference of Urban Land-intensive Use and its Driving Factors with the Time Dimension Introduced: A Case Study of Xi'an in Shaanxi Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban land-intensive use; Spatial difference; Principal component analysis; Grey correlation; Xi'an
Abstract: Land-intensive use is an important way to realize sustainable utilization for resources, of which spatial difference on urban land-intensive use is an important aspect for research. Based on the overview of the research on land-intensive use domestic and overseas, the evaluation index system is put forward from the implication of land-intensive use in this paper. Then the data set of 9 Districts and 4 Counties about land use from 2002 to 2007 in Xi'an is established, and the global principal component analysis is adopted to measure and evaluate the extent of land-intensive use. Later, the paper analyzes influencing factors of spatial difference on land-intensive use in Xi'an qualitatively and uses the method of grey correlation to find the main driving factors of spatial difference on land-intensive use in Xi'an quantitatively. At last, two conclusions are drawn from this research. Firstly, the extent of land-intensive use in District of Beilin and Xincheng is at the forefront steadily and has a significant increase, while the extent of Lintong District and Lantian county is lower. Secondly, economy and demographic factor are the primary driving factor of spatial difference on land-intensive use in Xi'an, while District of Yanta and Weiyang are driven by policy factor more obviously. It is hoped that this research can make sense and provide reference for some related departments by us.

Authors: Hofer, C; Dresner, ME; Windle, RJ
Author Full Names: Hofer, Christian; Dresner, Martin E.; Windle, Robert J.
Article Title: The impact of airline financial distress on US air fares: A contingency approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: US airline industry; Financial distress; Air fares; Contingency approach
Keywords Plus: INDUSTRY; PERFORMANCE; BANKRUPTCY; RISK; HETEROSCEDASTICITY; PROFITABILITY; OLIGOPOLY; COSTS
Abstract: This article investigates to what extent an airline's financial distress impacts its pricing behavior. While prior research suggests that, on average, distressed airlines sell at lower fares, it is hypothesized that the magnitude of this effect may depend on certain firm and market specific contingencies. A large-scale empirical analysis using panel data from the US airline industry is conducted. The results indicate that firm financial distress and air fares are generally negatively related. It is further shown that the magnitude of the effect of distress on fares decreases with the magnitude of operating costs and firm's market shares and increases with firm size and the level of market concentration. Implications for policy makers and managers are discussed. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Huang, R. Y.; Hsu, W. T.
Article Title: Development of State-Level Appraisal Indicators of Sustainable Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Sustainable construction; Indicator; Fuzzy Delphi method; Fuzzy analytic hierarchy Process
Keywords Plus: ANALYTIC HIERARCHY PROCESS
Abstract: To keep pace with global trends of sustainable development, the construction industry worldwide also needs to examine their practices for sustainability. The term sustainable construction has been defined as the creation and responsible management of a healthy built environment based on resource efficient and ecological principles. The purpose of this study is to establish a proper indexing system for assessing the performance of a nation on sustainable construction. In this paper, we established a framework for assessment of state-level sustainable construction. The framework consists of five layers, from bottom to top: the indicator; the indicator category; the core cluster; the theme; and the overall performance. We employ the Max-Min Fuzzy Delphi method to identify the proper items of each layer. In addition, we employ the Fuzzy analytic hierarchy process to determine the weight of each theme, the core cluster, as well as the indicator category. The procedure for the development of the framework is outlined. The results and the discussion are reported.

Authors: Huang, Y; Li, HM; Chen, CH
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Huang Ying; Li Huimin; Chen Changhong
Article Title: A Fire Risk Assessment Scheme for Underground Public Building Based on FPN
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Fuzzy Petri net; Underground public building; Fire risk
Abstract: With the accelerating process of urbanization, various types of underground public buildings continue to emerge, which fires occur from time to time. Compared with other public buildings, the underground public buildings fire has its own characteristics and resulted in more casualties and huge property losses. Fire prevention program of underground public buildings should take into account the unique risk and protective characteristic of these dangerous. It is the role of great importance to establish the fire risk assessment scheme for underground public buildings and to research the methodology of fire risk assessment. In this paper, the fuzzy Petri net modeling and simulation approach to the fire risk assessment of underground public buildings will be discussed based on the characteristics of underground building fire and the conclusion of the current fire risk assessment methods. The thesis discusses the object-oriented fuzzy Petri nets that are used in the field of fire risk assessment. Fuzzy Petri nets for risk assessment modeling, dynamic monitoring and simulation system design will be analyzed and researched. Finally, the fire risk assessment scheme has been used for fire risk evaluation of an underground shopping center, and the effectiveness of the scheme is verified.

Authors: Karlaftis, MG; Kepaptsoglou, K; Sambracos, E
Author Full Names: Karlaftis, Matthew G.; Kepaptsoglou, Konstantinos; Sambracos, Evangelos
Article Title: Containership routing with time deadlines and simultaneous deliveries and pick-ups
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Ship routing; Containerships; Pick-ups and deliveries; Time deadlines
Abstract: In this paper we seek to determine optimal routes for a containership fleet performing pick-ups and deliveries between a hub and several spoke ports. A capacitated vehicle routing problem with pick-ups, deliveries and time deadlines is formulated and solved using a hybrid genetic algorithm for establishing routes for a dedicated containership fleet. Results on the performance of the algorithm and the feasibility of the approach show that a relatively small fleet of containerships could provide efficient services within deadlines. Moreover, through sensitivity analysis we discuss performance robustness and consistency of the developed algorithm under a variety of problem settings and parameters values. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
