Article Title: A Primary Exploration of Housing Industrialization
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing industrialization; General-purpose system; Standardization; Complete-set Technology
Abstract: After over a decade of reform and development, China's housing industry has achieved remarkable results. Housing construction has successfully completed the great transition from the planned economic development mode to the market-oriented development mode, but compared with those of developed countries, China's housing industry still has big gaps. These gaps appear as long construction periods of housing construction, low labor productivity, out-of-date technologies, low contribution ratios of technological advances to the development of China's housing industry, supply chain disorders etc., and housing industrialization is an effective way to solve such problems of China's housing industry. How to facilitate housing industrialization? Firstly, technical systemization and serialization is a key. For many years, China has planned lots of scientific research projects in construction technology, and expended lots of human and material resources, but the contribution ratios of science and technology are still rather low. It is generally recognized that the implementation of general-purpose systems may facilitate the specialized, batch, and standardized production of parts. The implementation of genera-purpose systems is helpful for facilitating assembly line production and group operational mechanisms, cutting down costs considerably, and enhancing labor productivity as an important means to realize housing industrialization. Next, it should develop special-purpose housing systems, comprising the construction technology (development) system, the housing construction system, the housing design technology system, housing parts and complete-set technology system, the housing performance assessment system etc. Housing industrialization cannot be separated from integration and standardization. Integration is a general term of conducting large-scale housing construction by the mode of socialized production, serialized supply, and assembly construction. Different from the old wording of industrialization, integration involves not only an integration of structural parts, but even more an integration of thousands of housing parts in home decoration. The objective of standardization is to realize industrialization. That is, what should to do is organize and develop large-scale socialized production and extensive coordiation, and attain the purpose of integrated housing construction through standardized guidance and cooperation. The implementation of housing industrialization still has a long way to go, and may face a series of urgent problems. The top urgency is to develop and introduce advanced housing construction systems and serial engineering technologies, accelerate the standardization of housing-related materials, parts and equipment, and form into serial development, scale production and production systems supplied in package. Here it is emphasized to follow the principle of modular coordination, and build extensive production groups of the housing industry.

Authors: Li, QL; Li, J; Ma, X; Li, X; Mei, H
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li Qingli; Li Jing; Ma Xin; Li Xin; Mei Hui
Article Title: Studying on Management Information System of Railway Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Railway construction; Management information system; System design
Abstract: The process of supervising railway construction essentially is the process of information management for construction. Large quantity of the information in railway construction makes it necessary to develop management information system to assist the work. This paper analyses the character of information in supervising railway construction and the information system. On the basis of the research of the administrative levels and dominant function of the system, it explored the according system design. In the paper, as the analysis of the characters of the information in supervising railway construction, combined with the specialty of railway construction, it is necessary to use variety tools and technologies to assist the information management. It uses software and computer to design the information system on the base of system structure analysis in order to reach the purpose of managing information effectively so as to guarantee the railway construction. As the railway construction is more and more complex, it needs advanced tools and instruments to assist the implementation. Also we should strengthen the application of the related technologies then improve in practice, making the management information system of railway construction more and more perfect.

Authors: Liu, J; Yang, XL; She, N
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Liu, J.; Yang, X. L.; She, N.
Article Title: Innovative Stormwater Management on Guangzhou International Bioisland
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Low Impact Development; Stormwater; Environmen; Management
Abstract: The low impact development techniques such as natural drainage system, rain garden and permeable concrete pavement were used to the stormwater designs of C10 Road and the ecological park on the Guangzhou International Bioisland instead of traditional design approach. The rain drainage pipeline along C10 Road was replaced by two natural drainage systems and two rain gardens. The design of ecological park was made by means of bioswales, rain gardens and rainwater treatment pond. Such designs are helpful to utilize stormwater and reduce stormwater runoff and pollution. This paper discussed the practice of the stormwater management with the application of LID techniques on the Guangzhou International Bioisland in China. The rainwater utilization focused on the ecological park. The rain drainage pipeline and green belts along the east portion of C10 Road were replaced with two natural drainage systems and rain gardens to control pollutants, reduce runoff volume, and manage runoff timing.

Keywords Plus: BUSINESS VALUE; MODEL; SATISFACTION; QUALITY; HEALTH
Abstract: Nowadays, fulfilling the needs has been identified as the main challenge in implementation of e-government services. However, the research on the implementation of e-government service from demand side is rather limited. So the paper analyzed the dimensions of needs in e-government services from different perspectives, which is based on the Maslow's hierarchy of needs theory, Kano model and Importance-Satisfaction Model, in order to help government authorities fully understand the needs and expectations of citizens in delivery of e-government services.

Article Title: A Study on the Engineering Design Risk in International EPC Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: International EPC project; Engineering design risk; Risk management
Abstract: Engineering design plays a crucial role in the engineering practice of international EPC project. The engineering design risk factors have direct influence on the quality and progress of design, thereby affecting the use value and function of the project, the project progress, costs, profit or loss of construction and installation throughout the whole process from project planning to implementation. In this paper, with the FIDIC's conditions of contract for EPC / turnkey project and international practice, the key risk factors that exist in design are systematically studied which is based on the contract management and risk management theory, systematical analysis method, and considering the EPC procurement model and industry characteristics fully. These key risk factors include design obligations, design criteria and technical standards, examination and approval of design documents, design change and design optimization and cooperation between departments and disciplines. In the meantime, some risk response measures are proposed and risk management mechanism is established, managing the engineering design risk scientifically and effectively and providing protection for EPC general contractor goals.

Author Keywords: fiscal decentralization; financial efficiency; local government
Abstract: Based on a review of relevant literatures, the writer puts forward a framework to analyze the difference in regional financial efficiency in China from the aspect of fiscal decentralization and local government's behaviors Study reveals that the difference in outside constraints and target functions makes the control methods and extent to financial resource by local governments show different characteristics Especially, with implementation of tax-sharing system, governments in underdeveloped regions facing fiscal constraints are strengthening their intervention into financial sectors, which results in low efficiency of capital allocation

Article Title: Designs of Pension System Reform of Government Organizations and Institutions of China and Actuarial Calculations of Burden
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: government organizations and institutions; pension system reform; replacement rate; actuarial
Abstract: There are huge differences between the pension system for enterprises and the government public institutions, the pension level of retirees in the government organizations and institutions are much higher than the enterprise employees'. As a result, this may damage the construction of the harmonious society. In this paper, we use actuarial methods and population models to calculate the pension burden in the original system, and then give three typical reform programs in order to reduce the burden And the results show that the three reform programs can effectively reduce the size of the pension burden

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on the Establishment of Information Communication Platform in Large-scale Construction Projects Based on Concurrent Engineering Theory
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scale construction projects; Information communication platform; Concurrent Engineering
Abstract: The smooth implementation of large-scale construction projects requires information transferring truthfully and effectively among all participants. The traditional information communication platform is mainly transited by the vector of clients or supervisors. Because of the quality of economic man of each participator, transmitting information by clients or supervisors will have information distortion which is not conducive to information transmission during the implementation of the projects. As a methodology of project, concurrent engineering stands high perspective of product designing and the whole process of manufacturing, breaking the concept of the traditional organization structure leads to partition of departments and stressing the effects of participators collaborative working. The thoughts of concurrent engineering can bring effect to strengthening the links among different departments. So applying the theory to build innovative information communication platform of large-scale construction projects is very significant for strengthening information transmission among different participators and ensuring the authenticity and timeliness of information transmission during the construction course of large-scale projects. Based on analyzing the advantages and disadvantages of traditional information communication platform and the feasibility about using theory of concurrent engineering in the establishment of information communication platform in large-scale construction projects, this paper proposes that concurrent engineering theory can be used in establishment of information communication platform in large-scale construction projects, and gives programs of specific implementation.

Article Title: Investigation and Analysis on the Reasons why Affordable House Sale in Guangzhou Witnessed Purchase Abandonment
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: words affordable house; purchase abandonmen; policy suggestion
Abstract: 2145 affordable houses in eight locations were offered in Guangzhou at the end of 2008 for the choice of qualified families. But a considerable number of families chose to abandon their purchase. After analysis of applicants' basic information, telephone interviews with families that abandoned their purchase, and comparison between such families and those actually made their purchase, the author sums up the subjective and objective reasons for such abandonment, such as insufficient payment capability; remote location, inconvenient transportation and less than perfect supporting facilities of the houses; structure problem of mismatching between urgency for purchase the houses, which resulted in supply and demand; being reduced by market expectation; and problems project operation and Countermeasures are also paper. in program design, organization, etc. put forward in this

Article Title: Social Benefit of Urban Village Remolding-A Case Study in Xi'an
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban village remolding; Social benefit; Fuzzy hierarchy analysis; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation
Abstract: Social benefit of urban village can be defined remolding as: evaluate the public effect of the urban village which have been completed the visible remolding and completed or partly completed the invisible remolding. Urban village remolding is not only the impact of a particular group, but affects the entire community that is view of social benefit. The study of the paper is at the basis of previous studies on urban village and the general summary of the project evaluation studies. Through using literature analysis, Delphi and AMP, this paper got an evaluation model. Then it evaluated the social benefit of urban village remolding of Xi'an. Finally under the combination of theoretical research and empirical analysis of the conclusions, some policy recommendations are put forward, including adhering to the Government-led and standing the perspective of the overall situation, paying more attention to invisible remolding, strengthening the management and the building of the village committee, helping the village's company better survive in the market, the social security policy to take into account long-term development of the village.

Article Title: Analyzing Environmental Control and Sewage Authority Based on the Game Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: game model; environmental control; sewage authority; monitoring
Abstract: Increasing population, polluted environment and damaged ecology have been topics of common concern. In order to keep economic sustainable growth, we must make effective policies of environmental control, finally realizing economic high speed growth as possible under limited environmental capacity. The paper expatiates theoretical basis of environmental control and sewage authority from non-economic externality, then adopting Nash equilibriums strategy based on Game model It further studies Game model between Waste-water treatment behavior of polluters and monitoring behavior of Ministry of Environmental Protection. According to Game model, we can come to conclude as follows: I. improving punishment intensity to Waste-water treatment behavior; 2, decreasing monitoring cost, 3. raising monitoring frequency.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: The Coordination Evaluation Model and Its Application of the Circular Economy System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: the circular economy; index system; coordination degree; synthetic evaluation
Abstract: Coordination development is an important factor to measure the operation of circular economy in Shandong province. First of all, this paper has established the multi-level evaluation index system, according to the requirements of coordination analysis and the characteristics of circular economy system in Shandong province. Secondly, it has done the synthetic evaluation by the subject and object giving weight way, in order to settle the data base of the coordination analysis. Finally, It has established coordination model, in order to quantitatively measure the coordination degree between each subsystem of circular economy in Shandong province.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang Ping; Hu Chunyan; Li Yan
Article Title: The Influence of Typical International Conditions of Construction Contracts on that of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction; Condition of Contracts; Influence
Abstract: To regulate the construction market order, Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development and State Administration for Industry & Commerce of the People's Republic of China enacted the Model Terms of Contracts for Construction in 1991, and modified it in December 1999. in 1999 the construction contracts (standard form) had been issued and carried out in our country, and it includes contract agreements, general conditions and particular conditions. With some definitions and clauses having been analyzed in this paper, it has been found that there still exist some defects in it. On the basis of using those typical international standard forms of construction contract for reference, such as AIA, FIDIC, NEC and so on. Combined with the reality of China, modification and improvements have been put forward starting with the analysis as a whole and specific clauses, which can make the system of standard form of construction contracts and the definition of clauses tend to be more reasonable.

Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: Web3.0; mass tourism; new mass tourism
Abstract: Tourism has been developed unprecedented since the Second World War. The era of mass tourism appeared because tourism is becoming cheaper and more convenient than before. And more and more mass tourists traveled in different scenic spots. Unfortunately, traditional fixed price and group travel mass tourism can not satisfy tourist's individuation tourism demand any more. Web3.0 is a new information transmitting pattern which improved disadvantage of Web2.0. Its inherit characters are intelligent, individuation and preferably satisfying tourists' tourism demand. Web3.0 will exert its great influence in tourism industry. A new mass tourism is stepping toward us.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF
Author Full Names: Wu Weijun; Qiao Mingxiang; Wen Yang
Article Title: The Status Quo and Reform: Legislation Regulation of Government Information Disclosure in the Emergency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: emergency; government information; disclosure; regulation
Abstract: The special circumstances of the emergency determine that government information disclosure should be timely, active, accurate and extensive There are several shortcomings which consist in China's current legislation such as the excessively dispersive disclosure regulations, the comparatively vague disclosure contents, the inconsistencies of disclosure obligors, the distemperedness of the disclosure procedures and assistance mechanisms and so on. consequently, Government Information Disclosure Act should be constituted as soon as possible to clearly define the contents of the government information disclosure in the emergency, to prescribe the disclosure obligors unitively, to further perfect disclosure procedures and assistance mechanisms

Article Title: Institutional Coordination and Economic Growth: A Study Based on Threshold Panel Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: property rights institution; fiscal decentralization institution; complementarities; institutional coordination
Abstract: Usually about institution and economic growth, people only focus on a certain institution's linear influence over economic growth while seldom pay attention to institution's nonlinear impact on economic growth and how two institutions can coordinate well enough to promote economic growth In different economic environments, especially different institutional environments, property rights institution will affect economic growth differently This paper starts from this proposition and makes nonlinear analysis on China's property rights institution's impact on economic growth from 1994 to 2005 The conclusion is that in different economic environments, the impact differs that it presents wave-shape, u-shape or nonlinear features like progressive decrease. To study mutual influence and coordination among institutions under the circumstance that fiscal decentralization institution is fixed resulting from gaming between central and local governments, the paper applies threshold panel model and makes empirical study on how to maximize institution's impact in local government's property rights institution reformation The conclusion is that the highest efficiency of property rights institution is achieved when the ratio of two institutional proxy variables lies between 0 5 and 0 6

Authors: Chen, A; Zhou, Z; Lam, WHK
Author Full Names: Chen, Anthony; Zhou, Zhong; Lam, William H. K.
Article Title: Modeling stochastic perception error in the mean-excess traffic equilibrium model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Conference Title: 18th International Symposium of Transportation and Traffic Theory
Conference Location: Hong Kong Polytech Univ, Hong Kong, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Hong Kong Soc Transportat Studies (HKSTS),Hong Kong Polytech Univ, Dept Civil & Structural Engn
Author Keywords: Travel time reliability; Travel time budget; Mean-excess travel time; Perception error; Stochastic user equilibrium; Variational inequality
Keywords Plus: ALTERNATING DIRECTION METHOD; TRAVEL-TIME RELIABILITY; ASSIGNMENT PROBLEM; NETWORK; FORMULATION; UNRELIABILITY; ALGORITHM; CAPACITY
Abstract: In this paper, we extend the alpha-reliable mean-excess traffic equilibrium (METE) model of Chen and Zhou (Transportation Research Part B 44(4), 2010, 493-513) by explicitly modeling the stochastic perception errors within the travelers' route choice decision processes. In the METE model, each traveler not only considers a travel time budget for ensuring on-time arrival at a confidence level alpha, but also accounts for the impact of encountering worse travel times in the (1 - alpha) quantile of the distribution tail. Furthermore, due to the imperfect knowledge of the travel time variability particularly in congested networks without advanced traveler information systems, the travelers' route choice decisions are based on the perceived travel time distribution rather than the actual travel time distribution. In order to compute the perceived mean-excess travel time, an approximation method based on moment analysis is developed. It involves using the conditional moment generation function to derive the perceived link travel time, the Cornish-Fisher Asymptotic Expansion to estimate the perceived travel time budget, and the Acerbi and Tasche Approximation to estimate the perceived mean-excess travel time. The proposed stochastic mean-excess traffic equilibrium (SMETE) model is formulated as a variational inequality (VI) problem, and solved by a route-based solution algorithm with the use of the modified alternating direction method. Numerical examples are also provided to illustrate the application of the proposed SMETE model and solution method. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Perugia, A; Moccia, L; Cordeau, JF; Laporte, G
Author Full Names: Perugia, Alessandro; Moccia, Luigi; Cordeau, Jean-Francois; Laporte, Gilbert
Article Title: Designing a home-to-work bus service in a metropolitan area
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Home-to-work bus service; Efficiency, effectiveness, equity trade-offs; Generalized vehicle routing problem; Time windows; Multi-objective location-routing
Keywords Plus: VEHICLE-ROUTING PROBLEM; TABU SEARCH ALGORITHM; TIME; EQUITY; TRANSPORTATION; ROUTES
Abstract: This paper presents a model and an algorithm for the design of a home-to-work bus service in a metropolitan area. This type of service must display an equilibrium between conflicting criteria such as efficiency, effectiveness, and equity. To this end, we introduce a multi-objective model in which, among other aspects, equity is considered by time windows on the arrival time of a bus at a stop. Time windows can have other uses such as, for example, guaranteeing synchronization of the service with other transportation modes. This is one of the guiding principles of the proposed model which is based on concepts that simultaneously tackle several issues at once. Along this line, we propose a cluster routing approach to model both bus stop location and routing in urban road networks where turn restrictions exist. The resulting multi-objective location-routing model is solved by a tabu search algorithm. As an application, we analyze a home-to-work bus service for a large research center located in Rome, Italy. This case study provides a benchmark for the algorithmic results, and shows the practical relevance of the proposed methodology. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Gulczynski, D; Golden, B; Wasil, E
Author Full Names: Gulczynski, Damon; Golden, Bruce; Wasil, Edward
Article Title: The period vehicle routing problem: New heuristics and real-world variants
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Period vehicle routing problem; Heuristics; Mixed integer program
Keywords Plus: VARIABLE NEIGHBORHOOD SEARCH; TRAVELING SALESMAN PROBLEM; ALGORITHMS
Abstract: We develop a heuristic for the period vehicle routing problem that uses an integer program and the record-to-record travel algorithm. Our heuristic produces very high-quality results on standard benchmark instances. We extend our heuristic to handle real-world routing considerations that involve reassigning customers to new routes and balancing the workload among drivers across routes. We demonstrate how these new variants can be used by managers to generate effective routes in practice. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Real-time traffic estimation using data expansion
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Traffic equilibrium; Real-time traffic analytics; Bilevel programming; OD matrix estimation
Keywords Plus: BILEVEL OPTIMIZATION; SENSITIVITY-ANALYSIS; MATRIX ESTIMATION; IDENTIFICATION; EQUILIBRIA; NETWORKS
Abstract: This paper presents a method for estimating missing real-time traffic volumes on a road network using both historical and real-time traffic data. The method was developed to address urban transportation networks where a non-negligible subset of the network links do not have real-time link volumes, and where that data is needed to populate other real-time traffic analytics. Computation is split between an offline calibration and a real-time estimation phase. The offline phase determines link-to-link splitting probabilities for traffic flow propagation that are subsequently used in real-time estimation. The real-time procedure uses current traffic data and is efficient enough to scale to full city-wide deployments. Simulation results on a medium-sized test network demonstrate the accuracy of the method and its robustness to missing data and variability in the data that is available. For traffic demands with a coefficient of variation as high as 40%, and a real-time feed in which as much as 60% of links lack data, we find the percentage root mean square error of link volume estimates ranges from 3.9% to 18.6%. We observe that the use of real-time data can reduce this error by as much as 20%. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Multiple equilibria in a dynamic traffic network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dynamic traffic assignment; Dynamic user equilibrium; Bottleneck model; Uniqueness
Keywords Plus: USER EQUILIBRIUM; ASSIGNMENT; MODEL; EXISTENCE; STABILITY
Abstract: This study provides an example in which the dynamic user equilibrium (DUE) assignment of a congested road network with bottlenecks is non-unique. In previous studies, the uniqueness of DUE assignments with the bottleneck model has been shown in limited cases such as single-origin and single-destination networks. Consequently, it is still an important issue whether or not uniqueness is a general property of DUE assignments. The present study describes a network in which multiple patterns of link travel time are found, thus providing a negative answer to this question. The network has a loopy structure with multiple bottlenecks and multiple origin-destination (OD) pairs. Given a certain demand pattern of departure times for vehicles leaving their origins, a non-convex set of equilibria with a non-unique pattern of link travel times is shown to exist. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Patire, Anthony D.; Cassidy, Michael J.
Article Title: Lane changing patterns of bane and benefit: Observations of an uphill expressway
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Expressway; Traffic congestion; Uphill bottleneck; Speed disturbance; Vehicle lane-changing
Keywords Plus: CHANGE MANEUVERS
Abstract: A mechanism is unveiled by which congestion forms on a 3-lane, uphill expressway segment, and causes reductions in output flow. Vehicular lane-changing (LC) is key to the mechanism, particularly LC induced by speed disturbances (SDs) that periodically arise in the expressway's median and center lanes. Early in the rush, when flow was relatively low in the shoulder lane, drivers readily migrated toward that lane to escape the oncoming SDs. The shoulder lane thus acted as a 'release valve' for the high vehicular accumulations created by the SDs, such that forced vehicular decelerations were short-lived. The release valve failed only later in the rush, when flow increased in the shoulder lane in response to rising demand. LC induced by the SDs thereafter became disruptive: the decelerations they imposed spread laterally, and a persistent queue formed in all lanes. Long-run output flow dropped each day by 4-11% once the queue engulfed the base of the incline, and impeded vehicle ascent. Subtle details of this mechanism became visible by examining thousands of vehicle trajectories that were extracted from a series of eleven roadside video cameras. Though these trajectories were collected from only a single day, we suspect that the findings can be generalized to other days at the present site, and to other sites. This is because: (i) conspicuous features of the mechanism were repeatedly observed in loop detector data that were measured over many days at the site; (ii) these macroscopic features are consistent with observations previously made at other sites; and (iii) the more subtle details unveiled by the trajectories are compatible with a general theory of multi-lane traffic. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Xu, HL; Lou, YY; Yin, YF; Zhou, J
Author Full Names: Xu, Hongli; Lou, Yingyan; Yin, Yafeng; Zhou, Jing
Article Title: A prospect-based user equilibrium model with endogenous reference points and its application in congestion pricing
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User equilibrium; Stochastic network; Cumulative prospect theory; Reference points and congestion pricing
Keywords Plus: DEPARTURE TIME CHOICE; TRAVEL-TIME; TRAFFIC EQUILIBRIUM; RISK-TAKING; NETWORK; ROUTE; REPRESENTATION; WORK
Abstract: Given that the cumulative prospect theory provides a well-supported descriptive paradigm for decision making under risk or uncertainty, previous studies applied the theory to model travelers' route choice behaviors in stochastic networks and developed prospect-based user equilibrium models. The models rely on exogenous inputs of reference points and thus the resulting reference-dependence could be regarded as an ad hoc assumption. This paper proposes a conjecture on travelers' determination of reference points and encapsulates it into the prospect-based user equilibrium conditions. The conditions are formulated as an equivalent variational inequality and a heuristic solution algorithm is proposed to solve it. Both the model and the solution algorithm are demonstrated in two numerical examples. As one application, this paper further develops an optimal pricing model in which the proposed user equilibrium model is adopted to capture travelers' response to pricing signals under risk. The pricing model is formulated as a mathematical program with complementarity constraints, solved by a derivative-free algorithm. Another numerical example is presented to illustrate the pricing model and the solution algorithm. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Efficiency and patterns of service mix in airport companies: An input distance function approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport industry; Efficiency measurement; Input distance function; Cost complementarities; Outsourcing
Keywords Plus: PRODUCTIVITY GROWTH; TECHNICAL EFFICIENCY; STOCHASTIC ESTIMATION; UNDESIRABLE OUTPUTS; DOMESTIC AIRPORTS; MAJOR AIRPORTS; PERFORMANCE; ECONOMIES; BENCHMARKING; INEFFICIENCY
Abstract: In this paper an input distance function approach is used to evaluate efficiency and technological characteristics of Italian airport companies for the period 2000-2005. This approach is robust to deviations from neoclassical paradigm in terms of cost-minimizing behavior. Duality relationship between the input distance function and the shadow cost function is exploited to derive cost complementarities among outputs. Empirical findings are used to discuss the economic implications connected to changes in airport organization, involving in particular outsourcing of handling operations and development of commercial activities. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Dynamic relief-demand management for emergency logistics operations under large-scale disasters
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Emergency logistics operations; Relief-demand management; Multi-source data fusion; Fuzzy clustering; Entropy; TOPSIS
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY-CHAIN; RESOURCE-ALLOCATION; INFORMATION; OPTIMIZATION; MODEL
Abstract: This paper presents a dynamic relief-demand management model for emergency logistics operations under imperfect information conditions in large-scale natural disasters. The proposed methodology consists of three steps: (1) data fusion to forecast relief demand in multiple areas, (2) fuzzy clustering to classify affected area into groups, and (3) multicriteria decision making to rank the order of priority of groups. The results of tests accounting for different experimental scenarios indicate that the overall forecast errors are lower than 10% inferring the proposed method's capability of dynamic relief-demand forecasting and allocation with imperfect information to facilitate emergency logistics operations. Article Title: Metallogenic Prediction on Phosphorite in North China
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: North Phosphorite; Metallogenic Background; Metallogenic Conditions; Metallogenic Prediction; Resource Potential
Abstract: The metallogenic conditions of phosphorite exist extentivly in Sino-Korean paraplatforms as well as the deep-seated fault of brink Tarim paraplatform and the middle zone of several geosyncline folded areas such as Tianshan - Xing'an, Chilien- Chinling and Ererguna. Research and analysis showed that the endogenesis phosphorite have better prospecting potential as well as the greenstone belt phosphorite and sedimentary & metamorphic phosphorite in Paleoproterozoic Era, the sedimentary phosphorite usually with low-grade and in small scale. 4 Grade-B metallogenic predicting regions, 15 Grade-C metallogenic belts, 19 Grade-D metallogenic subzones for phosphorite have been marked off in north China. At the same time, we set up 2 Grade-A, 13 Grade-B and 13 Grade-C metallogenic predicting regions, 22 areas have been selected for further work.

Abstract: Nandan region of China is an important Tin base, China Tin Group Co., Ltd. in processing copper ore mine pit volume has reached 2 million t / a. Because the mine early and long service life, it already has five tailings that have a greater negative impact on the environment. Author Full Names: Zegordi, S. H.; Nia, M. A. Beheshti
Article Title: A multi-population genetic algorithm for transportation scheduling
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Scheduling; Supply chain management; Genetic algorithm; Transportation; Tardiness
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION; MINIMIZING TOTAL TARDINESS; JOB DELIVERY COORDINATION; READY-MIXED CONCRETE; PARALLEL MACHINES; SELECTION; INDUSTRY; MANAGEMENT; LOGISTICS; SYSTEM
Abstract: This study considers the integration of production and transportation scheduling in a two-stage supply chain environment. The objective function minimizes the total tardiness and total deviations of assigned work loads of suppliers from their quotas. After modeling the problem as a mixed integer programming problem, a genetic algorithm with three populations, namely, a multi-society genetic algorithm (MSGA), is proposed for solving it. MSGA is compared with the optimum solutions for small problems and a heuristic and a random search approach for larger problems. Additionally, an MSGA is compared with a generic genetic algorithm. The experimental results show the superiority of the MSGA. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lu, CC; Mahmassani, HS; Zhou, XS
Author Full Names: Lu, Chung-Cheng; Mahmassani, Hani S.; Zhou, Xuesong
Article Title: Equivalent gap function-based reformulation and solution algorithm for the dynamic user equilibrium problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dynamic traffic assignment; Dynamic user equilibrium; Gap function; Column generation algorithm; Traffic simulation
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT MODEL; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; NETWORK; FORMULATION; EXISTENCE; ROUTE; REPRESENTATION; STABILITY
Abstract: A variety of analytical and Simulation-based models and algorithms have been developed for the dynamic user equilibrium (DUE) traffic assignment problem. This paper aims to develop a theoretically sound simulation-based DUE model and its solution algorithm, with particular emphasis on obtaining solutions that satisfy the DUE conditions. The DUE problem is reformulated, via a gap function, as a nonlinear minimization problem (NMP). The NMP is then solved by a column generation-based optimization procedure which embeds (i) a simulation-based dynamic network loading model to capture traffic dynamics and determine experienced path travel costs for a given path flow pattern and (ii) a path-swapping descent direction method to solve the restricted NMP defined by a subset of feasible paths. The descent direction method circumvents the need to compute the gradient of the objective function in finding search directions, or to determine suitable step sizes, which is especially valuable for large-scale simulation-based DUE applications. Computational results for both small and large real road networks confirm that the proposed formulation and solution algorithm are effective in obtaining near-optimal solutions to the DUE problem. (C) Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: On the morning commute problem in a corridor network with multiple bottlenecks: Its system-optimal traffic flow patterns and the realizing tolling scheme
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Morning commute; System-optimum; Dynamic congestion pricing; Corridor control
Keywords Plus: CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; DEPARTURE TIME; ASSIGNMENT
Abstract: There have been numerous studies of the morning commute problem in a network with a single route or parallel routes with a single bottleneck on each route. Most congested networks, however, often contain more than one congestion spot along each route. In such networks, it is usually difficult to derive analytically their system-optimal traffic patterns and the tolls that realize them. In this paper, we study the morning commute problem in such a network with certain special topological features - a freeway with multiple entry/exit ramps and a surface street grid with large capacities. For this type of networks, we investigated the basic characteristics of their optimal dynamic traffic patterns and the corresponding tolling scheme, for which a graphical solution procedure was also developed. In this network, we found that at system-optimum: (1) the aggregate traffic flow on the freeway has a staircase temporal profile, and piecewise linear dynamic tolls can be imposed on a subset of ramps to achieve it; (2) among all the off-ramps in use, the ones closer to the destination are being tolled longer with higher maximum toll charges than the ones farther away from the destination; and (3) among all the on-ramps in use, the ones with larger cumulative volume-to-capacity ratios are being tolled longer with higher maximum toll charges. Some practical implications of these findings to corridor traffic management were also discussed. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Binding-Method of AHP and ANN for Evaluation on Living Residential Environment Quality
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Living Residential Environment Quality; Analytic Hierarchy Process; Artificial Neural Networks
Abstract: Evaluation on living residential environment quality in city resident district is the reliance on which government guide the development of housing industry, contemporarily, it is the fundamental reference for house developer to develop marketable residential house according to the demand of urbanite. The evaluation on living residential environment quality in city resident district, is comprehensive of multipurpose multi-attributer. Evaluating must be conducted from multi-angles and multi-criteria's. The evaluation on living residential environment quality in city resident district, is comprehensive of multipurpose & multi-attributer. This paper brings forth an evaluation method which could bind the AHP and ANN methods. The primary evaluation procedures of this binding-method were described in detail, and then evaluation index systems were defined respectively for AHP & ANN methods. At last, twelve resident districts were selected, and by this binding-method, a practically evaluating on those resident districts was done.

Article Title: Countermeasure Research on Developing Hubei Equipment Manufacturing Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: equipment manufacturing industry; technical innovation; countermeasure; research
Abstract: Accelerating the development of equipment manufacturing has seriously attracted national attention. Hubei Province, one of the comparatively developed regions in this field, has gradually lost its regional advantage in the current situation of economic globalization, compared with the Pearl River Delta, Yangtze River Delta and the Northeast region. In order to cope with the current international financial crisis, Hubei should make greater efforts to revitalize the equipment manufacturing, and strive to become a national equipment manufacturing base with self-innovation capability. This article conducts a preliminary study and discussion on how to expedite the development of equipment manufacturing industry in Hubei Province.

Author Full Names: Cheung, Esther; Chan, Albert P. C.
Article Title: A Research Framework for Developing an Equitable Risk Sharing Mechanism for Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Projects in the People's Republic of China (PRC)
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Procurement; Public Private Partnership; Principal Risk Factors; Risk Sharing Mechanism; People's Republic of China
Abstract: The People's Republic of China (PRC) is one of the most densely populated countries in the world. The forecast urban population in the PRC would increase to 827 million in 2025. To alleviate the negative impact of unorganized urbanization growth, mass rapid transit has been prioritized as a key transport mode in mega cities. Other public facilities are also in high demand to cope with the increasing urbanization growth. However, inadequate government funding may limit the development of these projects. Public Private Partnership (PPP) financing modalities have been identified as innovative tools for financing major infrastructure projects. Earlier research work indicated that a fair risk allocation amongst the stakeholders is essential for the success of PPP projects; however, actual empirical research on the ground is limited. The contents in this paper is based on the original proposal for the funding application of this study which is funded jointly by the Research Grants Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and the National Science Foundation Council Research Grant of China. This study aims to develop an equitable risk allocation mechanism for the delivery of PPP projects in the PRC. A two-round Delphi survey will be conducted to identify the principal risk factors and their preferred party to allocate the risk. Furthermore, face to face interviews will be carried out to evaluate the impact and actual allocation of the principal risk factors. Finally an equitable risk sharing mechanism will be developed and validated by a series of focus group meetings before proposing for implementation in the PRC.

Article Title: Game Research on Financial Innovation Regulation Based on Social Welfare
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: social welfare; financial innovation; financial regulation; game
Abstract: The global financial crisis caused by the U.S. sub-prime crisis in 2007, fundamentally speaking, is the result of financial innovation and inadequate regulation to financial innovation. Social welfare is useful to decide whether financial innovation will be done or not. When the social welfare with regulation on financial innovation is more than that without regulation, it is necessary to regulate the financial innovation; on the contrary, when the social welfare with regulation on financial innovation is less than that without regulation, it is not indispensable to regulate the financial innovation.

Article Title: A research on the dividend policy of developing REITs in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: REITS; Dividend policy; China
Abstract: Nowadays, the credit tightening policy has forced developers to explore alternative sources of funding for real estate projects. As the crucial economy member, China is considering liberalizing the financing ways of real estate market and evaluating the feasibility of creating a REIT market, and a policy announcement with respect to setting up a REIT market could be expected soon. This paper researches on the dividend policy in process of developing REITs in China. Referring to the REITs dividend's data in America in recent years and the dividend policy in Asian countries and regions, it concentrates on the detailed empirical study on the dividend policy's guidance data in the progress of developing REITs in china in its initial stage and draws the conclusion that China should require mandatory distribution of 90% and recommendatory ceiling of 135% taxable earnings REITs as dividends to unit-holders.

Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6

Author Keywords: Existing building; Energy-Saving; Transformation; Strategy
Abstract: The paper takes Urumqi city as a research target, analyses the present situation of energy-saving transformation of existing inhabitable buildings in Xinjiang region; probes into the main obstacles during the transformation work and was benefited by the modes and experiences of two successful cases: the transformation item in Xier lane Nanhu road and the show item, which cooperated by China and Germany in playground lane Xinm in road; thus it comes up the basic principle and strategy of energy-saving transformation. The strategy of province and municipality set up scientific regulations of energy-saving transformation; the governmental function should change its leading factor into policy conduction; the mode of transformation should turn simplification into multiplicity. The strategy of item implement department creates the main body; works out scientific and reasonable planning; guarantees the profits of investors; makes good transforming implement and debases disturbing residents. It provides references for upcoming large-scales residential transformation of energy-saving works.

The logistics industry will be a key economic sector for China in the twenty-first century. It has academic and actual significance for studying the reform of regulation in the logistics industry. The article analyzes the reasons of deregulation of logistics industry in the developed countries, and explores the existing problems of China's logistics industry. Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Default Risk; Sunny Weather; Upbeat Mood; Fat Tails
Keywords Plus: RETURNS; WEATHER
Abstract: Even though psychological evidence and casual intuition predict that weather may lead to changes in equity returns, little attention has been paid to these changes through asset pricing mechanisms. This paper fills this gap by examining the effects of sunny weather enhanced upbeat mood on bank spread management and default risk. An option-based model of bank spread behavior is developed to study these closely related phenomena. The model is designed to indicate the fat tails of loan repayments caused by mood effects induced by good weather. With the good mood influences on bank lending, this paper shows that sunshine is negatively correlated with the default risk in equity returns.

Article Title: Existing Condition Analysis and Strategy Research on the Economic Housing in Linyi
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Economic housing; Linyi; Countermeasure
Abstract: Building economic housing is a policy to solve the lodging difficulty for the low income residents, which is called popularly supported projection. Since 1998, the market of economic housing has been developing rapidly. As an essential component of the social security system in Linyi city, Economic Housing Policy has a certain positive action in resolving the housing problem for low and middle income families, disadvantaged groups, and relieving city housing stress which has lasted for 11 years. At the same time, it could promote economic growth through the development of a real estate market; it can also enhance people's welfare and right of residence. However, with the development of the economic housing market, a lot of questions needed to be answered. Through the analysis of the current situation, distribution, price formation for economic housing, the article points out that there are many problems in its development such as imbalances between supply and demand, poor quality in construction, higher prices, most of which are not applicable, especially the purchasers are difficult to identify compared with the standards, which all might lead to diseconomy in many ways, perhaps leading to social inequality. On the basis of these problems, great efforts were made seeking strategic solution. Devoting more efforts to supervision, open secondary market, innovate the mode of economic housing, and at the same time, the government should do well in a investigation plan, reinforce the micro-control and carry out the correlative policies. So that it can solve the housing problem for more of the population with low and middle level income, earners realizing the idea that everyone can own their apartment.

Article Title: Aspects Regarding the Net Profit Registered by Enterprises in Romania
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: net profit; expenditure; financial statements
Abstract: Trying to emphasize the competitive environment in Romania, we analyzed the relationship between net profit and certain items of expenditure shown in the profit and loss account. In this way we conducted a survey of 1230 SMEs from several sectors. If sometimes the relationship between the expenses and net profit was the expected one, some other time our research has revealed some situations that should be regulated from fiscal point of view.

Article Title: The Analysis of the Crowding -in or Out Effect of FDI on Domestic Investment in the Central Region
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: FDI; the central region; crowding-in or out
Abstract: In this paper, the six central provinces of China are the object of the study, we will make a comprehensive and systematic study of the impact of foreign direct investment on domestic investment in the region Results show that For the central six provinces, FDI has caused the crowding -in effect on the domestic investment Among them, the effects of Shanxi Province and Hunan Province are larger, are 5 88 and 5 44, respectively Followed by the Henan Province and Anhui Province, 4 34 and 3 51, respectively Finally, in Hubei Province and Jiangxi Province, the relevant datas are 1 87 and 1 14, respectively

Authors: Papageorgiou, A; Schulte, S; Schuller, D; Niemann, M; Repp, N; Steinmetz, R
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Papageorgiou, Apostolos; Schulte, Stefan; Schuller, Dieter; Niemann, Michael; Repp, Nicolas; Steinmetz, Ralf
Article Title: Governance of a Service-Oriented Architecture for Environmental and Public Security
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Research for the application of technical support in environmental projects has grown rapidly due to the progress of sensor network systems and the large, scalable IT infrastructures that can unify and expand them. There are numerous attempts to make use of new technologies in order to serve environmental purposes. The research presented in this paper focuses on critical aspects of the core infrastructure of a project that aims to serve these purposes as well. The nature of the actions that must be taken against environmental disasters, which are our target use cases, dictate that extended, cross-organizational information and communication systems are engaged. In order to integrate information from different sources and process heterogeneous services, the IT infrastructure is based on the paradigm of Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA). However, the distributed and often very large nature of an SOA leads to a need for governance mechanisms. We present an SOA governance approach targeted to serve the purposes of large-scale distributed IT landscapes for environmental and public security.

Author Full Names: Park, J. H.; Paek, J. H.
Article Title: Analysis of US Real Estate Business using 2-State Markov Switching Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real Estate Businesss; Markov Switching Model; Global Financial Crisis
Abstract: Current Global Financial Crisis is caused by Subprime Mortgage Loan Crisis in US. Collapse of US Real Estate Business is occurred US Financial Crisis and Global Financial Crisis. US have been occupied great position in Global Financial Market. Because of that, recovery of US Real Estate Business is very important for Global Financial Market. If US Real Estate Business will turn around, US Financial Market and Global Financial Market also will be rallied. Furthermore, it would be occurred recovery of Real Estate Business in Asian Countries. It means analysis of US Real Estate Business is very important and need for forecast Global Financial Market. Therefore, in this paper is progressed US Real Estate Business Analysis using 2-State Markov Switching Model. Markov Switching Model is one of good analysis methods in Economics Field to analyze Regime shifts. This model is found to be statistically congruent and economically meaningful. Regime shifts in the stochastic process of Real Estate Business in US are identified by fitting Markov-switching models to US Economic indicator monthly data of the last 29 years from January 1981 to May 2009 using Housing Units Authorized by Building Permits referenced by US Census Bureau. As a result, current movements of US are given positive signs, so Global Market has to observe US Market closely.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Evaluation of Real Estate Investment Environment of 200 Cities in China by AHP-Principle Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate investment environment; AHP; principal factor analysis
Abstract: From 1988 till now, the real estate market in china has been experienced a rapid development-from unfair competition to increasingly standardized real estate market. As the maturing of the real estate market, the competitions in big cities became fiercer. Investors began to shift the investment focus to the smaller cities which had high investment potential. During this process, investors began to realize the importance of rational judgment, and paid a lot of attentions on the evaluation of real estate investment environment. Based on such background, this paper tried to establish a scientific index system, and to use official data to evaluate the investment environment of the cities. The objective of this paper is to give some advices to the real estate investors in making investment decisions. By analyzing amount of materials on this field, this paper established an index system of real estate investment environment that includes 30 indexes divided into 6 sorts. Based on the integrity of the data, paper chose 200 cities in total as the evaluation objects. In the evaluation, this paper used analytic hierarchy process (AHP) and principal factor analysis to make evaluation and obtain the ranks of each city. In the analysis of the result, the paper compared with the two ranks from two methods, and classified the 200 cities according to changes of the rank. The paper also gave some suggestions to each sort.

Authors: Wang, YS; Zhou, JW; Chen, WG; Xie, LL; Zhang, Y
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang, Y. S.; Zhou, J. W.; Chen, W. G.; Xie, L. L.; Zhang, Y.
Article Title: A Characteristic Analysis of Guangzhou's Commercial Land Market in 2008
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Commercial land; Market; Real estate; Guangzhou
Abstract: The performance of the land market is a leading indicator in real estate development. Guangzhou, as a major city in south China, plays an important role in real estate industry of China. In this paper, the statistical data of Guangzhou's commercial land market in 2008 have been collected. There are 158 items of land supply with 7.61 sq-km in Guangzhou's land market of 2008. Most of the lands are supplied for industrial uses. The distributions of geography, season, plot area, usage, transition type, proposed price and real sale price in the commercial land trade market have been analyzed. The reasons of land bidding abortion are also explained. The structural change of land supply and market absorption is matched to the market conditions. As the residential housing market sale is restoring, the land supply plan would be adjusted to meet the potential demand. Therefore, some suggestions have been made for a healthy development of real estate market.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Study on Provision of Public Service Facilities for Government-Subsidized Residential Communities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Government-Subsidized; Communities; Public Service Facilities; Provision
Abstract: Against the backdrop of city renewal and implementation of government-subsidized housing system, a large number of government-subsidized communities are emerging across China. However, public service facilities are badly lagging behind and deficient in those government-subsidized communities which are located in remote areas and are paid little attention to provision of auxiliary facilities. Consequently, the quality of residents' life is affected, new social unfairness is caused and subsidization effects and the formation of a harmonious society are hampered. Based on analysis of influencing factors on the provision of public service facilities for government-subsidized communities, this study suggests the principles, time sequencing and level of provision of public facilities to meet the individualized demands of residents in those communities, emphasizes the leading role of the government as a main provider among diversified providers, and finally proposes the guidelines, principles and essentials of layout of public service facilities in government-subsidized communities, hence the study is of realistic guiding significance.

Authors: Ye, YM; Zhu, JM; Tan, R
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ye, Y. M.; Zhu, J. M.; Tan, R.
Article Title: Urban Housing Vacancy Rate and Its Influence Factors
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing Vacancy; Vacancy Rate; Reasonable Vacancy Rate
Abstract: Urban housing vacancy rate is one of the important indicators to reflect supply and demand condition in the real estate market. The current state of Chinese domestic studies is lack in a scientific and uniform definition on the Housing vacancy as well as the method for measuring it. This has resulted in great difficulty in comparing the housing vacancy of Chinese cities with their counterparts in rest of the world. Consequently, uniform and reasonable definition needs to be established for further measurement and monitoring of the Chinese housing vacancy conditions, which will be helpful for governmental intervention in the real estate market, and preventing the market risk. Through a Chinese literature review and comparing with oversea studies, this article first develops a definition for housing vacancy and the housing vacancy rate, and then analyzes the factors that can influence the change of the vacancy rate. Taking Hangzhou as an example, the paper measures the housing vacancy rate by a field survey in 2008, and compares with the data in other countries, which will make significant sense of judging the development of the real estate market in Hangzhou.

Authors: Ying, B; Li, HM; Huang, Y; Tan, XA
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ying Bo; Li Huimin; Huang Ying; Tan Xiao
Article Title: Analysis of Public Building Construction Phase Fire Accidents Based on Fault Tree Analysis Method
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public buildings; Fire accidents; Fault tree analysis; Importance degree
Abstract: There are numerous uncertain factors which are fire hazards at the public building construction sites, so it has high risk to get fires at this phase. The fire risks and consequences of construction phase are great, even more serious than completed buildings. The fire sources identification, fire safety assessment and fire safety management can positively and effectively reduce fire risk during construction, which can ensure the success of projects. This paper introduces the current situation and characteristics of Chinese public building fire accidents during construction phrase and analyses the common fire sources, furthermore, draws and analyses the fire accidents fault tree in order to obtain the importance degree rank based on the structure importance degree and the fuzzy degree of each basic event. The author uses various methods such as consulting experts, observing construction sites and researching relevant construction files to establish fault tree.Focus on the fire sources, this paper offers suggestion that construction phase fire safety should have system management based on technique and organization measures.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Analysis of Risks in Chinese Property Service Integrators Based on FTA
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Property management; Property service integrator; FTA(fault tree analysis); Risk
Abstract: Faced with the global financial crisis, more and more property management enterprises have to make efforts to reduce the increasing cost of property management and continuously meet the diverse needs of owners.FTA (fault tree analysis) is a deductive method of risk identification. Applying the method into the risk analysis of property service integrators, this paper analyzes the relationship among the property service integrator, owners and suppliers in the property management activities first. The fault tree was constructed in a hierarchical structure with a single top event, fourteen intermediate events and fifteen basic events. The minimal cut sets, structural importance are obtained in the qualitative analysis. Based on the qualitative analysis, the risk factors are identified and the priority order of the basic events causing the top event is measured. In addition, these risks can be classified into system risks and non-system risks to control them more efficiently. The result shows that most of the risks in Chinese property service integrators are non-system risks, so the property service integrators should strengthen the internal management of enterprises to gain fast development.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Earned Value Based on the Critical Chain Management Method
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Earned Value; Critical Chain; Buffer; Buffer Consumption
Abstract: Traditional Earned Value Management Method is recognized as an effective way of the project management method. However, the difference between the critical and non-critical work in the project are not so strict, which in turn result in the deviation in evaluation results of the progress. The Critical Chain Project Management Methods is an innovation in the project management in recent years, it controls the project through setting the buffer, and it emphasizes more on the manipulation of the critical chain in the project. After briefly introducing the two methods of the project management, the author proposed another reformed project performance management method Earned Value Based on the Critical Chain Management Method. In this new method, the author analyzes the actual implementation of the project by introducing the new progress and cost parameters. And also gives different considerations to tasks on critical chain and non-critical chain, which is in order to accurately reflect the progress and investment condition of the project. This paper also proposed an analysis method to the buffer consumption in the project implementation, so that project managers can take different measures to implement the project under various circumstances. The new method can not only settle the deficiencies of traditional Earned Value Management Methods and make use of the advantages of Critical Chain Project Management Methods, but also strengthens the control on the time and cost of the project. Finally, the author demonstrated the application of this method in analysis and management to project implementation through a simple example, which in turn verified the validity and practicality of the proposed method.
