Author Full Names: Bard, Jonathan F.; Jarrah, Ahmad I.
Article Title: Large-scale constrained clustering for rationalizing pickup and delivery operations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Clustering; Randomized heuristic; Pickup and delivery operations; Set covering; Case study
Keywords Plus: REPRESENTATIONS; ALGORITHMS; DESIGN; ZONES
Abstract: The paper presents a three-phase procedure for clustering a large number of data points subject to both configuration and resource constraints. Motivated by the desire of a shipping carrier to reduce its fixed costs, the problem is to construct a set of compact work areas for regional pickup and delivery operations. In general terms, the objective is to find the minimum number of clusters (homogeneous vehicles) that satisfy volume, time and contiguity constraints. The problem is placed in context by formulating it as a mixed-integer goal program. Because practical instances contain anywhere from 6000 to 50,000 data points and can only be described in probabilistic terms, it is not possible to obtain provably optimal solutions to the proposed model. Instead, a novel solution methodology is developed that makes use of metaheuristic and mathematical programming techniques. In the preprocessing phase, a fraction of the data points are aggregated to reduce the problem size. This is shown to substantially decrease the computational burden without compromising solution quality. In the main step, an efficient adaptive search procedure is used to form the clusters. Randomness is introduced at each inner iteration to ensure a full exploration of the feasible region, and an incremental slicing scheme is used to overcome local optimality. In metaheuristic terms, these two refinements are equivalent to diversification and intensification search strategies. To improve the results, a set covering problem is solved in the final phase. The individual clusters obtained from the heuristic provide the structure for this model. To test the methodology, six data sets provided by the sponsoring company were analyzed. All runs for the first two phases took less than 4 min, and in all but one case produced a tangible improvement over the current service area configurations. The set covering solution provided further improvement, which collectively averaged 11.2%. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Al-Kilidar, H; Hamedanimojarrad, P; Davis, SR
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Al-Kilidar, Hiyam; Hamedanimojarrad, Pedram; Davis, Steven R.
Article Title: Towards a Framework for Sustainability Indicators in Construction Developments
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Indicators; Framework; Sustainable development; Construction project; Project life cycle
Abstract: The construction industry is a major contributor to the economic output of any country. As such it will have a major effect on the overall sustainability of that county's economy. Sustainability in construction deals with the economic, social and environmental aspects of the construction and development processes. As emphasis on sustainable construction continues to grow, achieving the balance between the three aspects of sustainability namely economic, social and environmental aspects is proving to be a very challenging task. This paper proposes a framework that applies sustainability measures to the project level of the construction industry through related indicators. The proposed framework identifies indicators for the three aspects of sustainable construction at the various stages of the construction lifecycle (i.e. feasibility study, design, construction, operation and demolition). It is envisaged that such framework will serve as a tool which may assist decision makers in assessing sustainable performance at different stages of project life-cycle.

Authors: Bao, YH; Chen, QA; Zhao, J
Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Author Full Names: Bao Yue-hua; Chen Qiang; Zhao Jue
Article Title: Assessing Quality of Urban Development: A Study Based on Perspective of Business Sector
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: quality of urban development; assessment; business sector; satisfaction
Abstract: The improvement of Quality of Urban Development (QUD) has become an imperative method to implement sustainable development view at local level. After examining the current Studies on QUD, we find that there exists no developed theory in this area, whether of definition or of assessment. At present, the method of assessing urban development is mainly based on objective indicators, and this may not reflect the Public's real feelings and wills. In this paper, the authors firstly develop an integrative definition of QUD with both subjective and objective approaches, then a lens-model reflecting the relationship between QUD and Enterprises' Satisfaction is set up. The Authors also develop a method of assessing QUD from the Business Sector's perspective and make a case study in N District, J City.

Article Title: Bank Performance Evaluation Based on a Modified Super-efficiency DEA Measure
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: bank performance evaluation; DEA; super-efficiency
Keywords Plus: DATA ENVELOPMENT ANALYSIS; MARKETABILITY; PROFITABILITY; MODELS; UNITS
Abstract: Bank performance evaluation has been widely investigated as banks play a very important role in the financial system. The function of a bank is to efficiently channel funds to those who have the most productive investment opportunities, and to make profits as well. A bank's multiple objectives lead to complexity in its evaluation. As an approach for characterizing the relationships among multiple inputs and multiple outputs, DEA has been well used as a metric for measuring bank performance. However, there is an infeasibility problem associated with the traditional super-efficiency DEA models. Evaluation on bank performance is improved based on a modified super-efficiency DEA measure. The assessment of six banks in the Fortune Global 500 is used as an illustration example. Empirical results approve the subsequent efficiency change of banks due to the financial crisis.

Article Title: Shopping mode choice: Physical store shopping versus e-shopping
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: E-shopping; Shopping mode choice; Stated preference experiment; Value of travel time; Value of product delivery time
Keywords Plus: INFORMATION OVERLOAD; USER ACCEPTANCE; INTERNET; TRAVEL; TIME; FRAGMENTATION; ECONOMICS; BEHAVIOR; IMPACTS; DEMAND
Abstract: This study aims to explore how consumers evaluate these time attributes; i.e., the value of time, when they are facing a shopping mode choice between physical store shopping and e-shopping. For this purpose, it conducts an experiment to acquire data on respondents' stated preference choices between physical bookstore shopping and online bookstore shopping. It is finally found that the value of delivery time for a purchased book from an online bookstore to a consumer is approximately $0.53 per day, which means an online bookstore will have to lower a book's price by $0.53 to attract a physical bookstore shopper if the delivery is delayed for one day. It is also found that in terms of monetary values, avoiding a shopping trip produces far more benefits than bearing waiting for the delivery of books for an online purchase. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Getting Competitive Advantage by Improving the Return on Human Capital
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: human capitals; strategy; return
Keywords Plus: PERFORMANCE
Abstract: In the intellectual economics era, human capital has become to be the determinate of an enterprise's existence and development, as well as an important mine to promote economic progress. So people pay abroad attention to the return on human capital If the return on human capital can be fulfilled availably, it can mobilize the human capital to be positive and initiative, the human capital's effect on economic development can exert sufficiently. The study analyzes the impact of human capital on the enterprise competitiveness with an elaboration on its significance, proposes the strategies to promote the return of investment in human capital and conclude that the human capital return is of vital importance to the competitive advantage of an enterprise.

Authors: Li, HD; Zou, ZY; Sun, LD
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li Hongdi; Zou Zhuyu; Sun Lidong
Article Title: The Study of Calculation Methods of Highway Engineering Project's External Benefit Based on Real Option
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real option; Highway engineering project; External benefit; Calculation method
Abstract: The external benefit of the project decided by the characteristic of open and large-scale of Highway Engineering Project is significant, the external benefit impacts on the economies outside the project which generated by the project construction, and the calculation of quantification of the external benefit is useful to accurate investment decision-making. Because traditional methods lack systematic quantitative analysis, the external benefit of highway engineering projects didn't play an important role in investment decision-making. This paper calculates the platform type value-added option value of highway projects based on the ideology of the real option, we put the benefit measurement into the the measurement of assets value. This paper calculates the external benefit by the means of the B-S option pricing model, and analyzes the advantages and weaknesses of the comparison between the real option method and the traditional cost-benefit method through some concrete examples. It is helpful to investment decision-making.

Article Title: Comparative Analysis on Operating Efficiency of China's listed Companies in Real Estate Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; Super-efficiency DEA; efficiency; listed company
Abstract: In recent years real estate industry in China develops rapidly. Since last year, real estate industry has gone into a period of adjustment. This situation demands real estate companies more strictly. Extensive operation method is unable to adapt to the market competition for the real estate company. There is the need for real estate companies to improve operational efficiency. In this article Super-efficienxy DEA is used to evaluate the status of operational efficiency for the real estate listed companies. The efficiency analysis are taken to the listed companies. Empirical results show that the level of the China's real estate company's efficiency locates at a rather low level. Only one third of the real estate enpterprises' is efficient. There are not significant difference between the efficiency of real estate enterprises in Shenzhen and Shanghai stock market. High efficiency will bring high-growth for enterprise's performance. The low efficient enterprise will be replaced by high efficient compeitiors in future.

Author Full Names: Liu, A. F.; Guo, S. H. R.
Article Title: Research of Building Energy Conservation Index System and Comprehensive Evaluation Method
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Building energy conservation; Evaluation index; Analytic hierarchy process; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method
Abstract: Based on the building characteristic and present situation of energy consumption in our country's hot summer and cold winter zones, this study designs three levels of evaluation index system of building energy conservation from aspects of technical indexes, economic indexes, and functional indexes. This index system suits for the hot summer and cold winter zones and consider many factors such as the building energy consumption, the building's characteristic and the maintenance structure hot working performance. It chooses the analytic hierarchy process and the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method. First, this paper use the analytic hierarchy process to provide the weight value of every indicator, then confirm single factor fuzzy evaluation matrix, form sub factor fuzzy evaluation matrix and calculate top indicator comprehensive evaluation result by the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method, finally finish evaluation result analysis on the basis of centesimal system principle. This process obtains a set of intact algorithms. The way of combining analytic hierarchy process with fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method can unify all levels indicators well and realize the quantification analysis and also have strong feasibility. Case study shows that the method is objective, effective and has significant practical value.

Article Title: Reform and Exproation of Practice Education Model in Engineering Management Specialty
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project Management; Alternating work and study; Cooperative education; Practice education
Abstract: How to improve the project management major's practical ability is a important topic in the educational reform of project management specialty. Reform of practical teaching pattern and training mode to improve practical ability of students majored in engineering management are discussed in this paper. Based on empirical research an alteration mode of working and learning was proposed to training well experienced engineering management talent. Utilizing education resources both of college and enterprise, the mode was helpful for students to combine specialized theory and engineering practice and enhanced practical ability. The model configuration the alternating work and study cooperative education was constructed and the operational mechanism and management flow of the model has been practiced and discussed. This model is suitable for training the application personnel and it is valuable to promote. Finally, to implement the model, it must establish a whole set effective administrative regulations.

Abstract: Project Management Association of the United States believes that the project is aimed at creating a unique product or service of a temporary effort So designing project is a task which has specific design goals under certain condition. The existing problems of project cost management in the design stage are discussed. The main ways and measures to control project cost in the design stage of projects are proposed, including strengthening the investment control of design stage, optimizing comprehensive design work, improving the quality of investment estimation and ensuring the accuracy of investment estimation, implementing the tendering system of design and adopting strict design standards, strengthening design criteria and standard design. It can be referred for the investor. All stages of the design of a careful analysis in order to reduce or avoid the design stage due to various Reasons which led to the occurrence of the waste in order to maximize the reference Capital construction projects of high investment returns.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: A Survey of Knowledge Organization Systems in Environmental Sciences
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: There is an abundance of environmental information. It includes information that is being collected, processed and stored from various sources, such as climate and atmospheric data, data related to water quality and groundwater levels, or information on the diversity and productivity of delicate ecosystems. As this information is being continuously made available to various information management systems, it is an open challenge to effectively represent it, store it and organize it. To this end, Knowledge Organization Systems (KOSs) of the environmental domain have been introduced, trying to facilitate the analysis, search and reusability of such information. This paper tries to provide an introduction to environmental KOSs, by giving an overview of their current development.

Article Title: Information-based network control strategies consistent with estimated driver behavior
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Driver route choice; Fuzzy control based optimization; Information-based control; Behavior consistency
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; PROVISION; MODELS
Abstract: This study proposes a fuzzy control based methodology to determine information-based network control strategies that are consistent with the controller's objectives and its estimation of driver response behavior. It is the core of the broader problem where the objective is to enhance the performance of a vehicular traffic system through real-time information-based network control strategies. The controller seeks behavior consistency by solving a fixed-point problem that estimates drivers' likely reactions to the controller-proposed information strategies while determining them. Experiments are performed to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed methodology. The results suggest the importance of using a behavior-consistent approach to determine the in formation-based network control strategies. That is, the effects of driver response behavior to information provision may require more meaningful strategies than those provided under the traditional dynamic traffic assignment models to reliably estimate or control system performance. Information strategies that are not behavior-consistent can potentially deteriorate system performance. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Qian, Queena K.; Chan, Edwin H. W.
Article Title: PROBLEMS IN GOVERNMENT'S DECISION-MAKING ROLES FOR BUILDING ENERGY EFFICIENCY (BEE) IN MAINLAND CHINA
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Building energy efficiency (BEE); policy instrument; government's role; strategic planner
Abstract: China's energy consumption in building sector has great influence on the world energy markets and the global environment. A series of policies have been set out to support Building Energy Efficiency (BEE) by the Chinese Government, however, the effect is limited and BEE market share is still small. Experiences from developed countries show that government plays an essential role on BEE promotion. Therefore, there is an appeal for research on China's BEE policy, which has a high potential to be improved. In this paper, Chinese Government's role in promoting BEE is classified into five categories: 1) strategic planner; 2) policy-maker; 3) incentive motivator; 4) financing hub; and 5) Advocator. The current policies for BEE promotion are reviewed and evaluated according to each classification. Afterwards, key research issues, which are the main concerns affecting the effects of BEE promotion, are proposed and analyzed based on the classification. With the identified research issues, main considerations could be collected for future study.

Authors: Shan, NN; Liu, WD; Lai, B
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Shan, N. N.; Liu, W. D.; Lai, B.
Article Title: Cultivated Land Protection, Urbanization and Land Utilization Conflicts in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: index of land utilization conflicts; cultivated land protection; urbanization; urban land potential; cultivated land capacity
Abstract: Cultivated land protection is an important guarantee for economical and social sustainable development in China with vast population and scarce land per capita. Since 1990's, cultivated land had been shrinking for being converted to industrial and residential uses for urbanization in China. Of all the new urban land, about 74% was converted from arable land. In urbanization process, land utilization conflicts are inevitable between urban land expansion and cultivated land protection. Based on theory of synergetics, this paper constructs the model of land utilization conflicts to calculate the index of land utilization conflicts by 31 provinces in China. The index is decided by urban land potential and cultivated land capacity. The provinces with greater degree of urban land potential will accommodate with more new people and encroach upon less cultivated land in urbanization process. The provinces with larger capacity of cultivated land will have larger recuperability to external impacts and more land supply to urban expansion. The provinces whose index of land utilization conflicts less than 1.0 are Heilongjiang, Xinjiang, Xizang and Neimenggu. They can cope with unfavorable influence by urbanization by themselves. Furthermore, they can supply surplus grain for other provinces. The provinces whose index of land utilization conflicts more than 1.7 are Guangdong, Guizhou, Jiangxi, Sichuan, Fujian. The province with maximum of index is Guangdong (the index more than 1.86). The reasons for sharpest conflicts between urban land use and cultivated land are huge pressure of economical development, high population density and extremely scarce land resource. It is impossible that resolve the conflicts by themselves. In national perspective, the regional coordination of resources is critical measure to solve this problem in the provinces which have sharpest conflicts.

Article Title: Study on the New Financing Model of Low-Rent Housing-the Use of BOT
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing security; Low-rent housing; Financing model; BOT
Abstract: The Chinese Government attaches great importance to the indemnificatory housing construction as represented by the low-rent housing in terms of policy and capital investment. The implementation of housing security for low-income families can improve their living environment and conditions, which can secure the Home Ownership, and contribute to social harmony. In the indemnificatory housing construction, fund is the most critical and the lack of fund is an obstacle of its development. At present, the Chinese low-rent housing construction is still funded by government, including local financial fund, the central government transferred payments, the increment of accumulation fund system, and transferred income of land. According to the generalization of our country's convetional financing model of low-rent housing, this article discusses a new financing model of low-rent housing -BOT model. By creating financing model, the Government can bring in large-scale social fund, and change the government's direct financing model into the business operation model under the guidance of the Government, which can not only make sure the Government's goal of  Regard people's livelihood and Promote social harmony come true earlier, but also bring about development of related industries. It can really achieve the win-win objective.

Article Title: Opportunity Selection of Urban Road Congestion Charge
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Road congestion charges; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; Opportunity selection model
Abstract: With the emergence and development of road congestion, congestion charges as an effective means of traffic demand management becomes more and more popular. In this paper, fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method and construct opportunity selection model are applied in the urban road congestion charges. It is concluded that urban road congestion charges can't be carried out until the urban planning, urban transport infrastructure and urban traffic management achieve a certain level. At the same time, the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation index system is built, which is applied to Wuhan city. By fuzzy comprehensive evaluating of Wuhan city, it is find out that implementation of road congestion charges is not suitable for Wuhan city right now. The transport infrastructure as well as the level of traffic management in Wuhan is not developed well. However, we believe that with the gradual improvement of urban traffic management and development, road congestion charges will become one of the most effective measures for the future traffic demand management.

Article Title: Research on Virtual Construction Mode of Community
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Virtual construction; Community; Communication technology; Management
Abstract: The community is an important composition of society. The community construction is useful to achieve the habitant autonomy, orderly management, consummated serve, and civilized and harmonious community. This paper analyzes the present situation of community construction mode, points out the virtual construction mode, and establishes the virtual organization structural model, the information-sharing model and the digital management system model of community construction. The virtual construction of community is a new construction mode, which is different from the traditional construction mode. Using information and communication technology, it links regional independent organizations, companies and professionals to form a temporary or permanent joint, which provides them with core competitiveness that can benefit each other, and makes them complete the entire construction process by sharing resource. The virtual organization of community construction is made up of the owner committee, the government, community management committee, community economic organization, community residents and other service bodies. The information-sharing model of virtual construction of community can save the social resource and maximize the effectiveness of community construction. The digital management system model of community construction can provide the platform of digital management system of community construction. The study result can guide to carry out the virtual construction of community.

Article Title: Experimental Study of Green Renewable Concrete Materials
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Recycled concrete; Green Building material; Mechanical test
Abstract: At present, because of the building demolition, demolition construction waste generated widespread phenomenon, coupled with limited natural resources, native of concrete aggregate reduction in waste materials to study how to promote the application of practical significance. Based on the principle of turning waste into treasure, demonstrated the significance of the application abandoned building materials, for the regeneration of recycled aggregate concrete and its preparation of the relevant properties were studied, the preparation of six different percentage content of recycled aggregate, through the stress test machine - strain curve and elastic modulus tests, including the recycled concrete measure of stress - strain curve of the entire descending curve, Carried out analysis of compressive strength and elastic modulus. The results show that, with the recycled coarse aggregate replacement rate of increase in recycled concrete cube compressive strength and elastic modulus decrease; recycled concrete peak strain value is greater than normal concrete; recycled concrete ultimate strain than ordinary concrete.

Authors: Zhao, JX; Kan, HS; Liang, JF
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhao Jinxian; Kan Hongsheng; Liang Jinfeng
Article Title: A Method Combined Entropy with AHP Weighting Factors Affecting Safety on Construction Sites
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction safety hazard; Weight; Degree of membership; Entropy; Fuzzy set
Abstract: The method of AHP often used in weight computation is a mathematical disposal of the expert's subjective estimation. Weight is attained from judgment matrix which is evaluated by expert. So the factor weight is influenced by the subjectivity of expert. Appraisals from different expert are always different because of deficiency and discrepancy of each person's experience and knowledge. Traditional method of processing those weights from different experts is weighting expert's evaluation or geometric mean. They either have the character of subjectivity or accept the evaluations equally. If those evaluations are relatively concentrated, appraisals in concentrated area are more reliability, and if those evaluations are not relatively consistent, all of those evaluations should be considered. Here entropy, a measure of uncertainty in informatics, is introduced to measure the consistency of expert evaluations, combined with fuzzy set. In this way, subjective evaluation becomes more objective. In this paper, AHP and entropy are combined to evaluate hazard identification, and fuzzy set is also introduced. Through iterative algorithm of AHP analysis, the method considers fully sub-factors in construction safety hazard analysis, and it reduces relative subjectivity of expert, and distinguishes the important factors affecting safety on construction sites. It can give a more reliable factor weight as a reference for decision making.

Article Title: Analysis on Dependability of the Quality of Property Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Quality of property management; Dependability; Rreliability; Maintenance; Availability
Abstract: As a state, quality consists in any products (services) qualitatively or quantitatively, which is just the customer's need for the product (service) in terms of performance, dependability, safety, availability, economy, timeliness and civilization. With the progress of society's civilization, the research on the credibility of quality management has been regarded as a new international development trend. From the angle of modern quality management, we must make necessary analysis and design for quality either before we beginning property services or during service process in order to realize the quality objective through these functions. Introducing it to the quality management of property is an effective way to enhance the level of quality of property management. This paper puts forward the idea and channels of credibility of quality of property management by defining its definition, analyzing and designing component factors such as reliability, maintenance and availability, which will be the important complementarily for the research on quality assurance of quality of property management.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Risk Analysis on Commercial Bank Loan Based on the Enterprise Solvency in Foreign Trade Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: foreign trade enterprises; solvency; risk analysis; Data Envelopment Analysis
Abstract: Currently credit risk is one of the most important risks for China commercial bank. With a large number of non-performing assets and foreign bank competition, promoting the credit risk management becomes an important issue for banking. This paper selects listing companies of foreign trade enterprises as sample and measures the level of risk from the solvency effectiveness. Based on the former analysis methods, this paper uses the DEA method to assess whether a number of input and output indexes are relatively efficient. This method can not assess only economic efficiency indicators but also social efficiency indicators. This paper takes the accounts receivable turnover rate, fixed asset turnover rate as input indicators, and selects the current ratio, quick-freezing rate, operating margin, net profit margin, yield, equity ratio as the output indicators, then evaluates the solvency of the ten listing companies in the foreign trade enterprises in 2008. We find the finance risk level of foreign trade enterprises is invalid, so the sector needs to improve finances further.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Allocation of Delay Responsibility for Time Extension
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction industry; Delay responsibility; Superposition and Divergent effect
Abstract: But-for is a widely used method for analyzing and apportioning project delays among the responsible parties, but it suffers from serious drawbacks. Two versions of but-for analysis always have different effects which may easily lead to disputes for the contractor and the owner. Focus of the disputes comes from the outcome of Superposition and Divergent effect. Root causes of Superposition and Divergent effect will be talked in this paper. Superposition and Divergent effect is closely related to total float and newly created total float time. Under current scheduling practices, total float is considered to be an asset for both the contractor and the owner to use for free. Newly created total float is produced by project delays caused by the contractor or the owner. Based on the consideration of the ownership and utilization of total float and newly created total float, the principle for the allocation of the outcome of Superposition and Divergent effect has been proposed. The new concept makes a direct response to the focus of disputes for but-for method. Calculation methods for the allocation of delay responsibility are proposed in this paper.

Authors: Azevedo, SG; Carvalho, H; Machado, VC
Author Full Names: Azevedo, Susana G.; Carvalho, Helena; Cruz Machado, V.
Article Title: The influence of green practices on supply chain performance: A case study approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Green supply chain management practices; Supply chain performance; Automotive industry; Case study
Keywords Plus: ENVIRONMENTAL-MANAGEMENT; OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE; OPTIMIZATION; INITIATIVES; UNCERTAINTY; INFORMATION; INTEGRATION; FRAMEWORK; SYSTEMS; DESIGN
Abstract: The main objective of this exploratory paper is to investigate the relationships between green practices of supply chain management and supply chain performance. This relationship is investigated in the context of the automotive industry. Five research propositions are suggested and tested with empirical data derived from five case studies taken from the Portuguese automotive supply chain. The data analysis identifies the most important green practices considered by managers, as well as the performance measures that are most appropriate and most widely used as means to evaluate the influence of green practices on supply chain performance. A conceptual model was derived from the data analysis and it can be used to assess the influence of green practices on supply chain performance. This model provides evidence as to which green practices have positive effects on quality, customer satisfaction and efficiency. It also identifies the practices which have negative effects on supply chain performance. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Liu, TL; Chen, J; Huang, HJ
Author Full Names: Liu, Tian-Liang; Chen, Jian; Huang, Hai-Jun
Article Title: Existence and efficiency of oligopoly equilibrium under toll and capacity competition
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Oligopoly equilibrium; Social optimum; Efficiency loss; Toll road
Keywords Plus: PRICE; ANARCHY
Abstract: This paper studies the existence and efficiency of oligopoly equilibrium under simultaneous toll and capacity competition in a parallel-link network subject to congestion. We establish sufficient conditions for the existence of a pure-strategy oligopoly equilibrium and then derive upper bounds on the efficiency loss of the oligopoly equilibrium over the social optimum under different inverse demand function assumptions, respectively. Furthermore, we show that these bounds are demand-function free and only dependent upon the number of competitive roads. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Morrow, PC; McElroy, JC; Scheibe, KP
Author Full Names: Morrow, Paula C.; McElroy, James C.; Scheibe, Kevin P.
Article Title: Work unit incivility, job satisfaction, and total quality management among transportation employees
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Incivility; Harassment; Job satisfaction; TQM; Transportation employees; Organizational change
Keywords Plus: TQM PRINCIPLES; IMPACT; PERFORMANCE; WORKPLACE; ANTECEDENTS; TIME
Abstract: Survey results from 1381 employees working in a state department of transportation tested the idea that uncivil work environments bear undesirable consequences for job satisfaction and diminish the effectiveness of quality management practices. Results demonstrated that incivility does not have to be personally experienced to have deleterious effects, merely witnessed. Perceived workplace incivility was found to adversely affect job satisfaction and the effectiveness of quality programs aimed at teamwork, customer focus and continuous improvement, even after controlling for race, gender and prior experience of harassment. Managers are advised to broaden their consideration of incivility to include its effects on observers. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Xie, C; Kockelman, KM; Waller, ST
Author Full Names: Xie, Chi; Kockelman, Kara M.; Waller, S. Travis
Article Title: A maximum entropy-least squares estimator for elastic origin-destination trip matrix estimation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Origin-destination trip table; Elastic demand; Maximum entropy; Least squares; Subnetwork analysis; Convex combination
Abstract: In transportation subnetwork-supernetwork analysis, it is well known that the origin-destination (O-D) flow table of a subnetwork is not only determined by trip generation and distribution, but also a result from traffic routing and diversion, due to the existence of internal-external, external-internal and external-external flows. This result indicates the variable nature of subnetwork O-D flows. This paper discusses an elastic O-D flow table estimation problem for subnetwork analysis. The underlying assumption is that each cell of the subnetwork O-D flow table contains an elastic demand function rather than a fixed demand rate and the demand function can capture all traffic diversion effect under various network changes. We propose a combined maximum entropy-least squares estimator, by which O-D flows are distributed over the subnetwork in terms of the maximum entropy principle, while demand function parameters are estimated for achieving the least sum of squared estimation errors. While the estimator is powered by the classic convex combination algorithm, computational difficulties emerge within the algorithm implementation until we incorporate partial optimality conditions and a column generation procedure into the algorithmic framework. Numerical results from applying the combined estimator to a couple of subnetwork examples show that an elastic O-D flow table, when used as input for subnetwork flow evaluations, reflects network flow changes significantly better than its fixed counterpart. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Xu, JP; Yan, F; Li, S
Author Full Names: Xu, Jiuping; Yan, Fang; Li, Steven
Article Title: Vehicle routing optimization with soft time windows in a fuzzy random environment
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Vehicle routing problem; Soft time windows; Fuzzy random; Particle swarm optimization
Keywords Plus: RANDOM-VARIABLES; ALGORITHMS
Abstract: This paper is concerned with a vehicle routing problem with soft time windows (VRPSTW) in a fuzzy random environment. Two objectives are considered: (1) minimize the total travel cost and (2) maximize the average satisfaction level of all customers. After setting up the model for the VRPSTW in a fuzzy random environment, the fuzzy random expected value concept is used to deal with the constraints and its equivalent crisp model is derived. The global-local-neighbor particle swarm optimization with exchangeable particles (GLN-PSO-ep) is employed to solve the equivalent crisp model. A case study is also presented to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Build-to-order supply chain network design under supply and demand uncertainties
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Supply chain network design; Postponement; Build-to-order; Supply disruption; Uncertain demand
Keywords Plus: APPROXIMATION; PERFORMANCE; SYSTEM
Abstract: Supply chain disruptions are unintended, unwanted situations resulting in a negative supply chain performance. We study the supply chain network design under supply and demand uncertainty with embedded supply chain disruption mitigation strategies, postponement with downward substitution, centralized stocking and supplier sourcing base. We designed an integrated supply-side, manufacturing and demand-side operations network in such that the total expected operating cost is minimized. We modeled it in a deterministic equivalent formulation. An L-shaped decomposition with an additional decomposition step in the master problem is proposed. The computational results showed that parallel sourcing has a cost advantage against single sourcing under supply disruptions. In addition, the build-to-order (BTO) manufacturing mitigation process has its greatest impact with high variations on demands and is integrated with the component downward substitution. Lastly, the manufacturer needs to order differentiated components to cover its requirement for maximal product demand to prevent the loss of sale, even with fewer modules in stock. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A simulation evaluation of the maximum approximate composite marginal likelihood (MACML) estimator for mixed multinomial probit models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Mixed multinomial probit; Composite marginal likelihood; Maximum simulated likelihood; Discrete choice models; Unordered-response models; Panel data
Abstract: This paper evaluates the ability of the maximum approximate composite marginal likelihood (MACML) estimation approach to recover parameters from finite samples in mixed cross-sectional and panel multinomial probit models. Comparisons with the maximum simulated likelihood (MSL) estimation approach are also undertaken. The results indicate that the MACML approach recovers parameters much more accurately than the MSL approach in all model structures and covariance specifications. The MACML inference approach also estimates the parameters efficiently, with the asymptotic standard errors being, in general, only a small proportion of the true values. As importantly, the MACML inference approach takes only a very small fraction of the time needed for MSL estimation. In particular, the results suggest that, for the case of five random coefficients, the MACML approach is about 50 times faster than the MSL for the cross-sectional random coefficients case, about 15 times faster than the MSL for the panel inter-individual random coefficients case, and about 350 times or more faster than the MSL for the panel intra- and inter-individual random coefficients case. As the number of alternatives in the unordered-response model increases, one can expect even higher computational efficiency factors for the MACML over the MSL approach. Further, as should be evident in the panel intra- and inter-individual random coefficients case, the MSL is all but practically infeasible when the mixing structure leads to an explosion in the dimensionality of integration in the likelihood function, but these situations are handled with ease in the MACML approach. It is hoped that the MACML procedure will spawn empirical research into rich model specifications within the context of unordered multinomial choice modeling, including autoregressive random coefficients, dynamics in coefficients, space-time effects, and spatial/social interactions. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Strategic design of public bicycle sharing systems with service level constraints
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Bicycle sharing systems; Service level; Facility location; Public transportation
Keywords Plus: ARC LOCATION-PROBLEMS; HUB-LOCATION; ALLOCATION; MODEL; ECONOMIES; ACCESSIBILITY; FORMULATIONS; ACCESS; ROUTE
Abstract: This study addresses the strategic planning of public bicycle sharing systems with service level considerations. In considering the interests of both users and investors, the proposed model attempts to determine the number and locations of bike stations, the network structure of bike paths connected between the stations, and the travel paths for users between each pair of origins and destinations. A small example is created to illustrate the proposed model. Sensitivity analysis is also performed to gain better insights into knowing how several important parameters affect the design of the system. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A computationally efficient methodology to characterize travel time reliability using the fast Fourier transform
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Uncertainty; Stochastic capacity; Travel time reliability; Fast Fourier transform; Numerical quadrature
Keywords Plus: TRANSPORTATION NETWORK; CAPACITY RELIABILITY; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; ALGORITHM; MODEL
Abstract: In this paper we present a novel methodology to assess travel time reliability in a transportation network, when the source of uncertainty is given by random road capacities. Specifically, we present a method based on the theory of Fourier transforms to numerically approximate the probability density function of the system-wide travel time. Except for noted pathological cases, any common continuous or discrete probability distribution can be used to model capacity uncertainty. Theoretical bounds on the approximation errors are formally derived, both for general distributions as well as for the specific instance of normally distributed capacities. These bounds provide valuable insights into the structure of the approximation errors and suggest ways to reduce them. From a practical point of view, we propose a procedure based on successively refining the computational grid in order to guarantee accurate approximations. The proposed methodology takes advantage of the established computational efficiency of the fast Fourier transform. In a numerical case study, we demonstrate that the results of the methodology are consistent with intuition. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chen, JM; Lin, IC; Cheng, HL
Author Full Names: Chen, Jen-Ming; Lin, I-Chen; Cheng, Hung-Liang
Article Title: Channel coordination under consignment and vendor-managed inventory in a distribution system
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Channel coordination; Vendor-managed inventory; Consignment; Inventory-level dependent demand; Pricing; Deterioration
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY-CHAIN COORDINATION; LEVEL-DEPENDENT DEMAND; REPLENISHMENT; CONTRACT; MODEL; RESPONSIVENESS; PERFORMANCE; INTEGRATION; SALES
Abstract: This paper deals with the problem of coordinating a vertically separated distribution system under vendor-managed inventory and consignment arrangements. We formulate the profit-maximization problem and carry out equilibrium analysis under cooperative and non-cooperative settings. In addition, a revenue-sharing scheme joint with a side-payment is proposed, which leads to Pareto improvements among channel participants. Our analysis reveals that the non-cooperative decentralization tends to price higher and stock less, which leads to a lower channel-wide profit. The consistent bias can be rectified by the dominant, cooperative wholesaler or by using the proposed two-part revenue-sharing mechanism. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lee, DH; Chen, JH; Cao, JX
Author Full Names: Lee, Der-Horng; Chen, Jiang Hang; Cao, Jin Xin
Article Title: The continuous Berth Allocation Problem: A Greedy Randomized Adaptive Search Solution
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Berth Allocation Problem; GRASP; Container terminals
Keywords Plus: CONTAINER TERMINALS; OPTIMIZATION; PORT; MODELS
Abstract: In this research, continuous and dynamic Berth Allocation Problem (BAP) is studied to minimize the total weighted flow time. Different from previous studies on continuous BAP, an efficient method is proposed to address the problem to identify the possible locations for next vessel in the Time-space diagram. Then two versions of Greedy Randomized Adaptive Search Procedure (GRASP) are developed to search for near optimal solutions. Both small and large scale numerical experiments are tested to examine the effectiveness of the proposed GRASPs by comparison with CPLEX and stochastic beam search, respectively. Article Title: What shapes local public transportation in Europe? Economics, mobility, institutions, and geography
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Urban transportation; Local government; Mobility; Institutions and geography
Keywords Plus: TECHNICAL EFFICIENCY; POLITICAL-ECONOMY; URBAN; DEMAND; SCOPE; COST; ELASTICITIES; DETERMINANTS; METAANALYSIS; PERFORMANCE
Abstract: This paper analyzes factors explaining supply and demand of local public transportation. Together with variables related to traditional economic factors and mobility, we consider variables reflecting institutional characteristics and geographical patterns. Being a political capital increases supply and demand of local public transportation, inequality is associated with higher supply, and contracting out reduces supply. Furthermore, our regional analysis allows us capturing the effect of geographical characteristics and different traditions of government intervention. In all, we provide first evidence on the role played by institutional and regional characteristics useful to achieve a better understanding of local public transportation supply and demand. Article Title: A kinematic wave theory of lane-changing traffic flow
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: LWR model; Fundamental diagram; Lane-changing intensity variable; Riemann problem; Kinematic waves; Supply-demand method; Bottleneck effects; NGSIM data
Keywords Plus: DENSITY; MODEL; DYNAMICS; 2-LANE
Abstract: Frequent lane-changes in highway merging, diverging, and weaving areas could disrupt traffic flow and, even worse, lead to accidents In this paper, we propose a simple model for studying bottleneck effects of lane-changing traffic and aggregate traffic dynamics of a roadway with lane-changing areas. Based on the observation that, when changing its lane, a vehicle affects traffic on both its current and target lanes, we propose to capture such lateral interactions by introducing a new lane-changing intensity variable With a modified fundamental diagram, we are able to study the impacts of lane-changing traffic on overall traffic flow. In addition, the corresponding traffic dynamics can be described with a simple kinematic wave model. For a location-dependent lane-changing intensity variable, we discuss kinematic wave solutions of the Riemann problem of the new model and introduce a supply-demand method for its numerical solutions With both theoretical and empirical analysis, we demonstrate that lane-changes could have significant bottleneck effects on overall traffic flow In the future, we will be interested in studying lane-changing intensities lot different road geometries, locations, on-ramp/off-ramp flows, as well as traffic conditions The new modeling framework could be helpful for developing ramp-metering and other lane management strategies to mitigate the bottleneck effects of lane-changes. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Authors: Zhang, AM; Fu, XW; Yang, HJ
Author Full Names: Zhang, Anming; Fu, Xiaowen; Yang, Hangjun (Gavin)
Article Title: Revenue sharing with multiple airlines and airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Concession revenues; Revenue sharing; Airport competition; Airport-airline vertical cooperation; Non-atomistic carriers
Keywords Plus: FRANCISCO BAY AREA; LOW-COST AIRLINES; MARKET POWER; CONGESTION; OLIGOPOLY; CAPACITY; CARRIERS; INDUSTRY; PRICE; COMPETITION
Abstract: This paper investigates the effects of concession revenue sharing between an airport and its airlines. It is found that the degree of revenue sharing will be affected by how airlines' services are related to each other (complements, independent, or substitutes) In particular, when carriers provide strongly substitutable services to each other, the airport has incentive to charge airlines, rather than to pay airlines, a share of concession revenue. In these situations, while revenue sharing improves profit, it reduces social welfare It is further found that airport competition results in a higher degree of revenue sharing than would be had in the case of single airports. The airport-airline chains may nevertheless derive lower profits through the revenue-sharing rivalry, and the situation is similar to a Prisoners' Dilemma As the chains move further away from their joint profit maximum, welfare rises beyond the level achievable by single airports. The (equilibrium) revenue-sharing proportion at an airport is also shown to decrease in the number of its carriers, and to increase in the number of carriers at competing airports. Finally, the effects of a 'pure' sharing contract are compared to those of the two-part sharing contract. It is found that whether an airport is subject to competition is critical to the welfare consequences of alternative revenue sharing arrangements. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Risk Analysis on the Payment of the Goods on the Site in a Construction Contract
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xi'an Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: goods on the site; ownership; dual payments; fund risk
Abstract: Materials and equipment suppliers (here in after referred to as suppliers), as one of participants in the construction project, have borne a risk of failure to receive the payment after the delivery of materials and equipment to the site in accordance with the contract. Once the contractor goes bankrupt before paying the suppliers, the liquidator or the recipient will often deny the debt with regard to the delivered materials and equipment by Bankruptcy Law, and only pay a small fraction of the bill to the supplier, and sometimes even pay nothing. Thus the suppliers tend to suffer a great loss. In addition, there are no relevant laws and regulations in China, expressed or implied, for the payment of the goods after arrival on the site and their ownership in a construction project, which has become the root cause of disputes. Therefore, a reasonable definition of the ownership transference of the goods on the site is the key to solve this problem. For the balance of risks, the delivery of goods on the site should be defined as goods installed on the entities of the construction project. In this way, the risk not only is shared reasonably by the contractors and owners, but also ensures the basic interests of the suppliers. So the definition is suggested here to fill the gap in a construction contract.

Authors: Ma, Z; Kwon, RH; Lee, CG
Author Full Names: Ma, Zhong; Kwon, Roy H.; Lee, Chi-Guhn
Article Title: A stochastic programming winner determination model for truckload procurement under shipment uncertainty
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Truckload procurement; Combinatorial auctions; Stochastic programming; Shipment uncertainty
Keywords Plus: COMBINATORIAL AUCTIONS; DECOMPOSITION
Abstract: We propose a two-stage stochastic integer programming model for the winner determination problem (WDP) in combinatorial auctions to hedge the shipper's risk under shipment uncertainty. The shipper allows bids on combinations of lanes and solves the WDP to determine which carriers are to be awarded lanes. In addition, many other important comprehensive business side constraints are included in the model. We demonstrate the value of the stochastic solution over one obtained by a deterministic model based on using average shipment volumes. Computational results are given that indicate that moderately sized realistic instances can be solved by commercial branch and bound solvers in reasonable time. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. Article Title: Airport and airlines competition: Incentives for vertical collusion
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airport competition; Vertical collusion
Keywords Plus: FRANCISCO BAY AREA; MARKET POWER; CONGESTION; MODEL; FORECLOSURE; CARRIERS; CAPACITY; MERGERS
Abstract: This paper develops a model of airport and airline competition in a three-stage game. We analyse incentives for vertical collusion between one airport and one airline that compete with another airport and another airline, by means of static and dynamic games. We find that incentives for collusion exist when airports and airlines have different market sizes and, under certain conditions. also when secondary airports and low cost airlines compete with main airports and full service airlines. Article Title: A headway-based approach to eliminate bus bunching: Systematic analysis and comparisons
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bus bunching; Transit operations; Adaptive control
Keywords Plus: HOLDING PROBLEM; TIME
Abstract: Bus schedules cannot be easily maintained on busy lines with short headways: experience shows that buses offering this type of service usually arrive irregularly at their stops, often in bunches. Although transit agencies build slack into their schedules to alleviate this problem - if necessary holding buses at control points to stay on schedule - their attempts often fail because practical amounts of slack cannot prevent large localized disruptions from spreading system-wide. This paper systematically analyzes an adaptive control scheme to mitigate this problem. The proposed scheme dynamically determines bus holding times at a route's control points based on real-time headway information. The method requires less slack than the conventional, schedule-based approach to produce headways within a given tolerance. This allows buses to travel faster than with the conventional approach, reducing in-vehicle passenger delay and increasing bus productivity. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Optimisation of the exploitation period of individual vehicles in freight transportation companies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation; Replacement; Integer programming; Strategic planning
Keywords Plus: EQUIPMENT REPLACEMENT; MAINTENANCE POLICIES; UNSTEADY ECONOMY; MODELS; LIFE
Abstract: The individual vehicle replacement problem typical for freight transportation companies is discussed in the paper. Two characteristic features of such problem are that transportation companies utilise vehicles with intensity decreasing with an age of vehicles and that managers of such companies first of all take into account economical criteria when planning vehicle replacements. The paper presents a single criterion, nonlinear, deterministic and discrete mathematical model of such a problem that minimises a total exploitation and ownership costs calculated per kilometre. The exact solution procedure is proposed here. The problem is solved as a real life case study. As a result, an average, economically optimal 5-year exploitation period of vehicles has been determined. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Roorda, MJ; Carrasco, JA; Miller, EJ
Author Full Names: Roorda, Matthew J.; Carrasco, Juan A.; Miller, Eric J.
Article Title: An integrated model of vehicle transactions, activity scheduling and mode choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Auto ownership; Vehicle transactions; Activity scheduling; Mode choice; Stress; Household interactions
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL INTERACTIONS; HOUSING DEMAND; CAR OWNERSHIP; HOUSEHOLD
Abstract: An integrated model of vehicle transactions, activity scheduling and mode choice is estimated based on a retrospective vehicle transaction survey in the Toronto Area. First a conceptual framework is presented which links long run decisions of automobile transactions with short run decisions of activity participation, travel and mode choice. The concept of activity/travel stress is introduced to represent the difference between household activity/travel with the current vehicle fleet and that associated with alternative fleets due to purchase or disposal of a vehicle. The concept of stress is operationalized with a utility-based formulation in which two measures of activity/travel stress are simulated for each household, mode choice utility gained by making a vehicle transaction, and the change in number of conflicts experienced in the household over a limited number of vehicles. These measures are simulated with multiple replications of an activity-based microsimulation model of activity scheduling and mode choice that explicitly represents household interactions of vehicle allocation, ridesharing and drop-off/pick-up of household members. The empirical analysis indicates, for both stress measures, an asymmetry associated with vehicle transactions. Households increase their activity/travel stress far more by disposing of a vehicle, than they alleviate stress by purchasing a vehicle. A nested logit vehicle transaction model shows that both measures of stress are moderately significant influences on vehicle transactions. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Issue on the Promotion of Chinese State-owned Enterprises IPM to the Independent Innovation Ability
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: state-owned enterprises; IPM; independent innovation ability; case analysis
Abstract: Intellectual property has increasingly become the key factor of determining the nation's economic development and the status of international economic division. Its strategic status in technique advancement and economic development has also been improved to the level of strategic weapon for high-tech development and the strengthening of international competitive, which aims to maintain nation's interest and economic safety. This thesis reviewed the intellectual property administration system home and abroad for China, explored the common problem existing in the intellectual property executions of state-owned enterprises, which were aimed to implement the intellectual property management system for state-owned enterprises, making full use of the technique advantage of resources, pushing forward the company's independent innovative capacity, boosting the transition of intellectual property to practical productivity, promoting the market share for state-owned enterprises.

Article Title: Analysis on the Risk of Chinese Stadium's Privatization
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: public sports stadium; privatization; risk
Abstract: China is in transition, there are many risks during the process of Chinese public sports stadiums' privatization due to the imperfect institution and legal system, as well as the internal contradictions of profit-driven privatization, public sports facilities' publicity and public welfare. These risks include the new monopoly of public sports stadiums privatization, the complicity of the government and enterprises, the role conflict between citizens and customers. The existence of these risks have impeded the privatization of public sports stadiums, and distorted the purpose of Chinese public sports stadiums' privatization.

Article Title: A note on how to measure hubbing practices in airline networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Network configuration; Spatial concentration; Hub-and-spoke (H-S) networks
Keywords Plus: AIR TRANSPORTATION MARKET; HUB-AND-SPOKE; LOW-COST; COMPETITION; CONFIGURATIONS; LOCATION; IMPACT
Abstract: Benefits and costs associated to hubbing practices of airlines are still subject to much debate. In the previous literature, some standard spatial concentration indices have been proposed to measure it. However, we show that these indices are ill-defined because they do not take into account the salient characteristic of hubbing: connecting passengers. The purpose of this research is to present a new methodology which avoids the pitfalls of other methods. Our new methodology also analyzes the level of concentration of the connecting passengers studying two different dimensions: hub airports and routes. Finally, we apply our methodology to some US carriers. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: On Course System Building of Real Estate Appraisal
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate appraisal; course system; knowledge system; application-oriented talents
Abstract: Real estate appraisal industry is an intermediary industry which is playing a more and more important role in the social and economic life. In view of the importance of it, many colleges and universities cultivate real estate appraisal talents to meet the demand of society by setting real estate appraisal courses under some majors. Real estate appraisal is also a highly integrated and practical industry; the interrelated knowledge includes economic, legal, finance, accounting, statistics, project management and civil engineering etc. To students, it is difficult to acquire complete knowledge by only learning one or two courses. Also it is difficult to train qualified real estate appraisal talents. The primary issue of building real estate appraisal course system is to specify training goal. Real estate appraisal industry itself is an important social industry and has a positive impact on the employment of university students. So it is very necessary to train talents for the goal of application-oriented talents. The course system building of real estate appraisal should be based on the real estate appraisal knowledge system, since training goal of real estate appraisal course system is to train application-oriented talents, so the knowledge system which is needed for real estate appraisal should be made according to real estate appraisal practical business. The basic quality of real estate appraisal practitioners supplies an important enlightenment for building the knowledge system. As real estate appraisal practitioners, they should have good professional ethics and a wealth of knowledge on construction, project cost, economics theory, real estate professional and technical knowledge, law, etc. In addition, the implementation of the registered real estate appraiser examination provides a useful reference for real estate appraisal course system. In the paper, the knowledge related to real estate appraisal is divided into three types: closely linked to real estate appraisal result and report for the practice knowledge; closely linked to real estate appraisal method for basic theory knowledge; the relative knowledge and law for external knowledge. The corresponding courses require students to master, understand or familiar respectively. At the same time real estate appraisal courses can be divided into three types: basic knowledge course, professional basic course and practice course. Because real estate appraisal is an industry needed more practice, so practical training program should be paid more and more attention to. At current, setting up real estate appraisal direction under some majors to train real estate special talents is still a practice method.

Article Title: A Study on Local Government Employee Institution under the Planning-Market System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: planning - market system; local government; employee institution
Abstract: By using new theoretical framework to study local government employee institution is helpful for us to discern its essence, the present studies are lacking clear theoretical framework and normative research methods This paper has analyzed the essence of the institution based on the theoretical framework of planning - market system at first, also confined the hypothesis based on logic analysis and testified the hypothesis by statistics analysis using the dates from single case sampling. In the course of sampling, the paper has taken the method of stratified Finally, the paper has drawn a conclusion that the local government employee institution is of a rational design to reducing staff cost and optimizing management effect, the coexisting of planning - market system is a mutual movement with the forming and the existing of this institution

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The definition of engineering---views based on Chinese character thinking
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Chinese character thinking; system; engineering
Abstract: gongcheng is a loanword, corresponding English is engineering composed of engineer and ing, its meaning is a activity and result of activity. There are three possible definition of narrow gongcheng. gongcheng is a particular material and technological system, refers to project, refers to knowledge of a particular subject. The definitions of engineering (gongcheng), from the current level of monographs, textbooks and journals, have variety of interpretation. The main question is that: there is overlapping among the conclusions of a variety of interpretations, and there is not clear logical relationship among the conclusions. This paper reviewed the different view on the concept of engineering between west scholars and Chinese. Based on Chinese character thinking and the system theory, we suggest that the concept of engineering in general is a system and draw up its extension structure, finally, Point out the three the intension and extension of engineering in its narrow sense.
