Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: The Game Analysis and Strategies of Cluster Brand Building
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: cluster brand; creation; game analysis
Abstract: The formation and development of industrial clusters will inevitably form the cluster brand, as the cluster brand is generated by the common production areas of enterprises, so the cluster brand is a public good, and it has the basic features of non-exclusive, non-competitive and external economies, etc. In the creation of the cluster brand, there exists the free-riding behavior in a large number of companies, so it can bring risks to the creation and maintenance of cluster brand. The paper obtained that by the method of game theory: In the absence of external-force constraints, the investment of enterprises in cluster brand is insufficient; when there are too many enterprises in the cluster, the probability of participating in creating cluster brand for enterprises will be very low. Finally, the strategies and suggestions of creating the cluster brand are put forward in this paper.

Article Title: Strengthening the Government's Public Service Functions to Drive Continued Demand Growth in Rural Areas
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: government functions; public service; rural demand; sustainable growth
Abstract: The inadequate supply of public services is the main factor that has limited the sustainable demand growth in rural areas By strengthening the government public service functions in those areas and providing more public service supplies, we can not only create prompt demand but also improve the basic producing and living conditions in rural areas. Meanwhile, this is also an important measure to promote economic development in rural areas as seen in increasing peasants' income and stimulating their sustainable growth of demand

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Incentive Management's Three-dimensional Mode in Financial Crisis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: financial crisis; incentive management; three-dimensional mode
Abstract: On the basis of the Management theories, this paper applies incentive principles into management practices and suggests that the Incentive Management virtually reflects a prevailing management concept directing managers to employ various incentive measures in their daily management practices. Currently, in the global financial crisis, the concept has laid down a framework for a three-dimensional mode of the Incentive Management a combination of Material Incentive Management, Moral Incentive Management and Goal Incentive Management. It is generally believed that, as a result of the global financial crisis, market competition has been significantly intensified, and in the face of this increasingly competitive market and resulting challenges, many businesses are struggling to survive while their employees' initiatives are greatly stifled. In such circumstance, the key to an effective management of employees is to stimulate their initiatives through the Incentive Management practices. Undoubtedly, the enhanced employees' initiatives can be a strong tonic to increase businesses' vitality, which in turn will play an important role in strengthening businesses' competitive capabilities in international markets and ensuring businesses' sustained development. Thus, it is concluded that effective Incentive Management practices may help businesses struggling to survive overcome difficulties imposed by the current financial crisis by improving employees' work satisfaction and initiatives and ultimately maintain and enhance businesses' efficiency and productivity.

Article Title: Comparative Analysis and Prediction of Real-estate Industry between US and China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Rreal-estate industry; US and China; comparative analysis; Prediction
Abstract: With the rapid development of economic globalization, international capital flow freely and unlimitedly through the whole world. The industry has become high priority investment project of the international capital and important target of pursuing windfall profit. But comprehensive outbreak of financial Storm has made the real estate bubble. This paper combines different features of the U.S. real-estate and real-estate in China and analysis the difference from three aspects: the recognition of structure of industrial chains between two countries is different, the factors of real-estate downslide is various, the third factor is that the meaning to land agent and government and common citizens exist many differences. The paper presents difference-assessment index system. Through comparative analysis, pointing out that we should adopt scientific views' regulation policy for forming of the benign cycle and providing some countermeasures and proposals for getting to improve market stability of real-estate. So real-estate industry can satisfy the society, environment and economy. Meanwhile under the condition of considering uncertainty, build economic model of predicting the industry's future tendency.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF
Author Full Names: Liu, Zhizhong; Liang, Jun; Zhang, Hua
Article Title: An IS-LM Model with FDI and Tax Revenue: a Dynamic Panel Analysis for China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: tax; FDI; IS-LM model; dynamic panel analysis
Keywords Plus: FOREIGN DIRECT-INVESTMENT; UNITED-STATES
Abstract: This paper extends the IS-LM framework so as to incorporate foreign direct investment (FDI) and tax revenue FDI inflow stimulates economic growth and raises tax revenue which improves investment environment and attracts more FDI inflow The interrelation between them is reciprocal causation, they reinforce each other and form a benign circle. Strong evidence is provided by empirical results of dynamic panel models with 28 provincial-level units publishing data from 1985 to 2007. Despite FDI inflow decreases tax revenue in short term due to tax relief policy, they do promote each other in long term and the two-way causality is also proved

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Analysis on the objective factors affecting real estate developers in their pre-construction planning for projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Strategy plan; Developer of real estate; Objective factors; Questionnaire
Abstract: Under the background of global economic crisis, the development of real estate in China has become harder and harder, and the success of the strategy plan for a real estate project seems quite important. The both prudent and practical strategy plan at the very beginning of a project lifecycle should become the focus which can decide the survival and development for developers at present. When the economy has entered a regulatory period, in which the prospects of business, finance, and government policy are not lucid, developers may be influenced by complicated factors during the phase of pre-construction plan for real estate projects since more risks may be encountered by the projects. Therefore, it is necessary to carry out investigations and analysis on all kinds of objective factors that could affect developer's plan. It's meaningful that objective factors influencing the pre-construction plan of real estate projects are made clear through the analysis of variables such as government policy, financing, technology, market, location and humanities in this paper. Questionnaire survey including 30 questions was conducted on developers in order to discover which variables are recognized as the most important. Data are collected and reliability analysis is done by SPSS 13.0. The means of each variable are calculated. Nowadays, financial problem is ranked first by developers rather than the factor of market demand. This indicates that Chinese developers have less concern about what their clients really want, which probably could explain the gap between supply and demand in the housing industry. This could cause a vicious circle. Obviously, the subjective factors affecting developers' pre-construction planning of real estate projects, such as the experiences and character of developers themselves are needed to be studied further.

Article Title: Health Human Capital and Education Human Capital: A Survey Based on the Effect of Health Human Capital on Growth
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: health human capital; education human capital; growth
Keywords Plus: INVESTMENT
Abstract: On the mid-and late 1990s, when available data in variables measuring health human capital increased, and methods of statistics and measure improved, health human capital gradually became a new study direction for more and more economic scholars. Existing evidence demonstrates that the health human capital, like education human capital, has positive effect on growth On this basis, this paper studies the relationship between health and education, and draws the conclusion that health influences education directly or indirectly, even as education does, and thus produces an effect on economic growth Although literature confirms the existence of the correlation, it is too early to affirm the causality between health and education

Article Title: Monetary and Fiscal Policies In Romania Under The Impact Of The International Economic Crisis
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: policies; fiscal integration; monetary integration; economic crisis
Abstract: As the present economic crisis has its origin as well as its manifestation in financial components it may deeply affect the behavior of many economic agents. The financial component of the crisis is intensified by the fact that many companies are facing a decreasing demand, the sell less, the risk of not being paid is also very high and the risk of insolvency has never been such close. If at the end of last year the first signs of crisis could be hardly felt in Romania, at present, after a semester, the crisis seems to be more deeply felt, while the signs that were merely seen now represent more than daily realities.

Article Title: The implications of audit risk and materiality threshold towards economic risk and audit failure
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Audit risk; Risk assessment; Audit risk documentation; Materiality threshold; Risk associated with sampling
Abstract: The audit risk, as defined by SAS 107 Audit Risk and Materiality in Conducting an Audit, represents the positive opinion of an auditor of financial statements that are materially misstated, opinion that unknowingly failed to be appropriately modified. Based on the model recommended by SAS 107 we propose an audit model that takes in concern the recommendations of The Minimal Audit Standards, developed by the Chamber of Financial Auditors from Romania, model that depends on sampling and presents the assessment of the audit risk by determining not only the inherent risk, control risk but the risk of not detecting errors linked with sampling, result of audit work sheets elaboration depending on statistical techniques.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: Conceptual design and implementation of a model for the integrated simulation of large-scale land-use systems
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Land-use system; modelling framework; model integration; global land-use change
Keywords Plus: DAYCENT
Abstract: In the scientific literature, the relation between human land-use activities and the environment is often described as a coupled human-environment system with socio-economic as well as ecological and biophysical components as sub-systems (Mather, 2006). These land-use systems form the terrestrial part of the Earth System and are therefore critical components of global biogeochemical cycles and energy fluxes (GLP, 2005). One approach to simulate the spatial and temporal dynamics of land-use systems on the regional to global scale level is the LandSHIFT modelling framework, which is currently under development at CESR. First applications in the context of mid- to long-term scenario analysis focus on Africa (Schaldach et al, 2006), India (Schaldach et al., in review) and the Middle East (Koch et al., 2008). LandSHIFT has a modular structure, which supports the integration of various sub-models representing the key components of land systems. In this paper, we describe and discuss the design of the prototype of LandSHIFT, both on the conceptual and the implementation level. Additionally an exemplary model application is presented.

Authors: Sun, YR; Zhang, X; Li, FJ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Sun Yongrong; Zhang Xing; Li Fengju
Article Title: A Study On Emergency Plans For Safety Related Accidents During Metro Construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Metro construction; Safety accident; Emergency plans
Abstract: In recent years, the metro projects have been rapidly developed in China. At the same time the government has paid great attention to the severe situation of frequent accidents during metro construction. A well developed emergency plan can help to avoid further expansion of the accident and reduce casualties and property losses effectively. There is no doubt that emergency plans play an important role in the emergency rescue. According to the study of 126 cases of accidents during metro construction, collapse is of the highest-frequency, followed by fire, machine accident, and object attack, etc. It is essential to prepare special emergency plans for collapse accidents based on the geological conditions. There are several issues in the emergency plans for metro construction accidents, which go against implementing the plans effectively. Content inadequacy, less maneuverability and inadequate implementation of the plans are the major ones. In accordance with the general steps of emergency plans, the process of emergency plans for accidents are re-designed and divided into 4 stages to meet the requirements of the underground rescue. Considering the factors of the metro construction and complex underground environment, the main points of every stage are discussed in depth, so that emergency plans for metro construction accidents can be more feasible and effective. Based on the above mentioned study, an emergency plan for collapse accidents is taken for example, which includes emergency command organization, hazard analysis, prevention measures, emergency measures, recovery procedures and training programs. The emergency plan for collapse accidents has guiding significance to settle problems in the process of emergency rescue to collapses.

Article Title: Monitoring: When Institutional Investors Do?
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: institutional investor; corporate governance; repeated game
Abstract: We use a repeated game model to analysis when the institutional investors take monitoring action in corporate governance. The repeated game indicated that the higher percent and longer holding period of institutional, the greater possibility of institutional investors take monitoring action. It induce that the stockholding proportion and their holding period of institutional investors depend the cost-benefit framework of their monitoring on game theory. To the best knowledge; this is the first paper to study the role of China's institutional investors in corporate governance, simultaneously, from their stockholding proportion and their holding period.

Authors: Wang, JY; Zou, PXW; Ma, SC
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang Jiayuan; Zou, Patrick X. W.; Ma Shichao
Article Title: A Fuzzy AHP-Based Comprehensive Evaluation of Cost-Overrun Risks in Construction Projects in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: risk assessment; construction projects; analytical hierarchy process; China; fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; degree of membership
Keywords Plus: JOINT VENTURES
Abstract: While research has studied the cost-overrun risks in construction projects in China and else where and presented useful advices for managing these risks, the methodologies used to analyze the risks were mainly qualitative and there is a gap in using quantitative method which can integrate risk expert's knowledge to assess the risks. The aim of this paper is to fill in this gap by presenting a fuzzy AHP based methodology t evaluated the cost overrun risks. This paper first identified the key cost-overrun risks through survey questionnaires and then sets up a hierarchy structure of these risks. Following that the paper develops a fuzzy AHP-based comprehensive evaluation model for the appraisal of the risk environment to support the rational decision making. The AHP method is applied for calculating the index weight by forming interval number evaluation matrix. Furthermore, the paper discusses in details how to apply the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method which contains the index weights to analyze project cost-overrun risks. An empirical case study is used to demonstrate the application of the proposed AHP-based fuzzy risk evaluation model. It is concluded that the AHP-based fuzzy risk evaluation model is effective in tackling the cost-overrun risks. The information presented in this paper should be appearing to all parties considering seizing the construction business opportunities in China as the data were obtained in first hand from the Chinese construction industry by means of surveys. In particular, the key cost-overrun risks factors identified through the extensive surveys in the paper would be useful to practitioners in China and those in other countries in order to better manage such risks to achieve the project objective of within budget and value for money. The proposed research approach/methodology should be applicable to the research and analysis of not only cost overrun risks but also other types of risk such as time delay and quality risks associated with any types of construction projects and this in turn should be a useful reference to researchers in the field of construction management.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: The Elements Research of Stock Price Based on Ohlson Residual Incoming Valuation Model in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: Residual Incoming; Clean Surplus Relation; Corporation Value
Abstract: In this paper, the extend analysis is done for the Ohlson's model, and calculates the enterprise value for China listed corporation. The relation between the enterprise value and market price is given. This paper constructs three regression equations, and selects the financial index to compare with the residual income model. The result indicates that the Ohlson's model has the better ability of explanation for stock price. The financial index such as EPS and ROTA has the positive influence, and the other selected index has negative influence on stock price. The explanation of the Ohlson's model for the price is not sufficient, and there is also a lot of information which will affect price. So it is important for investors to regard the information out of the financial index.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Policy of Urban Indemnificatory Housing Supply Based on the Gradient Consumption Theory: A Case Study of Xi'an, Shaanxi Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Indemnificatory housing; Supply policy; Gradient consumption model; Xi' an
Abstract: Indemnificatory Housing is an important livelihood problem. Nowadays, indemnificatory housing is emphasized very deeply. Based on the overview of the research on housing security system domestic and overseas, the author puts forward a reasonable concept of indemnificatory housing supply balancing fairness and efficiency. First, the author reviews the situation of housing security system in Xi' an in recent years. The housing filtering theory and the gradient consumption theory are used to analyze housing policy of Xi'an qualitatively. Then, the author discusses the thinking of reasonable indemnificatory housing supply system, based on the logical layered of housing consumption. With the construction of gradient consumption model, the author describes the operation framework on how the gradient consumption model helps to realize the reasonable indemnificatory housing supply, considering the formation of gradient consumption configuration, the overall development of supply system, operation mechanism and the construction of related system. There are some main conclusions about housing security system, including the unbalance between supply and demand of indemnificatory housing, the need of improving the location and quality of indemnificatory housing, the lack of reasonable mechanism for access and exit, the strong casualness of policy because of low degree of legal system, the poor fairness resulted by imperfect operation mechanism and so on. Recommendations are proposed for these problems. The author hopes this research can make sense and provide reference for some related departments.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Inner City Brownfield for Residential Development: a case study in Guangzhou, China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Brownfield; high-density housing; inner-city; contamination; China
Keywords Plus: SUSTAINABLE URBAN REGENERATION; LAND-USE; SITES
Abstract: The economic prosperity in China has contributed to the significant and continuous adjustment of its urban industrial structure and inner-city brownfield regeneration is becoming a necessity in governments' urban management tool-box. To substance the growth need, China has hard-pressed major policies such as suppress the 2nd industry and develop the 3rd industry, which consequently weeded out a flood of polluting plants out of the inner-city. Most of the plants built in 1960s have generated in varying degrees poisonous waste seeping into soil; and a large portion of such contaminated land has been and will continuously be converted into commercial or residential uses. This paper uses a large residential project in Guangzhou built on a chemically polluted site in Guangzhou to examine factual evidence of contaminated treatment in the brownfield redevelopment process in Chinese cities. It identifies institutions, processes and practices related to the reclamation of brownfield sites for high-density residential use and assess preliminarily the impact of formerly industrial sites on residential development in inner-city areas. The study found that inner-city industry relocation being part of China's economic transition has triggered a massive process of transformation of inner-city land use from industrial to residential or commercial uses. Although controls of environmental impacts are carefully managed and monitored during the construction period, much less cares were given at pre-construction and post-occupancy period. For inner-city redevelopment on sites with heavy industry heritage, this could impose a significant impact on the sustainable land use in China's major cities.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Hedonic Model Analysis of Chongqing Housing Prices
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Hedonic model; Chongqing residence market; housing prices
Abstract: Due to the heterogeneity of real estate, the hedonic price model (HPM) has been widely used in analysis of urban housing market. On the basis of theoretical analysis, the present paper tries to construct the HPM for the empirical study on the residential property market of Chongqing. The theoretical basis of the model is composed of the Lancaster Preference Theory and the Rosen products hedonic of market supply and demand equilibrium model. Through the collection of residential transactions of Chongqing and selection of the locations, structures, environmental factors, etc. as the residential features, the paper constructs the residential hedonic price model. After using some software for multiple regressions on the model, the authors have achieved six implicit prices of the main residential features, and then they classify the residential features closely related to the residential prices into three categories. The statistical testing and the analysis of the model results show that the model is effective and reasonable; accordingly it can be used to explain and analyze the housing prices in Chongqing.

Authors: Xu, BG; Bao, HJ; He, LQ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu Baogen; Bao Haijun; He LinQian
Article Title: The Evaluating Method of Compensation for Land Requisition based on Set Pair Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Set pair analysis; Compensation for land requisition; Uncertainty analysis
Abstract: The uncertainty factors are ignored by current evaluating methods of compensation for land requisition. The lowest and highest compensation for land requisition are tangible. However, the material compensation for land requisition in specific location is intangible. Introduced to Set Pair Analysis, this paper put forward a new method, which considers the uncertainty factors in evaluating compensation for land requisition. The research indicates that the evaluating method of compensation for land requisition based on Set Pair Analysis is valid This paper shows that the method of evaluating land compensation price, based on Set Pair Analysis, has not only drawn existing methods, but also improved the existing deficiencies. This method makes full use of relative information on land compensation price, such as Agricultural land classification and other information. In this way, it can improve flexibility and completeness of the results, and provides more information in price negotiations.

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF
Article Title: On the Policy Option of Social Health Insurance from the Perspective of Interest Integration
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: social health insurance; policy; interest; the main participants
Abstract: The social health Insurance policy is an Important social policy China's social health insurance policy did not achieve the desired results in the implementation process, the main reason is the behavior of target groups couldn't be restricted effectively in the policy implementation, which lead to the Interest game among involved main participants of social health insurance trapped in a Prisoner's Dilemma Therefore, we should define the participants of social medical insurance scientifically, grasp profoundly the interest relationship and characters among them, and reveal the influence to the social health insurance policy implementation by the interest game of participants. From the perspective of interest integration of the main participants, we should design social health insurance policies, restrict behavior of interest game among participants,at last, and Implement integration effect on Interest of the main participant

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Under the financial crisis the investment real estate value and business value of performance-related research
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: financial crisis; the investment real estate; value relevance
Keywords Plus: MARKET VALUATION
Abstract: The global financial crisis which originated in the US subprime mortgage crisis of real estate industry, impact on the global real estate boom seriously. It also makes the enterprise begin to pay more attention to the value of the investment real estate enterprise performance, and the influence on enterprise surplus management of reasonable. For the further study of value of the investment real estate enterprise performance, thereby more effective management, enterprise surplus value theory, based on our first course and the application of the investment real estate value change trend analysis system. Secondly, through the price model and earnings of the investment real estate value change model with the enterprise performance between the empirical research,and use SPSS for under financial crisis the investment real estate listed companies in 2008 financial data analysis. Finally based on empirical research results of enterprises put forward relevant suggestions on earnings management. For financial crisis the healthy development of the real estate, avoid financial risks to have the certain reference value to the financial crisis, the investment real estate under appropriate of earnings management has practical significance.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on the Unified Rural-urban Housing Market
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: rural residence; housing market; Cournot model
Abstract: The main purpose of the article is to reveal the direction and requirements for the construction of Chinese residential housing market through analyzing the orientation of China's macro-economic policies and objectives and the different characteristics of residential ownership. For this purpose, for an in-depth research on the entering of rural residential houses into the residential housing market, the research adopts Cournot duopoly theory and uses the methods of policies comparative analysis. It discusses the advantages of building a unified rural-urban housing market on stimulating domestic demand, adjusting the price of residential, protecting villagers' interests, and promoting the intensive use of land resource. The conclusion of the study shows that: Building a rural-urban housing market will increase the residential supply and reduce house price, reduce the bubble of the real estate, increase the villagers' income and improve their quality of life, improve the living standards, reduce land waste, increase land using efficiency. What's more, it will eventually help to narrow the gap between urban and rural areas, and to promote the process of urban-rural-integration.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on the Evaluation and Prediction on Coordinated Degree of Real Estate and Economy Composite System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Composite system; Coordinate degree; Chaos theory; Econometric estimation; Real estate
Abstract: The real estate industry is one of the pillar industries of national economy, so it is very significant to study on the coordinated development of real estate and economy. First, we set up the model of the coordinated degree of the composite system based on the synergetic theory and systems science. Second, in order to evaluate and predict the coordinated degrees, the model of econometric estimation should be used, and then it can be known for dynamic behavior of the composite system on stability, periodicity and the chaos of Chaos diagnostic theory. Thirdly, demonstrative analysis has been done to the evaluation and prediction according to the status of the real estate and economic composite system in China, which is demonstrated by some data of national statistical yearbook from 1997 to 2007. Last, a conclusion of the interrelation is proposed between the subsystems and the coordinated degreed of composite system.

Authors: Barnum, DT; Karlaftis, MG; Tandon, S
Author Full Names: Barnum, Darold T.; Karlaftis, Matthew G.; Tandon, Sonali
Article Title: Improving the efficiency of metropolitan area transit by joint analysis of its multiple providers
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Data Envelopment Analysis; DEA; Technical efficiency; Allocation efficiency; Urban transit; Urban public transportation; Urban transport
Abstract: Public transportation in a metropolitan area often is supplied by multiple types of transit. This paper develops and illustrates a DEA-based procedure for estimating: overall efficiency of an area's public transportation; technical efficiencies of the individual transit types; effect of each type on overall efficiency; and efficiency of the allocation of resources among types and an algorithm for improving it. The paper concludes that the overall efficiency of an urban area's public transportation can be validly estimated only if the technical efficiency of each major transport type and the efficiency in allocating resources among them are taken into consideration. Article Title: The value of travel time variance
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Value of travel time; Value of travel time variability; Reliability; Scheduling preferences
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION; BOTTLENECK; COST
Abstract: This paper considers the value of travel time variability under scheduling preferences that are defined in terms of linearly time varying utility rates associated with being at the origin and at the destination. The main result is a simple expression for the value of travel time variability that does not depend on the shape of the travel time distribution. The related measure of travel time variability is the variance of travel time. These conclusions apply equally to travellers who can freely choose departure time and to travellers who use a scheduled service with fixed headway. Depending on parameters, travellers may be risk averse or risk seeking and the value of travel time may increase or decrease in the mean travel time. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Liu, R; Jiang, ZB; Liu, XA; Chen, F
Author Full Names: Liu, Ran; Jiang, Zhibin; Liu, Xiao; Chen, Feng
Article Title: Task selection and routing problems in collaborative truckload transportation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Collaborative transportation; Full truckload; Task selection; Routing; Memetic algorithm
Keywords Plus: RURAL POSTMAN PROBLEM; HEURISTIC ALGORITHM; MEMETIC ALGORITHMS; SEARCH; DEPOT; COSTS; FLEET
Abstract: This paper introduces the task selection and routing problem in collaborative transportation in which a truckload carrier receives tasks from shippers and other partners and makes a selection between a private vehicle and an external carrier to serve each task. The objective is to minimize the variable and fixed costs for operating the private fleet plus the total costs charged by the external carrier. The mathematical formulation and the lower bound are established. A memetic algorithm is developed to solve the problem. The computational results show that the proposed algorithm is effective and efficient. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Tirachini, A; Hensher, DA; Jara-Díaz, SR
Author Full Names: Tirachini, Alejandro; Hensher, David A.; Jara-Diaz, Sergio R.
Article Title: Restating modal investment priority with an improved model for public transport analysis
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Bus; Rail; BRT; Users costs; Operator costs; Crowding
Keywords Plus: BUS RAPID-TRANSIT; OPTIMIZATION; SERVICE; DESIGN
Abstract: We compare analytically and numerically the optimised performance of different urban public transport modes for three objectives: total cost minimisation, profit maximisation, and welfare maximisation. We find that under optimal operation, buses provide lower waiting time and operator costs, therefore the only possible advantage for rail is providing a lower in-vehicle time cost if trains are faster. Using Australian data, we found that bus rapid transit provides a lower total cost, higher profit and welfare, up to their capacity. Introducing passengers dislike of crowding and train-specific attraction elements might make Heavy Rail the most cost effective mode for high levels of demand. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Fan, L; Wilson, WW; Tolliver, D
Author Full Names: Fan, Lei; Wilson, William W.; Tolliver, Denver
Article Title: Optimal network flows for containerized imports to the United States
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Containers; Supply-chains in containers; Optimization of container shipments; Trade in containers
Keywords Plus: PORT
Abstract: This paper analyzes the intermodal transportation network of containerized imports to the United States. An optimization model is developed that integrates international and North America inland transport networks. The results indicate optimal ship size, route, port, and interior shipping corridor and are highly reflective of observed shipments. Sensitivity analyzes were performed to evaluate impacts of congestion on capacity constraints as well as the prospective impacts of the alternative routes that are emerging. Results indicate that Prince Rupert is highly competitive for shipments to some markets, but the expansion of the Panama Canal would have lesser impacts on container flows. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Goldstein, D; Shehab, T; Casse, J; Lin, HC
Author Full Names: Goldstein, Darin; Shehab, Tariq; Casse, Juan; Lin, Hsiu-Chin
Article Title: On the formulation and solution of the convoy routing problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Traffic models; Emergency vehicle routing; Convoy routing
Keywords Plus: TIME; HIERARCHY; ALGORITHM; NETWORKS; MOVEMENT; MODELS; GRAPH
Abstract: In this work, we will identify important variables that contribute to vehicular movement in an emergency environment. In particular, we formulate and pose the convoy routing problem. We suggest a method for modeling the problem and formulate a precise problem statement that significantly reduces the number of variables under consideration relative to similar previous work: even so, we prove that the decision version of this problem is NP-complete. After devising an algorithm using artificial intelligence techniques, we then empirically analyze this model (via software simulation) to get computational results on a single instance of the problem. Article Title: Supply chain network design under profit maximization and oligopolistic competition
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Profit-maximizing supply chains; Supply chain design; Network oligopolies; Game theory; Nash equilibria; Variational inequalities; Projected dynamical systems
Keywords Plus: MARKET EQUILIBRIUM; DYNAMICAL-SYSTEMS; STABILITY; MODEL
Abstract: In this paper, we model the supply chain network design problem with oligopolistic firms who are involved in the competitive production, storage, and distribution of a homogeneous product to multiple demand markets. The profit-maximizing firms select both the capacities associated with the various supply chain network activities as well as the product quantities. We formulate the governing Nash-Cournot equilibrium conditions as a variational inequality problem and identify several special cases of the model, notably, a generalization of a spatial oligopoly and a classical oligopoly problem to include design capacity variables. The proposed computational approach, which is based on projected dynamical systems, fully exploits the network structure of the problems and yields closed form solutions at each iteration. In order to illustrate the modeling framework and the algorithm, we also provide solutions to a spectrum of numerical supply chain network oligopoly design examples. This paper makes a contribution to game theoretic modeling of competitive supply chain network design problems in an oligopolistic setting. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Hsu, YL; Li, WC; Chen, KW
Author Full Names: Hsu, Yueh-Ling; Li, Wen-Chin; Chen, Kuang-Wei
Article Title: Structuring critical success factors of airline safety management system using a hybrid model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airline; Safety Management System; Decision Making Trial Evaluation Laboratory; Grey Relational Analysis; Analytic Network Process
Keywords Plus: DECISION-MAKING; DEMATEL
Abstract: With the global trend of legal requirement for a performance-based Safety Management System (SMS), to develop and implement an SMS to deliver services has become the most important goal within the airline industry. Yet there found some discrepancies concerning the use and the manner that SMS was being explained and taught. Therefore, this research aims to develop a quantitative evaluation model, which identifies the key components of airline SMS and considers the interaction between key components. To explore the core value of SMS. an extensive review regarding SMS components are firstly conducted and summarized from major aviation organizations and authorities, and then Grey Relational Analysis is used to group and select key components. After the critical components are derived, Decision Making Trial Evaluation Laboratory and Analytic Network Process are employed to analyze and map out all kinds of interactions among critical components and dimensions systematically. An empirical study is presented to illustrate the application of the proposed methods. From the results of the combined approaches, Organization is the most important dimension in SMS, which begins with Policies that convey to all staff the top managers' vision on safety. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A class of bush-based algorithms for the traffic assignment problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bush-based algorithm; User equilibrium traffic assignment; Acyclicity
Keywords Plus: SIMPLICIAL DECOMPOSITION; NETWORK; ENUMERATION
Abstract: This paper studies a class of bush-based algorithms (BA) for the user equilibrium (LIE) traffic assignment problem, which promise to produce highly precise solutions by exploiting acyclicity of LIE flows. Each of the two building blocks of BA, namely the construction of acyclic sub-networks (bush) and the solution of restricted master problems (RMP), is examined and further developed. Four Newton-type algorithms for solving RMP. which can be broadly categorized as route flow and origin flow based, are presented. of which one is newly developed in this paper. Similarities and differences between these algorithms, as well as the relevant implementation issues are discussed in great details. A comprehensive numerical study is conducted using both real and randomly generated networks, which reveals that the relative performance of the algorithms is consistent with the analysis. In particular, the results suggest that swapping flows between shortest and longest route segments consistently outperforms other RMP solution techniques. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Countermeasures for Building Public Stadiums and in Moderate Cities
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Medium-size and small cities; Stadiums and gymnasiums' construction; Program and plan
Abstract: With the progress of urbanization speeding up and economy developing in China, stadiums and gymnasiums are being built one after another in medium-size and small cities all over the country. However, in the process of construction many problems have cropped up, such as the backwardness in stadiums and gymnasiums' construction, blind comparison between cities and failure to position target customer dynamic precisely. This paper analyzes the source of these problems and at the same time brings up corresponding solutions, providing reference for stadiums and gymnasiums' construction in China's medium-size and small cities.

Authors: Rich, J; Holmblad, PM; Hansen, CO
Author Full Names: Rich, J.; Holmblad, P. M.; Hansen, C. O.
Article Title: A weighted logit freight mode-choice model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight demand elasticities; Nested logit; Discrete choice; Commodity groups; Mode-choice
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL DEMAND; SHIPMENT-SIZE; TRANSPORT; EUROPE; PROBABILITIES; ELASTICITIES; TIME
Abstract: The paper describes the estimation of a weighted discrete choice model applicable for analysing choice of mode and crossing for freight in the Oresund region. The study finds that, by applying a weighted logit approach, it is possible to establish a suitable decoupling of agents and shipments. Moreover, by assessing preferences on the basis of a representative baseline OD matrix it is possible to better reflect the dependence between mode substitution effects and geography/infrastructure. The paper presents demand elasticities with respect to monetary cost and travel time as well as value-of-time estimates for five modes and thirteen commodity groups. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. Authors: Liu, TL; Huang, HJ; Yang, H; Zhang, XN
Author Full Names: Liu, Tian-Liang; Huang, Hai-Jun; Yang, Hai; Zhang, Xiaoning
Article Title: Continuum modeling of park-and-ride services in a linear monocentric city with deterministic mode choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Corridor problem; Park-and-ride; Equilibrium; Mode choice; Supernetwork
Keywords Plus: NETWORK EQUILIBRIUM; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; TRANSIT; SYSTEM; LOCATION; HIGHWAY; TOLLS
Abstract: The objective of this paper is to enhance the insights into commuters' travel choice behaviors in a competitive railway/highway system with continuum park-and-ride services along a travel corridor. It is assumed that parking charges gradually decrease from the city center to the corridor boundary and commuters are continuously distributed along the corridor. Commuters choose either the railway or highway for traveling from their home to the center in the morning. If choosing the highway, the commuters also consider the use of park-and-ride facilities available anywhere throughout the corridor. Given these assumptions, we propose a deterministic continuum equilibrium model to characterize commuters' modal choices and park-and-ride transfer behaviors. We prove that, at equilibrium, the variable travel cost per unit distance on the highway is not higher than that on the railway along the corridor. As a result, the railway is used only between the city center (the destinations of morning commuters) and some location in the linear city, beyond which all commuters choose the highway. Furthermore, commuters living closer to the city center choose the park-and-ride facilities that are simultaneously chosen by those who live farther away from the city center. The model is solved numerically through its transformation into a discrete version using a supernetwork approach and demonstrated with numerical examples together with a discussion of the effect of park-and-ride services and pricing on travel behaviors. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Asymptotic traffic dynamics arising in diverge-merge networks with two intermediate links
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Diverge-merge networks with two intermediate links; Constant boundary conditions; First-order kinematic wave models; Asymptotic traffic dynamics; Asymptotic stationary states; Damped periodic oscillations; Persistent periodic oscillations
Keywords Plus: PHASE-TRANSITIONS; COMPLEX NETWORKS; FLOW MODEL; JAMS; HIGHWAY; SYSTEMS; PHYSICS; WAVES; ROADS
Abstract: Basic road network components, such as merging and diverging junctions, contribute much to formation and propagation of traffic congestion. However, in contrast to extensive studies of traffic dynamics on a road link, little is understood for those on a road network, In this study, we provide a comprehensive analysis of asymptotic traffic dynamics arising in diverge-merge networks with two intermediate links with first-order kinematic wave models. In addition, traffic demand at the origin and traffic demand at the destination are constant and maximum, and the proportion of vehicles choosing an intermediate link is constant. First, we examine all possible asymptotic stationary states and the sufficient and necessary conditions for their existence. With an example, we find that non-stationary states can include damped (DPO) and persistent periodic oscillations (PPO), and present an equivalent dynamical system that can be used to distinguish these two types of oscillations. This study can be a springboard for better understanding of traffic dynamics, especially formation and propagation of traffic congestion, on general road networks. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Financial Reporting Model in Enterprise Financial Management Information Collaborative Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: Enterprise Financial Management Information Collaborative model; network of financial reporting; extensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL)
Abstract: This paper mainly studies the network of financial reporting model based on XBRL. This article firstly defines the relevant concepts and the basic framework and design ideas of enterprise financial management information collaborative model are followed. Then it analyzes formation principles of the network of financial reporting and main features and technical characteristics of XBRL, and in enterprise financial management information collaborative model, it also makes demand and feasibility analysis about network of financial reporting model based on XBRL. Finally, the paper puts forwards application of the financial reporting model in enterprise financial management information collaborative model as well as the application benefits of XBRL.

Article Title: An Analysis of Influencing Factors and the Pattern Choice in Developing Tourism Real Estate in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: market; brand; tourism real estate; tourism resource
Abstract: Tourism real estate is a kind of managerial industry, which combines tourism industry with real estate. Due to continuing high-speed of economic development, rise of people's living standard and changes of consumption concept and consumption modes, tourism real estate has a good future. At Present, tourism real estate in China has a growing tendency. Meanwhile, it also appears many problems. Therefore, it is very necessary and urgent to research development of tourism real estate in China. Firstly, the paper discusses the basic concept of tourist real estate, analyzes the conformity relation between tourism industry and real estate. Secondly, it summarizes all kinds of factors that influence development of tourism real estate. Finally, connecting the four key elements together; it systematically constructs the model of route choice of tourism real estate enterprises. There are two innovations: firstly, it summarizes five main factors that influence the development of tourism real estate; Secondly, it puts forward the model of route choice of tourism real estate enterprises, which can provide a new tool to instruct tourism real estate choosing proper development strategy.

Article Title: Network Dynamics when Selecting Work Team Members
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Abstract: When selecting work team members several behavioral components concur. In this chapter we summarizes our line of research on this topic; here, we articulate our results and provide suggestions for extending our analysis in order to shed light on the selection of work team members. First, a computational model - together with a theoretical approach and the results of two human experiments where subjects interact in a similar game - allows us to identify some of the most important determinants. Our results suggest that the occurrence of two factors is crucial: the presence of leaders as aggregators of knowledge and the presence of agents able to expand and improve their higher profit projects. Second, we explicitly assume the presence of formal leaders. By analyzing the results of this modified model, we shed light on the conditions which allow the emergence of effective leaders.

Authors: Demirci, G; Ayar, B; Kivrak, S; Gokhan, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Demirci, Gulcan; Ayar, Bunyamin; Kivrak, Serkan; Gokhan, Arslan
Article Title: Contractor Selection in the Housing Sector Using the Simple Multi-Attribute Rating Technique
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction industry; Contractor selection; Qualification; SMART
Keywords Plus: CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTORS; PROJECTS; MODEL; MANAGEMENT; PROPOSAL; SUPPORT; SYSTEM; BIDS
Abstract: General contractors play a vital role in the success of construction projects. Selecting the right general contractor for the right job significantly influences the quality of work in these projects. Therefore, construction owners must be extremely careful while selecting the most appropriate contractor for the project. In the selection process, construction owners have to know all financial, technical and general information about the contractors to determine the most appropriate one for the project. Depending on the lowest bid price alone in the selection process, especially for complex construction projects in which a more detailed evaluation methodology is usually needed may result in serious money losses for construction owners in the long run. Within this context, the owners should consider several criteria that may include the quality of production, adequacy of technical staff and financial stability during the selection process. In this study, a survey was carried out among 52 construction professionals working in a public administration which has been operating in the housing sector in Turkey. The administration is the single responsible public body in this sector in Turkey and provides housing especially for the low and middle-income groups. The administration has been using several evaluation criteria for selecting contractors in construction projects. These criteria can be categorized under the main headings as quality, time, cost, and provisional / final acceptance. The objectives of the survey are to examine these criteria and determine the relative weights of the main and sub-criteria used by the administration. The survey was conducted over a two month period between August and September 2008. The survey questionnaire was administered during face-to-face interviews. Simple Multi Attribute Rating Technique (SMART) is used to determine the weights of the criteria. According to the responses, quality was ranked as the first important criterion with a slight difference.

Article Title: Distortional Bullwhip Effects on carriers
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Bullwhip effect; Simulation; Supply chain; Inventory replenishment policy
Keywords Plus: SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT; IN-SERVICE; IMPACT; INFORMATION; DEMAND; SIMULATION; CAPACITY; TIME; TRANSPORTATION; INDUSTRY
Abstract: This paper analyzes the Bullwhip Effect (BWE) problem from the (carriers') viewpoint. The analysis explores how retailer's limited capability to forecast end-customer demand and their sub-optimal replenishment policies distort service demand signals to carriers. The consequent unnecessary increases in carriers' capacity costs and operational instability are quantified for a context of pronounced seasonality. The paper finds that carriers unable to adjust transportation capacity to seasonal changes can incur costs of nearly five times what is possible with maximum forecasting capabilities and prudent replenishment policies. Another major finding is that replenishment policy is superior to forecasting capability in reducing BWE-related costs. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Study on the Derivation Mechanism and Development of City Commercial Pedestrian Street-A Case Study on Beijing Road of Guangzhou
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: City Commercial Pedestrian Stree; Derivation Mechanism; Development
Abstract: A construction boom of the pedestrian street has been initiated in China since 1980s, the construction of the commercial Pedestrian streets can Promote the local economy development and the popularity of city in the certain degree. The objective of this paper is to sum up the general experience of the construction of Pedestrian Street, to avoid the problems would produced during future construction, and to guide future development better. In this paper, a quantitative analysis has been implemented on the source of customers, the attractive factors, the accessibility, the behavioral characteristics of tourists and the acceptance of visitors about all aspects of the construction through questionnaire survey. This paper intends to find out the derivation mechanism and problems existing in the development of commercial Pedestrian Street in china. The paper predicts the development trend of the commercial pedestrian street. To promote the development of the city commercial pedestrian street, the author proposes suggestions as follows: (1) Highlight the characteristics. (2) Rational distribution. (3) Pay attention to the details of construction and user-friendly building. (4) Strengthen management and adhere to sustainable development.

Article Title: Economic Analysis of Coal Enterprises Build Strategic Alliance in New Mining Area Development
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: Mining development; strategic alliance; BaiYin Hua
Abstract: Aiming at the problems such as repetitive construction wasting resources existed in the development of new area, This paper analyzes the necessity of building the strategic alliance in the development of coal enterprise from the perspective of economics. And we know, although the coal output sum of the individual coal mine production is higher than the total sum of strategic alliances, their total profits is far below to the alliance's total profit level. So the strategic alliances is very necessary in the new development of the coal mining enterprises in order to realize the sustainable development of mining, and can realize resource sharing between the coal enterprise, reduce the waste of resources and realize the optimal configuration.

Authors: Ismail, F; Adnan, H; Abdullah, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ismail, Fadzida; Adnan, Hamimah; Abdullah, Arham
Article Title: Insurance Implementation in Malaysian Construction Industry
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Insurance; Construction; Indemnity; Premium; Claim
Abstract: Sufficient insurance coverage is important to protect an organisation's resources and finance. Insurance companies develop their resources through the insurance premium. The significance of insurance management in the construction industry is to provide security and to increase the chances of gaining back the losses occurred in any contracted incidents. This study aims to get the insight into the insurance application in the Malaysian construction industry. The objectives of the research are to identify the factors that affect the premium price, to study the types of claims arise from construction activities and to identify the claim procedure. Questionnaire surveys have been distributed to eight hundred contractors and thirty insurance companies, and semi-structured interviews were also performed with experts and insurance companies' representatives. It was found that the scope of work and the various types of coverage affect the premium price considerably. Fire, accidents and injuries are the highest types of claim arise in construction. The claim procedure starts from the day the incident happen and ends when the claimant gets paid. Finally, this research gives suggestion on the action that can be implied by the contractors in order to minimise the incidents at site thus can help reducing the claims.

Article Title: A Study of Small Property Right House Holders' Motivation : A Case of Small Property Right House in Wuhan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: small property right house; holder; motivation
Abstract: The aim of this research is to clarify small property right house holders' motivation factors and motivation tropism according to empirical research, and illuminate composing of small property right house holders' motivation. This study take the holders in three typical area of small property right house as sample, according to two stages survey and analyze, the author got the conclusion: the motivation of small property right house holder could be classified to five motivation tropisms: the impact of monetary value, the improvement of basic housing, the natural and pleasant environment, the requirement of work and life, and the achievement of cognitive and interest, in these five motivation tropisms, the impact of monetary value is the highest intensity motivation; most small property right house holders' motivation, which are composed of two or more motivation tropisms, are compound motivation style.

Article Title: Research on Demand Risk in Chinese Housing Market under Subprime Mortgage Crisis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Subprime Mortgage crisis; Chinese housing market; Urbanization; Population growth
Abstract: With the further deepening of global Subprime Mortgage crisis, the bubble in Chinese housing market has also begun to burst. The main reason is that the residential income can't keep up with the rising housing prices. The paper points out the chief factors that influence the purchasing power in Chinese housing market, such as population growth, the process of urbanization, income growth, mortgage policy, the per capita housing, and other factors. Then, the paper combines these factors to construct the demand risk model. By calculating the demand for residence in the next period according to the above-mentioned factors, we will be able to avoid effectively the risk of domestic demand. By the model, the paper analyzes the enormous demand risk and the inevitability of the burst bubble in Chinese housing market in 2008. At the same time, the paper forecasts the recovery of Chinese housing market in 2009 by the model.

Article Title: Study on the Real Estate Market Risk Governance Angle from the New Public Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Risk society; Real estate market risk; New Public Management; Cooperative governance
Abstract: In the modernization process, the dangers and potential threats of the society have reached a previously unknown extent of our by the exponential growth of productivity. Risk society is a society with bundles of risks and crises. The real estate market risk is one of the entire social risk's important components, which could easily induce some other relevant risk's knock-on effect. There are a huge social risks and crises hiding behind the prosperity of China's real estate market.It's crucial to the whole state economy development and the social stability by strengthening the real estate market risk governance, maintaining its sustained, healthy and orderly development. The article analyzed the real estate market risk's representation and its risky result, discussed the role playing of the government, market and society from the angle of new-cooperation ism and new public management, when they were in the real estate market risk. Then the writer gave a new model for the real estate market risk governance, which is the cooperative governance method based on government-dominant, market self-governance, society-participated in.

Author Full Names: Ma, Z. D.; Zheng, G. Y.
Article Title: Module design of process evaluation contents of construction project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction project; Process evaluation; Life-cycle
Abstract: After the economic crisis break out, in order to expand domestic demands and promote the economic grow steady and rapidly, Chinese government has issued a series of measures to rescue the stock market, and make a decision on NOV.5TH, 2008 in the executive meeting of state council, to invest 40 trillion in the coming two years. In such a short time, making such a large investment, people are concerned about if the fund can be used safely, reasonably and effectively. Aims at the problems that exist in process evaluation of construction project in our country, paper guided by scientific concept of development, according to the evaluating thought of modernize society, fixes the aims of process evaluation at three aspects of realistic thinking, rational thinking and philosophical thinking, and takes life cycle of construction project as main line, and divides it into five stages including decision making, design, preparation, execution and operation. Aims at technology, economy, environment and management, execute evaluation of aims, plan, execution, monitoring and effect, and establishes a three-dimensional system of process evaluation content module, finally designs contents of process evaluation in every stage.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Mi Lingyun; Wang Wenshun; Gao Tao; Ni Guodong
Article Title: Practical Research about the Agent Construction System in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the project invested by the government and not to obtain the profit; Agent Construction System; management mode; practical research
Abstract: In July 2004, the State Council promulgated Decision on Reform of the Investment System, pointing out: The implementation of Agent Construction System should be expedited in non-operating government-funded projects (NOGFP). Namely, by means of tender, choose the professional project management company. This company will be responsible for construction and implementation of the project, and strictly control project investment, quality and duration, and transfer the finished product to users after completion. Since then, various regions of the country gradually began to fully implement or try out the non-operating government-funded projects ACSThe characteristics and management mode adopted by some developed countries and regions of the project invested by the government and not to obtain the profits are discussed, and the excellences and disadvantages of the Agent Construction System are analyzed. And then based on some projects applying the Agent Construction System, existent problems and corresponding measures applying the Agent Construction System are discussed, such as the engagement time into the project of ACE, the selection of ACE, legal status of ACE, ACE standard for collecting fees and nurturing and business level problems of ace which is helpful for the developing and popularizing the Agent Construction System. Then the ACS will play a greater role in the NOGFP.
