Article Title: Construction financial crisis warning model using data mining
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Data mining; real estate; Financial crisis warning
Abstract: Financial crisis of construction companies not only influences the company itself, but also the shareholders, debtors, administration authorities, suppliers, employees, banks and the entire society. This paper employs artificial neural network of data mining and decision tree algorithm to build financial crisis warning model. The research results show that, forecasting performance of artificial neural network is better than that of decision tree model, hence, financial statement average warning model established through artificial neural network based on the average revenue of the past three years before financial crisis has better forecasting performance than the annual report forecast model. Factor analysis is employed to select common factor in 1 year before financial crisis, and the critical variables of financial crisis are found to be: debt-to-equity ratio, quick ratio, borrowing dependence, inventory turnover ratio, and earnings per share. According to the decision tree rule, variables differentiable to financial crisis warning are debt-to-equity ratio, earnings per share, and borrowing dependence.

Article Title: Research on Shenzhen Green Building Design
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Shenzhen construction; green building; design study; multidimensional space green design
Abstract: The green building follows the sustainable development principle, in a manner of saving the energy and utilizing resources most effectively, to build the safest, healthy, high-efficient and comfortable inhabitancy space in case of minimum environmental load, to achieve the goal of growing the honour altogether of human, building and environmen. It is the only way of urban development to popularize by ecology, energy-conservation, reduce abolishing and healthy as the characteristics of the green building. Shenzhen is an young city that market economy is relatively developed, the exploring of the green building will offer references for the urban green building development of our country. Shenzhen is famous for it's innovational high-efficient green building, and it has assembling a great deal of world famous design master. The harmony environment is constructed in Shenzhen warm harbour project, it's designed scientifically with multidimensional green design of the space overall arrangement, environment afforest design, natural ventilational underground garage design, elevation and roof afforest design.

Article Title: Research on Green Property Management Evaluation System based on AHP
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green Property Management; AHP; Evaluation System
Abstract: Green Revolution trend of product has been launched around the world. Green Property Management is to focus on environmental protection, resource conservation, harmony between man and nature, the principle of people-oriented on each aspect of property management; to create a healthy and comfortable living environment for the owners, in the efficient use of resources; and to save social wealth. But what requirements should Green Property Management meet exactly? The establishment of a viable and effective evaluation system would undoubtedly help to promote the development of green property management. This paper use Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP) to build an evaluation system of green property management so as to change the subjective evaluation on property management past, to make the evaluation on green property management provided by property service enterprises scientific and reasonable, comparable; to make for compete in the industry; thereby to promote the development of green property management better and achieve good economic and social benefits.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Ethic Management System of Engineering Project Owners
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering project; Owner; Stakeholders; Ethic management
Abstract: Owner is the possessor or investor of an engineering project, and an important participant with more initiative in project. Meanwhile, owner participates in the whole-life project management is the core body of project management. This paper brings forward the concepts of stakeholder and ethic management based on projects. It also constructs the owners' ethic management system which by starting from the meaning of project stakeholder, with ethics as visual angle, and project owners as object, tries to make owners' behaviors meet ethic code through their own ethic management, and thus realizes the value maximization and sustainable development of engineering projects. The system consists of the general target of project owners' social responsibility, the operational mechanism of project owners' ethic management, and the measuring system of owners' ethic management behaviors. The system aims at making owners realize ethic management in project management and the combination of ethic management and project management. And it belongs to the scope of research on the application of ethics in project management.

Authors: Wu, J; Jiang, M; Shi, QF; Zhang, YH
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wu, J.; Jiang, M.; Shi, Q. F.; Zhang, Y. H.
Article Title: Research on Knowledge Transfer Model in R&D Team of Real Estate Enterprises Based on Knowledge Supply
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: knowledge transfer model; knowledge supply chain; R&D team
Abstract: Knowledge chain is the basis of studying dynamic mechanism of knowledge flow, which consists of knowledge transferring network. Knowledge transfer is becoming the essential foundation for many organizations in the process of constructing competitive advantage. The internal knowledge transfer in a team is a microcosm of that within an organization; moreover, the performance of it will affect knowledge transfer within the organization or between departments. In corporation, the knowledge-chain composed of personal knowledge, group knowledge and corporation knowledge is an interactive, ordered, recycling system. The knowledge-chain management in the company is to convert the scattered, non-system personal knowledge to systemic corporation knowledge, and reduce the restriction of knowledge in front of corporation policy to promote its core competitiveness of the corporation. This article analyzed knowledge transfer in R&D team of real estate enterprises, summed up six important factors influencing knowledge transfer within R&D unit from the perspective of knowledge transfer infrastructure, analyzed the different network architecture plays different role in knowledge transfer, constructed the model of knowledge transfer in R&D team of real estate enterprises.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Allocation Model of Macro Economy Risk Associated With PPP Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Risk allocation; Macro economy risk; China
Abstract: A common objective in PPPs is the transfer of project risks to the party who is best able to control and mange the risk. However, in practice, the allocation pattern for macro economy risk is difficult to be determined, as neither the government nor the private sector is capable to control. This paper aims to explore the rationale behind those decisions about the distribution of macro economy risk. Meanwhile, demonstrates the complexity and the difficulties in distributing them appropriately. The findings should provide a better understanding of the risk allocation on macro economy risk between the public and private sectors; hence a more efficient risk allocation framework for PPP development in China can be established. The purpose of this paper is to explore the rationale behind decisions about the distribution of macro economy risk between the public and private sectors and demonstrates the complexity and the difficulties in distributing them appropriately.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The study of Chinese macro-control policies in real-estate during financial crisis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real-estate; policy; financial crisis
Abstract: The real estate is the important pillar industry of the national economy, after Asian financial crisis, the real estate is one of the important motive force of expanding domestic demand,. With the sustained economic growth in recent years and the emergence of financial crisis, national policies in real-estate become a big concern among public. This paper is a brief analysis on the current situation of China's real-estate and related macro-control efforts, based on the introduction of industry policy, currency policy and land policy in the past few months. This paper also tries to come up with some countermeasures for the current dilemma. This paper introduces a series of macro-control policies in the real estate during financial crisis. It analysis current situation of China's real-estate and related macro-control efforts and Problems occurred in macro-control. Author tries to propose a solution for the current dilemma. Reform the systems of land-supplying, set up a more perfect ensuring housing system, change traditional ideas of house consumption and control speculative demands, give more support on transaction and developing links by reducing taxes, develop a multi-financing system for real-estate companies and so on.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: An Application Study of Valuation of Compound Options in The Real Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real options; Compound option; Real estates; deferrable cost; Geske model
Abstract: Because for large-scale real estate project, the investment is big, the development cycle is long, and it is easy to be affected by the policy. Its decision-making has a bigger uncertainty. Compared with other investment projects, the real estate investment has the following characteristics: poor mobility; poor replacement; big impact of law; many impact factors.Real estate investment analysis is important in the process of real estate projects, and its success or failure is directly related to the consequences of the investment. But the traditional NPV approach ignores the uncertainties of real estate investment and values for dynamic flexibility. This article uses the Geske compound call option pricing formula to establish a real estate investment analysis and evaluation model which is based on the real options analysis in the investment of real estates and the compound option theory. The model makes up the insufficiency of traditional appraisal method. In addition, this article has considered delay costs and reduced the gap between the estimated value and the true one. In the model application, the article has provided a new perceptive and a new method for the value assessment in the real estate projects of multi-stage investments.

Authors: Zhang, XL; Shen, LY; Diao, XD
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, X. L.; Shen, L. Y.; Diao, X. D.
Article Title: Comparative analysis on market characteristics of real estate market in Hong Kong and mainland China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Market characteristics; Real estate industry; comparative analysis
Abstract: The characteristics of a real estate market will be determined by social and economical environments. This understanding is important to the analysis for a particular real estate market. This paper has established a formal scheme for analyzing the characteristics of a real estate market that differs in important respects from the other markets. In this process it was found necessary to identify the particular elements whose attributes may contribute to illustrate the difference. Following the classical SCP paradigm of the industrial organization theory, this analysis starts from the market structure, enterprises' conduct and enterprises' performance of real estate industry in China. A real estate market indicator system including three parts as well as three-hierarchy indicators was established, and a comparative analysis on two different market environments was constructed on the basis. Finally, compared with relatively mature real estate market of Hong Kong, remarkable regional market discrepancy, low market entry barriers and extensive property product mode were identified as the most typical characteristics for China real estate market. This can help new entrants locate themselves within the typical market environment and reengineering actions can be adopted for making right market competition strategies in the practical life.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on Application of Entropy Theory in Construction Project Communication
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: entropy theory; project communication; effective communication; entropy flow model
Abstract: Excellent communication is extremely important for the success of a project. It not only can solve a variety of coordination problems, avoid conflicts and disputes, but also can promote the exchange of information and participants in participatory through communication. Thermodynamic concept of entropy theory has been used increasingly in information science and applied to project management and organizational environment. This paper introduces the basic concept of entropy theory and the basic relations with communication, and establishes a project communication framework from two aspects of vertical and horizontal communication, to indicate the effect of local entropy's increase on the total entropy and project risk, and then establishes the entropy conceptual model of project communication flow. It analyzes the communication plan and behavior in communication process, and explains them with information entropy and cross-entropy respectively. It introduces quantitative methods of timeliness and quality entropy to measure the effectiveness of communication. In conclusion, this paper gives the strategy proposals of project effective communication.

Article Title: Additive measures of travel time variability
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Travel time variability; Scheduling preferences; Reliability; Additivity
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION
Abstract: This paper derives a measure of travel time variability for travellers equipped with scheduling preferences defined in terms of time-varying utility rates, and who choose departure time optimally. The corresponding value of travel time variability is a constant that depends only on preference parameters. The measure is unique in being additive with respect to independent parts of a trip. It has the variance of travel time as a special case. Extension is provided to the case of travellers who use a scheduled service with fixed headway. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Gavronski, I; Klassen, RD; Vachon, S; do Nascimento, LFM
Author Full Names: Gavronski, Iuri; Klassen, Robert D.; Vachon, Stephan; Machado do Nascimento, Luis Felipe
Article Title: A resource-based view of green supply management
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Sustainable operations; Green supply management; RBV
Keywords Plus: MANUFACTURING STRATEGY; CHAIN MANAGEMENT; DYNAMIC CAPABILITIES; KNOWLEDGE; OPERATIONS; PERFORMANCE; IMPACT; SUSTAINABILITY; COLLABORATION; CONSTRUCTS
Abstract: Companies are being increasingly pressured to consider environmental concerns in their manufacturing activities and, more recently, with regard to their supply bases. Despite the broad range of literature that links performance to both green manufacturing capabilities such as pollution prevention and green supply management (GSM), managers are having difficulties developing a greener supply chain. The objective of this paper is to provide a model for development of GSM capabilities. Using the resource-based view of the firm (RBV) as the theoretical background, we postulate that plant resources are positively related to green manufacturing capabilities, which in turn are positively related to GSM capabilities. The data from a survey of a sample of manufacturing plants indicates that a managerial philosophy that includes external knowledge exchange directly supports both greener process management and environmental collaboration with suppliers. However, this managerial philosophy is only indirectly related to supplier selection and monitoring. The managerial implications of these findings are twofold: managers seeking to implement GSM need to view internal investment in green process management as a step toward environmental management of their external supply chains. They also must realize that green process management requires the support of other resources, such as environmental investments and top management commitment. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Tactical crew planning in railways
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Crew planning; Railway; Capacity planning; Tactical planning; Minimum flow problem
Abstract: Tactical crew capacity planning problem in railways involves finding the minimum number of crews in a region required to operate a predetermined set of train duties satisfying the strict day-off requirement for crew. For the single-region problem, we develop two solution approaches based on a space-time network representation: the sequential approach and the integrated approach. We also study the multi-regional capacity planning problem where we minimize total system-wide capacity by simultaneously considering multiple regions within a neighborhood search algorithm based on our solution methods for the single-region problem. We present the computational study on problem instances from Turkish State Railways. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Non-aviation revenues and their implications for airport regulation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport pricing; Airport regulation; Dual-till; Landing fee; Non-aviation revenue; Single-till
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE INDUSTRY; SOCIAL-WELFARE; MARKET POWER; CONGESTION; CAPACITY; EFFICIENCY; CARRIERS
Abstract: This paper analyzes a non-congested private airport that possesses market power in providing aeronautical services. We find that the profit-maximizing landing fee decreases in the degree of complementarity of aviation and non-aviation. Furthermore, our model implies that airports will not take advantage of their market power if non-aviation revenues, or the degree of complementarity of aviation and non-aviation, exceed a critical threshold. In this case, a dual-till regulation will be unnecessary. A single-till regulation, on the other hand, will always result in lower landing fees than laissez-faire. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Strategies for customer service level protection under multi-echelon supply chain disruption risk
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Supply chain disruptions; Multi-echelon inventory management; Risk mitigation; Partial lost sales
Keywords Plus: INVENTORY MODEL; LOST SALES; BACK ORDERS; MIXTURE; DEMAND; BACKORDERS; SYSTEMS; UNCERTAINTY
Abstract: We model a multi-echelon system where disruptions can occur at any stage and evaluate multiple strategies for protecting customer service if a disruption should occur. The strategies considered take advantage of the network itself and include satisfying demand from an alternate location in the network, procuring material or transportation from an alternate source or route, and holding strategic inventory reserves throughout the network. Unmet demand is modeled using a mix of backordering and lost sales. We conduct numerical analysis and provide recommendations on selecting strategic mitigation methods to diminish the impact of disruptions on customer service. We demonstrate that the greatest service level improvements can be made by providing both proactive inventory placement to cover short disruptions or the start of long disruptions, and reactive back-up methods to help the supply chain recover after long or permanent disruptions. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Martín, JC; Román, C; Voltes-Dorta, A
Author Full Names: Carlos Martin, Juan; Roman, Concepcion; Voltes-Dorta, Augusto
Article Title: Scale economies and marginal costs in Spanish airports
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airports' cost function; Marginal costs; Scale economies; Translog system
Abstract: In this paper, we estimate alternative specifications of the Spanish airports' cost function with the objective to provide a comparative analysis on several technological features such as output-specific marginal costs, economies of scale, and the Allen elasticities of substitution. We found evidence of significant and unexhausted scale economies as well as technological development in the Spanish airport industry. The results suggest that traffic consolidation in multi-airport areas such as the Basque Country or Catalonia will result in lower costs for the public operator. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Managing network mobility with tradable credits
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Mobility management; Traffic equilibrium; Tradable credits; Networks; Congestion pricing
Keywords Plus: CONGESTION; PERMITS; MULTICLASS; TRANSPORT; SYSTEM; RESTRICTIONS; EQUILIBRIUM; ALGORITHM; MODELS; POLICY
Abstract: A system of tradable travel credits is explored in a general network with homogeneous travelers. A social planner is assumed to initially distribute a certain number of travel credits to all eligible travelers, and then there are link-specific charges to travelers using that link. Free trading of credits among travelers is assumed. For a given credit distribution and credit charging scheme, the existence of a unique equilibrium link flow pattern is demonstrated with either fixed or elastic demand. It can be obtained by solving a standard traffic equilibrium model subject to a total credit consumption constraint. The credit price at equilibrium in the trading market is also conditionally unique. The appropriate distribution of credits among travelers and correct selection of link-specific rates is shown to lead to the most desirable network flow patterns in a revenue-neutral manner. Social optimum, Pareto-improving and revenue-neutral, and side-constrained traffic flow patterns are investigated. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An ant colony optimization model: The period vehicle routing problem with time windows
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Period vehicle routing problem with time windows; Ant colony optimization; Multi-dimension pheromone; Crossover operation
Keywords Plus: TRAVELING SALESMAN PROBLEM; SYSTEM ALGORITHM
Abstract: This paper proposes an improved ant colony optimization (IACO) to solve period vehicle routing problem with time windows (PVRPTW), in which the planning period is extended to several days and each customer must be served within a specified time window. Multi-dimension pheromone matrix is used to accumulate heuristic information on different days. Two-crossover operations are introduced to improve the performance of the algorithm. The effectiveness of IACO is evaluated using a set of well-known benchmarks. Some of the results are better than the best-known solutions. Results also show the IACO seems to be a powerful tool for PVRPTW. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bhat, CR; Sener, IN; Eluru, N
Author Full Names: Bhat, Chandra R.; Sener, Ipek N.; Eluru, Naveen
Article Title: A flexible spatially dependent discrete choice model: Formulation and application to teenagers' weekday recreational activity participation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Spatial econometrics; Copula; Composite marginal likelihood (CML); Inference approach; Children's activity; Public health; Physical activity
Keywords Plus: PAIRWISE LIKELIHOOD INFERENCE; GENERALIZED LINEAR-MODELS; PHYSICAL-ACTIVITY; SPACE; SYSTEMS; GOODS
Abstract: This study proposes a simple and practical Composite Marginal Likelihood (CML) inference approach to estimate ordered-response discrete choice models with flexible copula-based spatial dependence structures across observational units. The approach is applicable to data sets of any size, provides standard error estimates for all parameters, and does not require any simulation machinery The combined copula-CML approach proposed here should be appealing for general multivariate modeling contexts because it is simple and flexible, and is easy to implement The ability of the CML approach to recover the parameters of a spatially ordered process is evaluated using a simulation study, which clearly points to the effectiveness of the approach In addition, the combined copula-CML approach is applied to study the daily episode frequency of teenagers' physically active and physically inactive recreational activity participation, a subject of considerable interest in the transportation, sociology, and adolescence development fields. The data for the analysis are drawn from the 2000 San Francisco Bay Area Survey. The results highlight the value of the copula approach that separates the univariate marginal distribution form from the multivariate dependence structure, as well as underscore the need to consider spatial effects in recreational activity participation. The variable effects indicate that parents' physical activity participation constitutes the most important factor influencing teenagers' physical activity participation levels Thus, an effective way to increase active recreation among teenagers may be to direct physical activity benefit-related information and education campaigns toward parents. perhaps at special physical education sessions at the schools of teenagers. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd All rights reserved

Authors: Madadi, A; Kurz, ME; Ashayeri, J
Author Full Names: Madadi, Alireza; Kurz, Mary E.; Ashayeri, Jalal
Article Title: Multi-level inventory management decisions with transportation cost consideration
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Inventory management; Decentralized ordering; Centralized ordering; Transportation
Keywords Plus: LOT-SIZE MODEL; DEMAND
Abstract: In this article we address specific inventory management decisions with transportation cost consideration in a multi-level environment consisting of a supplier-warehouse-retailers. We develop two models - namely, decentralized ordering model and centralized ordering model to investigate the effect of collective ordering by retailers on the total inventory cost of the system. A numerical study shows that the proposed model is robust and generates reasonable cost savings. The models have potential in several multi-level applications such as fresh or frozen food delivery to stores of different supermarkets or the supply of medicine to a number of hospitals from a wholesaler. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Calthrop, E; De Borger, B; Proost, S
Author Full Names: Calthrop, Edward; De Borger, Bruno; Proost, Stef
Article Title: Cost-benefit analysis of transport investments in distorted economies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Cost-benefit analysis; Transport investments; Marginal cost of funds
Keywords Plus: MARGINAL COST; PUBLIC FUNDS; TAX-REFORM; EXTERNALITIES; CONGESTION; GOODS
Abstract: This paper deals with cost-benefit analysis of investment in transport infrastructure. Its contribution is twofold. Firstly, we develop a general equilibrium model to explore the impact of a small budgetary-neutral investment in transport infrastructure in a second-best setting, where other markets in the economy are distorted by taxes or external costs. The model incorporates different transport modes that are used both for intermediate inputs (freight) and for final consumption (passenger travel). An intuitive operational expression for the net economic benefit of an investment is derived that depends on the way the investment is financed. This expression generalizes recent findings in the literature. Secondly, we illustrate the results numerically using a small example. Our findings show that both the specific financing instrument used and the labour market consequences may have large implications for the net benefits of transport investments. Significant errors may be made in limiting cost-benefit analysis to transport markets only. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Murali, P; Dessouky, M; Ordóñez, F; Palmer, K
Author Full Names: Murali, Pavankumar; Dessouky, Maged; Ordonez, Fernando; Palmer, Kurt
Article Title: A delay estimation technique for single and double-track railroads
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 2nd National Urban Freight Conference
Conference Sponsor: METRANS Transportat Ctr
Author Keywords: Delay estimation; Freight transportation; Railroad capacity planning; Railway routing and scheduling; Regression analysis
Keywords Plus: CAPACITY; RAILWAY; TIME; LINE; PERFORMANCE; METHODOLOGY; OPERATIONS; SIMULATION; MODEL
Abstract: To route and schedule trains over a large complex network can be computationally intensive. One way to reduce complexity could be to aggregate suitable sections of a network. In this paper, we present a simulation-based technique to generate delay estimates over track segments as a function of traffic conditions, as well as network topology. We test our technique by comparing the delay estimates obtained for a network in Los Angeles with the delays obtained from the simulation model developed by Lu et al. [Lu, Q., Dessouky, M.M., Leachman, R.C., 2004. Modeling of train movements through complex networks. ACM Transactions on Modeling and Computer Simulation 14, 48-75], which has been shown to be representative of the real-world delay values. Railway dispatchers could route and schedule freight trains over large networks by using our technique to estimate delay across aggregated network sections. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Network structure and capacity requirement: The case of China
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Network structure; Airport capacity; Air transportation in China; Hub-and-spoke
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE INDUSTRY; ECONOMIES; DENSITY; POLICY
Abstract: This paper analyzes capacity requirement by alternative network structures Based on a. simple model, it is concluded that the capacity required under a hub-and-spoke network would be more than twice as large as the capacity required under a fully connected network. In recent years, China has experienced unprecedented growth in the demand for air travel, which has put continuous pressure on the expansion in airport capacity. Still as a developing country, China suffers from insufficient investment in infrastructure. Therefore. given scarce capacity, it may be more efficient for the major air carriers not to adopt the hub-and-spoke network in Chinese domestic markets. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Roorda, MJ; Cavalcante, R; McCabe, S; Kwan, H
Author Full Names: Roorda, Matthew J.; Cavalcante, Rinaldo; McCabe, Stephanie; Kwan, Helen
Article Title: A conceptual framework for agent-based modelling of logistics services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Microsimulation; Market; Logistics; Contract; Commodity; Conceptual framework
Keywords Plus: FREIGHT TRANSPORTATION; MICROSIMULATION; DEMAND
Abstract: This paper presents an agent-based microsimulation framework that represents the diversity of roles and functions of actors in the freight system. how they interact through markets and how interactions between actors are established in markets through contracts. The framework provides sensitivity to technology trends, business trends, and policy scenarios. Logistics costs, outsourcing of logistics services to third party logistics firms, growth or retraction of various industry sectors, and the impact of new supply channels are explicitly represented. Data sources available in Toronto, Canada and new data collection efforts required for model estimation are described. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Abstract: This paper presents the industrialized application of preparation of porous ceramics filter using waste drilling mud as principal raw material. The optimal sample is burned at 1060 degrees C with 60 wt%. waste drilling mud. Its bulk density is 1.78g/cm(3), porosity reaches 36.65%, water absorption is 20.62%, crushing strength reaches 12.67MPa, acid resistance is 81.28% and alkali resistance is 97.31%, pores distribute evenly and are three-dimensional bonded, which meet the requirements as a filter medium for water conditioning.

Author Full Names: Timmermans, Harry J. P.; Zhang, Junyi
Article Title: Modeling household activity travel behavior: Examples of state of the art modeling approaches and research agenda
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Intra-household interaction; Group decision theory; Needs; Stress; Heterogeneity
Keywords Plus: INTRAHOUSEHOLD INTERACTIONS
Abstract: Even though the importance of representing group decision-making mechanisms of household behavior has been recognized since the 1980s in the context of the activity-based approach, studies about group behavior in transportation are relatively new and consequently limited, compared with the research about individual decisions. In line with the special issue Modeling Intra-Household Interactions and Group Decision-Making published in the journal of Transportation in 2005, and motivated by the recent progress of group behavior research in transportation, this special issue presents examples of state-of-the-art modeling approaches to household activity travel decisions. We hope it will stimulate more intensive discussion about future research directions from both methodological and practical perspectives. Five papers are selected to cover diverse methodologies, including group decision theory, utility theory, latent class modeling, rule-based modeling, and micro-simulation approaches. The topics cover household task and time allocation, car ownership, vehicle transaction. mode choice, activity generation, and activity scheduling behavior. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chan, PC; Chan, WM; Chiang, YH; Yeung, FY
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chan, P. C.; Chan, W. M.; Chiang, Y. H.; Yeung, F. Y.
Article Title: A Research Framework for Developing a Benchmarking Model for Construction Projects in Hong Kong
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Benchmarking; Key Performance Indicators (KPIs); Critical Success Factors (CSFs); Research Framework; Hong Kong
Keywords Plus: KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS; PARTNERING PERFORMANCE
Abstract: Over the last decade, a number of researchers have shown intense interest in the research area of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for measuring the performance level of construction projects. Nevertheless, KPIs have often been subjectively identified and vaguely defined. Therefore, there is a strong need within the construction industry for identifying a set of common KPIs to be used by construction executives and project managers in measuring, monitoring and improving construction performance at the project level. Even though some KPIs, such as time, cost and quality, are always regarded as the three most vital KPIs for measuring the performance of construction projects, different industrial practitioners usually have their own semantic interpretations on each KPI and there is a lack of objective and common basis to evaluate the performance of different construction projects, thus making benchmarking difficult. This paper provides an initial report of a research project in Hong Kong, which aims to develop a comprehensive, objective, reliable and practical performance evaluation model for benchmarking and monitoring purposes for construction projects in Hong Kong, and to identify a list of Critical Success Factors (CSFs) for implementing construction projects. The background, the research approaches, and the likely impact of the research study will be discussed in this paper.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Submarket and Hedonic Prediction of Housing Prices in Shanghai
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Hedonic Analysis; Prediction Accuracy; Housing Submarket
Abstract: This paper has two-fold purposes. At first hand, it aims to provide knowledge of key determinants of real estate prices in Chinese cities. Meanwhile, it contributes to the literature by examining how much the prediction accuracy of real estate prices could be improved by applying hedonic equations at suitably defined disaggregate levels and incorporating directional heterogeneity of distance gradients.Hedonic pricing models are subject to considerable cross-sectional and spatial heterogeneity. This paper contributes to the literature by examining how much the prediction accuracy of real estate prices could be improved by applying hedonic equations at suitably defined disaggregate levels and incorporating directional heterogeneity of distance gradients. We build our empirical analysis on a large self-constructed database of residential housings in Shanghai. We find the presence of spatial heterogeneity in the Shanghai real estate market, indicating that the marginal prices of some housing attributes are not constant but vary with different submarkets. Through research, we confirm that the accuracy of hedonic prediction could be improved by adding the suitably-defined submarket dummy in the models.

Authors: Chen, JW; Lei, S; Bai, YP
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Chen Jingwu; Lei Sheng; Bai Yuanping
Article Title: Study on Investment and Financing Model for Urban Infrastructure in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban Infrastructure; Investment and Financing; Model choosing
Abstract: Based on the comprehensive understanding of characteristics of urban infrastructure, each pattern of investment and financing model has been introduced. They are government direct financing (GD), Private Finance Initiative (PFI), Building Operation Transfer (BOT), Transfer Operation Transfer (TOT), As-set-Backed Securities (ABS), and Public Private Partnership (PPP). After that, factors affecting the selection of investment and financing model are summarized, and the mainly base of the investment and financing model choosing is given. The study suggests the investment and financing model should give attention to three aspects, i.e. First, increasing the fund supply, which means to diversify the implementation agency financing and realize dynamic balance of economic and social benefit by introducing the competitive mechanism. Second, improving the capital structure, this means to diversify the financing sources to realize coordination between fund supply and capital restructuring. Third, raising the financing effectiveness, this means to diversify the financing means to realize interaction between fund allocation and operation efficiency.

Article Title: Analysis of Logistics Cost and Study on Value-based Decision-making Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: logistics system; logistics value; logistics cost
Abstract: Integrating logistics system, improving operational efficiency and ensuring the value realization are important basis of the core-competitiveness and the long-term competitive advantage in a modern enterprise. The establishment of logistics value management system is to maximize the value of enterprises, with the organic integration of orders and customer value system, transport and network value system, warehousing and picking value system, inventory and control value system and supply and secure value system, which requires the guidance from the logistics value strategic system and a variety of means for effective value-based management. It also requires effective procedures for value-based analysis and evaluation to establish the correct logistics value decision-making matrix and to choose the appropriate logistics value strategic process.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Real Estate Project Investment Decisions Based on Income-Systematic Risk Equilibrium
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Property portfolio; real estate project investment; income-systematic risk equilibrium; model for optimal decision
Abstract: This paper establishes the optimal risk investment decision model of real estate based on the traditional earnings-variance model and capital asset pricing model, and carries on quantitative analysis to relevant parameters; this paper also studies how to confirm the best ratio between investments of different projects in order to reach the best risk investment objective of the real estate. Such a model can be in accord with the actual conditions better. Optimal portfolio investment decisions on real estate are analyzed in details in this paper. Based on the earnings-variance model and the capital asset pricing model, the model for optimal risk investment decision on real estate is established while the income-systematic risk is equilibrium, and how to identify the optimal investment scale is studied in this paper in order to achieve the best investment objectives. A real estate development item is taken as an example to carry on the application study in this paper.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Feng, C. W.; Chang, P. S.
Article Title: The Optimization Model of The Large-Scale Solar Hot Water System Based On the Life-Cycle Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-scal solar wtaer heater system; Life -cycle cost; Emission trading; Genetic algorithm
Keywords Plus: ARTIFICIAL NEURAL-NETWORKS; PREDICTION
Abstract: The solar energy is one of the most widely researched sources to replace fossil fuel energy in the world. Among the applications of the solar energy, solar hot water system is the most promising one. Previous research has indicated that the solar hot water system is more efficient than other applications of the solar energy. However, most of the research on the solar hot water system mainly focus on the small-scale household type, as the need of the solar hot water system increases, the large-scale hot water system should be considered as one of the solution for providing large amount hot water. Although the large-scale solar hot water system can reduce the use of fossil fuel and decrease the greenhouse gas emission, it would possess high initial investment of the equipment and decrease the economic benefit. Therefore, the overall benefit of the solar hot water system over its life cycle should be included within the analysis of determining the solar water system configuration. In addition, previous studies on the configuration of the solar water heater system, which determines the size of the solar collector and the volume of the storage tank, are based on the single type of the solar collector. However, the type of the solar collector plays a crucial role to the life-cycle benefit of the solar water system. Therefore, there is a need to develop a more generic optimization model that determines the type of the solar collector, the size of the collector and the volume of the storage tank with the consideration of the life cycle cost and benefit. This research first employs TRNSYS computer program and the typical meteorological year data to predict the auxiliary energy generated by different types of collector, size of the collector, and storage tank volume. Then a multiple regression analysis and genetic algorithms are applied to minimize the life-cycle cost of the solar hot water system. Several different models of the life-cycle cost are evaluated.

Authors: Ge, WX; Chen, M; Yuan, YY
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ge, W. X.; Chen, M.; Yuan, Y. Y.
Article Title: On the Curriculum Integration of Mechanics of Engineering Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering management; Curriculum integration; Mechanics
Abstract: The earliest attention on curriculum integration derives from the concept of curriculum design originated in Europe. In recent years, curriculum integration has got further affirmed in the field of education and has aroused a series of research and discussion of the relevant theories with fruitful results. The curriculum of engineering management is also undergoing such a process. However, at present, most of the work remains at such macro spheres as upgrading the technological and managerial knowledge, with foundation courses left undiscussed. No progress or efficiency would be achieved without a solid foundation in the long run. The article will give an analysis of the curriculum integration pattern of mechanics, the foundation course of engineering management from a new perspective, partially using the author's experience in teaching the course of engineering management as samples, in hope of contributing to the improvement of the overall teaching efficiency of engineering management.

Author Full Names: Guo, J. P.; Liu, Y. M.
Article Title: Measurement analysis on externalities of energy efficiency improvement on existed heating buildings in northern region
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Eexisted buildings; Energy efficiency improvement; Externality; Measurement
Abstract: Energy efficiency improvement on existed heating buildings in northern region is a key program to carry out the work of buildings' energy reduction in China, but the significant positive externalities of improving existed heating buildings leads to the existence of market failure and a slow space in this field. Based on the externality theory, the author first introduced the concept and classification of the externality of energy efficiency improvement on the existed heating buildings in northern region; then, the author set up the basic process of measurement on the externality, and gave the relevant formula; Finally, the author took Tangshan demonstration undertaking of China's improvements of existed heat building project as an example, calculated and analyzed the positive externalities. At the same time, made a conclusion that: Improving existed heating buildings has significant positive externalities. The research findings in this paper would be useful for governments at all levels to make economic incentive policies about energy efficiency improvement of existing heating buildings.

Authors: Han, Y; Gao, QM; Luo, Y; Huang, YL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Han Yu; Gao Qiaoming; Luo Yan; Huang Youliang
Article Title: The Systems Analysis of Large-scale Public Building's Risk
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Risk management; Large-scale public building's risk; Systems analysis of risk; Risk space model
Abstract: Large-scale public building is regarded as an open complex system by according to system engineering theory and method. Large-scale public building's risk is classified toreliability risk, security risk and sustainable development risk. Reliability risk leads to the system reliability insufficiency. Security risk originates from system reliability insufficiency and security risk source. Sustainable development risk is long-term embodiment of reliability risk and security risk, in environment and social system. The risk elements system is established, which is made up of human, building and environment. Contributors analyze the dynamic system's characteristics of risk and then point out that, the risk elements system & risk system and risk perception system & risk management system are feedback loop dynamic systems. By establishing the risk space model, and describing the risk state with space vector, the concept of risk security space is proposed. The functional relation of risk indicates that the key to reducing large-scale public building's risk is improving the system reliability.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Lee, K. P.; Chang, A. S.
Article Title: Integrating Humanities into Engineering Design
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Integration mechanism; decision making; humanity; engineering design; case study method
Keywords Plus: DECISION-MAKING
Abstract: In recent years, the humanity issues, such as the preservation of cultural heritage, have become prominent and are required to be incorporated into planning and design of engineering and construction projects. These additional considerations make design work and process more complicated. However, few attempts have been made to provide a proactive solution. As a result, the owners and participants of construction projects are usually blamed for their passive attitude or ignorance. This paper proposes an integration mechanism to help the owners and designers to integrate the humanity issues into design process, communicate with stakeholders and achieve consensus. The case study method was adopted in this research. A prominent controversy case in Taiwan(China), the preservation of Losheng sanatorium against the subway system depot location, was employed to understand deeply the evolvement of the issues. Documents were collected and interviews conducted to analyze major causes of the dispute. Literature and theory concerning engineering design, decision making and integration assessment were reviewed to build theoretical foundation. Key successful factors of other successful integration projects were also referenced. Then an integration mechanism including procedures was established. Finally, a rigor index was proposed to measure integration quality in four dimensions in the integration procedures. The study results show that the integration mechanism can help incorporate different issues and achieve consensus if followed rigorously. The process systematically examines the representativeness of stakeholders and experts, their participation, quality of discussions and supporting data. The rigor index, or level of following the mechanism, can explain the quality in integrating humanity issues into engineering design. The mechanism provides a useful tool to the owners and designers to cope with the decision making difficulties in such kind of disputes.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Study on the governance mechanism for strategic partnership based on supply chain management in real estate enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate enterprises; Supply chain management; Strategic partnership; Governance mechanism
Abstract: The supply chain management idea has gotten wide application in real estate enterprises and achieved great success in the developed countries. However, it has just started in China and needs further study. Firstly, the article gives the concepts of supply chain in real estate enterprises and the partnership, and then establishes the model of the supply chain in real estate project development process. Secondly, the article analyzes the problems and risks which are exiting in the Supply Chain Partnership (SCP) in real estate enterprises. After discussing the problems in the supply chain partnership management, the article analyzes a new governance mechanism for the strategic partnership. The article points out that the governance mechanism consists of four sections: the trust mechanism based on partners' integrity, the incentive mechanism based on all-win, the reputation mechanism based on information sharing and the contract governance mechanism based on contract documents design. Finally, the article advances management suggestions for real estate enterprises to administer the partnership. The article establishes the governance mechanism for strategic partnership, which has significant meanings for real estate enterprises to make full use of diverse enterprise resources reduce transaction costs and deal with the increasingly cut-throat competition.

Article Title: Community Institution in Malaysian Housing Management: Gated and Guarded Community Schemes
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Community institutions; Housing management; Institutional change
Abstract: The character of the community institutions in Malaysian housing management has changed considerably since the 1980s. Nevertheless, there has been a growing demand among the community for greater involvement in their housing management. Therefore in 2007, a gated and guarded community scheme, a new housing concept emerges legally under Strata Title Act 1985. Despite this development, there remains a significant gap in the literature on how to understand the community change in constructing and developing their community institutions. Based upon the empowerment typologies and the perspective of New Institutional Economics (NIE), this study will examine the criteria to identify the emergence factors and institutional changes in community institutions. The emphasis of this paper is to account for the emergence, key supporting factors, institutional changes and enforcement criteria of these institutions. It is expected to fill the gap by bringing together a comprehensive study of community institutions in Malaysia.

Article Title: The Development of Affordable Housing in Chongqing, China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Affordable Housing; Housing Supply and Demand; Chongqing; China
Abstract: Situated in the southwest of China, the city of Chongqing covers an area of 82.4 thousand square kms and has a population of 30.97 million, which makes Chongqing one of the most populated cities in the world. Being the fourth metropolis ranked after Beijing, Shanghai and Tianjin, Chongqing is one of the most important cities in western China. The central urban area of Chongqing is located at the strategic junction of the Yangtze and Jialing rivers, with a population of approximately 3 million while the greater urban area's population amounts to 14 million. Most of the population resides in the rural area with agriculture as the predominant industry. Chongqing's urban area is set in a river basin surrounded by hills which have tended to isolate the city until recently. In recent years the housing industry has thrived in Chongqing. In 2000, a floor space of residential buildings of 20 square metres per capita was provided and the figure increased to 32 square metres by 2007[1]. However, the housing development in Chongqing is not without problems. The main difficulty in Chongqing's housing market has been a mismatch between supply and demand at different market levels, which is due to overwhelming housing need and poor affordability. Currently there is a great demand for housing in Chongqing. The demand for housing in the urban areas in 2007 was 17.69 million square metres [1], which was far in excess of the 6.12 million square metres completed in 2000. This paper aims to investigate the recent housing development in Chongqing, with a particular focus on the feasibility and potential of using affordable housing as a vehicle to satisfy the huge housing need in Chongqing's urban area, at an affordable level to the middle and middle-to-low income group people. Design and construction considerations for affordable housing in Chongqing will also be made in this paper.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Research on PPP Model for Low-rent Housing of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Low-rent Housing; PPP; Prospect; Operation Framework; Risk Management
Abstract: As a main solution to the housing problem for urban low-income residents, low-rent housing is that by way of rent subsidies or renting in kind, the Government provides some ordinary housing with social security for those families, which meet the minimum living guarantee standards for urban residents and have housing hardship. Since 1999, the Government have issued and taken a number of policies and measures to support low-rent housing construction, however, the gaps between the countrywide current beneficiary of minimum-income families and the actual number of households which should be guaranteed is still very large, and the coverage can not be far to meet the current low-income groups and housing difficulties. Simultaneously, the low-rent housing construction still mainly relies on fiscal budget of the central and local government for investment, and nevertheless the effectual investment from other channels of financing is minimal. Consequently, it results in the singleness of financing of the low-rent housing construction, and then restrains development of the low-rent housing in China. Presently, the low-rent housing projects are facing the financing puzzle dom. Based on objectively reflecting this status quo, this paper introduced the PPP model, analyzed its application prospect as viewed from private capital, innovative financial instruments and experience in other fields, and tried to establish the operation framework and risk management structure in the low-rent housing projects and made some conclusions. By that, we expect the PPP model can solve the financing plight of the low-rent housing, and thereby abate the financial pressure on the Government to push low-rent housing development.

Authors: Riga, M; Tzima, FA; Karatzas, K; Mitkas, PA
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Riga, Marina; Tzima, Fani A.; Karatzas, Kostas; Mitkas, Pericles A.
Article Title: Development and Evaluation of Data Mining Models for Air Quality Prediction in Athens, Greece
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Air pollution is a major problem in the world today, causing undesirable effects on both the environment and human health and, at the same time, stressing the need for effective simulation and forecasting models of atmospheric quality. Targeting this adverse situation, our current work focuses on investigating the potential of data mining algorithms in air pollution modeling and short-term forecasting problems. In this direction, various data mining methods are adopted for the qualitative forecasting of concentration levels of air Pollutants or the quantitative prediction of their values (through the development of different classification and regression models respectively) in five locations of the greater Athens area. An additional aim of this work is the systematic assessment of the quality of experimental results, in order to discover the best performing algorithm (or set of algorithms) that can be proved to be significantly different from its rivals. Obtained experimental results are deemed satisfactory in terms of the aforementioned goals of the investigation, as high percentages of correct classifications are achieved in the set of monitoring stations and clear conclusions are drawn, as far as the determination of significantly best performing algorithms is concerned, for the development of air quality (AQ) prediction models.

Author Full Names: Shang, Y. H.; Liu, J. L.
Article Title: Research on Cmpetitive Strength of Construction Enterprises in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Competitive power; Construction enterprise; Vertical integration
Abstract: This thesis mainly research on the origin and building approach of competitive strength of construction enterprise by means of value chain analysis. Based on building inside and outside value chain models of construction enterprise in China, the authers find that competitive strength of construction enterprise origin from three aspects: inside value activities, relationship of inside value activities, relationship of inside and outside value activities. By means of analysis of the three aspects, the authers also find that construction enterprise must rebuild its inside and outside value chain if they want to hold permanence competitive strength. The conclusion can be treated as basis of proceeding vertical integration strategy.

Authors: Stathel, S; Luckner, S; Teschner, F; Weinhardt, C; Reeson, A; Whitten, S
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Stathel, Stephan; Luckner, Stefan; Teschner, Florian; Weinhardt, Christof; Reeson, Andrew; Whitten, Stuart
Article Title: AKX - An Exchange for Predicting Water Dam Levels in Australia
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: water availability; prediction markets; forecast; experts; Natural Resource Management
Keywords Plus: MARKETS
Abstract: The Australian population in rural and urban areas is heavily influenced and affected by such water shortages, either economically or in their life style. Managing water resources is therefore seen as a critical environmental, social and economic issue. Good forecasts can provide better understanding for the current situation (e.g. drought severity) and consequently improve decision making. Prediction markets have long proved to successfully forecast events in a wide range of applications. They seem to be a promising tool for aggregating and at the same time publishing information about water availability. With the Australian Knowledge Exchange (AKX) we launched a prediction market, in which people were invited to trade their expectations about future dam levels. Our results show that traders are able to forecast water dam levels quite accurately. Nevertheless, a simple self-developed model based on historic data beats the market forecast in half of the cases. Experts seem reluctant - due to various reasons - to join and participate in (water related) prediction markets. In summary, our first experiment results show that markets are a promising approach to forecast Natural Resource Management related figures. Further improvements are discussed which may help to increase prediction accuracy in future applications.

Article Title: The Impact of Pension Fund on Financial Development
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: legal origin; endowment; pension fund; financial development; social security models
Keywords Plus: ENDOWMENTS; LAW
Abstract: In this paper, regression results of 55 countries or regions present that the size of pension fund can explain cross-country difference of financial development This is the first paper to consider simultaneously the impact of the legal origin, endowment and pension fund on the financial development The empirical results indicate that legal, endowment and pension fund views are not exclusive but compatible The implication of pension fund view is that although we cannot change legal origin and endowment, we can change pension policies and reform social security system Funded pension system that accumulates pension assets will promote financial development and economic growth

Article Title: The impacts of Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology on supply chain costs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain; Radio Frequency Identification (RFID); Simulation model
Keywords Plus: INACCURACY
Abstract: Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) is regarded as a promising technology for the optimization of supply chain processes since it improves manufacturing and retail operations from forecasting demand to planning, managing inventory, and distribution. This study uses a simulation model to calculate the expected benefits of an integrated RFID system on a three-echelon supply chain obtained through performance increases in efficiency, accuracy, visibility, and security level. The study investigates how the product value, lead time, and demand uncertainty affect the performance of the integrated RFID supply chain in terms of cost factors at the echelon level. Authors: Van Utterbeeck, F; Wong, H; Van Oudheusden, D; Cattrysse, D
Author Full Names: Van Utterbeeck, Filip; Wong, Hartanto; Van Oudheusden, Dirk; Cattrysse, Dirk
Article Title: The effects of resupply flexibility on the design of service parts supply systems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain; Service parts; Resupply flexibility; Simulation optimization
Keywords Plus: GUIDED LOCAL SEARCH; EMERGENCY LATERAL TRANSSHIPMENTS; SPARE PARTS; INVENTORY SYSTEM; LOW-DEMAND; MULTIECHELON; LOGISTICS; MODEL; TIME
Abstract: We apply simulation optimization to determine the optimal design and stock distribution for a single item supply system with a one-for-one replenishment policy. We investigate both the effect of the number of echelons and the degree of resupply flexibility, considering single-echelon and two-echelon systems with either no resupply flexibility, lateral transhipments only or both lateral transhipments and emergency deliveries. We show that the implementation of an emergency delivery option allows an augmentation of the fraction of customers served by lateral transhipments and that increased resupply flexibility enables increasingly important cost savings. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A Study on The Real Estate Talents' Training in the View of Application
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate; Talents cultivatione; Innovation
Abstract: with the development of real estate industry, the competition in the real estate enterprises is becoming more and more impetuous. It is the price fluctuation in surface, but in essence it is real estate talents' competition. Real estate enterprises rely on their strength and management to healthily develop, while their strength depends on talents. Therefore, it is very necessary to study on the professional training of real estate to meet the need of talent. This paper defines applied talents and applied real estate talents, then puts forward the real estate talents' culture innovation. As talents come from training, it is also necessary to analyze the characteristics of applied talents and applied real estate talents, and then create the training models and methods. That is to change traditional culture method and combine learning with production, change the traditional curriculum and offer introduction curriculum, change traditional semester setting and add perceptual practice semester, and change traditional examination system and strengthen process inspection.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Mode of Cooperating Management of Value Chain and Supply Chain in General Contract Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: General Contract Project; Value Chain; Supply Chain; Cooperating Management
Abstract: No matter which way is used in equipment and material procurement, the specialized sub-contractors should select or put forward suggestion on some kind of procurement using its market information and appropriation technology, thus the most superior materials suitable to the design request may be purchased. The thesis aimed at general contract project, which is more and more frequently adopted in project management in recent years, such as D+B mode, EPC mode and Turnkey mode and so on. The thesis systematically analyzed the characteristics of the value chain and supply chain of general contract project, and analyzed the differences with traditional pattern, on the basis of the association of value chain and supply chain, the thesis put forward the idea that the value chain management and supply chain management should be cooperated together in general contract project, and designed the basic mode of the cooperating management. The idea could be used for reference by owners and contractors who want to raise the value of general contract project.
