Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Case Study of the Implementation of Rural Land Contracting Law in Two Villages
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Rural Land Contracting Law; Real Estate; Urban Sprawl
Abstract: Land is the basic means of production of the farmers, their chief and most reliable source of income. In a period of hyper-activity of the real estate market and rapid urbanization in China in recent years, commercial development and urban sprawl have constantly been taking up more and more rural land in the urban fringes. Rural land tenure security has been brought to the forefront of national polices. Increasing rural land tenure security will inevitably and indirectly influence future land requisition behaviors of the government, which in turn will affect the availability and cost of land for real estate development for commercial developers. Increasing tenure security also means the direct protection of framers' rights and interests as well as the potential bargaining power that they would have in the future in land acquisition matters. The Rural Land Contracting Law (RLCL) is the single most important piece of law protecting rural land tenure security. Through a survey of two villages in Anhui Province, it shows that farmers' knowledge about important contents of the RLCL is insufficient. The result for the implementation of RLCL is mixed: contract certificates are not sufficiently signed or issued while major land adjustments since the implementation of RLCL have not occurred. The RLCL also does not bring much confidence in tenure security. Land requisitions in one of the village surveyed shows that farmers are compensated and informed but their participation in the decision-making process is lacking.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Industrial Structure, Distribution and Assessment of Land Use Intensity of Development Zones in provincial scale-A Case Study of Development Zones in Jiangsu Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: development zones; industrial structure and distribution; land use intensity
Abstract: Industrial Cluster and centralized distribution is an inevitable trend of industrialization and modernization. However, issues such as industrial isomorphism, distribution chaos and extensive utilization of land resources exist in the rapid development of industry. According to the international industrial research center of United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), industrial similarity coefficient between Shanghai and Jiangsu, Zhejiang as well as between Jiangsu and Zhejiang, reaches 0.82, 0.76 and 0.97 respectively. The convergence of industrial structure has become very serious. In addition, by the end of 2006, the proportion of construction land in Jiangsu province has accounted for as high as 18.9% of total land area of China, which is higher than the national average level of 3.13%, while that of the United States is only 5.05%. Taking development zones in Jiangsu province as an example, this research first carries on to hackle and collate systematically 136 development zones in Jiangsu, and analyses the quantity, type, structure and distribution situation of development zones basing on provincial regionally scale; Secondly, it emphasizes on deep analysis of the key indexes from main aspects of land use scale, land input-output of development zones. Further more, it investigates the contribution rate to the province's economic growth made by land, investment and labor, then making analysis of intensive land use of Jiangsu development zones. Finally, conclusions and relevant countermeasures of this research are proposed.

Author Full Names: Wu, Z. G.; Chen, Y. N.
Article Title: Paradigm of Urban Planning Evaluation: A Case Study of Renewal Planning of Liede Urban-Village in Guangzhou
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban Planning; Evaluation System; Liede Guangzhou; Renewal of Urban-Village
Abstract: Associated with the rapid urbanization in China, a great number of urban planning has been drawn up in many cities. The works on how to scientifically evaluate urban planning, in particular establishing a systematic evaluation method, is still relatively lag behind, but urgent and important at present. This paper intend to establish a scientific and systematic urban planning evaluation paradigm using the theories and approaches of project evaluation as the reference, and taking the case study of the renewal planning evaluation of Liede urban-village in Guangzhou. The paper concludes that the urban planning evaluation system should include framework as following (1) evaluation design, including working technical workflow, collecting and sorting relevant data, constituting evaluation objective and principle and proposing the limitation and expectant results of the evaluation; (2) methods of evaluation, including questionnaire survey, data analysis, expert evaluation and residents interview; (3) contents of evaluation, including planning parameter evaluation, planning execution evaluation, detailed plan preparation and approval procedure evaluation, risk evaluation as well as evaluation for impact on urban construction;(4) evaluation conclusion and suggestion.

Authors: Xie, DF; Guo, SR; Li, ZQ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xie Dan-feng; Guo Shurong; Li Zhanqiang
Article Title: The integrated Study of Bid Offer Decision-Makin Construction g Model on Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Valuation With Bill of Qquantities; Offer Decision-Making; Opponent Model; Unbalanced Income Quantitative Model
Abstract: In the practice of construction bids, the offers lack quantification analysis under most circumstances, therefore based on value engineering theory, this paper discusses the offer decision-making and sets up Two Stages Bidding Model on the standpoint of contractors. In the first stage, on basic of construction budget, apply Opponent Model to determine the optimally bidding price, i.e. the most acceptance of the bid. In the second stage, apply Unbalanced Income quantification Model to optimize the bidding price so as to obtain expectant profits. By integrating Opponent Model with Unbalanced Income quantitative Model, the article avoids these two model's isolation, and overcomes the shortcoming of qualitative analysis, provides quantitative basis, thus makes the bid more reasonable and more competitive. In the end, according to one bidding practice, the article utilizes the above theories, quantitatively analyzes contractors' bidding price, receives a offer which has high winning rate and rich expectant profits, and obtains very good effect.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu, Q. Y.; Li, Q. M.
Article Title: Sustainable Development-based Real Estate Project Cost Optimization
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate project; Social nature spirit needs; Real estate market; Cost overall evaluation; Optimize method
Abstract: Facing global financial crisis, the sustainable development of real estate projects is becoming key factor when a real estate enterprise is confronted with investment decisions. Road of this article deep research our country real estate modernization development, pointed out backward in the real estate project's during sustainable development, item cost C covers economical indemnificatory cost C-1, sociality invested cost C-2 and ecological environment invested cost C-3, through to the real estate item cost C three aspect value connotation's description and the relationship analysis, thought mutually C-1, C-2 and C-3 must satisfy the functionality which corresponds to safeguard RI, necessary to be balanced R-2 and green environmental protection R-3 and so on different level social energetic demand R, the pass time passage period influence and the function, realizes the real estate project store of value and rises in value V. Under different cost evaluation system, real estate project cost has different optimal characteristics. According to Value Engineering and Entire-life Cycle theory, real estate project cost optimization is to try to find a proper value for the real estate project cost C = C-1 + C-2 + C-3, in order to make the project value V = V-1 + V-2 + V-3 maximal, and the life cycle cost LCC minimal at the same time. This real estate project cost optimization method is based on sustainable development theory, and is an application in the field of real estate development.

Authors: Xu, X; Zhang, X; Li, DZ; Teng, TL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu, X.; Zhang, X.; Li, D. Z.; Teng, T. L.
Article Title: Application of the Method of Emergy Analysis to the Sustainability Research of Metro Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Emergy analysis; Sustainable development; Metro project; Empirical research
Abstract: Metro construction project is a part of social economy of a city, it must be the capacity of sustainable development. The existing evaluation systems for construction projects, whether feasibility study or environmental impact assessment, cannot yet quantitatively appraise the sustainability of the research objections. To study the level of sustainable development of metro project, and to achieve energy of different qualities treated differently and evaluated uniformly, the method of emergy analysis is introduced into this paper. Based on the theory and analysis of emergy, a unified criterion Solar emergy is used to measure resources, energy, population, etc, in construction, operation and maintenance of metro, and emergy indices of metro project are built to estimate comprehensively. Nanjing metro line 1 is taken as an example for empirical research. Analysis results indicate that Nanjing metro line 1 is sustainable in the long time and resources exploitation should be attach importance. And the method is applicable for quantitatively appraising the capacity of sustainable development of metro project.

Authors: Yin, S; Lai, M; Zeng, D
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Yin, S.; Lai, M.; Zeng, D.
Article Title: Research on the Financing Model for Energy Efficiency Renovation of Existing Residential Buildings in Northern Areas of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: energy efficiency renovation; existing residential buildings; the financing model; SWOT analysis; comparative economics
Abstract: Since the energy efficiency renovation of existing residential buildings in northern areas of China began in 2008, it has been one of key tasks of energy efficiency renovation of buildings. It plays a important role of saving energy, protecting environment, increasing the heating comfort, expanding domestic demand and expanding employment and reemployment. Rapid development of energy efficiency renovation of existing residential buildings needs high finance, but the problem of financing gap hasn't been solved up to the present. Reasons mainly include complex investment subjects' composition, lacking reasonable mechanisms of cost splitting and suitable excitation mechanisms. This paper analyses the present financing model for energy efficiency renovation of existing residential buildings in northern areas of China, listing strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats, in use of SWOT analysis. Then current financing models at home and abroad are compared in many ways, using comparative economics. Owing to many project management models and financing models, which are EMC ( Energy Management Contracting ), BOT ( Build-Operate-Transfer ), PFI ( Private Finance Initiative ) and PPP ( Private Public Partnership ), a new financing model for energy efficiency renovation of existing residential buildings in northern areas of China is proposed in this paper. Making use of financial subsidies of central government flexibly, applying new effective excitation mechanisms, mobilizing firms and privates' enthusiasm of investment fully are the greatest feature of the new financing model. The model can let firms and privates, who were involved in the whole financing process, share interests which were brought through the energy efficiency renovation of existing residential buildings.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Integrated Framework for Construction Innovation Education-a Lesson Learned in Chung Hua University
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Innovation; Construction innovation; Integrated framework; Lesson-learned
Abstract: The construction innovation education in Taiwan(China) has just started. Very few higher education institutions offer construction innovation curriculum for their students. This paper describes the experiences of developing the construction innovation curriculum for students of the Institute of Construction Management at Chung Hua University in Taiwan(China). Three stages of curriculum evolution are described including: (1) process modeling and constructability-based curriculum; (2) patent analysis based and computer aided innovation curriculum; and (3) R&D integrated fast innovation curriculum. The successes and difficulties experienced and confronted in the curriculum development are described and discussed. Lessons-learned are concluded to provide the educators of construction innovation a guideline for curriculum design and practical coursework delivery. This paper reviews the development of construction innovation education. A similar effort conducts in the Institute of Construction Management at the Chung Hua University in Taiwan(China) is presented. After five years of curriculum development, an integrated framework that combines CAI tools with R&D project management procedure form a fast innovation methodology is proposed for conducting the coursework of construction innovation curriculum. The proposed is proved to be very effective in training construction innovators who were not familiar with this discipline before.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: On the Creativity Diffusion in Creative Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: creative industry; creativity diffusion; communication theory
Abstract: Based on the communication theory, this paper investigates the process of creativity diffusion in creative industry. It defines the concepts of creativity and creativity diffusion. The process of creativity diffusion is described by four elements, which are respectively the creation of creativity, methods of diffusion, network and adopter of diffusion, as well as the time dimension. The result shows, the diffusion of creativity depends mainly on the general media, the initial adopter and week chain relationship contribute most to the diffusion process. At last, some suggestions are proposed to the development of creative industry.

Authors: Zhao, XF; Andy, KDW; Liu, YS
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhao, X. F.; Andy, Kam-din Wong; Liu, Y. S.
Article Title: Review of the development of BIM in USA
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: building information modeling; Technology; Research; implementation
Abstract: BIM (building information modeling) has been taken as one of the most important new approaches to construction productivity improvement. As the cradle of BIM, the development of BIM in America can be look as the benchmark and trend of the world. The paper outline the development of BIM in USA from technology, research and implementation aspects. A conclusion can be draw that BIM use in USA is framework-formed, expanding quickly and has entered mainstream use. Building Information Modeling (BIM) technologies in the AEC industry have dramatically grown although its history is short. The technologies is mature enough to support huge project application and complicated analysis. The research on BIM is transferring from characteristics of signal project to rules and theories cross projects. The application and extension of BIM have drawn attention of all society levels, they make out many guides, reports and visions to promote it.

Authors: Zuo, JA; Ma, T; Kinnaird, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zuo, Jian; Ma, Tony; Kinnaird, Astrid
Article Title: The project managers' perspective of competence: a pilot study
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Competency; project manager; South Australia
Abstract: The current Australian Professional Competency Standards for Project Management (APCSPM) has largely been developed based on the Project Management Body of Knowledge and treats project manager competency as a specific set of knowledge areas independent of context and individual. However, competence is commonly defined as a combination of knowledge, skill, experience and personality. The interest in project management competency has been growing due to an increased demand for competent project managers brought about by the ever-increasing popularity of project management as a means of undertaking and completing work successfully. Many of project management professional bodies have developed project management assessment and development models and in doing so have also contributed to describing what competency is. However there are still different views on how to assess the competency of project managers. This paper reports the findings of a pilot study where an exploratory interview approach is adopted to develop a greater understanding of what competency is perceived by project managers in the construction industry in South Australia. This is followed by a small scale questionnaire survey to have a quantitative analysis of the established competency framework. As a result, a competency assessment framework is proposed which is subject to further testing and validating.

Authors: Koster, P; Kroes, E; Verhoef, E
Author Full Names: Koster, Paul; Kroes, Eric; Verhoef, Erik
Article Title: Travel time variability and airport accessibility
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Value of time; Value of reliability; Trip scheduling; Airport accessibility
Keywords Plus: CHOICE; RELIABILITY; VALUATION; TRANSPORT; VARIANCE; BEHAVIOR; AIRLINE
Abstract: We analyze the cost of access travel time variability for air travelers. Reliable access to airports is important since the cost of missing a flight is likely to be high. First, the determinants of the preferred arrival times at airports are analyzed. Second, the willingness to pay (WTP) for reductions in access travel time, early and late arrival time at the airport, and the probability to miss a flight are estimated, using a stated choice experiment. The results indicate that the WTPs are relatively high. Third, a model is developed to calculate the cost of variable travel times for representative air travelers going by car, taking into account travel time cost, scheduling cost and the cost of missing a flight using empirical travel time data. In this model, the value of reliability for air travelers is derived taking anticipating departure time choice into account, meaning that travelers determine their departure time from home optimally. Results of the numerical exercise show that the cost of access travel time variability for business travelers are between 0% and 30% of total access travel cost, and for non-business travelers between 0% and 25%. These numbers depend strongly on the time of the day. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Recovery of inter- and intra-personal heterogeneity using mixed logit models
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Simulation-based estimation; Approximation; Random taste heterogeneity; Mixed logit; Intra-respondent; Panel data
Abstract: Most applications of discrete choice models in transportation now utilise a random coefficient specification, such as mixed logit, to represent taste heterogeneity. However, little is known about the ability of these models to capture the heterogeneity in finite samples (as opposed to asymptotically). Also, due to the computational intensity of the standard estimation procedures, several alternative, less demanding methods have been proposed, and yet the relative accuracy of these methods has not been investigated. This is especially true in the context of work looking at joint inter-respondent and intra-respondent variation. This paper presents an overview of the various different estimators, gives insights into some of the theoretical properties, and analyses their performance in a large scale study on simulated data. In particular, we specify 31 different forms of heterogeneity, with multiple versions of each dataset, and with results from over 16,000 mixed logit estimation runs. The findings suggest that variation in tastes over consumers is captured by all the methods, including the simpler versions, at least when sample size is sufficiently large. When tastes vary over choice situations for each consumer, as well as over consumers, the ability of the methods to capture and differentiate the two sources of heterogeneity becomes more tenuous. Only the most computationally intensive approach is able to capture adequately the two sources of variation, but at the cost of very high run times. Our results highlight the difficulty of retrieving taste heterogeneity with only cross-sectional data, providing further evidence of the benefits of repeated choice data. Our findings also suggest that the data requirements of random coefficients models may be more substantial than is commonly assumed, further reinforcing concerns about small sample issues. Article Title: Airport congestion pricing and passenger types
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Airports; Airlines; Passenger types; Value of time; Congestion; Pricing
Keywords Plus: MARKET POWER; AIRLINES; CARRIERS; CAPACITY; DELAYS
Abstract: We consider a public and congested airport served by airlines that may have market power, and two types of travelers with different relative values of time. We find that in the absence of passenger-type-based price discrimination by airlines, it can be useful to increase the airport charge so as to protect passengers with a great relative time value from excessive congestion caused by passengers with a low relative time value. As a result, the socially efficient airport charge can be substantially higher than what we learned from the recent literature on congestion pricing with non-atomistic airlines. Authors: Karakostas, G; Kim, T; Viglas, A; Xia, H
Author Full Names: Karakostas, George; Kim, Taeyon; Viglas, Anastasios; Xia, Hao
Article Title: On the degradation of performance for traffic networks with oblivious users
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User equilibrium; Price of anarchy; Oblivious users; Fixed demand
Keywords Plus: VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; TRANSPORTATION NETWORK; ASSIGNMENT PROBLEM; EQUILIBRIUM; MODELS; ANARCHY; DESIGN; PRICE
Abstract: We consider the problem of characterizing user equilibria and optimal solutions for routing in a given network. We extend the known models by considering users oblivious to congestion in the following sense: While in the typical user equilibrium setting the users follow a strategy that minimizes their individual cost by taking into account the (dynamic) congestion due to the current routing pattern, an oblivious user ignores congestion altogether; instead, he or she decides his routing on the basis of cheapest routes on a network without any flow whatsoever. These cheapest routes can be, for example, the shortest paths in the network without any flow. This model tries to capture the fact that a certain percentage of travelers base their route simply on the distances they observe on a map, without thinking (or knowing, or caring) about the delays experienced on this route due to their fellow travelers. In this work we study the effect of such users using as the measure of network performance its price of anarchy, i.e., the ratio of the total latency experienced by the users (oblivious or not) at equilibrium over the social optimum. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Tampère, CMJ; Corthout, R; Cattrysse, D; Immers, LH
Author Full Names: Tampere, Chris M. J.; Corthout, Ruben; Cattrysse, Dirk; Immers, Lambertus H.
Article Title: A generic class of first order node models for dynamic macroscopic simulation of traffic flows
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Macroscopic node model; Dynamic network loading; Dynamic traffic assignment
Keywords Plus: NETWORK; ASSIGNMENT; MERGE
Abstract: Node models for macroscopic simulation have attracted relatively little attention in the literature. Nevertheless, in dynamic network loading (DNL) models for congested road networks, node models are as important as the extensively studied link models. This paper provides an overview of macroscopic node models found in the literature, explaining both their contributions and shortcomings. A formulation defining a generic class of first order macroscopic node models is presented, satisfying a list of requirements necessary to produce node models with realistic, consistent results. Defining a specific node model instance of this class requires the specification of a supply constraint interaction rule and (optionally) node supply constraints. Following this theoretical discussion, specific macroscopic node model instances for unsignalized and signalized intersections are proposed. These models apply an oriented capacity proportional distribution of the available supply over the incoming links of a node. A computationally efficient algorithm to solve the node models exactly is included. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
